svtdqTAUHh1RtTwnRYXCXQ.text: Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow.  It honestly couldn't have been any better.  First of all, sit outside... the ambiance is amazing.  Why would you sit in a dark room when this is available.  There were two 'shows' while we ate... one with a giant frog over the waterfall (I know, right?) but it was great.  It was the puppet frog singing "Wonderful World" and the other was a light show, but not in any way cheesy.  It just helped create this relaxed, elegant, but still fun atmosphere.  It's hard to describe the environment... not Vegas, not 'Disney', not touristy... don't know... but very much "Wynn."    Now, the actual dinner.    The service was impeccable.  Our waiter and his partner were spot on, never an empty glass, always asking if we needed anything and if we were talking, they'd wait then come back when you finished... or, they'd sneak in and fill your glasses without you even knowing.  When they weren't "on camera," they were still smiling and friendly just walking around... so many times, waiters put on the act when they get to your table and then you see them more 'real' when they step away.  Not with our waiters.  It honestly went above what I'd expect.  There were also manager(s?) quietly walking around checking on things for quality control.  That's a management team that gives a damn beyond the lip service of 'caring about customers'.  My friend and I ordered a variety of things.  She got a lychee martini and I got a Reisling... both were amazing.  I've never had a better Reisling in my life, honestly... I can't recommend it more highly.  (I don't care if it doesn't "pair" with steak, it just tastes great.)  We got a Rib Eye and a NY Strip and split them.  I didn't use any sauce except for a little creamy horseradish here and there but you can eat them without anything.  They were cooked perfectly and the selection of meat was perfect... no gristle anywhere.  They do this way to making it just crispy enough around the edges while maintaining the softness inside.  We also got mashed potatoes, which were also great.... probably 3,000 calories though, haha.      Get a reservation though, that's for sure.  I got mine about three weeks out but it gets tight quickly.    Overall... I can't thank SW Steakhouse enough for a better night catching up with a good friend.  Everything was perfect, top to bottom.  You couldn't have a more "five star" review than SW Steakhouse.

cucTabyQ1SZNTWHrOFE-hQ.text: Seriously, if you want a Vegas food experience, come here. And don't forget your wallet and your credit cards, because it will cost you.   My husband and I have been here twice. It never disappoints. Make sure you try to come when it's warm out and request a seat outside on the patio so you can view the Lake of Dreams which has a little show every 30 minutes. So fun! Just adds to the decadence.   I've always gotten the Filet Mignon and my husband has ordered the Prime Rib.  Both steaks were cooked to perfection. We've also ordered a side of mashed potatoes and a vegetable. Very tasty.   The servers are very formal and attentive.   Overall, this place is an amazing Vegas experience. Highly recommended, Worth every dollar.

XyOP89VhBXcZqc2n0lhtbg.text: We were there this past Saturday. We where a large group of 12. We were expecting to have a spectacular steak dinner. They got almost every plate wrong. My medium-rare was well done. They came in auctioning plates because they had no idea which one belonged to who. At the end more than one person stayed with their plate the way they got it, just all wrong. Although a very nice place, because you're paying top dollar for your steak you would expect better service. I was very disappointed!!!

E-k-iYv9yjwziMsw3bypHA.text: Worst experience I've ever had at a steakhouse. I called and made reservations for 7 people about four weeks in advance and requested a table with a clear view of the water/show. The day of the reservation I called out of courtesy to give them a heads up that only 6 people will be dining instead of 7, I again reminded them of the request I made to have a table with a clear view. We arrive at the steakhouse an hour early because our party wanted to have drinks at the neighboring bar outside. We checked in with them and AGAIN reminded them that we requested the table with the view. Well we show up at 8pm ready to be seated and the hostess begins to walk me back to literally the last table in the restaurant in the back near the kitchen. I stopped her and said we requested a table with a view, to which she says "since you called today and made this reservation we couldn't guarantee it." I was shocked I responded back loudly and quite pissed off "I made this reservation over three weeks ago, I called today to let you guys know that it would only be for 6 people instead of 7 out of courtesy to you, so figure out what you're going to do to get us a table with a view." We go back to the hostess table to wait for them and they find us a table with a "view" it was a long awkward table in the back and half of us could see. If the only problem I had with this restaurant was the lack of view and their incompetence with seating, I wouldn't have taken the time to write this, however I'm afraid the experience only got worse. We were celebrating two birthdays at this dinner, mine and my aunt's. I was in charge of making dinner reservations and I remember this place being good years ago but wow things have changed. First, it took us nearly two hours to get our main courses. TWO HOURS. I understand it's Saturday and it's busy but two hours is insane. I got the king crab pasta that was listed under the "chef's selections". When my food arrived it looked as if they found two hermit crabs and put them in a food processor and then sprinkled them on my pasta. It was totally pathetic. My boyfriend, for whatever reason got the vegan raviolis (he's not vegan I don't know why he ordered this at a steakhouse) but his stupid vegan raviolis were much better than my chef selection hermit crab pasta. My mother got chicken which she said was good but nothing to rave about. My uncle got the NY strip and he said it was very good. I'm not sure what the others got but by the time we got the food two hours after we sat down we were all so pissed off. The staff tried to make amends by bringing us a tower of funnel cakes for the table along with our birthday desserts but by this time we had been sitting for three hours. Although the funnel cakes were delicious(when is fried dough dipped in caramel and sugar not delicious)they can't change how long we waited, where we were sitting, and the hermit crab pasta. Looking back on this all I remember enjoying about this 3 hour long dinner was the stupid funnel cakes and the pretzel bread...I feel like at a steakhouse you should remember entrees instead of food you can get at carnivals for much cheaper and for sure a lot faster.

5W5L-sN4HYoswbm9yDchlg.text: Yuck. Overpriced. Lackluster service. Dry rib eye. Was really looking forward to this meal. However, when my Alaskan king crab soup came, the crab didn't taste fresh (was hard and lumpy), and the puff pastry was over toasted and burnt. Then the brussels sprouts came and very soggy. The veggies were undercooked and still hard. My friends ordered the foie gras which came overlooked and had to be sent back. Nothing was as expected. Really disappointing for a meal at over $100/per person. One star is for the tasteful decor, the other is for their bread; which, unfortunately, turned out to be the best part of the meal.

SM27G8JVW2Yc5hjvqJz15A.text: The meal was excellent but the service was rushed and judged. The staff treated us as we couldn't afford the meal and wouldn't let us relax. Hats off to the chef, the meal was delicious, the wait staff could use a lesson in not judging their customers.

63wQHCuenVBSxF-10Jjeqg.text: 4.5 stars. The plan was to take my family to an interesting place, so we chose SW for its  ambiance and Lake of Dreams showings, but the food ended up being great as well.  I don't understand the negative food ratings. Service was great too. The entrees took a little while to come out but the wait was properly balanced out by the three mini lake shows, which again, you don't usually get while spending decent money at a restaurant. The red and blue dancing-balls were our favorite.   Only gripe was the skimpy pour for a glass of wine. Prime steaks came out as ordered, and the veggie plates consisted of quality ingredients.

-JX_RP_8eCqVQEoPa8xOFw.text: One of the best steakhouses I have been to.  I had the foi gras torchon with a cherry sauce to start. It was absolutely delicious and full of flavor.  I followed with an heirloom tomato salad from tomatoes that had just come into season as were delivered that morning.  It was the first day they were offering that seasonal salad.  Best tomato salad I have had in a while.  For my entree I had the ribeye which was one of the tastiest steaks I have ever had.  It was perfectly cooked medium rare and very flavorful.  The quality of the meat was fantastic.  The sides were good as well.  Definitely worth a try when visiting Vegas.  Be sure to call in advance so that you can reserve a table.   The place fills up pretty fast. 96/100

_oldhdjFISPfN78ax4Hp9A.text: Awesome place. Request to sit outside. Literally amazing. Water show outside with the fountain every maybe half hour. Worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FjQPurpVRsFYKtewFPPdqg.text: How can you call yourself a "Steakhouse" and NOT know how to properly cook a steak? I take my steaks seriously and after seeing SW Steakhouse featured on the Food Network's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate", I had high expectations. However, I left completely disappointed and scratching my head as to how SW Steakhouse even came to be on the show. On Sunday, 9.11.11, my friends and I (party of 7) came to dinner at SW Steakhouse at 5:30 PM with reservations. We were seated outdoors overlooking the Lake of Dreams which I had requested; a must for a picturesque dinner. F O O D *BACON CHEESE BREAD - 4 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... Served warm, the bread was buttery with savory smoky bacon bits. The encrusted cheese gave it a subtle salty richness. *SAUTEED FOIE GRAS w/ Grilled Pineapple, Brioche Toast, Blackberry Jam ($24) - 4 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... The foie gras was nicely seared and had a luxurious richness without being overly greasy. The brioche gave it a nice texture contrast and the blackberry jam's subtle tartness help balance out all the flavors nicely. *42 OZ. CHILI RUBBED DOUBLE RIBEYE (Serves Two; $106) - 2.5 STARS (Please note: You can add the chili rub to any steak) yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... Featured on "The Best Thing I Ever Ate", the Chili Rubbed Ribeye was sorely disappointing. Though the ribeye was super rich in beefy flavor, it was overcooked. Requested medium rare, our steak was more like medium well. The chili rub which consisted of cayenne, cumin, and other spices was too overpowering and took away from the steak's natural flavor. It was like a glorified carne asada. Just to note, everyone's steak in our table except for one person was overcooked; that's a HUGE problem if you're a "steakhouse". *SIDES (Serves 2-3 people; $10 each) -BLACK TRUFFLE CREAMED CORN - 4.5 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... -PARMESEAN CREAMED SPINACH - 3 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... -MAC 'N CHEESE - 3 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... -FINGERLING POTATOES w/ Green Beans & Bacon - 3 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... The only side worth mentioning was the Black Truffle Creamed Corn. It was slightly chunky, yet creamy with a fresh sweetness. The addition of the black truffles added a decadent earthiness to the corn. *FUNNEL CAKE & STRAWBERRIES w/ Anglaise, Salty Caramel and Fudge Sauce ($18) - 4.5 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... The star of the night, the funnel cakes were beautifully presented on tree branches with a accompanying trio of sauces. It was crisp, light and airy. A mixture of the anglaise and salty caramel gave it a creamy sweetness. S E R V I C E Having dined at numerous fine dining restaurants, one would have a certain expectation in terms of service especially at the prestigious Wynn. Just like the steaks, the service was disappointing. Our waitress was MIA most of the night and never once checked on us to see how we were doing; yet we saw her repeatedly go to other tables with older patrons. Perhaps, people should be reminded that Generation Y are the "foodies" and "yelpers". When one of my friend's steak was cooked almost to a well done (requested medium rare), we had to wave our hands in the air just to get her attention to send it back. Only then did she ask, if the rest of our steaks were properly cooked. That's when our entire table went silent and I responded, "No, most of our steaks were overcooked..." When you're paying at least $100/person, you should never have to wave down your waitress/waiter at a restaurant of this caliber and for a place that's part of the Wynn family, you would think they would have tried to rectify everyone's overcooked steaks especially having mentioned it. I rarely send back my food, but our waitress should have least offered to make things right but she didn't. INEXCUSABLE. A M B I A N C E / D E C O R Classy, modern and swanky. The outdoor dining area overlooking the Lake of Dreams was breathtaking. yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL... During our 2.5 hour dinner, there were two water shows: a frog singing the "Moon Song" and two balls mating and having a baby ball. Though it was entertaining and cute, I thought it was a bit cheesy. After our disappointing dining experience at SW Steakhouse, I can't help but wonder if being featured on the Food Network's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" was merely a paid advertisement.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesean Creamed Spinach!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SW Fries!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac &#39;N Cheese!

JQmVwlROIWjaWSowijUUiA.text: We had a party of 4 and showed up around 8:30pm this past Saturday night. It was very busy not only in the Wynn but the restaurants including SW steakhouse.  We were seated right away and had drinks just has fast.  Once we all ordered it seemed like it took a long time to get the entrees, but it's not a big deal and was worth the wait. Prices are a bit steep but again this is the new Las Vegas and inside the Wynn.   Our meal was really good!  Starting with the 4-5 different bread's  and butter, it was very nice. Shrimp cocktail was good.  Kale and goat cheese salad was ok.   Awesome aged Bone in Porterhouse!  A great filet mignon that needed only a butter knife to cut.  The Dover sole with two prawns over lump crabmeat was good as well as everything else.   My vodka martini was the only thing nobody at the table liked. I think it was just vodka with 3 olives.

pBNzQKLHvJv7mV5xuCQkAw.text: Bottom line, SW Steakhouse has become my favorite steakhouse, and that's saying alot being that I live in New York.  Steaks are consistently cooked to perfection, and the wine list never disappoints (this past trip we had the 2011 Blackbird Cabernet, which was delicious!).  My go-to meal is typically -  - Yellowfin Tuna Tartare appetizer - New York Strip, medium rare - Shaved Brussels sprouts - A bottle of one of their Cabs (and there are plenty to choose from)!  I've tried most of the Steakhouse options on the Las Vegas strip.  There are PLENTY to choose from, including those with some big name chefs.  I've found little reason to keep hoping around.  If I want a Steak, I know where I'll be headed my next trip to Vegas!

vLxdc-i8tmo4hg2IY7kzLg.text: Not as romantic as I'd hoped, but otherwise a fantastic restaurant outing in Vegas.  What you need to know: *Make a reservation.  Too late and you won't get a table outside.  We made ours for 7pm for a view on the terrace; day of we switched it to 8:30pm and apparently they CLOSE it after 8.  Boo!!   *It's on the bottom floor of the Wynn Hotel - go down the escalators. *The rolls are to die for.  I would seriously come here for the bread alone, it is THAT good. *The bathrooms are so lush and purdy.  Stalls so airtight and quiet you can't hear if anyone else is in there!!  My loud ass sister walked in and I didn't even hear her!! *Food is, as expected, top notch.  Everything is ala carte.   Loved our steaks.  We recommend the cream corn (yes.) and mac & cheese.  Skip the mashed potatoes. *Service is impeccable.  We went with a large group (6), and they do this lovely thing where they wait for the last person to finish eating, then, in a choreographed dance, all the servers clear the table in about 4.2 seconds.  WOW.   *As I said, I was hoping for a little more of a romantic or personal feel considering the price point - I felt pretty close to other tables and could hear their conversations.  The lighting is bright.  I prefer the layout of, say, Prime Steakhouse in Bellagio where you have your own area and it's more dimly lit.   On the bright side, you could totally go here with your mother-in-law or business partner!  Highly recommend for groups, but perhaps not for "Anniversary Night".

irPmp6tBhufM4a0pQ3SP0w.text: My wife and I enjoyed a scrumptious dinner last night. The atmosphere was beautiful and the service was genuine and helpful. We are both trying not to eat too heavy or too late so we split a steak and ordered side dishes of vegetables. The waiter suggested half  orders of the vegetables and splitting the Caesar salad. That was very helpful because half an order is plenty for two people. The salad was really delicious and split is plenty to eat for two. My suggestion if you want to sit on the patio and see the water show, make reservations early.

VV50VcBacJdlhCjAWDK0IQ.text: We were seated outside near the water show which I loved.  The ambience is delightful and our server was attentive with drinks.  The hibiscus cocktail was my favorite.  I ordered the salmon which wasn't good at all.  The seasoning was strange to me.  The sides were just ok, but the bread was very good.  Overall I wouldn't pay to dine here again.

NY9GdYWTPFEadktGhguY2A.text: Great disapointment  Took my girl friend for her birthday to what I had in the past experienced as one of the best  steak restaurants. We were greeted with happy birthday wishes. The New York steak was cooked perfectly but it took a workout to chew each piece. I ordered the lobster tail that I had experience other times. The $45  tail was the less than one pound size and way over cooked. This was the type and size of one you would get at Red Lobster. I placed my empty water glass at the front of the table. It remained empty. At the end of the meal as we had coffee it was necessary to remind the server of my girl friends birthday. With a sour face he finally brought her a one inch slice of chocolate with a candle. Some may wonder why I did not complain about the poor food quality. I simply did not want to ruin the birthday dinner for my girl friend. The evening was topped off with a horrible experience when my girl friend went out onto the adjacent patio to see if she could located the British couple who were sitting next to us at dinner and who had invited us for a drink. The patio hostess demanded that my girl friend get off the patio.. she kept repeating that we couldn't go out there and that there is a three drink minimum. I tried to explain that my girl friend had gone out there to locate someone. It did not matter to this hostess. My girlfriend was speaking to the British gentleman when I summoned her and we left the premises. All in all this is not a place I would ever recommend to a friend.

AZrJC0uGx6G_Tzu_eeH5BQ.text: I can count the number of times that I've been to vegas on one hand.  Unfortunately, i don't really drink.. or gamble.. or enjoy vegas in general... (I know~ I'm weird).  But with this last trip to reunite with old college buddies, I experienced the most marvelous steak joint ever.  It was pretty darn epic.  SW outranks any past experience at a steak house I've experienced.  I'd come back to vegas just to eat here.  I hear that SW Steakhouse is a close competition to Del Frisco (which I have not experienced).. but the members of our group who have been to both preferred SW over DF.  We had reservations for our group of 7 and were seated near to but not next to the great Lake of Dreams (which is both pretty trippy and cool.. gorgeous view tho!)  Started off with a couple of bottles of wine and THE BEST BACON BREAD EVER.  It was hard for the girls not to scarf and fill up on this bread.  The cream butter with two types of fancy smancy sea salt was soo good.  Soft, creamy, and melt in your fattty mouth heaven.  I adore bread.  Both the french and the bacon bread were delicious.  (Take a gander which one was better)..  Some of the members had appetizers.. and the BLT salad came with this FAT solid 1 inch slice of premium bacon.. balancing atop crisp lettuce and heirloom tomatoes.  It was a gorgeous sight.  I can only dream of how big this slab of bacon was before being cooked down.  Our meal was absolutely delicious.    BF and I split the Porter for two (I did the math and it was cheaper than the individual steaks).  IT WAS DIVINE.  Came out sizzling and hot in a huge plate (it was a shit load of meat for two people~ i think like 40 ozs?  I know~ fat@ss. haha).  We added the fois gras - which was an awesome move cuz it made everything melt in your mouth.  There was a side of.. not leeks.. but similar to celery root .. just can't remember.. but it was all heavenly.  We got sides to split for the table... and YOU MUST ABSOLUTELY GET THE CREAMED CORN.  I don't normally enjoy creamed veggies but this was ... sex rolled into a winning lotto ticket and a double promotion at work.  Yes.  It was awesome.  The mac and cheese was meh~ not bad but a little bland.. and... I can't remember the other sides but they were all fabulous.  TRUFFLED CREAM CORN. GET IT.  Service was great.  Wine and food abundant.  Great friends. It was by far the best experience second to Chippendales.  Definitely recommend this place and would absolutely return (once I save up enough money haha).  It broke down to about $100 per person which isn't bad considering the quality, alcohol and service.  FABULOUS. Added to the List of Ya Really Gotta.   So GO! :)

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yes that is bacon on top. isn&#39;t this gorgeous?!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. our porter for two
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. isn&#39;t this just gorgeous?  it was so freaking delicious

dhO0jBGBokHWoVM7mRHhrQ.text: This is located at the Wynn. As Wynn is full of whimsy, the SW Steakhouse is awash in white. It was very well appointed and tasteful. The ambiance is definitely spot on. We were seated near the balcony with a view of the waterfall. I suggest you sit facing the waterfall upon sitting. It has mini shows that's very enjoyable while you eat your steak. We made an appt beforehand and were seated promptly. The service was graceful. Everyone has been very nice on this particular Vegas trip. The sommelier came to the table and I chose a moscato by the glass. Then, the bartender came to the table and suggested to mother that she have a lychee martini since she stated that she'd like something sweet. She also asked to add very little alcohol as possible. The bartender assured her that he'll do the best he can. If she isn't satisfied, just let him know and he'll take care of it. Like in any high end establishments, no is simply not in the vocabulary. The lychee martini was delicious. We had sirloin steak as we're fans of a bit of fat in our steaks. I also had foie gras on the side. The rest of my family loved the steak but I thought it was just ok. I had better foie gras. Because of the food, I decided to give this establishment a three star. But its service and ambience screams five star. Perhaps, try its Kobe beef. It's certified to prepare kobe beef. It must be their specialty.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye and foie gras

a61bJWh0QRNb75QI59Hu5A.text: Simply the best had Dinner there last night it was amazing. The food is just incredible. Definitely recommended

6ebN3bCI3Z8DLnGgxrQVjQ.text: Excellent food and service from beginning to end. Had dinner outside by the water in the evening which featured shows every couple of hours. The lamb was absolutely delicious! Macaroni,  spinach and au gratin potatoes were also great. Excellent selection of wines and cocktails! Great for a special occasion or date night.

WIqeSWb5qoBgirPg7AhWqQ.text: I've been to nearly all of the highly rated steak places in Vegas, and this one was decidedly mediocre. It wasn't even as good as the less-highly-regarded Botero at the Encore, so that alone was disappointing.   We came here for my little sister's 21st. She started the evening off by ordering a margarita. Odd at a steak place (umm you drink martinis and red wine!), but she's 21, so whatever. It was AWFUL. Undrinkable. Her 21 year old buddy got one as well and both of them couldn't choke them down. I figured the $15 margarita couldn't be THAT bad, so i tried some. Yup, decidedly awful. Ok, so we aren't getting off to a great start...  We got beef carpaccio and foie gras to start. Beef carpaccio was boring, but it tasted decent enough. The foie gras on the other hand was disappointing. Probably ranks close to the bottom of all the foie I've had in Vegas. While it wasn't badly prepared, it was just missing something.  My husband and I made the mistake of splitting the filet mignon and adding lobster. The $49 lobster add on was awful. The chewiest, most flavorless awful lobster I've had in a LONG time. EW. The filet was decent. I liked the crust, but the steak definitely was nothing special. My dad finished maybe 1/3rd of his ribeye before giving up and calling it too blah to eat. Yes, we're brats about steak, but when you are paying $60 per steak you expect it to be mind blowing. I've eaten 5 better steaks in the past month! Sad.   The $18 funnel cake for dessert was fun. It was lots of small funnel cakes randomly stuck in what looked like a mini metal forest sculpture thing. They were tasty. My sister ordered a piece of red velvet cake for her birthday. This was NOT tasty. It was dry and flavorless. How freaking hard is Red Velvet cake ???  Service was decent and the atmosphere was nice. Not a bad evening, but not a spectacular one either. At these prices I guess I just expect more these days! Next time I would choose Cut, Botero, Carnevino, or Strip Steak instead to name a few... The dining at the Wynn seems to be going downhill. No more Daniel, no more Alex, and we are left with mediocre steak and vegan food.

S5YE3JIpWNPWaxbClXg39Q.text: This place is great.  I like Cut, Tom Colichio's place, the one at Bellagio and a few others but Wynn's is probably my favorite.  Food was awesome and the steak is cooked perfect and the cuts divine.  Sides are legit too & not an afterthought like some other steakhouses.  I have yet to try emeril's place but this is one the best I've had in Vegas to date.

YzDny5gr9O5Xj_CFlX7PVA.text: I'm still a fan on their rib eye steak.  It still taste good in my mouth & my tummy.  This is my 2nd visit since 2(?) years ago.  We got the truffle creamed corn & I don't remember having that on their menu last time, but it's heaven eating it with the rib eye steak.  Prices has gone up, I don't remember paying $79 for 24oz steak, but should definitely share so you can get some sides to go with your steak.  Can't wait to come back to this place again.

CazPgfjMh82OJIXY9r5poQ.text: Very elegant setting with high quality ingredients! Really enjoyed the bread, best I have ever had and I typically don't care if bread is served but this was off the charts house baked bread! The steak was in my opinion overrated but very good and the lobster mac w black truffle was addictive ... Is addictive

Unr7lUrjTwrFzAmtOre2FA.text: Came here for my little sister's graduation dinner the other night. Was really excited to try it as it's rated as one of the top 25 restaurants in the US (at least thats what the reservation guy told me).   Dishes that stood out: -Crabcake was PERFECT. a way bigger portion than I was expecting and very tasty. -Black truffle cream corn... YUM. super good and surprisingly not that heavy. -The bacon cheese bread thing  was super delicious -Rib Eye was cooked perfectly! The creamy horseradish sauce was also really good.  If you order toe foie gras, it's a hugeeee piece!  Reasons why I'm taking a star off: Risotto- tasted really bland and the consistency of it was strange with the crunchy vegetables Service- from the hostess, to the server, nobody was that friendly. Not sure if SW is going for the stuffy pretentious vibe but I felt like they were annoyed to be working or something..kind of off putting considering I'm eating a $500 meal and celebrating a graduation.  With all the highly rated steakhouses in Vegas, I'm not sure if I would come back to SW right away but still glad I came (and mom paid)!

Xal_GhcHB5cJYggx-t9y8w.text: Fantastic. I was a little put off initially when within two minutest for being seated, 6 different people had spoken with us, but quickly realized they were a finely tuned team, and all our orders and even our name were kept track of. Of course the steak was exceptional, as were the sides. The wine list is impressive/daunting. During evenings they have the music/light show out on the little pond which although entertaining, can be pretty loud and distracting- it's good for a light hearted group, but if you want quieter/more intimate meal ask to sit inside.

bJnMmkcAeMqTSc2iE1cqRA.text: I was taken here for my brithday this year on 2/22. Yes, it was only 4 days ago, so this experience is fresh in my mind.    The service was great. I would expect nothing less from a restaurant named after THE Steve Wynn.   We were seated very politely. First we received our bread basket, which had a greay assortment of baked breads, including a pretzel bread and a cheese biscuit with bacon pieces baked inside. Yum!  For our meals, my boyfriend ordered a T-bone steak, and it looked amazing. He ate is all, except for the fat he cut off.   I ordered the 9oz. filet mignon, and could only eat half of it. It was so much meat. I want to come here again. I will order this and a side dish for my boyfriend and I, and share both. That is more than enough.   As for the sides we ordered, a vegetable medley and  the creamed spinach. The vegetables were OK, nothing too exciting and the creamed spinach was VERY rich, and I felt it had a little too much cheese. I honestly don't think I would order it again.  The highlight of my dining experience was the giant singing frog that  rises above the waterfall. Sitting right next to the lake was also really beautiful and special. I would love to eat here again, just to sit next to the lake and feel the mist, eat and people watch.   It was not perfect, hence the 4 stars, but I still had a wonderful time, and would return again and again when I get the chance.

y7-Lk5wHIKckAkXFA-zN8w.text: 4.5 rounded down due to expensive price.  Had the filet mignon and it was very good.  But for the price I have had much better experiences.  Atmosphere is a bit strange with the show that seems to go off every 30 minutes.  Definitely interrupts the flow of the conversation.

6oKB_ncarAX9Cs9S4AxLkg.text: Can you really beat a lakeside table with good food and excellent wine? Didn't think so. The service was superb, the shows on the lake were so entertaining, and the food was yummy. We started with some sparkling rose and the foie gras. Then made our way to our delicious filets and the most amazing truffle creamed corn ever. My red wine was phenomenal and the bread was fantastic. Definitely a spectacular place to dine at in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon, truffle creamed corn, napa valley cab, Laurent Perrier rose. Perfect.

PSBA4ha7pPOOHMtEAK064A.text: This is my absolute favorite restaurant of all time. There is literally nothing to complain about (it is at the Wynn after all.) I've only been there twice because it is a little pricey, but it is totally worth it.   From the moment you walk in, they do their best to make you feel welcome. I am young, so I get the shoulder a lot of the time at fancy places. The staff is very knowledgeable in everything they serve. I like to try new beers and the waiter was very informative on their selection and even helped me pair my beer with what I was going to eat. The waitstaff is not intrusive when clearing plates and it seems like they do their best to not talk to you with your mouth full of their awesome steak.   As for the food, it is some of the best I've ever had. Last time I went (July 2013,) we started off with some foie gras and the squash blossoms, which I didn't even know was a food. Everything was excellent. My friend and i got awesome New York steaks, you can add foie gras by the way, and my girlfriend got a filet mignon. The steaks were cooked perfectly and were perfect cuts and extremely tasty.   For dessert, we shared some chocolate cake and ice cream, with a little bit of scotch. Again, it was perfectly done.   The thing about this place that makes it so great is it's 5 star service that doesn't make you feel like you need perfect manners to eat there.   Oh yeah, get the truffle creamed corn as a side.

Q48PzJ8IHroq9QbC2IJqFw.text: Service was amazing as was the food. We tried the Chile rubbed double rib eye and I can see why people rave about it. The funnel cakes and dipping sauces were yummy as well. Overall great experience at the Wynn.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile rubbed double rib eye = perfection

aRr0wPPwAQ-LQdKX-wTy4Q.text: Delicious! Get the A5 strip...melts in your mouth good. Polite and attentive service. Highly recommend!

s9IoSCGgbEcCQmfo_T1K9Q.text: I make this restaurant my only must experience every time I visit LV. Probably been here 4-5 times!  I believe this is by far the best dinning experience in Vegas - especially when its warm and you sit outside and watch the fountains/show!  Last time I ordered a cesar salad(strong and flavorful with crispy parmesan cheese on top) a perfectly cooked medium filet mignon, and a side order of corn - all 5/5.  I know this is a me too review (who doesn't love this place); but I can honestly say I dont always eat this well at the Wynn. For instance the Sushi place, for all its beauty,  I feel the food is just par at best - compared to many other sushi's throughout the city...the sports bar cafe - I downright hate the food there!  AND yes, it's expensive to dine here - its a top quality steakhouse at the best location, in the very best hotel in LV ... It's still cheaper than spending time at the tables or clubs- so keep ordering them drinks!

GiZM29vaeuR90gedNbNTAg.text: Our dinner here was enjoyable and the food worth every dollar. The place is pretty big, with plenty of outdoor sitting. We asked for a table outdoors so we could see the Lake of Dreams but was placed in a table right in between, although by the end of our meal we were glad they did, because it was getting cold and the Lake of Dreams turned out to be lame (one showed a frog singing "What a Wonderful World" and another showed two balls making rated R sounds and out comes a baby ball... Really now? =.='').  Complementary bread & butter. I have to mention that I love their butter, I couldn't stop eating the bread because of the butter.  Appetizer: Maryland Blue Crabcake - They kindly splitted the crabcake for us, so we each had our own. We both liked it, it was flavorful and complex, I can't describe how it tastes but it was good.  Main Course: Porterhouse for Two - We asked for medium rare and it was done to perfection. The filet side was oh-my-god good, it was so tender, so juicy, so flavorful. The strip side, although was very good itself (compared to other strip steaks), when compared next to the filet, it was obvious which is the better cut.  Roasted Sonoma Foie Gras - This is my first time eating foie gras, and it's set some high standards for any future ones I'm going to eat. It literally MELTS in your mouth. The flavor is strong and it has a nice roasted aroma that lingers. With every bite, I wonder why I've never tried it.  Dessert: Funnel Cakes - We thought we were going to get one or two, but no, we got SIX. How is two people going to eat six funnel cakes after so much meat?! Anyways... these are the BEST funnel cakes I've EVER had. It was hot and crisp, comes perched on mini tree branches, served with three dipping sauces: chocolate, some sort of vanilla cream, and caramel. Chocolate is standard. The vanilla cream was very good, not too sweet, it's kinda of like melted vanilla ice cream. Caramel was too sweet, and we both have a sweet tooth.  Advice: break your funnel cake into small pieces and dip it into the vanilla cream instead of spreading it on the funnel cake, it makes the cake soggy really fast. Dip it again in chocolate for a chocolate vanilla ice cream taste!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funnel Cakes (yes this is ONE order)
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Sonoma Foie Gras
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse for Two

Lfyc0IXR1lvUnp-Lb2Lmtw.text: I was persuaded by some local waiters in Vegas to try SW. When visiting Vegas for steaks I had always had excellent experiences at Palms, Prime & Ruth Chris. My appetizers were excellent, but after a prolonged wait for my bone/in ribeye, it was hard and overcooked. After calling for the metre/d, the response was an acknowledgment. I proceeded to pay my bill and tip at 18% to show class. However, I will not be going to SW again and will advise my friends not to do s.

wJf5tlIBVO5AHdAbH8WSSA.text: Nope, bad service, okay steaks.... Craftsteak at the MGM any day over this over-hyped place.

k5_hB_J15ttiriePQwIr7g.text: Hmmmmm.....where  do I begin????  This place is certainly worthy of bearing the initials of the casino mogul Steve Wynn.  The initial greeting at the bar was prompt and courteous, with VERY strong drinks as well.  The first time we dined here we sat indoors and sat outside(lakeside sitting) the third time.  We prefer sitting indoors from a serenity standpoint, but being outside was beautiful as the sun set on the  Wynn in the early evening .  The steaks were AMAZING, perfectly cooked, wonderful sear and impeccably seasoned. Our favorite side is hands down the TRUFFLE CREAMED CORN. yes, it warrants being typed in all caps. Lol.  Run, not walk, to SW.  You will not regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet, truffle cream corn, garlic mashed potatoes. Opulent.

9SoECCAU6bDt_l-IkXkKjw.text: Now, if your looking for the best steak ever with top notch service then come to SW.  BE FULLY ADVISED THIS PLACE ISN'T CHEAP!!!   I came here with my girlfriend on a Sunday night and was shocked at how good the food was.    1.) Steak was perfectly cooked (although pricey at $60 a steak, but SOOOOO GOOD). 2.) The bread was out of this world, especially the bacon bread. 3.) The margaritas were to die for, at $16 a piece, it wasn't too expensive. 4.) The service was outstanding.  Katherie went above and beyond to make our experience top notch. 5.)  The layout was great, half indoor and the half outdoors.  We were lucky that we got there early and were seated right next to the lagoon with perfect views of the nightly show. 6.) The show in the lagoon was an added bonus (the singing frog and the dancing balloons).  Overall, love this place and had a memorable experience.  Will definitely be back, hopefully really soon :)

s29WZYl3td9087BuePDjIA.text: ordered the Kobe beef filet- medium rare. simply exceptional. It almost melted in your mouth, minimal chewing. Was able to compare to filet mignon Americans style- was good but not great. If you're coming to this place to eat steak then go for the Kobe! You will not be dissapointed!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bowl of bread! could eat this all day!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ceviche!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. filet mignon!

JeFsIiDW52-H_EDiSEE6yw.text: Our go to steakhouse in LA is Mastro's, but when we're in Nevada SW is the place to be. The ambiance, the food, the beyond delicious steak, is what i look forward to when i'm in town. Such a beautiful restaurant full of elegance, i love the indoor seating but absolutely enjoy the patio seating, they have a nice water show every hour i believe. Can't wait until our next Vegas trip so I can enjoy our delectable dinners at SW.

KFGfIHCEJkUXPmEI-PC0qQ.text: I usually try new steakhouses every time I'm in Vegas.  My last trip was no different.  Everything at SW was fantastic and my strip was perfect.  Besides the fresh bread and the awesome steak the other thing that stood out above some other steak houses on the strip was the service.  We had multiple waiters and the service was fantastic and personable.  I will have and recommended SW to others and may even return again - sooner than later.

OEEUr8JwovCQQHm197O64w.text: Took me a couple of mediocre steakhouse dinners before I realized how good this place is. The wine is out there in left field somewhere but everything else is quality. It's Steve Wynn, he makes money by spending money and he did it well here.

goh0n50LB3HSi18ObzAG5A.text: Took the bf here for his b-day and they seated us outside by the waterfall, really beautiful. Their steaks are excellent (almost comparable to Mastro's in LA). Started off with the the oysters and crabcakes (yum!). For our main course we got the bone-in rib eye and filet along with some creamed corn (yum!) and crimini mushrooms (that was ok). Then for dessert we had the funnel cake and chocolate covered strawberries (enchanting presentation...double yum!!).  Will definitely be back again!

ottMCPRdCALFc_7yZ1wClA.text: I love steak! I always go to whatI think is the best I can find, Peter Luger in Brooklyn, Capital Grille's, Del Frisco's, Palm, Charlie Palmer, etc. This certainly ranks right up there with the best of them plus it's an elegant place. The porterhouse was fabulous. Juicy, Tasty, everything I could hope for. It was a while ago that I went so I don't remember exactly what the dessert was  but I remember it being very good. Highly recommended.

pXlN9E9bchYx4ApDe0p4JQ.text: Great steak, good crab cake, excellent kobe beef carpaccio, chocolate souffle was delish.  next time I'll bring my own wine to save some $$.  will definitely be back!

zvj7fV5WoinY-TXZsos9fQ.text: We went to this place right before seeing La Reve (which by the way is a great show)   We had the scallops and rib eye steak along with some truffled potatoes. The food was amazing and makes my mouth water just thinking about it. they do an excellent job preparing and cooking the food. the serivce is excellent and the ambiance is fantastic. I woudl definately go there again. If you go during the right time you can also see a show from the lake outside.

aCu8vYnEzwAws_eJhbUFMQ.text: The food was very good, can't complain. Actually the tater tots were exquisite, but for the price, the steak was not up to par, and the atmosphere was too loud and boisterous due to the water show to come off as a 5 star restaurant. Great meal, but sorry guys!

XuOeC--m07-TNB5D7GtTkA.text: We went for my brother in laws 30th birthday.  The staff and food were excellent.  I cant wait to go back.

EAcRafLiTZVPueHloelRSQ.text: The scallops, steak, nutella brownies, dirty martinis and duck l'lorange was superb. Dim lighting, casual attire.

pYOCtRs_DcFqC5wsdh7Iuw.text: Clearly one of the most opulent, elegant and notable steak houses in the city of Las Vegas. The service is impeccable and the food is first-rate. The steaks are so flavorful that you do not need any sauces whatsoever. Yes, this place is expensive but it is well worth the price.

oAAAGS3O7V4kViZcEMz9_w.text: I ordered the rib eye and it was charred perfectly! The meat was also cooked nicely with great marbling. My fiance also loved the charring on his filet. He did his "test" of cutting a piece with his fork to test the tenderness, it passed. So, we both loved the texture BUT we felt it wasn't flavorful enough. I'm not sure, but it could've been aged longer, maybe. We ordered the "tots" and truffled potatoes for sides. The tots were kinda blah and the potatoes were ok. It had a nice truffle flavor to it, but I thought it was too watery. The service was fine. Not sure how much the bill was, but the prices were comparable to other fine dining steakhouses.

rG55Z1XPcLmF-T4wfQNl6Q.text: Tried quite a handful of steak houses in Vegas over the years and this came away with the best combination of service, appetizers, and steak.  The seared Toro at $35 is worth every bite, and the Chicago-style crusted/charred Rib Eye at 20oz is an excellent finish.  Portions so big we could care less about desserts.  Cut the grease with a fine red from their extensive selection, then head out to the bar for a light show and coffee.  Steak has been the staple of many a customer meetings in Vegas, and I'll definitely be visiting this one on my own dime when I'm there.  Preferred the service , meat, and pricing to Prime in Bellagio, which was our destination the previous night.  Would have been perfect if: - the steak accompaniments matched that of Prime - the waiter not knowing what a Caipirinha is ;-)

E6IABkKj-BJBhtj4oPYhgg.text: Went there with my girfriend on Spring Break. Probably one of the nicest and best restaurants I've been to. The view alone was worth the money!

R4999wt0rDZVYjSAnzK1pg.text: This is one of the best steak houses I have ever been too. The atmosphere is intense with a great show at the water fall. Aside from that they are known for their tender steaks and amazing martinni's if thats your fancy. I went twice while I was in Vegas during CES and I certainly will be back there again soon

Z255wo7D-fYqn1kl2V8qkA.text: I'll keep it short...AMAZING FOOD! You should definitely try this place for the great dishes and great ambiance. However, they lose a star because we had the worst servers ever! (I think this was a fluke, we had 2 servers and they both ignored us and didn't check up on us. As a former bartender, I was pissed at their behavior and attitude. I will try again because I'm sure it was just these 2.)

DHLK1kPFwnCuXPz5YB00_A.text: 4 Stars for the food. 3 stars for the service.  The view of the waterfall at the Wynn is gorgeous, but the service put a damper on the evening. Our waiter was rude beyond comprehension and ignored our table (party of 14)  for the table next to us on a bachelorette party. You would think for that with a party of 14 and a bill exceeding $1200, we would have been treated better.   But I have to say the filet was amazing, as was the appetizer. The manager apologized for the service, but I won't be going back.

2bZPVBFOcQMWXaYd2yfLuw.text: Great food. Good atmosphere and great service. Steak was perfectly prepared. Definitely recomended. It wasn't cheap but I guess nothing in Vegas is.

XOW0L7W3rPgrwmoeYdYXqg.text: Its Steve's Wynn's steak house need I say more? I have to write this place up because it was the best dining experience I ever had.  If you're in the Vegas area and have some money to blow this place is it.  Everything is good from great steaks, great seafood appetizers and the best side dishes to compliment there steaks.  Service is 5 star like there hotel, it's the type of place where a waiter is there to refill your water with every sip.  I thought the show is actually distracting while you're eating but it's great why you wait for your table or afterwards with a drink.  I had the Caesar Salad, NY Strip and was lucky to be in a big group so basically got to sample all the sides.  SW Steak House is 5 STARS

-xaa7wk3Dj7LoYrJyKX17w.text: great great steak.. this was my first time staying in the wynn/encore and we are so glad we chose SW for our first meal. we were all in a rush to hit up the nightlife so we skipped appetizers and went right to the porter houses. there were 8 of us and most of us split a couple of porter houses. The meat was cooked perfect and i sware everyone got a steak knife but me and i just used the butter knife to cut my steak. it was so tender and had SO much flavor. probably my second best steak i ever had. Kean's NY and Luger's NY are at my top. the sides were tiny but all were so very good especially the potatoes. we used to make charlie Palmer's our Vegas steak place but now it will have to be SW... good job Steve now just get rid of Sinatra's at encore...

u3Di6PoQXOj_3rfdv_PbfA.text: by far the BEST bone in ribeye steak you will eat in your life!!  i have tried all steak houses and non compare to SW steakhouse's bone in ribeye!!  we have our fair share of steak houses in chicago and i am very sad that mr. wynn will not open a SW in chicago.  of all 5 times that i have eaten here, i would have to rate it 5stars each time! steak comes out perfect and juicy to your liking and the sides are incredible as well.  bone in RIBEYE is a must along w their creamed corn w truffles!! order these two and you will not be disappointed!!   this is probably the only restaurant i gave a 5star to!!!

qzLwsfEjb2-H9O82WvRJOg.text: Ambiance, location, presentation: all 5 stars  Food and pricing: 4 stars I was underwhelmed honestly. It had been oversold to me it think. I got a delicious steak and had several of their entrees. I would go back but only when someone else is paying haha

NJ8vGLaToAaUAk-zezajSA.text: I have high expectations for this place.  Last night's experience with this restaurant didn't meet those expectations. Our reservation was at 7:30pm for a party of 6, we didnt leave till 11pm because the food came so late. The waiter said he put a hold on our main course because our appetizers were consumed slowly. But really??? We didnt request to put our main course on hold! 1 and a half hour late?  Our steaks didnt come as requested. Well done was pink, medium well was rare.  We had plans on going to the encore beach club but sitting and waiting there for a long time made everybody tired and took the mood from excited to disappointed. Then our food came. No it wasn't fantastic. I have tasted better steaks and food somewhere else. Also, the reservation was made for a birthday on our party. No slice of cake or mention about it from our waiter or anything close to a nice gesture. Then why would their customer representative ask if there's anything we are celebrating? The two stars is for the nice ambience that Wynn never fail to offer. Disappointing.

DQDUb8FpZKSdrb2uCx3-oA.text: Wow what beautiful restaurant.  I came on a Sunday night (you must make reservations) and it was packed. The setting could not be more beautiful with the waterfall background as your view from the restaurant. At sundown they open up the sliding door and it feels like you are in some resort on vacation. You can then hear the water and it adds to the experience. The inside of the restaurant is elegant and very clean looking. I love the light colors. Such a great ambiance for a special occasion.   I had the bone in rib eye and it was the best rib eye I can remember having in years, loved it! For the sides we shared a Au Gratin potatoes which usually doesn't excite me but this one was the best I've had with gruyere cheese in it. Creamed spinach was great. We also got the black truffle creamed corn which was very unique and delicious. For a starter I got the Caesar Salad and it was nothing special. Desert was a molten chocolate cake which was excellent and a ice wine the waiter suggested.   Service was great until the last 10 minutes when we were ignored when it came to getting the check and taking the payment. I was disappointed that I told them when I booked that it was my best friend's wedding anniversary and a special occasion and they did not bring them something that said Happy Anniversary. I do see it in the yelp pictures that they do this, so I don't understand how they overlooked this. Maybe they don't do that here or they forgot? They did mention her anniversary at check in though so they did know. It's always nice to get that to take pictures with and I was expecting that this expensive restaurant would do that.    Our night ended with seeing Steve Wynn himself enter the restaurant and go to the back room.   I can't wait to come back!

PDFZduqJjQypImguBBxLCw.text: Phenomenal service. Our waiter was one of the most knowledgeable waiters. Food was great and drinks were well suggested. We will be back!

0eobcTDu4EIsn59MqhXUlQ.text: The main reason why I gave SW there's stars instead of 2 was because the restaurant is stunning. No debate about it. It's beautiful and romantic on the inside, and the waterfall and shows are captivating and beautiful as well. We sat on the patio and loved the ambiance. The trees and water are just stunning. There's really no other words to describe how great the atmosphere was.  However, I would not return except for the beauty of the space. Primarily because the service is extremely slow and the food is not remarkable. We were a party of 2 and were there for over three hours - and not by personal choice. We didn't get our appetizer for over an hour after sitting down. After that every single course took another 30-45 minutes to get. It was insane. They'd clear our plates promptly when we were done but the food just wouldn't come out. I'm assuming it's a kitchen issue, not service.   The service was good, but hard to come by at the same time. When our menus were shut they'd come and take our order, when our water was empty they would fill it. But there was twice we needed our server and they wouldn't come by. We watched them standing by server stations, but they just stood there. Being that we aren't the type to wave across a restaurant it was a little frustrating trying to get the server to come by. They were friendly and helpful with the menu once they had come by though.   The last reason why I'm only giving three stars is that it was our anniversary and it was never acknowledge. Nobody said happy anniversary, there was no anniversary dessert, nothing. We told the reservationist twice so it was pretty disappointing not to have it acknowledged.  We ordered the snake river strip, 9 oz filet and the dry aged bone in strip. The dry aged strip had a mild flavor of dry aging so if you're curious to try a dry aged steak it's a good option cause it's not overly potent. The filet was good. I ordered it with a char and they did a great job of creating a crust. For sides we did spinach, corn and au gratin. The corn was the best part of the meal. It was almost like the consistency of grits, but with a sweet corn and truffle flavor. They were great. For dessert we had the molten cake and the cake was fantastic. I didn't love the grand mariner ice cream though.

_d8NXdlqXC-dNtg0xyBKsw.text: This place is always a hit. From the decor, to the creative entertainment, best drinks, food, and top notch service. the caviar or scallops are my favorite. The kale salad is the best. Robert is an incredible manager and always makes sure every dinner is the perfect experience. I can not say enough great things about him and his staff. Personal or business dinners, you cannot go wrong with this place. Always get the funnel cakes!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bj0L--wYOPa9uaoynjXo7Q.text: I have to say I was very disappointed with my dinner at SW this week.  The restaurant is beautiful and for that it was 5 stars.  However, I took a group of 9 people for dinner and although the servers themselves were great the service was incredibly slow.  I ordered a NY strip, my go to steak, it was terrible, arrived cool, it was so tough it was difficult cut, chewy, not even close to what I would expect at a top end steakhouse.  I gave up on it, barley eating 1/4.  Looking around the table no one finished their meal.  We still had a great time with lots of good wine, but the dinner itself needed much improvement.    Sorry for the poor review, I expected so much more.

1XWQMDZcuqnCmumJCYdq1g.text: Full disclosure- I'm a pescatarian so I can't really speak about the meat!   We sat outside which was amazing because we were able to watch the show in the water. The service was phenomenal and the drinks were good. I had the kale salad and the tuna tartar... both were very tasty! My family and friends who had the meat seemed to really enjoy it too!

R6bJWwgUZCQYy8vicI_l-Q.text: I celebrated my birthday here with my friends. Inside the restaurant was very bright for a dinner house, so I was so glad that we got seated outside patio! The weather was just perfect, the perfect lighting, and the entertainment above the water was so fun, it was like the extension of the La Reve we saw before the dinner... First of all the bread basket was so yum, so I didn't order any appetizers, my boyfriend and I shared Chateaubriand, side of mushrooms, cream spinach, asparagus and brussel sprouts for the table, this steak was the most tender, one of the best steak ever! All the sides were delicious too. My friends did not have a steak but they said their food was delicious as well. At last, the dessert Rocky road was so cool, nobody expected to come like it did like magic! I will definitely go back next time I take a Vegas trip! And this place is definitely the best steak house in Vegas! Great job Steve Wynn!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After pouring the fudge!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rocky road dessert before he poured the fudge...
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My little birthday cake:)

dLC1WVfvU0sJ5fL6E4SnXQ.text: The food was 4/5, the service was 5/5 and the ambiance was 4/5. It's a little too big for my taste for a steakhouse- I prefer darker and more cavernous and this kind of feels really open like I'm in a Nordstrom cafe. The water show every 30 minutes is really fun though so I guess just think of it as a great Vegas steakhouse. Service was really awesome and we had a lovely time.

dfyjcgMXXnDNClWdoS3grQ.text: This review is hard one to swallow for sure. Just like the steak I had here three days ago. But I would like to be very clear the servers there were extremely personable and sweet. They were on point and did everything expected and more, they are a True 5/5 so thank you for our experience because that is still something. The two stars are for you.   But to be a steakhouse out of all of the things you need to get right, steak is the first one. My filet was over charred leaving a burnt taste every time I ate a piece, the servers did switch our steaks, either that or the chefs do not know the difference between medium rare and medium. This is truly one of the worst steaks I have ever had.  The steak was dry, and lacked actual seasoning, and man it was so hard to cut! I enjoyed the seafood spectacular, my boyfriend did not, he just was not impressed. The wine was good, and the mash potatoes were awesome. The server noticed I didn't enjoy it and offered to replace it with something else, I declined and he kindly removed it from the bill.   I really wanted to like this place, my boyfriend and I don't mind paying for service, food, and experience. But for over 300, I expect a good steak.

5IsheE3EviWY0gWhVg7l3A.text: I'll just come out and say it: this was one of the fanciest dining experiences of my life.  Now, I'm no high roller, but when you go to Vegas you have to splurge a bit. That's part of the experience. One of my old friends actually works here and suggested we all eat here, so we did.  Don't go walking in with flip flops and some jorts, either. This is a nice place. You can wear jeans and a polo, but anything else might be frowned upon. The tables are numerous, and they're all covered in white tablecloths. The room itself is quite elegant.  It's one of those places where three different servers will come to your table at one time: one guy brings the bread, another pours your drinks, and the other brings you the seafood platter -- which, for a solid $100, is awesome (jumbo shrimp, crab, oysters, lobster, three different sauces).  For dinner I HAD to get the filet, so I did. It was certainly one of the best steaks I've ever had in my life... I'd put it in my top three. It was so tender yet so juicy, and the sauce served with it makes my mouth water from 2,000 miles away. We all split different dishes too: mac and cheese (a nice twist and a very rich cheese taste); brussel sprouts; potatoes au gratin and steak tartar. Every side was scrumptious. Yes, you pay a lot but the portion sizes and the quality of the food is just amazing. We even split a piece of cheesecake for fun at the end, and that too was out of this world good.  Yes, it is pricey. My girlfriend's 24-ounce beer cost around $40. But again, it's Vegas and you're eating at Steve Wynn's steakhouse. The staff is great; they joke around with you but are very prompt on all the food and drinks. They will even take pictures of your group if you request it. Also, I was told Wynn himself is a vegetarian, so the menu has numerous veggie options.  It was one of those meals I will remember for a long, long time. I ate a lot, spent a lot, laughed a lot and had an overall great time with friends and significant others.

P93Q6Cx_WpnCN5vkcSPoyw.text: We were very disappointed with our experience here. We came in with high hopes. We had 4 out of a group of 11 celebrating birthdays and were looking forward to a delicious meal. We are a young group, but not rowdy and all ordered nice cuts of meat, sides and bottles of wine/cocktails. We frequently found our water glasses empty. We had to pour our own wine; something we do not expect to go given the prices of the wine. My fiance and I's NY strips were bland and difficult to cut. I will say we tried our friend's domestic wagyu and were delighted. Overall, we would not recommend and do not remember this food or service pleasantly.

Q7PXQGwDi1d2eJ39XZN-jw.text: I booked a reservation two months in advance. It was my wife's birthday and we were going to drop some serious $$$ trying their True Kobe beef steak (estimated bill of $600 after the additions). We arrived only to be told we couldn't bring our 10 month old in. Mind you, she's on the verge of falling asleep and our reservation was at 9:30 (they close at 10:00). So basically they didn't seat us just because of a baby when the restaurant is emptying out. Pretty ridiculous. As if a 5-year old (their age limit) is better behaved than a sleeping baby would be.  Well good. We won't be spending our money with that hotel or steakhouse. Just a stupid policy for a restaurant to have and it cost them tonight.

rqN3fnPYmZmS53EE2QmmoA.text: Absolutely top notch.   For those that don't know, Steve Wynn is vegan and therefore most restaurants in the Wynn and Encore have a vegan menu/options. From perusing through the menus, this one seemed to be the best for my fiance's liking.   First off, and restaurant and ambiance are fantastic. We had early reservations right when they opened so we got seated right by the water. Unbeknownst to us, there's water lights shows throughout the evening. As expected, staff is first rate and very friendly.   Vegan bread and butter to start, which were good. I still eat dairy, so I tried their other assortments which were delectable.   Our waiter went to verify with the chef on whether or not the crab cake was vegan, and came back with a very detailed response. The breadcrumbs weren't vegan, but we ordered it anyway. 4.5/5 very good.   I ordered the domestic wagyu New York strip. Cooked to perfection and the best steak I've ever had.   Ordered some vegan sides to share with my fiance: whipped potatoes (vegan sour cream) and black truffle cream corn. Both were great, but in particular the truffle corn.   Fiance got the chick'n ravioli which she said was very good. Looked small, but at $26 she could've gotten 4 when compared to the price of my steak!   It's amazing to find and restaurant where I can order steak and my fiance something vegan that isn't just a salad. Top it off with phenomenal service and ambiance, you've got a winner here.

BrCZmdRaHATS65hqWofELw.text: How can I start!!! This restaurant is five stars all the way!! Ok yes it is expensive but well worth the money. The expression you get what you pay for is where this expression stems from.  We had the kale salad AMAZING!!! So delicious!! I ordered the sea scallops and boy did I choose right. My husband choose the wagyu he said it was the best steak he has ever had!!! Everything was sooo fulling!! We also had the Mac and cheese and gnocchi. Believe me we have leftovers!!! A most try, just remember money does matter for happiness.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea scallops
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu steak
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view

wF5mOFPTB33cKdnGnYpJrA.text: My second visit to SW Steakhouse over Memorial Day Weekend turned out even better than the first visit. First, I have to recommend the Lychee Martini! It is so delicious and yummy! In fact, it does not taste like alcohol at all. I ended up drinking 3! Oops.   Also, I would really recommend their seasonal specials.Last time I was here in December, the snow crab claws were AMAZING. Unfortunately, they were not in season this time. However, we tried the truffle gnocchi was was equally tasty and also the truffle salt steak carpacchio which also blew my mind!   We also tried their famous chili rub steak this time, however, the meat was a little over-cooked. My boyfriend loved it but I thought it was just okay.   ONE LAST THING - get the Rocky Road for dessert. This comes out in a chocolate sphere and the server will pour a hot syrup over the sphere and the ice cream inside will reveal. It was delicious and really cool.   Reservations are hard to get so make sure you make them in advance. The outdoor seating is so amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasonal dish - the truffle was disappointing

w6C1w8hdiIroF2Q6-2E85g.text: Not worth what you paying for!!!!! The reason for this review is a big disappointment and experience that I had today with SW Steakhouse for my wife birthday!!! I made a reservation 2 days ago and was very specific that I want to get a cake at the end of the dinner for my wife birthday. I ask the representative over the phone if she need me to pay for the cake over the phone and she was very clearly that I will pay it together with my bill. So as I expected and the end of the dinner an hour ago I'm waiting for the cake I order and the person that serve us gave me a desert menu. As I got a bit confused I got up to him and ask him to look at my reservation notes. After few minutes he came back to the table with this embarrassing few balls of chocolate!!!!!! VERY DISAPPOINTING AND EMBARRASSING!!!! I went to talk to the manager and the response I got from her was that the cake is pending and she doesn't really have anything to do with that!!! From a high hand place as this and for what you paying over there you looking for a little bit more of respect at least for the manager. I will highly recommend not going there!!!!!

J5VyCHzZUcU3Lp4XeaEOug.text: Absolutely amazing the service, hospitality was awesome  Nina was such a pleasure and a blessing to have as our server, Ryan & John complemented her awesomely. I don't have enough stars to say how good the food was and excellent the service.

tjA_cXZx1Ovaw9CldryEpg.text: The steak was soooooooo juicy and tender also really helpful and kind staff the restaurant was very nice it was clean everything was perfect honestly one of the best steaks I've ever had

ZUaqlGralk2ShL5L0mcN2A.text: Gf is vegetarian and hard to find a steakhouse with vegetarian options -- this place has many alternatives which was perfect!  Steak was great - not nearly as delicious as Ruth's or Mortons though.  Amazing Caesar salad one of the best ** Delicious teriyaki greenbean side Loved the every 30 minute visual show outside via water fountain Our server was mediocre. Not sure if it's because we are "younger" so he didn't give us as much attention as necessary but luckily the B server was fantastic. Wish I could've given him the entire tip.  For Vegas steak house- great spot. I personally prefer Joe's Stone Crab 9/10 times over this spot though

zMV0R4McK5VEwdFROvf-lg.text: Best steakhouse to me in Vegas! Great food, beautiful ambiance and awesome service! I'm a local and I finally went there for the first time. We were close to the outdoor seating so we were able to watch the show and see the waterfall. What I love about it is that they can open the indoor part of the restaurant to be exposed to their outside area. I would definitely go back. I think it's great for groups, families and dates.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t70V4oF4lYnsKXRJCuqIUw.text: To make a reservation, they would tell you the restaurant is full for that day, then you walk in and it's definitely not.  Steak, salads, appetizers and sides were very good.   Service is not so great, and considering the prices, you would expect better service and friendlier staff.

-s9zXXO6LLr3zhrrDRZ7XA.text: Dinner and a Show ...  Fashionable restaurant , quiet and spectacular. Very good meal and good choice lobsters. We have such a good  time here and unforgettable impressions.. Just go there and enjoy  ...  Definitely  recommended !

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3IVa63kKDVEpWgI8dN8b_Q.text: Had a lovely evening here. Food was very good and the atmosphere was awesome. The little shows they do every 20 or 30 mins were highly entertaining. Staff were very attentive and on top of everything. I had a steak and it came with a lovely garlic fat sauce that was so delicious. We also ordered the Mac and cheese. That was super good as well and would have been my favorite if it didn't have fennel in it. It tasted like black liquorish. Overall a cool experience.

zreTrcFZHtsDEf8KU7ldRg.text: Awesome dining experience! I enjoyed everything!  I had the bone in ribeye medium and it was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet was great!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend said the lamb chop was great
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Ribeye steak

4v8vwNdRWCs08BR5FwPYmw.text: I was appalled by the lackluster service we received at SW Steakhouse. For one of the Wynn restaurants, I expected much better.   First off, we had to wait 10 minutes just to be seated at our table (even with a reservation). Given there was a crowded entryway in the restaurant, I could forgive this if it were not for the service to follow. It took 30 minutes for our drinks to arrive and an hour just to take our orders. It would have taken even longer had I not been tracking the waiter down with my eyes and giving her meaningful looks to come over to our table. Basically, my party of 6 had to wait ~1.5 hours for any food to hit our table.  The food itself was great but didn't blow me away compared to other steakhouses. I had the Tuscan Kale salad and the bone-in rib eye. The ambiance was entertaining with the waterfall show and we were seated outside as per my request.  Everything but the service met my expectations. But for the price of the food, that kind of service is just inexcusable. I love the Wynn but not this restaurant.

TzS43QAfaGsUXcp7DcjWyQ.text: My absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas. The class, the service, the food, the ambiance of this restaurant is incomparable to any other. I love dining and watching the show in the waterfall. I will continue to return to this restaurant each time i am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DV0rDbx8Fow52pXe4ywD_Q.text: Although pricey, this is the best steakhouse in Vegas  Why?  The environment is great. The water light show is cool and the food is amazing  Their starters and salads are unique and top notch in flavor and quality  Their meats are usda prime and cooked perfect ( I love the tomahawk rib eye)  Their sides are unique from other steakhouse. My favorite is the corn with truffles!  Really nice wine list  Is their anything the Wynn does not do right ?

uLbjVUsz-Rca2pourkVJmw.text: A cut below the other staples in Vegas.  I prefer Craftsteak and STK over SW Steakhouse.  Service goes without saying because when you pay 60-70 dollars for a ribeye you expect the service and presentation to be great so I can't consider this as a value added.    Of course what I can critique is the steak.  I got the bone in Ribeye and only the first bite (near the fat before the marbled portion) was succulent. With each successive cut the ribeye began drying up in my mouth.  Typically I judge a good ribeye from the first to last bite being oozing w/ juiciness--not the case here.  The sides left much to be desired.  Nothing special and nothing that can't be found at a buffet.  Winelist was good, again was expected when you're spending this kind of money.  $144 was my total tab and I have to say that  1) STK 2) Craftsteak 3) Vic & Anthony's   Will all be a better "Tasting"/Dining experience.

9n282hBNZnHEVPDyIuvBHA.text: had the kosher steak...table of 8 and everyone's steaks were perfect temperature.  sides were generous and tasted delicious.  service was great too.  5 star review for a five star experience.

vj8WlhAiKNsulZWXHefbeQ.text: Mixed performance that falls short of expectations.  First the good: the domestic kobe beef steak was excellent and perfectly grilled. A wonderfully complex, savory and creamy delight. Same for the fois gras, and accompanying veggies. The molten chocolate cake with ice cream was an exquisite study in contrast with just the right amount of tartness. Interior decor was up-to-par for this class of restaurant.  Now the bad: the noise level was so high that we could hardly carry a conversation, the steak fries were undercooked and over-fried (i.e. too crisp outside and hard inside - as though the potatoes weren't parboiled with the cook then compensating by letting them fry extra long), and generic pop music is not a wise choice for this caliber of restaurant. I don't really want Maroon 5 with my kobe beef. Lastly, one of the servers picked a used napkin off the chair and placed it on top of one of the plates. Read: took a used napkin off a chair that probably wasn't disinfected beforehand, and then placed it on a plate from which we were going to eat desert.  Given the aspirations of SW, it falls short for this class. So, yes, in this genre, we've had better. Management may wish to study Wing Lei upstairs, for they have got "it" down to an art.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium rare kobe beef new York steak.
