AfrRGhAW7WLjc0J3zcgtlQ.text: Another 3.5 stars.  Came here for my birthday dinner and was expecting so much from SW, as I've heard great things, but unfortunately I was disappointed in the food.  The service was wonderful but our steak and wine was mediocre at best.  We had shrimp cocktail, tuna tartare. a bone-in rib eye, and a wagyu rib eye.  I did appreciate them bringing out a delicious macaron with a candle.  I believe in second chances, so we shall see if they can redeem themselves.

FUtt4wGQ2yd2no6_QdG3Cg.text: Food was excellent. Service all there. I had the lamb chops, wife had halibut. 5 star. And the 5 minute show was great. Over all exc.

8M4sfRyHD7BVLk2HtQ9Juw.text: The meal was epic.   It was probably the best meal I have ever had. We had the scallops, filet and lamb and all were cooked to perfection. The spinach and fries were amazing. The staff is more than attentive and you do feel special. By far worth a visit and what amazing food.   I still dream of it on a daily basis.

dZaYKTMKY6RSPghPPi8iDA.text: Went there last night and the food was good and service was great. With that being said: I would confident myself A person knows good meat and good way of cooking the meat, been to CUT recently and the Japanese wagyu at CUT blows this place out of the water!!! Again, I would say this place is decent but not for the price... our bill was $4,000 for 8 people so you would want it to be absolutely perfect. The reason I'm even giving 2 stars is cause the appetizers and sides were very good.  Very disappointing... skip this place and go to CUT

Jdbks8k6ojq3RGgePh147w.text: A bit upset. FOOD WAS SPECTACULAR. Let me be clear , but service is not all that's great for a place that costs a arm and a leg. However, that's the kind of place we were looking for. If you want a great steak this is the place, but the service is NOT the for the price of the steak....

g_6Q4ryAJlovEdX9zGaQDw.text: Great food!!! We have a big party of ten so we ordered so much for everyone to share.   We started with the bread and the cheesy one is to die for! So good so yummy! Pretzel was good as well as the French baguette!  Appetizers - oysters platter, kale salad, octopus  Sides - truffle corn, Brussel sprouts, cheesy mashed potato, saute mushrooms, truffle Risotto  For steak we ordered porter house, bone in rib eye and all the steaks are HUGE. Definitely recommend sharing!   Drinks - lychee Martini and sparkling blood orange neogori is so good too!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge porter house

Hk4rj3FB5LInZeKLcZ8jOQ.text: Another great steakhouse in Vegas.   We came here for a work celebration and I was extremely impressed with the service and food.   We had reservations and were seated promptly after we arrived.   The bread basket was amazing. It included bacon and cheese muffin looking bread, pretzel bread and small baguettes. It was accompanied by butter topped with Hawaiian sea salt. Great presentation even better execution. You have to try the bacon cheese bread, it was SOOO good!   I ordered the New York strip topped with bleu cheese. I ordered it medium rare, it was cooked perfectly. The steak was super flavorful and extremely tender. I highly recommend the New York strip.    The sides were:  Au Gratin Potatoes: Very flavorful and rich. My only complaint is the portion size is so small. If you have more than three people sharing, order two.   Crisp Potato Rosti w/ chive cream: Skip this one, it was like a giant tater tot. No one at the table was very impressed  Poblano & Smoked Bacon Mac n Cheese: This side was really good. Not the best mac n cheese I've ever had but, it was really good.   Roasted Jumbo Asparagus: You have to order at least one healthy side, right? Well it was healthy until they bathed the asparagus in butter. Don't get me wrong, they were delicious, but no where near healthy.   Dessert: We ordered the funnel cakes. They were displayed beautifully. The funnel cakes themselves where extremely crispy. I like my funnel cake like I like my woman crispy on the outside and warm and delicious on the inside.... wait what? The dipping sauce were great except for the chocolate. I don't know what they put in it, but it was horrible. I'd skip the funnel cakes next time.   Service was really good, a couple of times our waitress was M.I.A. but, our drinks were never empty and our empty plates never stayed on our table.   All in all, this place is great and we will be coming back. If you are in town, give it a whirl.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket and butter

tuLtkuGERXOw4YMeQqHCwA.text: $$$$!  As good of a steak you can find without going into the astronomical price ranges - at 62 dollars for a bone-in ribeye, you definitely get an amazing slab of meat. And the bone here is not really an issue. The marbling, texture, and flavor are all top notch. There's a reason why this place is brutally busy on weekend nights!  The meal opens up with a nice little bread basket featuring bacon and cheese bread, pretzel bread, and a standard french baguette. It's served with delicious sea salted butter that's too good to not slather all over the bread. Both the bacon and cheese bread and pretzel bread are very tasty and the pretzel bread is notable for its texture.   As for appetizers, the ones we got are very good but didn't blow my mind. The chopped salad was refreshing but nothing outstanding. Same for the side dishes - I think the creamed spinach was my favorite. Neither the french fries, corn, nor mac and cheese were worth writing home about. I might recommend scalloped potatoes first and foremost.  But really you're coming here for the steak. And it's a really damn good one.  On a second visit here, I was able to try the cheese crusted colorado lamb chops - the lamb itself was absolutely top notch, but I felt there was a little too much emphasis on the cheese crust and not enough on seasoning the meat itself. Therefore, bites without cheese crust were a little bland. Still, I chalked that to a bit of preference as well.  We also got desserts our last time. I'd definitely reconsider the pavlova - I didn't like the textures so much, but it was a unique and well crafted dessert that contrasted with the creme brulee's and brownies with ice cream.  The restaurant itself is huge - people are quickly moving across the restaurant making it a bit of a bustle. One noticeable feature is the large waterfall and pool on one side of the restaurant. The first night we sat outside and had a great view - but the entertainment itself is really strange and eclectic and is in someways a distraction rather than a pleasing display. A singing frog, blue and red sex balls (they moan and have a baby), and freaky faces fail to add to the atmosphere. I get that it's "art" but bleh.  Another note worth pointing is out is service was generally good, if not a tad slow at times due to the busy nature of the restaurant. Still, they were very good about refilling drinks and recognizing when we were done with our food. Best of all, they were more than willing to take pictures for us in front of the water with nary a hint of disdain! :-D

UAJc5qVuhJvAOuByLwV9MA.text: Worth every penny! The service was impeccable like a finely orchestrated musical. Wonderful older ambience! Was waiting for Sammy Davis Jr. to sit down with me. The rib eye was cooked medium well to perfection. Made my trip to the Wynn a memorable experience.

-GI2C0kR1MQu0lxW-bpYmw.text: We dined last Saturday at the SW Steakhouse.  Parties are only seated together. While we were checking in for our reservation, I overhead the hostess taking a call from a customer that wanted a table for the same night.  If you want to eat at SW, I HIGHLY recommend that you make a reservation well in advance of your desired dining date. We waited for our friends in the bar/lounge area.  The cocktail prices were not excessive and made to order (I can tell if the servers are paying attention because I always start off with a Bombay Sapphire Martini, up, in a very cold glass, dry like the desert, with three (3) olives. If any part of that order is wrong it is usually an omen for the rest of the experience).    Because the weather outside was cold (in the low 50's) we were given the option of dining on the patio or inside.  Our party of six chose to dine inside.  I would like to point out that SW does not start with an automatic gratuity until the party size reaches eight (8) this was a nice surprise (even though our tips usually are higher).  Each of the meals was prepared to perfection and the service was outstanding.  My wife and I had the porterhouse for two and it was served resting on vegetables.  The table ordered a few sides to share that the amount of food was actually too much.  Some of our party ended taken food back to their suite.  The wine selection is sophisticated and complete (some of the accompanying prices are sophisticated as well).  Not everyone in our party was drinking wine so one of the spouses suggested to the waiter that they bring something out in the $100-$150 range.  The selection was excellent for our preparation.   I would recommend this dining experience to anyone who enjoys a great steakhouse.

5okjt6_oYcsf6cy1pLaYRg.text: Overall I enjoyed SW. The steak was just slightly above average but the service was way above average. The waterfall on the lake is really cool and the shows just add to the experience. I will go back next time I'm at the Wynn!!!

cWb8ZKY8Ja2zJS7Cb4fQQA.text: I loved this restaurant! The service the food....all of it!   Let me start with the yummy bread they bring out at the beginning of the meal. Soft warm rolls speckled with bits of smoky bacon and butter served with their butter drizzled in olive oil and truffles. This was a great start! I love my carbs so when the bread is good I have high hopes for the rest of the dinner and I definitely was not disappointed :)  I started with the Crab Corn Chowder. So delicious! It was a generous serving served in a small crock pot. It was a smooth blend of creamed sweet corn with nice big chunks of crab meat. It had a slight spiciness to it but still mild where you just notice it. If I'm not mistaken it also had a small bit of a mild white cheese to top it off and a light garnish of parsley. So YUM!  For my main course I chose the pan seared Halibut. Cooked absolutely perfectly served atop a tomato relish/puree. The fish had this great outer crust simply seasoned with just salt and pepper and the inside evenly cooked, flaky and so moist and flavorful! The menu is a la carte so I also ordered the butter roasted fingerling potatoes (I do love my carbs!) as my side. Again simply seasoned with salt, pepper and garlic and roasted in butter till tender.   Finally, to top off the whole dinner they give you these absolutely delicious, chocolate truffles. My friend and I could swear that there was some type of flavoring in the chocolate but we were told that they were pure chocolate truffles, no flavorings added. Sooo very YUM!  The whole staff was very attentive, but not overly bothersome, prompt, very friendly and courteous.   I had a great time and a fabulous meal, I would definitely visit again!

lRRw23yUVp-H4O34Edewjw.text: I went here after reading these reviews. My parents were coming into town and wanted to have a night out and this was our first stop.   Well worth it...

bwtcWhVDqZf92LLsfDgmPA.text: This place was extremely disappointing.  Both my husband and I felt that everything we had was super salty.  The steak was improperly cooked and left a bad taste  in my mouth.    I feel like the recognition of this restaurant is only being given credit due to the WYNN name.

aaBdTGzcp37HeDCmPrTf1g.text: Had a great experience, I had the 9 oz Fillet and it was prefect, my wife had the scallops and they were perfect. Service was perfect and we sat in a private room which was perfect. Basically we had a perfect night.

h8uYl6BBJKz6iyHpNgm4Ug.text: We hosted a customer dinner event here last week.  We had a group of 30 and our dinner was excellent.  Service and food was outstanding.

GS8A2tqkKKDAOQZbrZDPKQ.text: Best steak I have ever had.  My 12 ounce filet mignon was done perfectly as was companion's bone-in rib eye.  It was crisp on the outside and moist and tender on the inside.  Medium rare was perfectly executed.  The only downside were the sauces, the white (SW) one was okay, and the rest were inedible.  But, I went for the steak and not for the sauces.  The bread was also excellent, and the sides were fantastic (creamed corn and yukon potatoes).    The atmosphere was wonderful.  Definitely go after dark.  The waterfall is so beautiful with different lightly, giving it a romantic and beautiful atmosphere.  Also, sit outside on the patio if you can.  Cost is approximately $100 per person, but my steak was worth every cent!

bhJkqWLyBqrCniSRDmN_IQ.text: I loved the crab cakes here! They were made perfectly, very flavorful. The decor is pretty and modern with dim lights and lit candles. Very romantic. The one thing I didn't like was how the tables were all so close to each other. The restaurant is pretty big but not roomy. Our server was great, he knew how to crack jokes which kept the mood more lively.   Me and the bf both ordered the ribeye which came in a pretty big portion. Although it was missing a little flavor. There wasn't anything special about it so it was just average. I wanted dessert but we were just too stuffed from the steak. I def. regret that! Although our waiter knew it was our anniversary so he brought out a plate with some chocolate and on the plate it said "Happy Anniversary". That was sweet and it seriously made my night. I left happy and satisfied.

4UOtR4M7xpqilMFesygh_A.text: Not bad, not great.   For those that think this is the best steakhouse ever.... I'm wondering if they have ever been to facy steakhouse before.  There is only one dry aged steak here, the baseball cut ribeye.  Everything else is wet aged.  Really, wet aged?  That is basically telling me you just left it in the bag for 30-40 days.  You can tell by the flavor and coloration of the meat.   It's fancy and nice ambiance, but there are alot of nice steakhouses in Vegas with nice ambiance.  Best steak ever.... far from it.  I did have a good time though.    Oh and by the way the side dishes were average at best.  Put this all together and that's why it gets a 3 in my book.  They do cook the steaks well though so that helps (for those who think I'm just bashing).

X7IdLSbPfPNSEYdimqKnsg.text: This place is located inside the Wynn hotel right on the Lake of Dreams.  I guess that isn't too hard to figure out seeing that SW=Steve Wynn.  Anyway, my wife and I decided to eat here on our last night in Vegas.  It is a very nice and classy restaurant.  I would consider it to be kind of a hip steakhouse as well.  My wife and I each ordered the 9 ounce filet ($54 each).  I ordered mine medium rare and it was cooked perfectly, while my wife ordered her's medium well, and it was well past well done when she got it.  So, they brought her another filet which was only cooked medium.  My wife ended up liking her filet, but the waiter was nice enough to take it off the bill due to the incorrect temperature.  We ordered the au gratin potatoes as a side($12), and had a caesar salad beforehand (around $12), both of which were very good.  The best part of our meal was the dessert.  We ordered chocolate creme brulee, which was outstanding.  As I mentioned before, this is a steakhouse inside the Wynn hotel, so don't be shocked by the high prices.  It's Vegas after all.  I would say the steaks and accompaniments were very good here, but I honestly thought the steaks at the Capital Grille across the street were better.  Either way, we enjoyed the meal here and our server was great.  We'll be back if staying here again and in the mood for a steak.

mRbo2dyVNy_ll3_im4aH-A.text: My New strip was a rock I ordered it med rare it was slightly pink...I will give it a shot again!

HZAR859bvNVLo-i9UKgKiQ.text: Among the changes to Las Vegas is its rise as a restaurant town. And among your available options, steakhouses are particularly well represented. SW resides at the very top of that list.   Notwithstanding the fact that most everything in Vegas is couched in hyperbole, the food, service, and ambiance are truly world class.

ZTPA6_oz8lKM_Az5LcyajQ.text: Easily the best steak house I've ever been to. Simply spectacular food, ambiance and service. Can't wait to go back!

omaTm20TSiuWJSk681aumw.text: Very good but I still think Ruth Chris makes the best steak. Had 20 ounce rib eye (bone 3 ounces), creamed spinach, and split salad with wine on date night.

Ii4txl9_ueP6DIZIhztg0Q.text: Came here for my birthday and was impressed with the beauty, customer service, and the food.  Great place if you are a " steak and potatoes" type of man/woman. :-)

umbNlNc5Bmof71ZXLFBcJw.text: Went for a weekend away with a group of ladies. Had the best rib-eye of my life! Tastes of au gratin potatoes and creamed spinich to pair; simply amazing!

diiIc71x_aAbz84QR_DBFw.text: I am from NY which is home to some great steakhouses as well, but this one deserves 5 stars. I would actually give it 6 stars if possible. The location, view, decor and atmosphere of this place is perfect. My table had a partial view of the outside, and it was so beautiful and serene. The changing of the light colors outside by the trees is a nice touch.  Not sure if my friend who made the reservations was drunk or if there was some miscommunication, but we had 9 people for dinner. They had us for reservations for 8 people. I was worried there would be some big inconvenience, but they immediately moved us over to a larger table that could accomodate the extra guest. The manager even shook my hand to say it was no big deal. The service was excellent and courteous. Always had my water refilled and another drink when needed.  I was pretty full from a late lunch that I had, so I didn't eat anything before  my entree besides the bread which was really good actually. For my entree I had the Bone In - NY steak. It was cooked perfectly. I savored every bite. We also ordered some side dishes for the table - asparagus was ok, the creamed truffle corn was excellent, au gratin potatoes were tasty and the creamed spinach was delicious. Little touches like having all the waiters come by and place everyone's entrees down at the same time are a nice touch. The waiters were all friendly but one guy was encouraging us to buy some shots but we were all drained from the night before.  I will definitely come here again, this place is great for parties of all sizes, and if you bring a date I would definitely ask for the table outside with the view of the waterfall.      Hopefully you can win some $$$ playing blackjack so your dinner will be free, otherwise it may be a little pricey but worth every benjamin =)

J3jVz53y1_GwsiAsCG9OVA.text: Best steak I've had hands down.  I used to be in love with Smith and wollenskys in Vegas but sw blew my mind.  Came here with a party of 12 on a busy night and the steaks still came out perfect.  Could not believe how good their rib eye was.  Seasoned just right and the tenderness was like eating a new born cow, just melted perfectly.  It is a little on the pricier side but I can't complain I'm still going to come back.  Far better value than carnevino.  I remember the sides being pretty good but I still can't stop thinking about their steak.

8EjPPDe3uH5sS8De0bgj1w.text: Best bone-in ribeye I've tasted. Seafood tower, scallops and the other stuff the people curiously allow to compete for room in their stomachs at great steakhouses were also good.  Very courteous of them to stay open past closing even when all other tables (including Steve's) had long ago cleared out.   Outdoor late dinner in September in Vegas is about as good as it gets, especially with a view of the ridiculous waterfall show at the Wynn

1SAIvHTUnqO2LQllBrMWPA.text: I had the pleasure of eating at SW Steakhouse this past weekend in Vegas. The experience was all that I had expected and more.  My group of 6 was luckily able to get a last minute reservation for a Saturday night and we even got a table partly facing the Wynn's beautiful waterfall. Our waiter was extremely helpful and knowledgeable as we asked a slew of questions about food choices.   Appetizers: I ordered the sauteed foie gras with grilled pineapple, brioche toast and blackberry jam. The foie gras MELTED in your mouth. The blackberry jam at first seemed an odd choice with the foie gras, however it added the perfect amount of sweetness to the dish.  Main course: I shared the 20 ounce bone in rib eye steak with another person...and yes I stole the piece with the bone (which definitely had the sweeter meat on it). The rib-eye was cooked medium rare JUST as I had requested. It was lightly charred on the outside and juicy on the inside. No one dared try the spicy chili and garlic garnish! I'm sure it was great.   We ordered the Black truffle creamed corn, parmesan creamed spinach, and the gold potato puree as sides and each were delicious.. favorite was the black truffle corn. The truffle wasn't overbearing.  Last but not least, we ended with the chocolate souffle. The homemade ice cream and cherries were to die for.   Perfect end to a great trip in Vegas. I will definitely be going back to this restaurant the next time I'm there so I can try the seafood!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Rib Eye (cut in half)
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauteed Foie Gras

S2YNsB4tMpigKXVTHqYq2g.text: Steaks and sides were great!! The view is also pretty unique with the changing fountain colors and statues.

yNpnmW9JoWU8Sh7vM93C7A.text: D I S A P P O I N T E D !  BRAD (general manager) is BAD, as in Terrible.   Every time I go to Vegas, whether I'm with friends, family, or business, I have always made IT a point to eat at SW. After this experience, I won't ever go back.  The Four Seasons made an early reservation around 6pm with a request to have a table with a view for my party. When my mother and I arrived, we were greeted by a hostess. She takes us to our table and it faces the kitchen. We asked if we could sit on the patio and she states "It's all booked"  SW has a big patio dining area - There were only two couples on the patio at the time. I stated, "So all those tables are going to fill up within the next hour and half?"  She ignores me and takes us back to the hostess stand..... Here is where we meet the ASS - Brad. My mother tells him The Four Seasons called and we requested a view of the lake. He answers my mother in a rude, arrogant, tone, "I have over 700 hundred guests to seat tonight. The table we sat you in, is the only one available".  I was pissed. Don't talk to my mother that way and frankly I don't give a damn how many people you have to seat.   An hour and a half latter, only half the tables on the patio were filled.  The restaurant was pretty empty but then again, it was early. We left at around 8:30pm.   The servers were nice and accommodating for the most part.  The food was good but not spectacular like I remembered (been dining here for the past 4 years) and the mac and cheese was a little rich. They use to have crab meat or lobster and instead they had gross chunks of bacon (not crispy bacon either).  When you pay top dollar, (SW is super pricey) you should be treated nicely and the food should always be amazing.

soOFliaK8J_1XIV7r1o8iA.text: Saturday was my fourth visit to SW and by far the worst. I came with a party of 6 and we all left disappointed.   Our appetizers led the night off to a good start. The shrimp cocktail and tuna ceviche appetizers were enjoyed by all of us, and the crabcakes were phenomenal- probably the best I've ever had. And then those complimentary biscuits with the bacon bits in them? Oh man. Best free bread on the planet.   The sides were also delicious as usual...the au gratin potatoes being the best, followed by the mushrooms, mac and cheese, sauteed spinach, and finally the onions and jalapenos.   Two of our main courses, on the other hand, were prepared wrong. One friend ordered her steak medium rare and it was served not even rare, but raw. She lost her appetite and instead of having them cook it a little longer, just sent it back. Another friend ordered her steak medium and it was served well-done. They took one of them off our check, but not both. And for the love of God, what is so difficult about a dirty martini, straight up, served in a regular glass (not a martini glass)? The server got it wrong not once, but twice!  Three out of four ain't bad I guess, but I expected better. It could have been an off-night, but with all the amazing restaurants in Vegas, I may not return. If I do, I will probably eat some biscuits and crabcakes and then leave and go to Carnevino to order steak and martinis.

yIuKkikgL-mTZdNEMxJkDw.text: The service at SW was awful.  My husband and I spent over 500 dollars and the waitress never even checked on us during our meal so she did not notice that the gnocchi and creamed corn sides went untouched because they were awful.  From what we could tell the waitress had only one other table to which she was very attentive while we had to wait forever to order more drinks and have our waters filled.  Will never return to this restaurant and will reconsider even staying at the hotel due to the terrible service at SW.  Very inappropriate, poor service for such an expensive dining experience.

0qijiyvESVgl6UaDvPeTag.text: I want to start by telling you that SW Steakhouse is in a league of its own! The wonderful time and food will remain tattooed on your brain and taste buds and you'll want to go back for more the very next day. My husband and I have been to SW about half a dozen times and the experience and food never disappoint. SW provides an out of this world dining experience with high quality food and service, and entertaining shows on the Lake of Dreams, all so very Las Vegas. So, you're definitely in for a treat! The ginormous 42 ounces Chile Rubbed Double Rib Eye is the most tender and succulent piece of meat my palate has ever been graced with. And don't get me started on the amazing flavors that the chile rub gives the meat. And then there's the Black Truffle Creamed Corn. I can't rave enough about this side dish. This scrumptious creamed corn is a perfect balance of sweetness and creaminess, while the truffles bring elegance and earthiness without being overpowering. Simply decadent! Feel free to check my full review to learn more about SW Steakhouse and the other 6 exquisite dishes and drinks with pictures that we've ordered during our many visits to SW, such as Steve's Chopped Salad, Corn Soup (from the Vegan menu), or Bigeye Tuna Ceviche to name just a few: simplyromanesco.blogspot...

qwMJONwzlcnheAYBXLQ8tg.text: Four Star review for ambiance and service, three stars for the food and the prices. The Wynn is a lovely hotel, and dining on the patio was great. The service was attentive without being intrusive.  Echoing other reviews, this is a straight up steakhouse, with the exception of some special menu items found at higher end restaurants like foie gras, caviar and fresh seafood by the pound.   I started with a beet salad, which was good, but pretty expensive for the portion and simple preparation. We planned to order two different types if steak and share.   I ordered the bone in rib eye, which was good, but not amazing. It was properly cooked, but under seasoned and less than I expected, considering the beef was prime.   My husband ordered a small fillet, which was overcooked. As huge steak fans, I am always shocked when this happens. The one place you should be able to expect your meat to be prepared properly is at a steakhouse, especially a prime steakhouse. Although we considered eating the overcooked meat, given the $54 price tag on the 6 ounce filet, we decided to send it back. Although the second filet was closer to what we asked for, it arrived undercooked. Since we were on our way to a show, we didn't have time to deal with it any further and ate the second steak. Again, although it was pretty good, it was not the best steak I've ever eaten.   My favorite part of the meal was the pretzel bread with the Hawaiian sea salted butter- and sitting near the lake/water feature.   This place is lovely if you're dining with someone that has an expense account, or for a special occasion.

LXRBr6hJqhTBcpHaegEuAA.text: You won't be disappointed!  Top notch food served with a "Wynn-sical" show over the private waterfall.  I will let you be surprised by the performer.  The atmosphere has a Fantasy quality, which makes this a great place to relax.  Great food and deserts, and a free show, what's not to like!  Dressy Attire.

Z2S6vG-W3-3PJoGLG2h1cA.text: Steak came out medium and should have been rare. Took too long to bring out 2nd cut. Places like this should not make this kind of mistake based on the level they exude.

EDiKgGulqyY035kx1rejaA.text: SW is no steakhouse. It is an excellent restaurant that serves steak. HUGE difference between the two. Lots of pro's and reasons to go to SW especially if you are lucky enough to get seating out doors. The ambiance is relaxing and beautiful as the waterfall is not only peaceful it serves as the back drop from mini shows done by a giant mechanical frog and glowing balls (hard to explain) among other things.   As far as the food goes, I don't have any complaints outside of the steak. The oysters and crab cakes were very good. The side dishes, especially the potatoes au gratin, were spot on. The desert was nice. But my biggest gripe was the steak. 11 guys went and a majority of us ordered the bone-in-ribeye to be cooked medium. Each one seemed to have a different color. My steak came out medium well and was very tough. The char and crust on it were great. Had it been a little more tender I would have kept it. Any how I sent it back and asked for it be a legit medium. My next steak came out and it was medium rare. It was still very tough. The meat just seemed low quality to be honest and I barely put a dent in it. I was very surprised bc everything was good up to that point. I don't know if it was an off night or my standards for steak are just real high considering Gibsons in Chicago has done it right every time I've been. Or maybe the ribeye isn't their best dish. My crowd didn't seem as unimpressed as I was, but they did agree the steak was nothing special.   Anyhow, if and when I go back to Vegas, I'd consider going back to SW for drinks and maybe a light dinner, but I would order something other than the steak.   Quick note on service. It was decent. A little slow at times but it was a big group.

t7FwroUCQIk3vnG2wgX_cg.text: The food was amazing! Steaks were Huge portion as well as the side dishes. we had the bacon mac n cheese, parmesan spinach dip and the asparagus which was delicious. For dessert we had the pecan brownie which was warm and good. Good service. We went there for our anniversary! We were greeted Happy Anniversary! Our table was by the window where you can see the lakeside show! The outdoor patio was closed because it was cold!

DoXlZsyoUQUooZ90zCJG4g.text: How out living says vegetarians should try the grilled royal trumpet mushrooms with creamy polenta and shallot balsamic sauce.

N9EfUbxDl9EL_4CcXIE8iw.text: I absolutely love SW Steakhouse, this was my second time here and it was as good as I remembered it.   The interior is very classic from the lake of dreams to the upscale designs.  I like that when you walk into this place it doesn't feel like other $$$$ in Hollywood or LA, less pretentious, still fun, but more mature.   The waiters were attentive, on point, never missed a thing. Everyone ordered the classic Caesar to start with, I especially liked the baked parmesan stick.  For sides we had the sauteed mushrooms, creamed corn, au gratin potatoes, and creamed spinach this is also my order of preference.  They were all really great but the mushrooms and creamed corn were my favorite! I had the Asparagus risotto for dinner (I don't really even like rice that much), and it was SO GOOD, I literally ate till I could not breathe. The rest of the table had a variety of NY, Bone in rib eye, and chicken plates which they all raved about. Overall it was an amazing experience, the bill for 5 of us came up to about $600, including 8-10 drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed mushrooms, cream of corn, potatoes au gratin, and creamed spinach.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Risotto- unbelievable

wdPN725Odr7IjgheSC-mDw.text: One of the BEST steakhouse i have ever been, Best in Vegas!!  The decor is absolutely stunning and elegant.  Service was perfect and prompt that i can't find anything to pick on. They also offered Shun steak knives with `SW' stamped on...so speechless!  Cocktails were delicious and not watery at all.  Real deal for the price and the best compared with what we got in other restaurants/bars in Vegas  Back to the food:  Foie gras Torchon was great.  it tasted soooo good that we enjoyed the leftover as breakfast the next day.    Ribeye was prepared perfectly.  All food we ordered were presented nicely and tasted great.

RuHGsuuXfaqvNVo3Hn3iWg.text: The service at most places in Vegas is really good, this place not being an exception.  The steaks were properly cooked, and flavorful.  They just didn't bring anything new to the table.  A steakhouse is a steakhouse in the eyes of this restaurant.  They have a great outdoor patio and view of the waterfall.  This place is just another pricey steakhouse - Maybe I'm just over the whole steakhouse... Thing.  Unless they can bring something new to the table, it all seems just played out to me. Between atmosphere and the meat they serve, they're all becoming rather indistinguishable.

0RBKUuvwFAtGjsuLOLTEIw.text: Bar: For some reason the bartender tried to make my sazerac with remey martin. Minus 1 star  Service: Was lacking. Just cause we look young dosnt mean we shouldn't get the same service as the people around us. Minus 1 star  Food:Rib eye, filet w/bacon, Mac & cheese, and foie gras was probably some of the best food I have ever had.

oa9eHI__QSR3eXEUStcp_w.text: This top the list of splurging on a meal and it was all worth it. The experience from the service to the food, plus the complimentary bread was excellent. We were seated right by the lake which was a great way to start our meal. The bread basket came with pretzel bread, banquette, and the yummy cheesy bacon bread which was an ultimate favorite.  We started out with the seafood spectacular which included, two types of oysters, lobster, crab, jumbo shrimp and king crab legs. The seafood was fresh and very fulfilling. Hubby and I shared the dry aged tomahawak chop (Rib eye) with a side of truffle cream corn. The steak was cooked to perfection; juicy, medium and char on the outside goodness. Although I tasted the truffle in the corn, i didn't see anything special about it.   To end our night, we ordered the peanut butter banana chocolate crunch (i think that is the full name). If you like the combination of  peanut butter and bananas, you will love this. The way they made the banana into a mousse, the peanut butter crunch at the bottom and then topped it off with chocolate...oh my amazing!  We had a two hour dining experience and to conclude the evening, we saw the singing frog made the evening more memorable.

mSL9PEJngbK-dp-Su6uMPA.text: SW makes the best steak in Vegas.  Kind of a bold statement for a guy who's eaten at dozens of the best rated steakhouses across the country, and probably dozens in Vegas alone. An even bolder statement for a city known for luxury, extravagance and world class restaurants, particularly its steakhouses.  I went with very low expectations. I love the Wynn and all, but not for its food (can we say most overrated buffet?). But we had some rooms here, and the SW was chosen out of convenience. It was also one of the few my buddies and I hadn't tried yet. The reviews I read were positive, but not gushing which isn't good for a town over-saturated with five star reviews. I was warned about cheesey water-light shows with giant frog puppets. The pictures I saw her on Yelp didn't show me dishes that looked to be particularly special. To be honest I tried to lead my friends over to CUT which had been spectacular on a previous trip. But I relented. And thank God I did.  There was a wait so we grabbed a couple of Macallan's at the bar. And we waited.  Our table gets called and I walk into a giant dining area. It's reminiscent of a giant ballroom with giant glass windows on one side giving a view of said frog puppet show. I wasn't impressed. The decor was less than promising. It didn't scream hip like N9NE, nor sexy and dark like CUT or craftsteak. It looked like the restaurant tried to go for a posh elegance look, but got tired half way. Not a promising start.  Then the food began to come out.  Fantastic. Start-to-finish.   For bread they give you cheesy bacon bread, as if they thought you might not get enough meat during your meal. It was so deliciously salty and fluffy and different. We asked for more than one basket.  The steak I chose was a bone-in rib eye, my go-to cut about 90% of the time. I know when it's good and when it's just alright and this was toe-curling, eyes-in-the-back-of-the-head orgasmic. Perfect sear and crust on the outside. Perfectly medium rare on the inside. It's honestly difficult to get this just right so I usually err on the side of rare+ in case it comes out overcooked. This was medium rare done right, where the meat has the slightest crunch on the outside and almost melts with every bite, gushing with flavor with each bite.  Most sides don't even get a mention in my reviews, but the black truffle creamed corn which we got on a server's recommendation was amazing. I'd go back just for the corn alone. You cannot eat here without getting the creamed corn as a side. The mac and cheese and au gratin potatoes were pretty good too but not quite withdrawal-symptoms-inducing memorable.  As a male, red-blooded American, it is my God-given honor to eat right meat. It's almost a duty, given the forefathers who died to give me this freedom. I vote and I pay my taxes. God bless America and it's cattle industry. God bless the SW Steakhouse.  After awhile, the frog puppet thing kind of grows on you.

WnWfD2ADYnnPSfW_d_eOWw.text: Only reason we came here was because of the Kobe beef! It was so delicate and it melted in my mouth. The corn side is  a must absolutely delicious. Such a great restaurant with an amazing view of the waterfall and the show.

4iYozum5d11QI5xwDi6zfw.text: Had dinner here for the 1st time.  The food was great the steak was cooked perfectly. This is one of the best steak houses in Vegas.  The service was great Gabrial our server was delightful.  We had a great time will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l4PS5x9TM21SpC1cKNxxWQ.text: I had heard really good things about this place... ex: it being one of the top steakhouses in Vegas. The restaurant decor and ambience was really well done. We visited in January, so you could not go / see outside (too cold), I would imagine if being even more special during warmer months. The food was good, but not amazing. I had the Domestic wagyu steak which was again, good but not amazing (compared to real wagyu). Would I go here again? Yes. Am I still hunting for the best steak in Vegas?

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance downstairs
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Domestic wagyu
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Private dining room in the back

oARKzgnROBLGCDlopQphkw.text: As usual, my hubby planned a Valentines dinner for us 5 days before Valentine's day to avoid the cheesy-Valentines crowd. We like to be just a few of the cheesy bunches on these date-night infested fine dining spots. Our first time coming down the escalator for these lake side restaurants. My first impression was how gorgeous the view was. The main dining room in this steakhouse was nice, warm, simple, and posh.   My husband had called a couple nights before trying to reserve dinner out in the patio with the lakeside view. They did warn him that he may not get it because people have reserved them months before. Sure, fine.   We get there, greeted, denied the patio for the same reason. Sure, fine. We'll take any seat you have available on a Saturday night (5 days away from Valentines). My husband was pretty irritated because it was only 5:30pm and the whole patio was empty. He literally wanted to leave lol. But I was hungry and wanted us to have a good time regardless. Btw, the guy working at the reservations check-in booth was a dick and half about it too.   Our waiter, however, was kind and helpful. We shared a steak cooked to medium. This tasted well. Flavorful, juicy, and well-charred. We also shared some king crab legs. This was good, but nothing bone-shaking. Our sides were mashed potatoes and wild mushrooms. Mushrooms tasted and paired well with the steak. Mash potatoes were, well mashed (nothing to woohoo about).   Come 6ish, and the patio was not even half way full. Around 6:30 or so, most people wanted to sit inside because the wind picked up a little. Kind of a blessing in disguise for us, but we are still pretty bummed that this whole patio thing ruined our overall impression and take of this place. They could have easily sat us both (only 2 people) somewhere out in the empty patio At 5:30pm and again around 6 and even around 6:30 when people wanted to move indoors. Funny how they can accommodate people back into the main dining room as they please because they were simply not as busy as they portrayed to be.   Because of this..... I can't even recommend my friends to this place, even if the food was decent enough. They'd probably get better treatment at another nice restaurant with a view in Las Vegas. This same rule applies to the patio dining at Prime in Bellagio, but we always seem to get the patio last minute anyway when they realize there is still some room for two more.

iuEgatDWrvnSOlIPWju2Bw.text: I'm so sad to be writing that I had my 1st subpar experience at the Wynn :-(  I really wanted to love SW but I just didn't. The food was good but not great. Ambiance was fantastic and the patio overlooking the lake of dreams was so beautiful. Extra points for that but the food just didn't live up to my expectations.   The grilled octopus appetizer I had was bland & was so much better at Botero (before it closed).  Fennel mac & cheese was overwhelmingly fennel. Mashed potatoes & brussel sprouts were standard issue.  Recommendation: although you might be tempted, do not sit on the patio in the middle of summer! It was so hot that had to excuse myself several times to go inside just to cool down. Unfortunate because the view is so beautiful but it made the meal unpleasant. I couldn't wait to get out of there.  I would give it a go one more time solely based on the fact that I love all things Wynn.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi crudo
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious bread basket

oT4CEz38OgYIeSralrc2EQ.text: If you're looking for big flavored, spicy steak along with a Vegas water show, this would be your place. It's a 5-star experience because it was immensely satisfying and unique.  We had the 42oz chili rubbed ribeye. It was unbelievably flavorful, be sure to get it cooked medium as medium rare would be too raw for a steak of this size. It was basically too much for 2 people, three would be the right number. I've never had a steak like this, and it's worth the trip. So juicy, so spicy, properly seared - just amazing. Six stars. If you're not into strong, spicy flavors then stay away from this one.  Roasted bone marrow appetizer - not bad at all, nicely caramelized on top, not normally my thing but it's good here. 4 stars.  Sides - we opted for fries, creamed corn, and mushrooms. All were good, the creamed corn was very rich and rather sweet (it was summer and therefore sweet corn season). You can't go wrong with any of these, but please, don't order all of the above for two people as it was too much food. 4 stars apiece.  We also had a couple of glasses of red wine - the house wine ($17) was okay, and the Rioja ($20) was zesty and just right for a strongly seasoned piece of meat - I recommend it. The rest of the wine list was moderately impressive in quality and frankly outrageously expensive, even by stratopheric Vegas standards. However, the above by the glass options were reasonable for Vegas so all is well. 4 stars here, too.  We were seated outside by the lake and waterfall, every half hour there was a music and automated prop show in the water. This was a lot of fun and a unique environment for a steak place. Service was typical high-end Vegas, attentive and prompt. 5 stars for the show and service.  Price - $270 for the above. Not cheap, but I actually expected worse and overall I am happy with the experience and my choice of SW Steakhouse for a nice night out.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed corn with truffle - decadent
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (part of) The Chile Rubbed Ribeye - so flavorful
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Bone Marrow at SW Steakhouse

BsrC1H717wRRqhfaumaing.text: Delicious? Yes.  Romantic? Yes.  Upscale? Yes. Worth the $$$? Maybe not so much.   The service and atmosphere here is great. Those two things are so important when it comes to your recall of a restaurant's experience.  Loved that there was a floor to ceiling window with the waterfall view. However, be advised that the water show doesn't start til 8:30.   Food came out very promptly. And I did enjoy the bread basket (a little too much) during the short wait (pretzel bread, why you gotta be so good?)  Shrimp scampi (5/10) - Probably my least favorite part of the meal. They used jumbo shrimp, which lacked juiciness. The flavor was also a bit bland yet was oily.  Maine Lobster (7/10) - Was surprised at how generous the portion was. But I do wish they put a little less seasoning (cheese, garnish, and whatnot) because it took away from the taste and made it pretty heavy.  Bone in ribeye (8/10) - Cooked to medium rare perfection! Tender and crispy. Seasoned well, although it could've used a little less salt.  Kobe wagyu (8.5/10) - Of course this was the best part of the meal. If it wasn't, there would be something very wrong. Juicy and buttery, melts in your mouth. Balanced flavors of sweet and savory for a steak. I did have a bit higher of expectations for it, as it was not very marbled. But, it was still very tasty.   Overall, this was a memorable meal. However, the seafood and ribeye steak quality were on par with steakhouses that are nearly half the price. And as good as the Kobe wagyu was, I've had better wagyu at a Japanese BBQ restaurant in California once .. I'll wait to try the real deal in Japan.  It was a good one time experience , but cost to quality ratio wasn't good enough to make me want to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib eye, lobster, Kobe wagyu &amp; shrimp scampi

1vmLi9Cpg5zeO3pNCjv5Og.text: I ordered the tomahawk steak.     So freaking good.   Great view.  Little pricey but worth it.   Nice place to take a date on!   Can never go wrong with this place!

ZXzuzPgaCITDOz_LKQwSqA.text: The Foie Gras was to die for, velvety texture, made to perfection. The gnocchi with truffles was full of flavor, big pieces of lobster. The creamed corn was sweet and beautifully textured. The service was spectacular. And every 15 minutes they have 2-3 minute shows. Love the ambience

SJT7Xn4fZAV5edWyDKsRqw.text: I hate to be the bearer of bad news but this place has disappointed me to a new level. I made reservations at 7PM months in advance in celebration of my wife's birthday. I even had a $100 arrangement of roses and lilies sent to the restaurant for a nice touch and a nice centerpiece to make this a special night for my wife.  As this was my wife's birthday weekend getaway, I was excited to go back to the SW Steakhouse because we loved the setup as well as the nice lake show that happens every few minutes. Upon arrival, we weren't greeted with smiling faces...Jessica along with the rest of the front desk ladies said with a distraught look to say, "Were sorry, we can't take your reservation because you have a baby with you." I was livid. My baby just turned 2 months old, all he does is eat and sleep. We have NEVER been turned away of a reservation due to having a baby and we have ate at nice a handful of nice restaurants since he's been born. I made the reservation for 3 so the car seat can be placed on a chair or next to my wife in a booth. This place swears like the noise level is low and intimate, anybody that has been here knows it's loud and upbeat. We were at Mr. Chow the previous evening and the ambiance is much more quiet and intimate and they welcomed our baby with open arms constantly checking if we needed anything. I definitely won't be back here EVER again, nor recommend you guys to anybody. I appreciate SW Steakhouse for ruining a planned evening and birthday. Keep up the good work.

s7P9gOnZ511bEcFg-u8i8g.text: I was expecting an amazing amazing steak.  Well I got a nice steak but nothing close to what I expected for the very high price tag we paid for this.  I had a NY Strip that was good, not great. As Jack H. stated i his review which BTW I didn't read and wish I had, it was downright tough and while i ordered it medium rare it was more medium.    My mates had Filet's and both said they were good, not great.  We started the meal with cesars and there was nothing special about those either. The side were good, the creamed corn was very interesting and I would suggest that to anyone ordering sides.  If your on a corp expense account or your happen to  be a high roller this is a good place, however, if you asked me to choose between this and say Strip Steak or Smith and Woolinsky, it would be an easy choose.  The Wine list is very good but prepare for some very $$$$$ prices.

0aMzMIDc6CqrLyI_aV-Fbg.text: Food was exceptional! I had the chicken - so flavorful and juicy. We went for my birthday and were served delicious chocolate cakes at the end with candles. Was a nice touch.  It's a bit pricey - but worth the splurge for a special occasion.

RyXcgDjcsmth_xiByhzjuw.text: The ambiance is awesome and the service was great.   That said, I have eaten at much better tasting Steak places.   Pretzel rolls are yummy but the Filet and au-gratin potatoes were just so-so....for instance, they were not as good as Capital Grill and I was expecting it to be the same level or better.   That said, it was an overall good experience...just not "out of this world".

9kOwU_Vhw_iTWsnG8SjuLg.text: Made reservations for 6pm on a Sunday. We arrived a few minutes early and were seated in a cozy corner with a nice view of the outside patio. Our server, Ryan, greeted us immediately and provided us with a wine and cocktail menu. I ordered a pink sangria and my bf got "The Smash." I'm not a big whiskey drinker but the bf and I agreed that this was the smoothest whiskey and easy to take down. Shortly after we sat down we were given a complimentary assortment of bread. We tried each one but the pretzel bread was easily our favorite. I started off with a Caesar salad, which conveniently came out split into two plates so both myself and bf could enjoy it. We each got filet mignons for our entree and split the Au Gratin Potatoes. The filet was so tender that we barely had to use a knife to cut it. The potatoes were the right amount of cheesy with a crisp topping. As if we didn't eat enough already, we knew we needed to try a dessert. We decided to go with the half order of funnel cake and strawberries. The vanilla creme sauce was amazing and complemented the funnel cake well. I wish I could put the sauce on all desserts. Overall, this was one of the best meals I have ever had at a steakhouse. Thank you to Ryan for making this experience so wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Au Gratin Potatoes
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funnel cake and strawberries (half order)
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9 oz. filet mignon

XtLY4WfMSJLkDuma4m4nkw.text: SW treats you like royalty.  Upon check-in I asked for seating with a view of their waterfall, within less than a minute they had prepared side by side seating with an unblocked view of it. (++)  Service was astounding for the most part. Our actual server had a little grumpiness with him, but it didn't affect the wait or availability of the restaurant unknowns, so eh who cares. Our bus boy was the friendliest, he made you feel comfortable, just sit back and relax, he'll take care of things. (+)  Drinks- The ingredients are what separates these from other variations of the same drink. Details matter here, including the way in which you get intoxicated  Ultimate Margarita: Felt double shot, a cheery sipper. (+)  Mango Paloma: The best. You could easily taste the alcohol but the flavors beneath it soothed it out so well. (++)  Starters  Chopped Salad: Everything was fresh but they over did it with the dijon vinaigrette. It tasted like it had been washed in it. It wasn't ruined, but it made it stand out in the wrong way.   Grilled Octopus: I had a terrible version of it at The Lark (Santa Barbara) and so I was worried so much about it that I had to ask if it would actually taste like Octopus. He looked at me like I was crazy, but if he only knew. Anyways, yes this is what I expect when I order grilled octopus, lightly grilled taking out the deep oceanic taste, but leaving enough taste in it to savor it as a seafood dish. (+)  Steaks- both cooked to a perfect medium rare, avoid the sauces, the meat and the butter topping is enough.  9oz Filet: Tender, with a taste that stood behind what you'd hope to get from SW. Not the juices experienced from a bone-in but it matched the taste of the Mastro's. 4.25/5  24oz Bone-In Ribeye: I ran through this like a Saharan lion. One of the best steaks I have ever had. Food perfectionist me wishes it would of had slightly and I really mean slightly less fat but for a ribeye it's probably the best that you can get. The tenderness, the juices all in the flavor of every bite. I could not be distracted away from it. 4.8/5  Sides  Creamed Corn: You must order this. A rich creamy taste that you'll have trouble shaking yourself out of.   Au Gratin Potatoes: Another one. The warmness of the potatoes and the cheeses. I am not supposed to go heavy on the dairy, but SW is where you want to go all in.   I regret to inform you that I skipped on the dessert. I REALLY wanted their funnel cake, but after all of the above I really had no room. Plus I needed an excuse to come back.  After this experience, I would put SW up against any steakhouse, not just in Vegas but in the country. If you appreciate a good steak, don't disrespect yourself by going anywhere else.

uqKgZJ3w6fWIv3ngACqt7g.text: One of my favorite steakhouses!!! Great food, service, and ambiance.  Definitely a must while in Vegas, especially if you are staying at the Wynn.

Ndx5N_JM8BPujUB2oLEQQA.text: I don't know what's the good reviews about  Unseasoned food is never a good thing but paying $60 for unseasoned steak  and under cooked chicken is way worst  Seriously this place is a joke and waste of money  Literally TGi Friday's quality  I'm not kidding  We chewed and spit the steak it was that bad  Probably wondering why we didn't take it back but it's our valentine's   day diner and we don't want to ruin it  The show was not worth it either  You can save your money and go to the bar pay $18 for glass of wine and you get to enjoy the same view :)

uZKQdM0Lof9YeSDF1XaAaw.text: Make it a point to come here, every, single, Vegas trip. Their food is PHENOMENAL, fresh, and tasty. I've come to this restaurant both in the winter and summer, and definitely appreciate the summer vibe more - since you're able to enjoy the outside patio. My husband and I always share a few plates since the portions are pretty generous. One of my top 3 restaurants by far in Las Vegas!

t9WAqL6wJrWGePPPUnZaIg.text: As always , the sea food towers were great. Drinks galore  awesome , steak as good as it gets . We will be back every time we come to Las Vegas

8bkmf8OSwgnu24z6UUAmMQ.text: Best restaurant in Las Vegas !  We eat only kosher meet ! This restaurant have kosher ribeye stake amazing stake !!! I'm highly recommend to make reservation and make sure to try the best  kosher stake you ever eat ...

knwsFICiCrL5gpJSu5pvrQ.text: As always, the meal was amazing! Loved the fresh pretzel bread, delicious salad, filet was perfect and the shrimp cocktail was very fresh and a big hit One of my favorite go to's in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ev00nIBW40UmdYlJFn7yrQ.text: Yes, the food is wonderful.  I had the boneless ribeye, and it will be my new standard for 'cooked to perfection Husband had New York, and he said it was wonderful. 25 y/o son had the Filet, also cooked to perfection. This, however, is what pushed good food to 5 stars. My son has an 'invisible' disability.  In few words, he does not have fine motor skill abilities on his left side.  He asked our server if they would cut the steak in the kitchen. Now usually this simple request is met with no. SW Steakhouse not only graciously agreed, but after being cut they pushed it back together so that his plate did not look different. THIS IS SO COOL!! When serving our sides, server discreetly asked if he would like the broccoli cut. So, THIS is Service. Thank you, SW Steakhouse, we WILL be back

lnCPlUKpl4e6diptRx7ang.text: My family and I ate here while staying at the Encore. No complaints!! The service was excellent. There was more than one person that waited on our table and they were always close by. The atmosphere and ambiance is beautiful. We chose to sit outside which concerned me at first bc Vegas can be miserably hot during the summer months, but the water seemed to cool give a cool breeze. We had reservations and there was no wait to seat our party. Now on to the food. We were told that we should share the a la carte sides which we did and had plenty to go around for our party of 7. We ordered the Mac n cheese, creamed spinach, scalloped potatoes, veggies and I believe something else. We were also advised we could share the meat and they could cut it accordingly. We didn't listen and I regret that. We had tons of meat that went to waste as there is no refrigerator in the Encore rooms. They do char the meat but you can ask they go light on that which I did and my meat was perfect. This place isn't cheap but worth the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q39GN_AHJgQbHzq4taN8Ww.text: The food is phenomenal. The cocktails are great. What really makes this place stand out is the service. They cater to exactly what you want and treat you wonderfully! Make sure to spend a night with someone you love here!

mXPSBsqDc-vttg-VwiQoXw.text: Awesome food and beautiful ambiance. Service is good but they're really busy in evenings so it was kinda hard to get servers attention sometimes. Loved the Alaskan crab legs. Definitely a MUST. the fois gras was okay. Over cooked a bit. The scallops were delicious.

nshXIvbbtWBcBQpa3d9L-A.text: The food is always amazing! But service lacked this time. We had made a reservation with outside seating. This is the restaurant I spend my money at when we go to Vegas and the experience is part of what makes this restaurant. When we went to check in they asked if we still wanted outside, I said absolutely and we waited about 10 minutes and they sat us in the very back of the restaurant. When we said we had asked to sit outside they said they were all booked. Totally would have been fine but had they told us when they checked us in. We are around 6pm and there were tables open outside the entire time we were there, just disappointing because that's one of our favorite places to go and it has special meaning for us. The food was still great, potato puree is amazing. For a $400 meal I wished there was better communication.

WFJ_0v29dCtwtMrYTw_eSw.text: Sucks Please don't eat here:( The shelves for the glasses were very dusty. We reserved a table outside and when we arrived said we had a table with a view. I ordered my steak medium and it was served rare. I was very disappointed and will never eat here again .

XJdVLuD3inzCp3EH34M8nw.text: I booked this place to celebrate my birthday past weekend. Everything was going great; the food was very good, ambience, water show amazing as always. As the time went by I've approached the hostess and asked to charge my bill to the room without bringing it to the table. She said not to worry and just to stop by before leaving to sign the bill. As we finished our desert the bill arrived at the table...after I specifically asked to hold on to it since I wanted to treat my guests and not to deal with paying in front of everyone. When I went back to the hostess and asked her why the waitress brought out my bill she could not explain it to me. All she said was I'm sorry. I think 5 star restaurant inside of Wynne hotel has to have better approach to the customers and grant them what they asked. Should I add that I was not happy??

QHq1JK7uy0qil1iDvjHl-g.text: Had an amazing experience here celebrating my boyfriend's birthday.  Upon arrival, my boyfriend was greeted with happy birthday wishes.  I wasn't sure if they would remember because I made a note on the reservation months ago, but several employees went out of their way to send their well wishes,    We ordered the bone marrow appetizer, chili rubbed double rib eye and brussel sprouts.  Everything was delicious, but the rib eye was the real star.  I would even go as far as saying that it was the best piece of meat I have ever tasted.  It was so tender and flavorful; the peppers and onions were grilled to perfection!    I hate that this steakhouse is in Vegas, so I'm not able to visit very frequently.  I am hoping they will open one at the Wynn Boston Harbor.

3PdSLQ-qTBRNoXYOkkG9rw.text: The service and ambiance were absolutely phenomenal and if the food were on the same level SW would be a definite repeat for me!    Service: Staff went out of their way to accommodate our request to sit at a table instead of stuffed in between two other tables.  The server was so friendly and knowledgeable. She knows fine dining and it shows!  Food: Appetizer: King Crab Soup = too many onions and not enough crab. Liked the crouton on top. Entree: All Natural Filet = Just ok, didn't finish it Sides: Shaved Brussels Sprouts = Yuck, not sure what I expected.            Baked Fennel Mac and Cheese = Too much Fennel.    Atmosphere: Chic, classic design and spectacular view of the waterfall.

zs1DMabHYVDtejxzLFR5Bg.text: So let's start with the manager. He's just incredibly rude. Bald guy, doesn't look at you ever when he's talking to you. Make a request to sit somewhere...good luck the night wasn't even busy and he didn't even care what we requested.   Then fast forward. The Caesar salad was phenomenal. Our steaks came out. I ordered mine medium rare. It came out medium, if not medium plus. My friend decided to let our waiter know that I was dissatisfied. All he did was stand above my head and tell me that it was how I ordered it....medium. But I had ordered medium rare!! No apology. No nothing. Fine.   Side dishes: nothing to write home about. Nothing stood out honestly. We didn't stay for dessert because the highlight of the meal thus far had been our salads. So we called it a night.   Simply disappointed with SW. This was my second time here and second time I left dissatisfied. I love the Wynn/Encore. But will not be back here. Ever.

Kp543-SxP3NiLrAtdmevoQ.text: We went to SW Steakhouse for a 40th birthday celebration and were overall disappointed (9 Dec).  The SW is clearly setup for fine dining.  The decor, layout, and quality material are top notch.  I was thrilled the restaurant listed a dress code, "Business casual attire is required; shorts are not permitted and gentlemen must wear a collared shirt."  Upon entry it was clear that the dress code was not enforced.  Gentleman were wearing tee shirts, cowboy hats, and other attire that were anything but business casual.  We, a party of two, checked in before our 1800 reservation and were told it would be just a minute.  We went to the bar for cocktails.  The Manhattan was good, the Hendricks and tonic came with a lime (hint: cucumber.  The bartender should have asked for a preference).  At approximately 1818 we were sat.  Several parties arrived after us and were seated before we were.  Not a great start.  Our table was all the way in the back of the restaurant near the servers station.  Initially, I was very unhappy, but it turned out to be very private and I could observe the staff and clientele.  Our server Anthony was awesome, definitely the high point of the evening.  Very knowledgeable, professional, and friendly without being too familiar.  A+ for Anthony!  The food.  The bread basket was one of the best I've ever had.  Salads -- Caesar and Baby Iceberg both solid.  Main -- pepper crusted chateaubriand.  The meat was so tender and delicious except it had SO much pepper on it.  It was overwhelming and I had to scrape some of it off.  The beef tallow fries were a fail.  The were over cooked, dry and if I had to guess reheated/refried.  The Brussels sprouts with bacon were tasty.  We sensed that the bottom line for the restaurant was more important than the guest experience.  Let's face it, most guests (tourists) will not return, but we are Las Vegas locals.  I don't mind spending well over $300 for 2 people, but the total experience has to meet the price point.  Our search for our high end local steakhouse continues.

ivytyRiGgDOIarUaRb5YKA.text: The most perfect experience all the way around. 5 stars for food, ambiance, decor and service. Plus a bonus for the beautiful show that starts at 7pm right outside of the restaurant on the lagoon with a huge mesmerizing waterfall that you can see through the windows while dining or you can come out on the patio and enjoy it with accompanying music.  Recommendations as far as the food: Kale salad light and citrusy- delicious  Pasta with lobster and mushrooms - excellent  Black Sea bass light and full of flavor served with bok choy and tiny mushrooms  My husband had the steak and loved it. All their steaks are premium USDA meat and you can't go wrong here. We also tried the cream corn with black truffles as a side dish - terrific! Decided to go with martinis instead of the wine. The drinks were good,  strong enough and with good flavor. Skipped the desert but there were some good options to consider for the next time. The restaurant is beautiful and the staff makes every effort to make your experience unforgettable just like all of the restaurants of the Wynn and Encore Hotel. Will definitely come back,  again and again !

6Ryxk77W5Jnt70Xb-d3Cog.text: We ordered the filet minion, tomato salad and potatoes au gratin. Everything was wonderful.

0_MpCtzW8swRqAwPwQWFtA.text: My previous experiences at this restaurant have been excellent.   We had guests from out of town and this is one of their favorite restaurants  as well.   The steak is always delicious but it should be.  My wife hated the Hawaiin snapper. Maybe she shouldn't have ordered fish at a steak house but I expected more from the flagship restaurant that bears the hotels name. It was almost as if someone just poured a can of tomatoes over the fish and called served it.   The three starts is more for the service than anything else.  Service was slow. They gave me a regular knife for my steak and not a steak knife.  They mixed up dishes and we had to tell them who had what.  And fish should always be served last and it wasn't.   Again the service was slow and we ended up being thirty minutes late for our show. We felt rushed at the end.   The pretzels bread is amazing and almost worth the  price of admission.

tjI1xAfxzw2t-qHWiH-a0g.text: Amazing dinner from start to finish. Service was outstanding. Food was excellent. Atmosphere was beautiful. Highly recommend the charred octopus, tomahawk chop, creamed spinach, and molten cake. Just do it!

The bread basket -- corn bread roll and pretzel stick are great!!!! Wish they still had sourdough bread--that was too die for!!! Great ambiance and atmosphere!!!

96YfuvyB0fdUKfxCNIgqOA.text: This was an extremely expensive steakhouse that had a lot of pros, but a lot of cons as well. I ordered the bone-in ribeye and I gotta say, I've had better, but it was still pretty good. I think I would go with the filet next time. We ordered three sides, Au Gratin potatoes, asparagus, and a gnocchi that was on special. The gnocchi was some of the best I've had, but it might be a little rich for some. A great dish to share. I didn't care much for the asparagus because the stalks were so big, they kind of felt underdone. The potatoes were pretty good, but tough to split with four people since the portion was a little small. The service was exceptional!

3NpAIVMQas9M3xi5sAWV0w.text: Never again. I've been here many times and this time our party of 10 was very disappointed. The meat was very dry. They overlooked my bone in rib eye and it wasn't edible. Completely ruined my steak experience.   Mastros is so much better.

NB6LdDyS8IyAYgr2vYSxZg.text: 04/30/17 - We made reservations for a party of four, outside. Once we arrived we were informed that even though we had a reservation booked for outside, they would seat us inside due to others making reservations months ahead of time for the outdoor seating. There was plenty of room outside, so after 5 or so minutes they moved us outside.  My steak was mediocre at best. Slightly overlooked and not flavored how a well marbled ribeye should be. Pretty disappointing since I've had higher quality steaks from chain restaurants.  The service is what makes me give the SW one star. It took us about 20 minutes to get our first round of drinks. The waiter was inattentive and only made efforts to come by twice within the 3ish hours our party was there. We had to flag him down each other time in order to get water, cocktails, and order additional plates. Overall: Fun atmosphere, but a subpar steak and terrible service equates to a one-star review.
