bnTuF9PZCu4qnQbliacTjg.text: Ok I've been here a few times before and the food is usually outstanding.  However, the food tonight was not good and the temps were all off.  The porterhouse steak had a funny taste to it and the chili rub sauce they gave me on the side was gross.  I was excited to bring my parents here so they can try it and I ended up hearing how awful the food was for the rest of the night.  We ended up eating a short time later at the cafe because we all left hungry.  Kudos to the waiter for excellent service and hopefully if I do choose to come here again the food will be equally as good as the service

jGnuiYPrl8nDyckWcOHVxg.text: Amazing meal overall, service is impeccable, and beautiful ambiance.  We were seated on the air conditioned patio, and started our meal out with a nice red wine.  We tried the asparagus, heirloom tomato salad, kale salad, steak fries, and steaks. The table bread, while I'm not much of a bread eater, was absolutely delicious. Everything was well-presented and prepared. While not the most amazing steak I've tried, it was definitely up there.  I'd definitely return and try other dishes along with different cuts of steak. Next time, I will save room for dessert!

77llZVghnvYqkq04LF1O6A.text: Just got back from Vegas and went with friends on the first night to SW for a patio dinner. Great tip for anyone requesting patio seating: make reservations in advance AND come at 5:30pm. Why? Because that is when they open. You can take your pick of tables on the patio if you wish. Perfect planning prevents poor performance. As we were leaving there was a group of young ladies complaining to the hostess why they are not able to sit on the patio WITHOUT RESERVATIONS. HHHMMMM. As I walked by them I just shook my head. I felt bad for the hostess having to put up with silly muppets in mini skirts, taking selfies in a restaurant they are complaining about. I guess they felt entitled. Oh well.  Anyway.....  the service is incredible and the food is delicious. If you want to go all out for a nice dinner in a fabulous hotel, just go to the SW Steakhouse. You won't be disappointed. I won't name names because that is bad karma, but I have gone to my share of "other steakhouses in Vegas" and I can tell some negative stories (Bellagio, get your act together guys!). I know there are people that give this place crummy  reviews but I understand, as well as everyone else should as well, that every circumstance comes with different outcomes. With that said, I've been here 4 times on 4 different trips and I am extremely pleased each time. (Add-on the Mac and Cheese side, oh man!)

Ueub_kMhd8Z4diChKK_OyA.text: worst restaurant I ever been!! if there is 0 start rating I will do 0! when we find this restaurant we have really high expect on it,  but the truth is so disappointed. we all order steak that night, so ask the server to pair a bootle of wine for us, and he bring one said he think it will go great with the steak, and open it ask us to TRY if we like it. OK here comes the problem, most of the restaurant I been to ( cheaper than is one or expansive than this one, both ) if you say you don't like it they ask me do you want to try something else right away. ( sometimes I keep sometimes I change just depend on how I really like the taste.) but the server turn his face right away after we said we think is too dry for us. He said if we let the wine decant a little bit will be fine and pour out the wine without ask us if we really want to take it! OK fine. if he feels return the wine is trouble then we take it.  But then we wait a long time to get our food like 30 mints for appetite and 40 mints for the steak. but the worst thing we mad is that people around us that sit down after us already finish their food when we got our food. and we taste the food and feels really sorry about it. it's not a food quality that should comes out from a high class restaurant. the only food that taste ok is the Bread Basket. thats all. other food is totally oily than any restaurant I ever try! not only the steak, its everything!! The Foie gras appetite is so high rating when I read some other review, but when I taste its just nothing that will give you surprise. we ask for to go boxes after we taste a little, cause don't want to wast time on the bad service and so so food. one of our friend is very mad and write down how she feel on the ticket. but no manager come to us and ask what happen, only the waiter come and said the wagu beef is suppose be marble and oily! sounds like we never try before! come on, the wagu beef originally come from Japan. of cause we know how it should taste. and also we try kobe and wagu  all over the place, there are so many restaurant doing lot better than them. we even try the wagu beef sashimi the other night at another restaurant in vegas. no one taste that worst like here!!! I feel really pity for the steak cause they wast a such good wagu steak. I won't said its the worst food I ever try but its worst service I ever got. we leave without hearing they say a words "sorry". they are racist I think! cause other white people since been treat very well. so if you are not a white people do not go there to spend so much money and get bad food and worst service. one of my friend said that normal in vegas cause the server get their tips so easy, thats for sure, expecially the restaurant is in Wynn. but if you are truly a high class restaurant that you will train your server to treat every one the same way, the good way! they do not respect you as a customer.

wn8K3wPxcpw3nFlhKNzovg.text: I had the chefs choice, Perfect Rib Eye with Shishido Peppers and Shitaki Mushrooms and as a side Sardinian Gnocchi-lobster, cream sauce, and truffles. It was decadent. The steak was perfectly cooked. The atmosphere was a  little pretentious but it was worth every penny. Everyone deserves to eat like this.

mE_GsN7LtDR_29U3NDtTcA.text: Try it at least once.  Best to make reservations.    We were fortunate to dine overlooking the waterfall.  In the evening there is an amazing bouncing ball light show.  My husband loved his filet.  It was seared and looked like a present.  My scallops were beautiful.  I would have liked salt and pepper on the table.  I am sure our attentive waiter would have been happy to add cracked pepper to my meal.  But, in this restaurant all I could think about is the chef coming out and screaming at me in french like in the I LOVE LUCY SHOW when Lucy asked for Ketchup at a French restaurant.  So I just ate my fish,after all this is a steakhouse.  The scalloped potatoes were the best I have ever had.  They should be for the price they are charging.  Just sayin'  I think (hard to remember) we also order the spinach which we enjoyed.  The best part of the meal (seriously) was their bread basket with their signature seasoned butter.   When in town I am going to just get their bread to go!  :)  As far as dress code ~This is supposed to be the BEST steak house in town.  Yes, the food and service is similar to the Ritz BUT you would NEVER see jeans at dinner in the Ritz.   Would we dine here again?  I think it would be a good idea for Mr. Wynn to offer discounts to his guest who stay at his hotel~ At least a free appetizer or drink.

WmisalUPFJLi99TkJl1UuQ.text: I read all the reviews about how awesome the Wagyu is so naturally I had to splurge for my birthday. I'd never had Wagyu and I've always wanted to try it. We made a reservation, arrived early and had to wait to be seated until the reservation time. We were seated outside and had a nice view of the water show there, which was a nice touch.  First off, they only had the option of either rib eye or rib cap. I made reservations with the intention of ordering tenderloin, so that was a real bummer.  But, we were only available that night so I went for the rib eye. We also ordered the Ohmi and 3 sides: mushrooms, creamed corn, & mashed potatoes and 2 drinks, which ended up being way too much food and we had a lot of leftovers, but didn't even end up eating them after taking them to go.  The best surprise of the night was the free bread that was served, we ordered seconds and so glad we did because it was amazing! We're not that crazy about bread but this one had bacon and cheddar in it. Mmmm!  The Ohmi NY Strip was probably better than the Wagyu Rib Eye, which was ordered medium rare and tasted like nothing special, definitely not worth the $220 exorbitant price tag! The Ohmi was $180 and although it was a bit of a better "deal"... it still definitely was also not worth the price. Also, it was ordered "blue" but served more like medium rare.  Apparently, the chef cooks the steak to whatever he thinks is appropriate rather than the way you order it! lol. They did give me a free dessert for my birthday, so that was a nice touch. It was a macaroon plated by being "glued" to the plate by some chocolate---this made for a messy eating, especially since no utensils were served--tisk, tisk. But, alas, this was complimentary so I really shouldn't be complaining, right?  Service was ok. But, not excellent. If you're paying such a steep price, your water should be refilled before you get to the bottom, bread crumbs should not be visible on the table, etc. This was not the case. If this were just a regular steakhouse, let's say at a quarter of SW's price tag, perhaps this review would have a higher rating, but I was oh so disappointed. I expected an extraordinary evening that excited my senses and instead I got a mediocre night--nothing special. And it was my birthday! :(   Yes, I groupon and like to find good deals for everything, but I also don't mind splurging ...ifff it's worth it. So I took a gamble.  A party of 2 for a total of $550 plus tip, totally not worth it! I guess I gambled in Vegas... and lost! ;(  P.S. There was a couple seated 2 tables down from us and they were smoking towards the middle of our dinner... this made an already mediocre night, pretty horrible, as all we tasted was smoke!  They should definitely make separate smoking and non smoking sections where you 100% can't smell the smoke.  We definitely will not be returning.

AxXUiiikdp40G_gQE60J9g.text: This place is amazing ! One of the best steak houses I have visited! My husband and I had such a great experience! The service was superb! We didn't have reservations and even though it looked really busy, they accommodated it us! Eddie, our waiter was outstanding ! the bone-in rib eye was amazing, the creme brulee was exquisite... What more can I say! Loved, loved, loved this place!

SYmy3-9AqzZzyroq199zWA.text: "The Best Steak in the World!!"  This is the second time I've been to this restaurant and have to say that it far exceeded my expectations. Again, I had the New York steak and let me tell you that it was so tender that you could cut it with just a fork and butter knife. The flavor was tremendous. Just a hint though...go hungry. I'm definitely going back and have the same thing. I can't wait.   Visited July 2013

CKjxoZVbXyK6Mf3A8P-oeg.text: Poor service! Went here with a couple before a show and experienced the rudest management. My friends had brought a very nice bottle of wine, as it was a special occasion for us. The corkage fee is $50, which we were well aware of. However, their policy is that if they sell that particular bottle of wine they will not open it. The restaurant does not offer a list of their wines anywhere though. We explained this to our waiter, the som, and the manager. We were told is such a matter of fact and even rude manner. We were extremely disappointed and ended up leaving without a meal.

ufpRk7PZ9Trn3dN6gqu7JA.text: This place is great!  It's inside the Wynn and when I walked by I couldn't resist the urge to eat here.  They have a gorgeous view where they have little shows to keep you entertained through your meal.    The food is very creative and well made.  I remember digging the menu, although I can't remember what we ordered.  Steak and fish w/a couple sides.  The deserts looked really special to.  I would definitely come here again.

owdL3qwPFMIhHcJM8Bx87A.text: This place was very highly rated. I was in shock at the poor service, but even more shocked by the poor meal. I ordered a 12oz filet. It came out a little rare for my liking, but I figured it would be ok. The absolute driest steak I have ever had. Only ate a couple of bites. The waiter asked if I wanted him to box it up to take home. I told him no way. He asked me if it was good. I replied not at all. He immediately asked if it was too dry. Seemed like he knew. He said he would let the chef know, but that was it. Very very disappointed.     After posting this review I realized they did take my steak off our ticket which was a nice gesture. They also have reached out to me in an attempt to make things better. I appreciate both of those gestures. Nothing is always perfect. I'm going to up my review from 1 star to 3 star. I appreciate their concern, and desire to make things right.

t89Av57wUN0HvbAeSuMZbA.text: I been here two times prior. Both experiences were good. This recent time I came here and they were full and had a 1 1/2 hour wait, so I decided to sit at the bar for dinner with my friend.  I was shocked by the service! The entire place had a lot of class. But the two guys who were taking care of customers at the bar area was horrible. They were talking about personal things that I did not care hear (R rated). We were two ladies that came in for a great dinner. But we felt like we were eating a bar in old down Vegas. But paying top dollar for the food. It was horrible! I would never recommending eating at the bar at this place!

I_RiQhzJR-jjE_5hRQ5C9A.text: This place is a must when you come to Vegas. Let me tell you why.   First- the outside seating gives you a show every 20 mins. It's a beautiful show with music and out of water robotics. If you google or YouTube it you can understand what I am saying.  Second - you can't go wrong with any of the appetizers. We got the foie gras because we try to get it since they don't have it in LA.   third and main reason why this was is amazing, is their entrees. Wow!!!! Everything was perfection. My husbands ribeye was so flavorful and fulfilling he was so satisfied. I got the white fish which was really well prepared and full of flavor.   This was an enjoyable dinner experience for the both if us. We are definitely coming back here.

6atawXxYetQEfBoHem7OYw.text: A+++ goes out to SW and Mr Wynn again. I had the opportunity of dining here not once but twice in a week. Both times the restaurant was exceptionally busy but our servers did a fantastic job. For those of you contemplating going - don't just go and request seating next to Wynn's Lake of Dreams in the evening.  I had the opportunity to try the following: Marinated Beet Salad Big Eyed Tuna Ceviche Filet Medium (both times) Maine Lobster Mac N Cheese Au Gratin Potatoes  Grilled Asparagus with Lemon Butter  After typing all that now I'm hungry. All were excellent. Remember you only have this one life to live so you might as well enjoy it.

NPkRZoGE7h9G6tnfDZiDxw.text: We really wanted to like this restaurant. We were celebrating a special birthday with friends and were excited to be dining here. We sat on the terrace which was lovely. The food was very good, wine exorbitantly expensive. The show was fun to watch.  We were disappointed with the service. Our server was inattentive, time between courses was way too long. One of our guests had to actually get up to get a fork for our friend since we could not get the attention of our server. There are many excellent restaurants to chose from in Vegas. Sorry, but I would not choose this one again.

63LsJd1BIGN486Klafi_Lw.text: I came in with high expectations so maybe that's why I walked out disappointed. Service was really good but it came down to the food being so-so. We ordered a side dish of Sardinian Gnocchi which was under seasoned despite the fact it had grated black truffle and lobster. When the waiter asked how everything was and I told him it seemed like the gnocchi was under seasoned he was a bit snooty and put off in his offer to take it back. I ordered the bone-in ribeye which I ordered medium. It, as well as all the steaks that came to our table, came out charred on the outside which made it a bit tough. I wasn't expecting fork tender but for a $72 bone-in steak at a renowned steakhouse it was a bit of a letdown. I don't believe to get a tender and flavorful steak one should have to resort to ordering off the very expensive wagyu menu SW had. Next time in Vegas I'm afraid I'll have to go with another steakhouse. When you drop as much money as we did in a steakhouse you only get one shot to prove yourself worthy.

IU--HKr8anykMfbwIHRu9Q.text: To put it simply, this is one of the best Steak Houses you will find anywhere in the country. Fantastic food, beutiful decor, great service, and prices in-line with other high end resturants in Vegas. I would say this is one of the top 3 resturants in Vegas (with Del Friscos and Charlie Palmer being the other two).

TzgroJ5ll41hUeX4VB9gFw.text: Inedible food... and the service was worse. The steak was soaked in salty brine. I sent back the steak and when it came back again the staff had cleared the side dishes and plates. There was just one lonely tiny salty chunk of low-quality beef. Maybe it was the chef's night off.  Staff was arrogant and inattentive, manager was unpleasant. The wine list was uninspired. If you go to look at the pond then maybe have a drink at the bar. Vegas must have a good steak-house. This tourist trap should slap an Arbys sign on the door... although the meat would be better then:-(

YFB0b7LaOx5Z1FJQ8KVmgw.text: A good rib-eye makes everything better....and this place did not disappoint.  I was pushing my luck with a 5:30 reservation and needing to be out by 7:00 with a group of nine, but the waiter was able to make it happen for us! We requested a window view and it is truly gorgeous with the large waterfall and foliage outside.  Patio seating is available as well...but not preferred when it's 104 degrees outside.    The bone in rib-eye was cooked to perfection with great flavor and sear.  The side that impressed me the most was the black truffle creamed corn...the black truffle helped tone down the sweetness of the creamed corn.  The marble potatoes with green bean and bacon was just average in my opinion but still tasty nonetheless.  The service is top notch at this restaurant.  We didn't quite finish our 20oz steaks, so they offered to pack up our food and not only that they offered to cut up the steak so that it would be easier to eat later.  They also included their amazing bacon cheddar rolls and pretzel rolls in our to go boxes as well.  I can't say enough good things about the bacon cheddar rolls, definitely not healthy, but what can be better than a buttery roll with bacon pieces!  A definite must try if you are a steakhouse lover!  I'd pick this steakhouse over Del Frisco's which is now my 2nd favorite.

QI6Yxg_WUzIcIj3AHaXqMg.text: Food is phenomenal and wine list wonderful...  Sit in between the outdoor and indoor areas so u have AC, but also fresh air.  Also, this way u get a romantic dinner with a show every 30 minutes, so fun and will never forget it.  Thnx!!

xuJ0jOl6Shn7ucMQeVTkbg.text: Steakhouse perfection.  The food and service were outstanding, and the water-feature, which all of the outdoor tables and some of the indoor tables have a beautiful view of, is absolutely gorgeous (the Lake at Bellagio has nothing on this water show at the Wynn).  Even if the weather is cool, I HIGHLY recommend getting an outdoor table. They have tons of space heaters and will also lend you a Pashmina wrap, if you're chilly.   Save extra room for dessert. We split a fantastic key lime tart, and then the server brought exquisite handmade truffles with the check that I wished I had saved  more room for.

Ub4wCPv_Ni7yP6iMoSNY-Q.text: 4.75 stars...I know who gives a .75 rating?  It was almost perfect.  If only it had been free!  The experience was amazing.  My boyfriend and I had a special night planned with a nice dinner and a Cirque Du Soleil show.  We arrived at SW Steakhouse about 5-10 minutes early and were seated after a minute inside at a table looking at the waterfall.  After a couple minutes, the servers opened up the floor to ceiling glass doors so it was like we were sitting outside.  The view was the best in the place.  We were greeted promptly and served a bottle of Panna.  The service is so cohesive and together it's amazing!  Everyone was helping to take care of everyone else.    The crab cake here was awesome!  My boyfriend got the caesar salad which was really good too.  For our main courses, I had the scallops which are served with english pea risotto and a black truffle sauce.  I got five huge scallops!  Well worth it, the dish was a little salty though.  My boyfriend had the 9 oz. filet with potatoes au gratin and sauteed mushrooms and leeks...mmmm buttery creamy goodness.  We finished off with a chocolate souffle with some cherries and creme anglaise I think.  Soooo good.  The only downside is that there wine selection is REALLY overpriced.  One glass of wine ranges from $18-22.  Overall, it was great.

RNmf7eX-1rqvNCOUcqJ8oQ.text: So worth the high price tag. I've been to Las Vegas 3 times now in the past year and SW has been a stop during each trip. It is consistently professional, delicious and entertaining. One of Las Vegas' restaurant jewels.   You know  a steakhouse is good when you would be perfectly happy only eating the bread basket they serve (warm pretzel bread & bacon cheddar muffins? yes, please).  All times I've visited, the caesar salad has been my go-to. It's chock-full of parmesan and tossed in a homemade dressing. I die. Their wedge is also a cut above the rest - it comes with a thick (I mean THICK) slab of bacon on top.   I've had both the filet and the scallops with risotto and both were equally delicious. You'd think a steakhouse would be better at steak, but the scallops were perfection and I could eat the risotto for days. Both times I had the steak, it was seared/cooked/seasoned perfectly.  Unfortunately, I've never had their dessert as I've always been too full to order it. Their service is nothing less than great - the waiters last time I went were so accommodating in making recommendations, letting us take our time and checking in often to make sure it was up to our standards. I can't wait to go back.

W3NY0LFM2RroKy3ar7NiBg.text: Ok I was initially going to give this place a 4 but I just remembered what a good time I had with my friends and how our server, Chris was one of the best I have ever seen.  He was friendly, funny and had the best recommendations.  Needless to say, I had went with most of his recommendations.  So this review is based not on the steaks....well because I dont eat steak.  I knowww...why was I there then?  Well the others in my party had heard really good things about the steak and they were excited about...so why not? As long as they have some good seafood. THEY DID!  Scallops which happen to be my favorite on top of this wonderful black truffle and pea risotto.  OH yea...!  I was too preoccupied with my food to ask everyone else how their food was but I can safely say, they looked very happy!  Next was dessert....I am soooo glad I saved room for the most heavenly Creme Brulee topped with this fresh boysenberry jam accompanied by tiny little french madeleines (I dont think that's spelled right).  Yumm yumm!  We weren't seated in the outside patio, which is great because I tend to get cold a lot, but they were really nice to have a table for us with a great view of the parasol bar show from the inside.

6unuu0aN6xvm3R6BRIyDJA.text: We were staying at the Wynn and were lured in by the atmosphere. We had requested a table on the patio with a view of the lake and this was honored. It is quite amazing that the las Vegas strip is beyond the waterfall and the foliage. The outdoor seating has a serene environment & puts you in an environment that has little to do with Vegas or the casino the restaurant is attached to. Although all this is erased every 30 minutes with the "lake of dreams show." Which while entertaining can be quite bizarre.  We had the tuna ceviche, which was more like a fresh guacamole with really good tuna in it. The tortilla chip strips were a nice textural element. For our entree we shared the chile rubbed 42oz bone in ribeye for two. The steak was spicy and smoky with a nice charr. It was accompanied by char grilled onions and halapenos. We had the lobster Mac and cheese for a side which was tasty yet nothing special.  This is a traditional steak house with a non traditional atmosphere. It definitely makes for a nice night out in Vegas. I do recommend reservations as the restaurant was packed on a wednesday night.

mYEZDsWqaXTe_2zbukiwbA.text: Hands down the one of best steak I have ever had, but you better have a good night at the tables because its going to cost you.   The place is loud and you are far away from the person you are with (tables are long) and like I mentioned it is expensive, even with all of that this place rocks. The steak was amazing, the foie gras excellent and the bearnaise sauce was unbelievable.

l75LeyIJKqePJutp7Snmng.text: I had very high expectations on this restaurant and I was not impressed. The food was fantastic, great flavoring. Again, vegan options were available. The atmosphere was too sort of club like which is the reason I did not enjoy it very much. The service was good but not that great!

72a8wTwm-JBwCyeKsWSSfQ.text: Went with 3 people and the bill was $285 before tip.   $50 corkage fee - wine must not be on their list, limit of 2.  We entered at around 6pm and there were maybe 5-6 other tables. We got seated on this pillar, hard to describe. I think our server's name was Nina?   starters: maryland blue crabcake - great. fluffy, flavorful, yum! steve's chopped salad - surprisingly, this was really good. no regrets  meal: we shared the following: 42 oz. chile rubbed double rib eye  -wow..great meat, great oils, watch out for the pepper, it's really spicy (green one). I was waiting 3 months to have this, and it almost lived up to my expectations. The meat was good, but it wasn't "melt in your mouth." I still enjoyed it to the last bit. ate both of the ribs on the plate, haah. 2 - roasted sonoma foie gras- this was good, i love foie gras, but my party didn't so we only needed 1, 2 was overkill. au gratin potatoes - if you love cheese....this is no question the best dish black truffle creamed corn - this was a great balancer to the meal. the peppers were so spicy, this helped a lot.  Overall, the service was top shelf. They were not intrusive, observed from a far and knew when we needed their assistance. the corkage fee was over the top, but they did decant the wine in a nice decanter, provide stemware, but still, $50 for corkage seemed steep.  i'll come here again, it was a great gift to my best friend and we left full.

JFwxB-Ja5i48FDHaOtT_-A.text: Things always taste better when you're not paying for it but nonetheless, the three or four business dinners I have had at SW Steakhouse have been great experiences.  Food and service is top notch and warrants their price points.  Going to celebrate anniversary dinner here this year ...

DG56rVb1_11i9cgvR-IyCA.text: Ate here for the second time and they exceeded all of our expectations AGAIN!  Got seated early, staff called us by name when presenting menus, server dished out our food for us. A phenomenal dinner with the best chateaubriand I've ever tasted. Can not recommend highly enough. If you like steak you must eat here!

SeLaUgMeLZnKIa7HCkyzYg.text: A lot to like about the restaurant. Nice ambiance, food very good, attentive service, great wine list.  And the Wynn is an experience by itself. But it is expensive. Sit outside of you can.

bG15WgJ4_acf3j5bTJD5pQ.text: PORTERHOUSE!!!! BEST OF BOTH WORLDS! Will need to share... preferably between 3 people.   I came here twice, and had great dining experiences.  Service was pretty decent, can't really complain.  But no matter what, you have to order the porterhouse steak.   I also ordered the Absinthe as a after meal dessert drink. It doesn't taste good, but it was fun as all hell to play with, and does job. They will bring out a huge apparatus and set up your table like a chemistry classroom, and I'm not going to tell you the rest and spoil the surprise for you.

SAHnGw6r7gi1mzM_MtknOw.text: Steakhouses are hard to review. Good steak is not actually that hard to come by. I cannot say that the steak here was somehow "so much more steak-y" than other fine establishments.  But I can say that the these guys can do more than just steak. They think they're a french restaurant. The rest of the menu is stronger than most traditional steakhouse. It's good, but I won't say that their other dishes are as good a proper french restaurant.  The steak was good, though. What I would recommend is that you order the steak "for two". It's served cut, and the kitchen does a much better job making the initial cuts than you would so little juice is wasted.  Ok, so there's this weird "show" that you watch during dinner. Don't get your hopes up here; it stuck most as surreal rather than entertaining or even appetizing. It's very Cirque de Soleil.  The show had to compete with the clientele. I've never seen so many attractive and well-heeled people in one restaurant in my life. Eye-candy abounds. Might want to iron your shirt before you come.  So why only three stars? Low taste/dollar. I guess if you really want great French food in Vegas, you're better off going to a real French restaurant. If you want really good steak, you might as well pay a bit less and go to BOA or one of the many, many others.

TkqXPpBOlhVfnHRU9ntAnA.text: Now this is what a Vegas steakhouse should be like.  Excellent service, delicious meal, great atmosphere, and a stunning waterfall in the distance.  Perfect.  It was way too hot outside, so we opted for an inside seat with a view of the waterfall.  The crab cakes for our appetizers were divine.  Our steaks, mine the filet, his the rib-eye, were both cooked to perfection.  The creamed spinach just melted in my mouth, and the potatoes au gratin was so rich and creamy - to our horror - we just couldn't finish it all!   How sad it was to watch them take it away.   We were too full to have any dessert.  Our waiter was very nice and made the overall experience of the restaurant a memorable last night of our vacation.  As it should be, this is a 'nice' restaurant that prefers their guests to dress accordingly, and I've seen them turn people away.  Nothing irks me more than someone walking into a 5 star restaurant in ripped jeans and a dirty t-shirt, when everyone else is in semi-formal dress.  Make an effort.

nthoL2Vyg2B8yktNJabIOw.text: Multiple reviews i read on Yelp, call this place the best Steakhouse in Vegas, curiously I tried it with my forever love at my side. We were staying at the Wynn anyway so I made the reservation.  I can say with certainty that we have both had better.  The setting is nice, service was as-close-to-correct (being Vegas), wine selection was excellent, the food: good but I really expected great. I had a ribeye which was cooked perfectly but just lacked deep "high end-steak" flavor, even though it had slightly too much fat which should have helped. I tried to "fix it" with SW's own version of A1 sauce but it did not work. My love had the Sea Bass which she also described as "just not memorable".  The highlight of the meal (besides the company) was a perfectly made Mojito and the selection of table breads (but I had to ask for it). I enjoyed the Au Gratin potatoes as well but the other 2 sides we ordered ...not so much. Maybe its me, but i feel that for $250 for 2 people the steak should be the star, and that evening at SW it wasn't shining brightly. Would I go back, simply no, there are way better steaks in town (Craftsteak being one). I read in a guest room propaganda magazine that Steve Wynn is a vegan...hmmm??.

Opm5tnyeicusX_Vcqzkk9w.text: Recently usurped Peter Luger as my favorite steakhouse.  We ordered the porterhouse for 2 which was charred to perfection on both sides.  SW broils their steaks (as does Peter Luger and Ruth's Chris) which I think results in better flavor than grilling.  The meat was tender and full of flavor.  The steak came with a few sauces, which I completely ignored since i couldn't imagine putting anything on such a well-cooked steak.  As I was eating my steak, I thought, "The only steak that edges this one out is Peter Luger."  Then I went to Peter Luger's twice in the following two months and no, Peter Luger's did not edge out SW.  SW was, in my book, a much better steak.  The decor was setting was also very nice.  We had a table by the man-made pool thing where we saw some shows that looked like they came from a grown-up Disneyland on acid.

h9UfoYiLzmg7SZcg-uFqFg.text: Stayed at Encore and wanted to eat something before heading out on a club crawl. Called in to rsvp and was seated immediately even though I told them I would be 30 min early. I got the rib-eye and my wife got the filet. The steak was really good but side of macaroni was okay. Service was good but not excellent.

YCQfAEOnHIotiuzz4mgKXg.text: The chateaubriand and filet here are two of the best steaks I've had. The white truffle creamed corn is amazing.

SOsj3wKoJrSk0460SRd6OQ.text: The SW Steakhouse is located in the new and fabulous Wynn Hotel on the Las Vegas Strip.   I was under the impression that the SW stood for South West....WRONG!!!  The S W stands for Steve Wynn the hotel owner.    The menu at the SW Steakhouse features some of Mr. Wynn's favorite fare.  There are of course steaks, but they also have excellent seafood, beautiful salads, excellent appetizers (try the lobster rolls), decadent desserts..AND a big plate of sausage.  That is right....a plate of sausages from around the globe.  An international plate of sausage if you will.  The service is stellar, the wine list expansive, the decor beautiful and the food is delicious.  Ask for a table with a view of the gorgeous water fall/fountain.  At night it changes colors and shows graphics.  It is really beautiful.

EQ62ocN_6UY3J3_oygijoA.text: As with any Las Vegas experience SW Steakhouse is over-the-top and outrageously good. Choosing to remain at the bar as opposed to taking a table, myself and a friend must have spent 3+ hours sipping, tasting, and socializing in the bar. Nothing against the restaurant dining room, which is like most any other fine dining room in Las Vegas, but sometimes it really kills the buzz to sit-down for a quiet dinner when you're in the mood just to have a good time.  So, instead we sat at the bar and socialized our way through various appetizers, entrees, and bottles of wine.  The chilled Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail was out of this world. Of course so was the price at $20, but it is Vegas after all. Nothing comes cheep, so be prepared to spend. We also had a caprese type dish, which was disappointing because of the mushy tomatoes, but I don't even know if it was on the menu so that's probably just what we get. Making up for that mistake we ordered the Filet with blue cheese that was amazing as well.  The wine list was extensive, specifically focusing on big reds from California, Italy, and France. We had a bottle of Shafer Merlot and a Brunello (this was the second bottle so the name escapes me). Overall, our experience was quite enjoyable as I'm sure the bartender, hostesses, and any guest passing through the bar could attest to. Enjoy!

k4q6steobL2716CSIsvqow.text: WE expected so much more!  Called to make reservation, young women said there was a dress code, no jeans, needed a shirt with collar, etc.  That Was BALONEY.  People were casually dressed - a BIG disappointment.  THe food was mediocre.  foie gras with blueberry jam, REALLY!!!  Crabcakes were fishy.  Snapper was soppy.  Service was O.K.  GO TO PICASSO at the BELLAGIO if you want a wonderful meal.  Don't go here.

np7z7fZfV05FgttcQQKy_w.text: This ambience of this restaurant feels like burnt toast tastes. The staff was dry and not very friendly or approachable. Although an interesting selection of music was playing (and by interesting I mean they threw a random playlist of crap together), it feels a little too quiet. The ribeye I ordered was tough and not very savory for a $60 steak cooked at medium. The macaroni and cheese was not very tasty (bacon yes, jalapenos no). I could've had a better mac n cheese at Chili's. At the end of our meal my family and I had about $100 worth of food left over that was barely even touched. Before I even got the chance to ask to take the food home, they cleared our table and brought us a check. Despite being there on a not so crowded Tuesday, they couldn't get us out fast enough. One word to describe this restaurant: Meh. There are much better steak houses in Vegas. I won't be dining here again.

FB4GaHbNzjEMSJFUelWMBA.text: Another flawless fantastic meal at SW. Perfect steak, don't miss the truffled cream corn or the grilled asparagus salad.  Wonderful service, great flavors, good wine and delicious cocktails. Really, that's all I have to say about that.

l_2pu7LNY3nmYtXYGNh4hg.text: WOW, just...wow.  This is a piece of meat I will remember for the rest of my life.* I ordered my filet medium rare and the searing on the outside with sea salt was just amazing. The service was impeccable and the drinks were strong and tasty.  Honestly, the meal in and of itself was very simple and I almost wish we hadn't ordered sides because I can't even remember what they were (but I remember being too full to eat them).  Yes-- it's expensive, it's loud, and there's a dress code.  But for my first meal in Vegas, it totally got my approval and paved the way for an awesome trip.    _______________________ *That's what she said.

21VTTt3BAoNFb0Ze0fxuzQ.text: We had a very nice seat next to the video show. I could just eat their bread basket with the black salt butter! wow, my appetizer was to die for. (seared steak tartar, she enjoyed her Caesar salad. She loves Caesar salads that is.my only concern was the long wait for our food and the pureed creamed corn and the mac n cheese which was not to be expected. but I am a picky eater too. a tad pricy but to be expected in a hotel of that caliber. I love the pioneer Mr. Wynn and would return for another experience.

EmjljjCEOG2UlhcwsEEP1Q.text: The best bone-in rib-eye I have ever had in my life.  The Steve Wynn Steakhouse sits down the escalators and opens up to the man-made private lake of the Wynn Hotel.  There has been a lot of locals alike who remain unimpressed by Wynn but I beg to differ.  While Bellagio really changed what one could expect to Vegas, Wynn's position is more subtle.  It is more private, quieter, and it's elegance doesn't shout at you.  Feel it and breathe it in.  The big plus for those who are used to fine dining from a NY or SF, the prices at Wynn are not that bad.  I took 3 others with me and the bill was less than $500 with cocktail and wine.  The cap of the night was to have Steve Wynn, the modern day Da Vinci, and one of the top business men sit two tables away...10-minutes later Mick Jagger joins Wynn for dinner.  My party were amazed.  Pos: excellent steaks, nice lake views, for those looking for a more elegant ambiance compared to the Nines Steakhouse at Palm or other restaurant.  Negs: None noted

VN4mUs7JBaqRZEyHXjGClw.text: The Dry aged bone in New York steak was one of the best steaks we have ever eaten.  The foi gras was also amazing.  The reason we didn't give 5 stars is because they forgot my soft shell crab appetizer but it was a very busy night on a Saturday. Having the place open to see the waterfall was nice but the show was cheesy with the Senor Frog showing up on top of the waterfall.

7IuKoQvUSoFtg8rSCd_36A.text: SW was definitely a must do if your looking for a great steak!! had the bone-in ribeye and it was perfectly made to my taste. MY boyfriend had the Australian waygu and he wasn't as satisfied with it and says it was not worth $150, he tried mine and was satisfied with mine so will definitely go back and have ribeye! all the sides were delish with great flavor!!

XwpY4Q5J83eQAYP_idpxzg.text: This won't be a fair review because we had a show to watch at 7pm but got our food at 6:20pm so we had to scarf down EVERYTHING.  However, I will review the outstanding aspects of our speed eating.  Bacon and cheddar au gratin - OMG, those were SO AMAZING.  It was melty, gooey, cheesy, salty, and delicious. Truffle creamed corn - the texture is a bit odd since it's like chopped up bits of corn, not the entire kernel, but the flavor is still all there.  the truffles add this intense kick at the end, loved it Filet mignon - i ordered mine medium rare and it came out almost well done.  i had no time to complain so i just scarfed that meat down.  it was still very tender and juicy but i'm sure it would've tasted even better if it wasn't so overcooked.  next time we'll schedule out at least 2-3 hours to actually enjoy our meal instead of being super ghetto and asking for the check and to-go boxes right when our food came out.

I4NrYNa9j9EyLBbqaw4Ylg.text: I ordered the 20oz Bone-In Rib Eye and finished the entire thing.  That says a lot coming from someone my size, I'm not a very big girl.  We had a variety of side dishes, they were all delicious.  My server was great, I wanted for nothing, and he was pretty funny too :)  I'll be looking forward to my next visit here.

dfACHpmBg8nwxZVstP_TFQ.text: This wasn't all that. I ordered the scallops with the risotto and um....yeah one of my scallops were raw,lacked color and flavor andmy risotto was like....stick/mushy. And I didn't want to make a big deal about it, I mean I ate the other 2 scallops so I was like "whatever". My aunt next me ordered the filet well done.....but she got it and it was burnt to a crisp! Lol I couldn't believe it. Sometimes u really don't get what you pay for. I just wasn't impressed. Oh, and it was a Sunday so they prob had a different chef working that day.....BUT still no excuse. The food should be made up to parr.

m8p0h82A3VxpKpe-bgmDXA.text: Can't say enough about how great SW is, my GF and I had one of if not the best dinner of our lives.  Our waiter knew the menu inside and out and was extremely helpful in making recommendations.  We started off with the carpaccio, which was good but surprisingly slightly inferior to the one at ToW (the truffle oil used on the ToW carpaccio was great).  I started off with a glass of the Monchhof Urziger Wurzgarten Riesling, which was exceptionally well balanced and one of the better Rieslings that I have had.  For dinner, I had the Wagyu Sirloin, which was a special for the night.  One word: AMAZING.  The cut was perfectly marbleized and melted in the mouth. Everything about the steak was perfect, easily the best cut of meat I've ever eaten. I had a glass of Merlot from Bordeaux with the steak which was good but nothing special.   For dessert, we ordered the chocolate soufle, which was also delicious and a great end to an excellent meal.  Despite the high price tag, the food and service was to die for and I'll definitely be back.

lMZyBioGt0I1VoSYPvtrvA.text: What does Rachel Ray say when she really really likes something, Yum-O!! This pace is Yum-O. Every bite was a culinary master piece - perfect food.  I had the halibut and a friend had the ahi tuna, they were both so good. I wished I had the tuna too. The cheese cake dessert was amazing. The sides of cream corn and spinach were to creamy for me but I don't have taste buds or a digestive system that can do creamy anything. The wine was excellent the service was even better. If you can only have one meal in Las Vegas, you eat at SW. I think that says it all.

eA68S3F1M1MUJAxT7YgYzA.text: What a great dinner experience .  First we we able to get the seating we requested out on patio.  It was ideal.  Then our server Lea was awesome.  She answered all our questions and gave us suggestions.  The food was excellent, service outstanding,  I can't wait to tell my friends.   Great night out.  Oh and the wine list is to die for.

p39kjberNE_37CX97XoPXw.text: meh.  steak is not usually a 'good deal' at a restaurant, so I set the bar high.  neither was the steak perfect, nor the atmosphere 'wonderful' nor the service 'great', it was all just 'okay'. and rather expensive

oxGCE3Wzpj7QN0fGErGmOw.text: Before I begin, let me say that the service was impeccable. I had just had an almost identical dinner the night before back home in SF. Needless to say, I was much happier eating in SF.  It was probably normally a delicious meal, just people sitting around my table were on cellphones (or they were ringing), being obnoxious (I thought a $175 steak would weed those types out of the dining room), and just generally not creating a quiet and luxurious environment.  Everything had this feeling (and taste) of being good parts, but together made each dish WAY too rich.

NQGtdzAUR4wxc_lmxoR3gQ.text: I dined here when I saw Garth for the first time. Loved the show! It was apparent that Mr. Wynn spared no expense with regard to the acoustics. We loved the show so much, we went a second time, and my employer will be taking her husband to see Garth again on November 21, 2010.   My employer, a dressed down Las Vegas attorney, went to pick up the tickets to the show earlier that day. She asked an employee at an Asian restaurant, where the fine steakhouses were located so she could make reservations for us. Looking down their noses at her, they recommended that perhaps she should go to the coffee shop. This reflects very badly on the Hotel in general, assuming she couldn't possibly afford to or have the inclination to dine in a fine steakhouse.   The restaurant was clean, well staffed and rather quiet...Hmmm, still trying to figure out why I had to literally "FLAG" down someone to fill my water glass, and wine glass. It shouldn't have been that difficult, since they crammed us into the back corner where we could easily be seen. The staff stood around and jabbered with one another as we attempted to get their attention for service.  A strong indication that our order sat on the line for quite a while before it arrived at our table.   The lobster was delivered cold and chewy as shoe leather...quite possibly, the worst I've ever experienced in my life. I never imagined that a succulent lobster could be transformed into such a rubbery mass. The steak was tough and dry.  Definately not cooked to order, and I wasn't impressed in the least with the cold creamed corn with...what was that, truffle or truffle oil? Didn't taste like any truffle I've ever had that was worth remembering. Honestly, I've eaten better steaks at Ruth's Chris and have experienced a far better quality of service at The Sizzler.   I've dined from Delmonico's on the strip to Dal Rae in Pico Rivera, and I truly expected better quality of food and service from such an esteemed establishment. I am embarrassed for my employer for receiving such poor customer service and being treated by Hotel staff like a low class vagrant. If you're going to pay top dollar to dine, one should expect to receive impeccable service and exceptional food. I love Steve Wynn, but this place needs some sturdy polishing if it expects to compete with the finest.

l-h8FPggK8Bw5qI_KMlOhQ.text: This is a wonderful steak house in the Wynn hotel and casino.  As is with all the restaurants at Wynn fabulous food and service.  'nuf said.

-yM_mBjcUKABvy7SW34EVg.text: My partner and I had the Chili rubbed double rib eye for 2 which was cooked perfectly and tasted better than expected. The oyster appetizer was fine. The red wine sauce was a good effort. The Chocolate souffle can be skipped.   The service could have been better. We filled our own wine, had to request water to be refilled, and got charged for items we didn't order. How can that happen when we rarely got checked on upon??  There was also no apology for the overcharge. I guess it is a regular occurance. We ordered our dessert with our meal or could have spent an hour longer there easily. Also, even though we ordered the souffle early as it has a prep time, we didnt get it for a half hour after our steak was finished.   The view of the Wynn waterfall is beautiful and adds to the aesthetic appeal.

3xKuED3OU-Gg-tlbjNl9hQ.text: If this isn't a 5-star restaurant then there are no 5-star restaurants. I've been going to SW about three times a year on average since they opened in Wynn back in 2005. It is my favorite restaurant in the world. Everything on the menu is fantastic and the service is simply as good as it gets. I usually get the petite filet and it melts in your mouth. Friends usually get the bone-in ribeye, which makes it difficult for them to visit any other steakhouse. Every single appetizer and side dish is the best I've ever had anywhere. Yeah, it's super-expensive, but worth every cent. The little extras like the types of breads and butter they serve plus the waterfall and frog show (be sure to request an outdoor table) make it the most memorable place you will ever dine. Bet on it!

IUIuY-RnuezfJQpFDJb_fQ.text: Amazing food and service.  Ambience and wine list is top notch as well.  I would go back here again.

n1IkTLKQ3Jmc4rrHV9x0Ww.text: Usually I am lazy and don't write reviews, but this restaurant make very angry and unhappy, so I download Yelp and write the review just for THIS WORST Restaurant.this is the worst restaurant I have ever been to, severs there were rude, and the food are not as good as expect, and the most important, after the dinner, 3 of us(we have party of 6)had bad VOMIT and DIARRHEA . the sever being super rude and impolite when he heard that we don't like the wine he opened and made us took it. Our entree came after at least 30 minutes after we finish all the appetizers and no one came to check on us if we need anything. even the table next us had meal earlier than us and they sat down after we already ordered our food. Then we told our sever we don't feel like the Kobe steak we ordered, and he looked us with a dismissive sight like we never had Kobe before and tell us that is the flavor the Kobe should be. OMG I am not super rich but I still get lucky to try few times of good Kobe ! I do feel they have racism because we are all Asian! Maybe they will treat you better if you wear super fancy and expensive clothes. worst  restaurant exprience ever!!!!

16a1ZR0K4c513on7NC26cQ.text: Hands down one of the best meals I have had all year! The kale salad and filet oscar style were simply amazing, the asparagus was not my fav but otherwise what an amazing dish. You pretty much cannot go wrong with any of the sides. If on the rare chance you have room left over, the funnel cake dessert should not be missed. At the end of the meal it took quite a while for the server to deliver the check, this happened at 3 separate restaurants during my stay in Vegas so I've accepted it as a Vegas thing. If you don't mind spending $$$$ on din or are fortunate to be here on business (like I was) then I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant.

7ovXzsjFunVM5taUT6hVrA.text: Seriously--AMAZING! We went at 9 pm on Friday the 13th, without a reservation, and they worked us in promptly with a 10 min wait. We ordered a bottle of Malbec, I had the filet and my fiance had the Ribeye. We had the brussels sprouts with andouille sausage and mustard cream sauce and scalloped potatoes. The steaks were cooked to perfection and the sides were delicious! The meal, the service, everything about the experience was perfect!

9_9V65s_huoMkePrkBLdiw.text: I've been to SW twice.  Great service, great food

Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty grey goose martini with blue cheese stuffed olives
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye

fxyPnP8DqRClYYRAI2I0ng.text: The rib eye here was one of the best I've ever had. It was phenomenal.  Every bite was a piece of heaven in my mouth...so good that I even ate a couple bites of the fat that I would normally just leave alone on the plate.  I'd venture to say the rib eye here is even better than Mastro's in Newport Beach and Costa Mesa.

F1Dzr3WCnmuBwETp98Qqow.text: I'm vegan, so I was eating from the vegan menu, but that was the best food I've ever had.  The mushroom croquette appetizer was incredible.  The most delicate and flavorful combination of ingredients I can imagine.  The gardein chick'n is not just what you've had at home but something extremely authentic marinated with herbs and spices.  I can't recommend this place enough.  It was a little loud and the waterfall show is weird, but the food was out of the world, the service was excellent, and, while not cheap, it wasn't even as expensive as I expected.

xu5E3t2dRiIz8Jh5l6VmGA.text: Veal chop is to die for; clearly one of the best steak houses in las vegas; Also one of the best views and atmoshphere. Have something special to celebrate you can't go wrong here.

T3_YSeMeRZgjfKOHgxj-WA.text: Best filet mignon I have ever had. Make sure to make a reservation, and ask that they seat you "on the rail", which is right by the water for the show.   This place is always busy, so seriously, make a reservation. This place is great for a date night, family dinner, etc....I can't think of why not to go here.   They have amazing desserts - my favorite is the funnel cake that comes on fake branches with dipping sauces.

8k7_hmTehNbbIzu2Clk3Pg.text: We went to SW this weekend. So this is really fresh on my mind.  I was at first so excited about going to visit the Wynn for the first and eat at the famous SW steakhouse...... The Hotel and casino was amazing however I am not rating the hotel or casino I am rating SW steakhouse. A complete disaster.   We were a party of Six we ordered drinks and appetizer and food and sides and dessert. so we experienced the whole think with this establishment.   The steaks were terrible and dry from the Fillet Mignon, Rib Eye Steak, New York Strip, and even the Chicken.... Wow I can't believe it. they missed the mark on every once order. The only thing that was good was the french fries.... Even the mac and cheese was terrible.   The service was horrible. It was a cooler evening so we asked for the heater to be turned on which is right above our table.... They turned it on and then they turned it off, when asked why they did that they said the table next to us didn't want it on. What!! that table next to us has its own heater what the heck does our heater have to do with their table. They were six people just like us and we ordered more stuff then they did.   I really wanted to complain while we were there, however my group said it wouldn't make a difference. I just told the waiter to compliment the chef on the French Fries... I hope that made sense to him.   I wish we had gone to Ruth Chris and spent the money there. At least we would have got excellent service and most importantly great food. and then went to the Wynn to enjoy the hotel and casino.  Mr. Wynn I don't know what you were thinking about that steakhouse, however I would really would appreciate if you were to go and try it yourself.

DKL--cVxJPSeYWSv6Ph7bg.text: I take my best clients here every time we're in town for the trade show and it never disappoints. Awesome food, great ambience and impeccable service. A must go to for top notch dinners.

FG34Oy6ufjK3nKxEh6CHXw.text: I stay at the wynn every other month for work and have been to all the multiple restaurants within the hotel. I would highly recommend not wasting your time at SW. The only appeal is the outside seating which the lounge has as well as the Lake side grill right next to it (which is far better). The food is decent, nothing special. The reason behind the one star is because I couldn't post my review without at least one but I give SW zero stars for the awful service. We are all visitors to LV and I would expect a higher standard of conduct to hotel guests. There was nothing hospitable, kind of personable about the staff at the front. Not one smile or attempt to make the experience pleasurable. You have many other options in this hotel and city, pass on SW.

mJ3257maNz9pw3nfYol79Q.text: Was there for a wedding told us jackets required NOPE just regular attire everywhere.  Food was ok crabcake was dry so was the desert . Ribeye and sides all good.

eTz8bbx6KrcXDGTxBB7OhQ.text: One of the best steakhouses I've ever been to, and I've been to a lot all over the U.S. The quality reigned supreme. The chopped salad and ceviche appetizer were delicious- very fresh and my filet was cooked to perfection. My boyfriend got the ribeye and was not disappointed- so tender. We got the creamed spinach, mashed potatoes and hash browns as our sides and they were amazing too! They even offered an option to do half orders for the sides! Loved the ambiance, service and light show as well. Great experience, we will be back!

mW4OelIZyXdhD9KJa0Y6yw.text: Came to vegas to celebrate my 50th b-day and being a steak kinda guy SW was #1 on my list, , in life you make all kinds of choices and this one was one of the worse ones.         Lets start with the matre d, several table open at the windows and refuse to let us dine there. The head waiter was very indifferent to us, he spent much time at his other tables but only came to ours 3 times (ordering,salads, check) Food; the florida crab claws were great, the caesar salad dressing was very good but flat lettuce swimming in dressing does not make a salad  worth eating, the chef special bone-in filet was a beautiful piece of meat that was wasted by bad cooking, i order medrare, was med+ on the edges to nearly raw at the bone, waiter never came by to check on us or our meal.waiter finally showed up, with a $400 bill, no dessert, no happy birthday, not evan a kiss

p-Z31fbZoAxwLOGv7eDlHw.text: Hands down the best meal we had in Vegas.  The service here is so outstanding, they make you feel like your dining party is the most important one in the restaurant. We felt so spoiled!  The quality of the meat was exceptional, but be warned, you may not be able to finish because the portions are huge.  The wine list is impressive.  It is expensive to dine here, but well worth it for the quality, the service and the ambiance.

gICVfL2kOALBbN2fHU-i8A.text: I attended SW on Saturday 01/07/2012.  What a lovely and delicious restaurant.  I don't know if it was the greatest steakhouse that I have ever attended but it would not be a stretch.  I ate so much that I had to throw up to make more space.  I meant that literally not figuratively.  I actually chucked because I wanted more and I had no more space.  I had the Bone in Rib-Eye and it was just wonderful.  Perfect medium-rare and perfect cut.  Now I expected the meat to be good so it was no surprise that it was.  What really got me was the cream corn.  Seriously!  Serio pedo, it was the greatest side to any meal that I have ever had.  Enough said!    I also wanted to discuss the wonderful bacon muffins.  Well I guess I just did.  Overall this place is fantastic; those who complain about the cost are probably the same people who complain that the 007 movies are not realistic.  Come on guys, enjoy the ride.

WUFhhLeRH2MTjoUEUtz8pg.text: Outstanding food every time! Ask for Ryan as server. He has been our server every time we go for the last 4 years. We only go to Vegas once or twice a year and he always remembers no only what we normally order but how we like it prepared. It is great food and service!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vXFEaee9Y0nzo3RTxpw2Jg.text: This place is what a steakhouse should be. I ordered the rib-eye cooked med-rare and it came out PERFECT. The beef was packed with flavor and super tender. I also tried the foie gras for the first time and it wasn't my thing but it tasted like fat.   The side of mashed potatoes we order was not good. For dessert we had a neutella ice-cream/cake which was really good but I barely made a dent cause I cleaned the steak.  This place is hands down the best steakhouse I've been to so far in Las Vegas. I've previously lived in NY and Boston and been to these ranked from highest to lowest in my opinion. I always get porterhouse or ribeye and have it cooked med-rare.  SW Grill 23 Del Frisco Peter Luger Morton's Sparks Smith & Wollensky Capital Grill Old Homestead CARNEVINO  I know these aren't considered steaks but Megu is great for Waygu beef and Lawry's is great for prime rib.

w4XBWFzO-ff-AVgnzFRm8w.text: I finally made it to SW...and don't think that I'll make it back.  I requested patio dining, knowing that I may have to wait for something to open up.  It was worth the wait to sit outside.  As others have said, the "shows" are a bit different and don't think that they really go with the surrounding restaurants.  Nonetheless, you still can't help but watch it, even if they are a bit cheesy.   After ordering a few drinks and apps, the server was not to be seen.  At a restaurant of this magnitude, empty drinks or empty salad plates should not linger long.  After sitting there for at least 10 minutes we had to wave down another waiter to order another drink and ask him to take our dirty plates.  Finally the main course and sides arrived.  The food was good - highly recommend the creamed corn! It is out of this world.  The mushrooms and steak were really good, but not great.  Again our server was not to be seen.  This time we waved down a manager of some sort and told him our server was MIA.   After that, our server tried to make it up by checking on us multiple times, but the damage was done.  When dropping $150+/person for dinner, I should not have to try to hunt down a server, it ruins the experience.   Hopefully management fixes this...as frequent visitors to the hotel, it would be nice to return, but with such terrible service, it probably won't happen.

R0TMeTgKM4rGeDK193aGhA.text: I am a huge fan of the Wynn and its restaurants. They are all top-notch and I always look forward to a night out at Sinatra, Andreas or SW. Unfortunately, last night was such an opposite experience from previous ones. It was extremely underwhelming. Our drinks took very long to arrive, so long that my boyfriend and I asked the waiter if he could go check. Our bread basket only had one kind, when in any other time it has had at least three kinds. For our main course we shared a bone-in Rib eye; it was cold, felt a bit dry and not tender. I had spoken so highly of SW to my bf who had never  been, that when we tried the steak I felt almost embarrassed.  Im baffled about how different it was from previous times... the consistent quality of the food and service just wasn't there this time

dm1mmoq8IiLoSE_vxc5E2Q.text: I usually don't write the review unless its really good or really unacceptable. I love the Hotel itself, Have been staying at Encore for I guess 25 times and been at SW for at least 14 times but my last 2 experiences were unaccepted and the last one was the worst. We were party of 6 and I was the only one who insist to go there as I had good experience before but this time was really disappointed. We ordered Caesar  salad and Seared Steak Tartare for appetizer which both are good actually but for main course we ordered 3 medium rare plus porterhouse which supposed to be the best cut, but this time was not, no flavor not Tender at all. IT WAS USED TO BE THE BEST CUT BEFORE  BUT PROBABLY I NEVER GONNA TRY IT AGAIN. I also ordered the NY Strip 2 months ago (before my last visit to SW) which was not good too but I wanted to give them another chance and this time, I was embarrassed and feel sorry  because it was my strong recommendation to my friends to go to this steakhouse and none of my friends were happy. Atmosphere was great and our waiter was nice and respectful but food did not meet those expectation at all. Again, I have been at this steakhouse for at least 14 times before but NOT ANYMORE.

dKP6_3uJcPNpXnzGwCfHGg.text: Ok!    I called last min for a table on the patio right next to the water/show.  They fit us in and the seats were bonkers awesome.   Tyler was our server and I said surprise me with a vodka cocktail and it was unreal and amazing ....wish I asked what it was but I was so busy catching up with my friend at dinner and the constant changing shows I forgot!  Then I says surprise me with an app... I asked him what was best the crab cake the steak tartare or foie gras... He suggest COLD foie gras and I felt it tasted something like Fancy Feast cat chow .... I was disappointed and I love foie gras.... So my friend and I both ordered MR filet with blue cheese...it was nothing special....but The dessert was unique and Tyler was awesome.   He was so attentive and honestly I didn't realize that we stayed until we were the very very last table on the whole entire patio!   Great service doll!!!!  Thank you!!!

ZbqVJhzoyyK0gGJH80vnDQ.text: So disappointed this this time around. I usually love our annual dinner here for either a birthday or our anniversary. My steak was cooked wrong & when I told the busser he took it away & dumped it. No I'm sorry or getting our server or management. The server did not check on us once after the food was delivered. I wasn't asked if I wanted another glass of wine. It seemed as if we weren't a priority because we were young & weren't going to spend money or tip well. So upset about our experience. $300+ down the drain. I'm giving 1 Star because the property is beautiful. I will be writing corporate regarding my experience.

0V7alafenxcRUGUWynzC9w.text: Well, I felt let down. Decided to spend my 50th birthday at the Encore and dine at SW and see le reve after.  Started great with everyone greeting me with a happy birthday wish! Fantastic off to a great start.  Hostesses and waiter also were aware the show was an hour and a half away. Assured us Plenty of time to enjoy and make the show which is only a couple minute walk. Drinks, apps, bread start coming, "Excellent Shrimp cocktail" great bread "pretzel bread was Great! Plenty of time! Hour +  Table cleared, more drinks. Here is where it fell apart. A lull of about 30+ minutes before we were advised salad is coming,  Ordered the Wynn chopped, honestly think they forget the dressing?  Was very bland, Looking at time before starting salad noticed we have about 20 minutes before we need to go. Advised the waiter about our time, he said main course will be right up. We were less than half way through our salad when the steaks arrive with the sides.  Less than half way through the steak they bring me a happy birthday plate and a bill.  We were told when making Reservation we would have Plenty of time to enjoy dinner. Again assured by hostess and waiter the same. "They were not busy when we arrived, or during our service"  Unsure of the 30+ minute lull in service they seem to have forgotten us. Then to ram steaks, sides and dessert and a bill almost at once was very disappointing. Was only able to eat half my steak and a few bites of the sides. 1.5 hours is plenty of time for a dinner service with far less than half a house of people and a complete full staff. Well we made the show on time! And had to leave half of what we ordered behind along with a few hundread dollars. I would think this should have been easy, with extra time to spare all while enjoying everything. Nope ruined a very special dinner. Wish I would have done The Sinatra for my special 50th, the service was 100 times better, and all done in 1.5 hours with no rush 2 days later. And a full house. Food overall 3.5, service 3, lack of following through with complete service on a very special occasion,  after being assured multiple times we would have plenty of time 0 stars.  We did not order excessive, or order hard/long cook items, and it was not busy! THEY just blew it. Think they were more concentrated on the 2 couple party that arrived when we did who did not have a Reservation, but did have a hundread dollor bill in hand slipped to the hostess. They had complete attention by double + staff the entire time.

Js7gTBSaG_4_Wf-AsI8tpw.text: Unfortunately, I was not able to return to SW because my last attempt to dine at the bar was met with being told they don't allow shorts. While I understand this in principle, I'm a 58 year old wearing a clean cut outfit attempting to spend a few hundred dollars sitting at an empty bar at 9 pm. No problem, Las Vegas has a million restaurants that can do steak that's overpriced with wine at 3x the retail price. Despite having been there before, I'll never go back. Hello, Bobby Flay's Mesa, great pork tenderloin and innovative cocktails at half the price!!!

oNsQs-2_DHZjsmH3d7Oi_g.text: We had an excellent dinner here and service was fantastic! The bread basket, especially the pretzel and cheese bread, was delicious.  I started with Tuscan Kale Salad, which was HUGE. I was shocked. It easily could have been split by two. It was very good though and I wish I could have eaten more. My husband and I split the bone in ribeye, medium rare. Quality of meat was excellent and portion size was again, huge! We had au gratin potatoes and sauteed wild mushrooms for sides. The mushroom were the clear winner. I also tried the truffle cream corn but didn't care for it (way too much truffle for my personal preference.) If you like truffle and corn though, you will LOVE this side. We booked months in advance so we had a great view inside but right by the sliding glass doors which they opened up as the night went on. Booking reservations here was the hardest time I've had booking reservations in Vegas, so I'd suggest booking way in advance so you don't miss out!

LBkc1Kd89cj4qxMok_SGeg.text: A couple weeks back I planned a Bachelorette party and decided to make reservations here. I requested outdoor seating and they managed to fit our group of 10. YAY! The bride loved the fountain/light show and the ambiance.   The food: Bread- the pretzel bread was AMAZING! and the cheese bacon muffins? Don't eat too many before the apps and main courses come out! Steak- I shared the filet and it was super tender and delicious. It was overcooked (not rare plus as ordered) but was the most tender overcooked piece of meat I have tasted- hahha! We didn't mind it was done to a medium rare :P Sides- the brussel sprouts with bacon were my favorite. I think I ate most of it, oops...The mac n cheese and potatoes au gratin were also good but heavy.  Overall the bride loved her dining experience here and the Bachelorette party guests all loved their food too. *Pat on the back to me* LOL. The atmosphere is awesome here and definitely would recommend if anyone is looking for a nice steakhouse on the Strip.

Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My filet.

7uiFPOvrNpTieggxbbdA6Q.text: Their dogs go "wan wan".  Cats, "nyan nyan".  So what do cows sound like in Japan?  Moo.  Same sound, yes, but wow, do they taste different.  Enter SW Steakhouse, offering the largest selection of True Japanese wagyu brands in Vegas.  All A5, BMS 8-10.  (BMS 12 tops the scale). Translated, nearly the best quality.  Each brand has its own unique flavor.  All show a unique sweetness not found in American beef.  All very rich but the fat in unique; it leaves no cloying oily finish on the palate.  Tip:  Order the steak blue (seared and raw in the middle) to rare.  Best way to savor the fat within.  Tip:  Unless sharing, stick with the 4oz portion of Japanese wagyu.  Very rich.  Props to you if you can finish more.  Tip:  Go with a group and order all the Japanese Wagyu brands and compare them side by side.  Fun and eye opening.  Kobe - Offered in various cuts.  The rib cap is the most tender and flavorful.  Velvety mouth feel as the fat melts on the tongue at body temperature.  Pronounced sweetness lacking all mineral flavor usually associated with beef.  Ohmi - NY strip.  Viscous fat melting below body temperature.  Velvety mouth feel.  Sweet with a distinct but pleasant animal fat aroma (think uncured bacon).  Again, no mineral flavors.  A personal favorite.  Kagoshima - NY strip.  Closest to American Kobe.  Incredibly tender and less sweetness than the other brands.  Has a beef flavor with some minerality.  Prefer an all American steakhouse experience?  SW offers a good selection of more traditional USDA prime, wet and dry aged beef and American Wagyu.  Only tried the dry aged New York.  Cooked to temp with even sear.  Well trimmed with a gentle umame finish from the aging.  Sides?  For Japanese beef, none.  For American beef, the black truffle cream corn is outstanding.  Umame punch of the truffles plays well on that of the dry aged steak.  Sauteed  wild mushrooms; aggressively seasoned with a generous amount of chanterelles simple good eats.   Seafood?  Uhh, this is a Steakhouse although the restaurant does offer seafood, poultry, lamb and vegetarian (yes, I know how silly that sounds) options.  Desserts?  Way to full to sample.  Service is very polished and professional yet steakhouse friendly.  Excellent wine list with some vintage depth.  Typical resort pricing.  An overindulgence for sure but hey, it's Vegas baby!

M3aTlIWTOJPtxSs0zY7SKQ.text: The service first is world class. True amazing people that work for this place. The food needed so innovation. Just a little bit underwhelming.

_zcCVcPgrLuUVUOZMLzG5Q.text: There are many great places for steak in Las Vegas. However in addition to the excellent steak, outstanding service sets SW above the others. Entering SW is walking into an elegant space. The decor is warm and beautiful. We arrived a few minutes before our reservation and were immediately seated at a table that I requested which was along the windows facing the Lake of Dreams.  Our servers, Katherine along with her associates were very extremely attentive. Our dining experience began with perfect cocktails. The bread and water service followed and were monitored continuously. I received a recommendation for an excellent Pinot Noir. The food service began with the Yellow Fin Tuna Ceviche that just melted in your mouth. We both ordered the 9 oz Filet Mignon, hers well done and mine medium rare. Both were juicy and tender. Side orders of summer vegetables and Onion Rings were enough for 4 people.  SW Steakhouse continues that over the top dining which we have experienced at other Wynn and Encore restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellow Fin Tuna Ceviche

T-VoxmFMk96vrWXhQ_dtLg.text: During my Vegas trip with my girlfriend for our one year anniversary, we wanted to get something special and we wanted steak so I decided to make a reservation for this restaurant. Making a reservation was easy since you can do it online or over the phone. They had a time that we wanted more when I called so a good tip is if you don't see a time in the website, try giving them a call too! This restaurant has a dress code so do dress up! Once we got there, we were seated shortly after checking in. The decor is definitely on the fancy side and there is also a waterfall that has some light shows. The waiters were patient and very knowledgeable about each of the dishes we asked about. We decided to get the dry aged snake river farms domestic A5 wagyu with a side of truffle gnocchi and au gratin potatoes. They even had complementary bread, which was probably some of the best bread I've ever had. The A5 wagyu we had was cooked medium rare and was very tender. Slicing it was a breeze and one bite into it was an explosion of flavor and oil. It was worth every dollar I paid for it. The au gratin potatoes were thinly sliced and were quite heavy. This was the same with the truffle gnocchi. Nevertheless, the experience here was very memorable and is definitely a restaurant that suits a dinner for a special occasion!
