CG5whsxOWQ_NkpIKcK6RcQ.text: This is hands down my favorite steakhouse and restaurant in all of Las Vegas. Over and over and over again it always proves that it has the elegance, the flavors, and the staff/entertainment that will always top any steakhouse in all of Las Vegas. You must get reservations in advance. You also must dress elegant and expect an elegant ambience. I recommend asking in advance if you can have a patio seat. Because in the evening hours they do a laugh for water shows that are quite entertaining but not as lively as let's say the Bellagio fountain shows. It's great for a date and it's also great for a great big group. The best part about this is that it allows for kosher options for steak and vegan options for anywhere from macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, and other pastas and vegetables options. The staff is very attentive. I recommend getting the wedge salad, tuna tartare, the ribeye, and the donuts at the end for dessert. They put the desert on a tree looking  design holding the funnel cake with lots of different sauces such as strawberry and chocolate to dip. Incredible.

Vo7Kf-g9b_uglcK6U5GmPg.text: While my friends and I were planning a Vegas trip, we wanted to spare a night for fine dining. After some research we elected SW Steakhouse to be our destination.  Made a reservation 2 weeks beforehand, Saturday evening at 5:30pm. It's located at Wynn hotel ground floor. Not difficult to find this place at all so we got there a bit early. Checked in to make sure the staff knew we were there already, and decided to chill at the bar a bit. I myself got a Mojito and it was pretty good - it was quite strong and I knew this is gonna be a nice dinner.  Got sit in right on time. Once stepped in and looked to the right, there was a large door/window openings and a man made, tall waterfall was there - not sure they did any sound effect but it really sounded like a huge waterfall inside a forrest. Nice environment with the natural light! Now the prime time for food:  -) The Bread: A. What a nice start. There were two different kinds of breads, all garlic based and they were just so good and fresh and couldn't stop eating until my friends asked me to stop and save for the steak. Alight... but man that was good.  -) Mushroom soup: A-. The whole soup was concentrated with chopped mushroom, not the usual milky-cream type and that was what made it unique. If it could be slightly less salty it would have been even better.  -) 20oz rib eye with addition of Alaskan King Crab (oscar style): A. Wow what a nice steak! I asked for medium rare and it was exactly my definition of medium rare. The outside layer was slightly crispy and the inside was soooo tender and juicy. Haven't had that good of a steak for a long time! 20oz is indeed a huge portion and I managed to finish the whole thing, it was just too good. The asparagus sitting below the steak received some juice from the steak, and the two tastes mixed and coordinated with each other very nicely. The Alaskan King Crab on the other hand was a bit disappointed. It's actually an option to be added so I did, and it was just slightly too cheesy and it didn't match with the steak well.  -) Mushroom (as sides): A+. Oh man that mushroom was so memorable. With its garlic based sauce and the green onion on top, and the cooking time was right at the point where the sauce went into the mushroom while keeping the freshness of it, that was indeed the best mushroom side I have ever had.  -) Cream Corn (as sides): A-. It was not liquid type of creamy, the texture was more like mashed potato but with corn. The sweetness of the corn was quite outstanding.  -) Mac and Cheese (as sides): B+. Comparatively this was not as good as the other two sides above; but don't get me wrong it was good too; just that it was not anything spectacular and I would have gone with other choices instead.  It was my friend's birthday and the restaurant got us free chocolate dessert with "Happy Birthday" written on the plate with chocolate, how generous!  Needless to say this place is pricey and we ended up paying around $120 per person. But the food and environment was super nice. This place is good for group gathering as well as romantic date (just don't sit too close to the waterfall side if you want to enjoy some quiet time) so definitely I am going to go back someday when I'm in Vegas again!

fDmhUfyRQ0z6TFJ2wE_txQ.text: I eat at SW every time I stay at the Wynn. It's a great steakhouse and the outside view with the water show is also fantastic. I get their bone in ribeye with Mac and cheese and potato gratin. One time, I got their vegetarian risotto. I would say to pass on that. It wasn't as tasty as the steak and sides. This steakhouse is better than the one across from it.

YJZhcOcQ7HG4EUnzrJBz7g.text: My boss always takes us to great places to eat and says SW is his favorite steakhouse. After our company dinner there I can absolutely see why.   First off their restaurant is very beautiful. They have a very clean and elegant look with a waterfall garnishing their outdoor eating area. The service was top notch and very interactive. Appetizers and bread selection were elite as well.  I am a very big fan of steak and have been to other steakhouse here in Vegas and the rest of the work, but I have to say SW is definitely one of the best places I have ever ate at. Their bone-in 24oz ribeye was cooked perfectly, seasoned well and had such great flavor. I could've ate three orders of that ribeye. Definitely looking forward to our next dinner here.

mk899EMTAWrlI7MXokVhVQ.text: Ladies and Gentleman. That's who we are and who he is. Let me introduce you to Tyler. We were #blessed to have him serve us for the evening not just fine wine, superior steak, savory sides, decadent desserts but his company, humor, kindness and attentiveness that aligned with the ambience. Did I say, #blessed?  Next time you have the pleasure of dining at SW, treat yourself and request Tyler. He is the ambience. XO

ViR599dxLb_UvaGG1IcMJA.text: This place is a great steakhouse. Wonderful environment, staff make you feel great too. The steaks are cooked to perfection and the view is amazing while you eat if you are on the patio.

GBja9uP7sbZ1loWnGtzhBA.text: I'll start by saying I'm a professional chef. This place is top notch. Service, ambiance and most importantly the food. I was dinning alone so I sat at the bar. The cocktails were perfect as was the service. I was looking over the fabulous menu with the bartender told me the chef was doing a slow braised Wagyu Short Rib. I ordered that with the Yukon Gold Potato Puree. While enjoying my pre-dinner cocktail I got an important phone call. My food came while I was talking...bartender politely came over and said, "Mr. Crawford...please eat that while it's hot". I kind of looked at him oddly then at my plate...abruptly told the caller I had to go. He was so right. Damn, I make an amazing Short Rib but I was outdone! Best Short Rib I've ever enjoyed. I thanked the bartender for the recommendation and telling me to basically get off the phone and EAT!  Can't wait for my next trip...only stay at the Wynn/Encore. I'll be right back to SW...hopefully with a date!

G93BUGw6adJ5rW1AAW4cPA.text: Perfect. That's the word I would use for our experience here on our first night in Vegas. We wanted to splurge at least once during our trip and this was my choice and I'm glad I made it.   The service was impeccable. Our water glasses were never empty and every single person on the wait staff was kind, helpful, and knowledgeable.   The food...DEAR LORD. A couple of us ordered the dry-aged bone-in New York strips and DEAR LORD you gotta see that crust. Deeeelicious. Perfectly cooked and DEAR LORD it melted in my mouth. My gal got the seared scallops with Risotto. I'm a bit of a risotto newb but I didn't know it could taste that good. But the showstopper was the gnocchi with lobster. Legit one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life. I will return just for that.   Can't wait to come back. If you're reading this, you should definitely go here and give them all your money.

7TLhSNeLNfBcZppAmHTfaw.text: Wow what a place to go eat. If you want to impress a girl and ask her to marry you after the meal.... THIS IS THE PLACE TO MAKE HER SAY YES! Great service. Excellent food. It's just the best of the best in fine dining. You won't be disappointed. After you eat you can enjoy a free show right from the restaurant.

3AOLi3DKwLay_1mBdAYf8A.text: My fiance and I came here on our last visit to Vegas and while we found the food and ambiance wonderful, the service was uneven. We were celebrating our engagement and wanted a romantic/upscale experience. The food was delicious. We both had steak and some tasty sides. The starter bread is also very good and supremely above average. The unique show adds to the experience. I would suggest making reservations and requesting outside seating for the best seat of the house. While we enjoyed the food and show, the service lacked a bit. On the night of our visit, we had several waiters come to our table as we didn't have an assigned waiter. Also, the service was a bit slow. I don't know if the restaurant was short staffed on that day, but it was definitely a bit upsetting given how expensive this restaurant can be. In general, we had a good experience. This restaurant is on the Wynn, which is a lovely hotel to walk around.

yyNiW3ozyq0I9eCvrSgq6A.text: This was a fun dinner, there were five of us celebrating a family event.  The first thing I noticed, is that the round table we were given, could have taken 6 or 7.  In other words, the table was a bit large for five. But five is an odd number, so we accepted that, and decided to talk louder.  This review is top rate, but let me give some detail. We started with ordering two orders of the crab pasta, but asked them to split it into five servings.   They agreed, though I could not believe it. This super fancy restaurant wants to accommodate my request to put two portions into five servings? That is so crazy, but they easily accommodated me.  Then, for the next course, was asked to split two mixed salads into five plates. Again, they did this. That is way too nice. I gave my server a $20 cash tip in his hand, because they are being too nice.  For the third course, we each ordered the 9 oz filet. It was so cool, when the steaks are ready, the staff puts them all on the table at exactly the same time. This is very professional!  So...this is the perfect dinner experience. Every detail is perfect. Our dinner server,  Edward, was so helpful. He is the epitome of a professional.  A ten star experience. Highly recommended!

5VnrQsdIQlRG747xREGOCQ.text: I honestly hesitate to eat at this place and finally accepted under our friends pressure and the fact that Golden Ramsey restaurant was fully booked for days in advance  The Caesar salad was absolutely the worst I ever tasted in my life and the presentation I ever seen worst (see my pictures) even Chef Boyardee  oils make it better and will taste better  The meat was dry and tasteless and almost burned The side dish were expensive for what it is  This is not the kind of place that I will visit again for sure specially it is very costly not to say overpriced for the food quality and service

pf4JlVTpqIfxwwM6VryFfw.text: This was a really disappointing experience... We came in this past weekend to celebrate our anniversary + my boyfriend's birthday. We purposely chose this place as a special occasion dinner since my boyfriend had an amazing previous experience a few years ago. However, this visit left a lot to be desired.  We were seated outside next to a space heater, we weren't cold at all - the ambiance outside is SO much fun! We absolutely loved it!  What started our experience off on a bad start though was the wait staff... We couldn't figure out who was actually our server for the first 20min of being seated. The woman who we thought was our server came by again to drop off our drinks - but she didn't even look at us or say anything. She dropped off the drinks and just walked away. We tried talking to her, but she just left. Then our actual server came by. He was not very helpful when we asked for advice on navigating the menu. He was not able to offer detailed descriptions of different entrees, all of the answers were pretty short, and we were a little frustrated trying to figure out what we wanted to order from the selection of steaks. My boyfriend & I agreed that our server was much more friendly later on in the meal...  The food was pretty good. We split all of our dishes & left very full. We had the kale salad + the Snake River Wagyu + a side of the creamed corn. Honestly, we would've ordered more, but the appetizers selection left a lot to be desired. The bread selection was sooo good - obviously loved the Cheddar biscuits. The Kale Salad was AWESOME, we hope we can try to recreate this at home. The Snake River Wagyu (especially with the peppercorn crust) was delicious, and even more so when eaten with the butter supplied. My boyfriend really enjoyed the creamed corn, but I felt it was way too sweet & rich. I could only have a little bit.  The server did bring out a little dessert at the end for our anniversary/birthday celebration, which was a nice little touch!  Overall, for a special occasion dinner, we were pretty disappointed. It didn't knock our socks off like many of the other restaurants in Vegas. We come to Vegas for the unique food experiences and this just didn't do it for us.

ktHBKbRBc6YGR7pKCl4FNA.text: Expectations were very high and were not met. Food was good but bone in ribeye came out severely undercooked as is often the case at these high end steakhouses.  Ordered MR+ and came out Rare.  It's amazing how for the price paid that these types of places so oftentimes miss the mark on meat temp. Its inexcusable IMO.  In addition, the service was mediocre at best - a significant underperformance given the lofty prices.  Overall could not recommend and would not return.

v629EU0tWqHgYCqiBZ39EQ.text: Ribeye and lobster were perfectly cooked - melts in your mouth! However, the green beans had an odd teriyaki sauce that didn't do it for me and the fries were way over cooked. My dirty martini tasted watered-down which was a disappointment for a high end steakhouse. Recommend asking for a lakeside table since the shows are really cute.

UK-i7BnYHVSg5uhmpge-Pw.text: I am uniquely qualified to review SW as I have dined here over 200 times. When the restaurant/property opened in 2005 I became a regular. A few years later another regular started dining at SW every single night and he certainly became the most regular diner here. Well he died, RIP MD, so I think I have regained the title.  The restaurant is beautifully situated on the Lake of Dreams tucked far enough away from the casino to achieve a sense of serenity. BUT, the restaurant is far from serene as it is almost always packed and filled with energy. SW has successfully achieved an indoor/outdoor ambiance which adapts to weather and features mini shows on the lake every 45 minutes. My only harsh criticism is the pace at which new segments are added to the Lake of Dreams. Newbies enjoy them but they do get stale for regulars and it doesn't seem like it would be that difficult to program new content.  The bar awaits you when you enter the restaurant and is great featuring two TVs, top notch bartenders and a full menu. I love watching games here or grabbing dinner if in a rush. Excellent selection of wines by the glass.  The dining room is expansive with outdoor patio that opens seamlessly, weather permitting. There are private rooms in the back that can connect if necessary and a "private" patio. Great place for an epic private dining experience. The dining room has great energy due to the crowd and see and be seen design (eye level mirrors throughout).  Despite the great location, design and energy... the food and service steal the show. When the restaurant opened it had an all-star crew including the poet/sommelier Noe (best in town). The entire team was "poached/recruited" (you can find them at Scarpetta delivering the same world class service). Fortunately, SW was able to maintain its standards and you can expect attentive, gracious service.  It's really about the food. It starts with the bread basket which has pretzel bread, cheese rolls and corn bread... now French I think. I try not to eat them but always do because they are so good. The steaks are all prime or better and usually cooked to perfection. They are all excellent. Great seafood selection including stone crab when in season and crab legs. There are usually specials most recently Sardinian Gnocchi. Delicious.   You will spend some money here so be prepared. If you want the full steak/wine experience but don't want to break the bank or don't have a comp, try the Meyer Cabernet. In 2006 it used to be about a $100 but has crept up every year as the wine keeps getting better. It's the best value and a no brainer. Probably around $135 now which is the low end of their list. Cheers!  If you want a no risk high quality dining EXPERIENCE, SW will deliver... even if you are a vegan.... there is a menu for that too!

YJAOqcGEnqhP7jA1F5vjkg.text: Amazing. Best place in the Wynn. Classy and quiet. I have dined in Bar and in dining room. Wonderful steaks and food. If staying at wynn dine here.

__gsXY-2DOMNe4wq6YYGog.text: SW is one SWELL establishment.  The food, the entertaining ambiance, the service; you are guaranteed to be delighted.    Best seats are on the patio where you can partake in the wonderment of the lake show ("lake of dreams").  However, if you happen to get smoked out by a neighboring patron smoking a cig or stogie throughout dinner, no worries inside dining is just as enchanting.  The steaks and all the sides will ensure culinary overload (special mention to the mac n' cheese and black truffle creamed corn.)  Word to the wise skip a side dish and save room for their mouth watering desserts.

VM_NnAahZFV4dqR6VAMUSA.text: My steak was cooked to perfection, I had the 30oz tomahawk.  Delicious!!   Services was great, different waiters would stop by spend 20 seconds on random chats, no too long, but enough to make you laugh or smile before getting back to your plate.

ZkqU9lYo9p_5VdHqlX872Q.text: Chris. Wow.  What an amazing way to spend the only night we had in Vegas.  My husband and I spent so much time wondering what restaurant we should go to.  We chose sw.  Chris was our waiter and made our night. Funny, attentive, knowledgeable.   I am from LA and lived in NYC and this is the service I'm missing.  Just a great night thanks to Chris.  Food was great , but would have been nothing without the service From Chris.  That's what dining in Vegas is all about. Top notch.

r2mGeibgrrIZKM0uNm0N-g.text: Very nice steak and romantic atmosphere , need to book ahead of time . Friendly waiter and personnel . Pricy !

mt-e-eagd8aMsOhIOJxL_w.text: By far my favorite steakhouse I've ever been to. The steak cut like butter and all of the food was prepared amazingly. We celebrated my boyfriend's 21st and we bought a cake from the hotel as a surprise and they presented and served it to us. So happy with the way everything turned out. We sat outside near the waterfall and every 30 minutes there's a little show that makes the night even better.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of funnel cakes
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops fantastic
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uui8ppDrfFiGgTowvSO9rQ.text: From start to finish it did not disappoint. As regular Vegas goers, we love the restaurant selection and have been waiting to try SW. The service was impeccable with having a duo. The servers were polite and helpful with questions about all the dishes including desserts. The kitchen also went above and beyond to accommodate my food allergies on the stop which was such a relief because I forgot to call ahead to inquire. This will definitely be a new regular spot for us when we are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple pie
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12oz filet
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops made specially to accommodate my allergies!

cncX_irdfdQzA2U95ivZzw.text: My wife and I selected this restaurant to celebrate her birthday during our stay in Las Vegas. We were seated, given menus and offered water by a server. We then waited 15 minutes before our assigned waitress came and greeted us. We were never told anything about the restaurant or any chef specials for the evening-as we overheard our neighboring tables were. I mentioned to the waitress that we were celebrating my wife's birthday and she casually acknowledged. We ordered drinks-my wife selected a speciality cocktail and I ordered an old fashioned with preference for a particular 'high end' whiskey.  The waitress questioned my choice-"Are you sure you want that?" She swiftly brought me a drink menu and showed me the price list-I'm well aware of prices in Las Vegas and this is not our first time traveling.  We then ordered our food-my wife and I shared a 24oz beef cut (plenty of food for two) along with two sides. As we sat and waited , enjoying the beauty of the outdoors, we couldn't help but notice that the guests around us were receiving top service and attention. We were never approached or asked if we were in need of anything or perhaps wanted to order more cocktails. After nearly an hour, our meal was served- the food was delicious. We were never approached during to see how things were...never asked if we needed anything. We finished eating and sat with our empty, dirty plates on the table for over 30 minutes. The staff and our waitress walked by MANY times assisting neighboring tables. We flagged a server down and asked him to kindly remove our soiled plates. He then offered us dessert menus. The restaurant and our waitress were well aware that it was my wife's birthday. As we sat, there were numerous parties celebrating birthdays. They were brought a small desert and a candle in acknowledgement. That was something NEVER offered to us. At this point we were both very upset and honestly felt a bit discriminated against. We waited about 10 minutes (watching others being waited on and treated well) and never were acknowledged by our waitress asking how everything was. We again had to ask the server for the bill- we paid and left. I'm writing this review because I came to this restaurant because I'm a guest in the hotel -I was expecting top service and treatment and was given nothing of the sort. I'm truly disappointed.

2zSAl9patMUfoGsk75AwzQ.text: Welcome to mastros of the desert aka sw steakhouse. My god, wow I loved this place. The food quality was top notch from the bread basket to appetizers and desserts.   We started off with crab cakes, shrimp cocktails and wine. All were very tasty. The ribeyes  were just  so fucking good. Perfect medium rare plus, the presentation was outstanding. A must go

fMkKN_RwsQIdvu-LHAqGug.text: Love the steak. I always get the filet and top it off with foie gras. All of the sides are amazing and you can never go wrong with any of them. I always get any and all of the foie gras options. Portions are huge as well and the drinks are strong and flavorful.

dK3VpdkeAir3M_-uJWSqdA.text: This is always a "MUST STOP" when I am in Vegas.   I believe SW Steakhouse to be one of the best in Las Vegas.  I always start off with the beef carpaccio.  It is so good, I can eat the whole dish myself.  My favorite steak is the double rubbed chili ribeye.  WOW!  This steak is amazing!! Caution...this steak is 42 oz!!  So, plan to split it with a few friends.  It's worth every penny.  The bread basket is always fresh and delicious, and the restaurant overlooks the Lake of Dreams.  Give yourself a treat, and stop by SW.

A3YBcwH_pYsykDvyvlI74g.text: Yum....one of the best Filet I've had. And the Wild mushrooms, are the bomb. Very attentive staff too.

l0RCMDUp16YVq8iOOom7fg.text: Delicious!  Make sure you make a reservation, the maitre d' can be a little pretentious.  Try the scallops and risotto.  Sides are served family style - the creamed corn and Brussels sprouts are delicious.  Service once you get to the table is outstanding.  Funnel cake for dessert!

ws3aC9xNeox--YMDxqZPPw.text: Based on eating here twice, SW is ok. Compared with high end steakhouses in NYC, Boston, Chicago, I'd say the food is sub par. With the exception of the actual filet and parts of the seafood platter, I was unimpressed. All the sides I had on both nights varied from average to "are you serious with this crap?"  The decor, atmosphere and waterfall-lightshow-psychedelic-frog thing were solid, but it didn't make up for the food. The service was standard high-end steakhouse excellence and worthy of 4.5 stars alone. I'm sure there have to be better steak options in Vegas. My sense is that SW gets the benefit of the doubt from a lot of people because it's in the Wynn which is one of the best properties on the strip - shame.  Take a pass on this one.

g3SiDZNP1SE36kW3TksIXw.text: We went there on July 27th my daughters birthday. As it was raining and the outside shut down there was a bit of a wait but being the fine place that it is they made all our drinks while waiting on the house.  The food is to die for and with our group of 7 there where many appetizers to sample and the crab legs where to melt in your mouth.  The dinner was well worth it even if it's high $$$$ . But do not regret  dinning here at all and we left  a $275 tip as the service and food is that good.

igmhYW5YPkNBjL-pA_rxpg.text: Steve Wynn is a radical vegan these days, so all his restaurants feature vegan options. I am most definitely NOT a vegan...but I like to try new stuff, so a friend took me out for a little sampling one night. We started with appetizers here, and then walked across the hall to Lakeside for our entrees (see my other review).  I had also been here once for dinner, at which time I had steak. I don't remember much about that previous meal other than the fact that the place seemed overbearingly full of itself, and was mainly patronized by the Beverly Hills Botox Gang. Also, my boyfriend at the time had to lie and pretend he was a client of his (a high roller who was staying at the Wynn)...otherwise they were "booked up" and weren't able to accommodate us, so sorry (yeah...it's THAT kind of place).  But anyhoo, THIS time, my friend and I had a reservation, and just ordered cocktails and appetizers...all from the vegan menu. We had a sort of molded quinoa salad that was FANTASTIC, plus a butternut squash soup with cilantro that was FAAAABULOUS. We also had some croquettes that were made from some weird meat-substitute that tasted like whatever it is they put in croquettes (peasant fetuses or something, knowing the kind of people who dine here). Everything was delicious, and the waiter and host staff were courteous and friendly, even though we were only having apps and not racking up a huge check. Bonus points to them for that!  Alas, I f*cked up the vegan theme by eating the bacon cornbread muffin from the bread basket. The waiter didn't offer to bring us a vegan bread basket, which they did later at Lakeside...just the regular shtick, which was the usual Holy Trinity of BreadBaskets: pretzel bread, cranberry bread and bacon muffin.  Atmosphere-wise, this is sort of a mix between those clubby old-school steakhouses, and the hip new douchey kind of steakhouses. Muted color palette, sort of country-club bland. I think some kind of equally bland Diana Krall-type jazz playing in the background. Boisterous laughter from the red-faced captains of industry at the tables around us, chortling over their latest acquisitions and tax evasions.  A few cranky old couples in Ralph Lauren and St. John, mincing their steaks in the grim-faced silence that only comes with decades of miserable coexistence with someone you hate, but married because of their pedigree and the lifestyle they were able to provide you. You know....THOSE kind of people eat here!!!  Honestly, unless you want swanky vegan food (and even then), I don't really see much to recommend here, as it is very expensive and not all that exciting of a scene. But...if the last time you slept with your steel-titan husband was during the Reagan administration, and your grandson just crashed the Jaguar you bought him as a graduation gift, and you regularly clean out the La Mer counter at Bendel's in a hopeless quest to regain your tennis-playing youth and firm up your withered jowls......you just might dig this joint!

elP7RLUlXYWio_JGfLGSig.text: Everything was superb, except for the steak, a bone-in New York. which just wasn't good, either in flavor or texture. Not sure why. My wife had the sea bass, which was outstanding. Wonderful service, great wedge salad, terrific house special wine. We had the coconut tapioca for dessert-delicious and light.

8IQou74YiZpSsPPl_Hh3iw.text: So we were torn between a number of steakhouses. Yelp reviews are all over the board for all of them. I suspect you will love or hate any or all of them. So we decided to try SW despite the restaurant being named after Steve Wynn, a vegan.   The restaurant was nice, but it was noisy. Our waiter was sharp, attentive, and helpful. We shared the porterhouse and it was cooked perfectly to our order. The sides were tasty. We were very happy.  Only 4 stars due to noise, stuck in a corner with no view, and food was a bit overpriced.

wd0OEpKdscDzmbZP0-CpdA.text: Two words: lobster macaroni! *nom, nom, nom, nom*  I have some really awesome friends and last week for my birthday I was treated to an amazing dinner here. Dinner started with the foie gras that everyone mentioned. We ordered the sauteed version (there are two variations) and it was different than anything I've ever had. The blackberry jam perfectly complimented the flavors.  For my main course I had the 9 oz. filet mignon and we all shared a few appetizers. Again, the lobster macaroni was insane! It really was a party in my mouth. My friend Alex was crazy about the creamed corn. I wasn't that impressed, but it was good.  Dessert was creme brulee and they served it with a candle and "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate sauce. It was good and it was a very nice presentation. I jokingly asked if they were going to sing to me like at Applebee's. One of our servers didn't quite know how to answer me, so I tried to help by saying that we paid enough for them NOT to sing and that was okay.  The food was delicious and I really appreciated the terrific service. Everyone was very attentive and professional, but never stuffy. They made it seem effortless, making the experience that much better.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They certainly know how to make a great impression.

aQ3yqk6xeYiUIkfeBn7nqQ.text: Soooooooo amazing!!!!!!!! Had dinner here on Sunday night, the steak was perfect, comes with this amazing butter, we had the crab cakes for appetizer , I highly reccomend it!!! I also reccomend the steak fries that are cooked in the wagyu oil , the Mac and cheese, and the creamed spinach. The food was delicious!!! Then there's the entertainment, very cool hallograms with music, a huge screen on the water, I would reccomend sitting outside so you can see it. I am definitely going back!!!!

4uwobywPItvw_HlYS6NY1w.text: Do you want the good news or the bad news first?  I think I'll start with the good and sweeten up this review and then end it on a bitter note as this is how I feel about this steakhouse.  The ambience of this restaurant itself is classy, romantic and with the giant frog that pops out and starts singing over the waterfall...i'd even say magical.    Service was great.  Friendly servers who are able to make recommendations on the menu and wine list.  Our drinks were refilled and they checked on us just enough.  I saw them watching from afar ready to service us if we were in need of anything.  There were 5 of us in the party and plus tip we each paid $125.  We ordered the Maryland Blue Crab Cake, Kobe Beef Carpaccio, Filet Mignon, Bone in Rib Eye, Bone in New York, Chile Rubbed Rib Eye for 2 (42oz) and wine all around.  We also had the Au Gratin potatoes, mushrooms and 2 orders of the black truffled cream corn based on the servers recommendation.    I loved the crab cake.  It was made out of blue crab so the meat was sweet and full of crab flavor.  The crab cake was light, fluffy and cooked perfectly.  The carpaccio was okay.  I think i've had better carpaccio elsewhere.    I loved loved loved the Black truffle cream corn.  My favorite item of the evening.  This dish was divine.  Creamy, sweet, melt in your mouth delicious.  The mushrooms were also good but it's sauteed mushrooms...you really can't screw that up.  The bad news...which is the steak :(  I tried my hubby's filet mignon.  It was good but slightly cooked medium well about half the steak and the other half cooked perfectly at medium rare which he asked for.  Honestly, I think I cooked filet mignon once at home and we kept saying throughout dinner that it was amazing.  Yup, hands down I make a better steak than SW.  My friend ordered the bone in rib eye medium well but it came out well.  Not the slightest hint of pink at all.  That got sent back to the kitchen and a new piece of rib eye came out cooked medium well...but mainly in the center.  The sides were still medium well.    I shared the 42oz chile rub with my friend and that was only decent.  A good portion of the steak was uneatable as it was chewy and it had a lot of the muscle tendon tough stuff.  Only the middle part was good and even then it wasn't tender melt in your mouth steak.    Overall, I was bummed that we spent a bit of money here and the steak was just okay.  This is a steakhouse after all...but it did not rock my tastebuds.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crimini mushroons &amp; sauteed leeks
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black truffle creamed corn
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile rubbed double rib eye (42oz)

HsahAzisWdtGFfOpxRzhcg.text: This restaurant is absolutely phenomenal. I'm a vegan and went with a non-vegan for dinner last night.  For the vegans, they take impeccable care to make sure you know what you can and can't eat - even bringing out vegan butter for the bread! I had the quinoa cakes (amazing), creamed spinach (pretty standard), and the sauteed mushrooms (can be made vegan). The mushrooms were the best I've ever had! The vegan dessert was also amazing.   The light shows start at 8:30, so try and get there at 7 or later to make sure you get to see them!   Will definitely be coming back to try the other vegan entrees soon.

PCmngt7cSEVgL7K40VCsMg.text: Before I go with the bad, I'll start out with the good. Keep in mind this is my first high end steakhouse dinner and I did come on a Thursday night.    I went with a party of four, of course, with reservation. (2 ladies and 2 gentleman)  Hostess seated us promptly and near the fountain show view.  Ladies  shared 1 order rib-eye medium well.  It arrived 2 halves in 2 separate plates without our request.  We weren't complaining about that, we were surprised that they did it to save us the hassle of doing it our selves so kudos on that.      Gentleman's ordered the 40oz porterhouse medium rear for 2.  *First timers just to let you know this cut will be cooked on a bone and than be for you cut for you in slices in the kitchen for you.  Shared the Crab cake as a little appetizer.   Sides we've ordered Truffle cream corn, Broccoli, and SW Fries.  3 glasses of wine and ginger ale.  Came with 3 different kind of complimentary bread which was pretzel, bacon cheddar muffin, and some other bread.     Services was great. Everyone was prompt and fast.  They even folded the napkins back to the triangle as the ladies went to the restroom which I saw was a wow factor as I am an ordinary guy.  Waters were quickly refilled which out asking.  The view of the fountain is a pretty view.  But the show is kind of odd and usual.  I am not sure if they have different shows but the one I saw is about 2 balls floating on water making love than popping out a baby.  I am neutral about the show but, maybe it will bug others.  I will go in order.  Cheese and bacon and pretzel bread were both good and delicious. The other one was really chewy and hard. It came with butter and i believe it had some sort of black salt on the top.   Crab cakes - It was just okay to me. Yes it has big lumps of crab in it and it's non greasy but there is no wow factor in it.    The rib eye (about 1 inch thickness) the ladies ordered was salty due to the season they used as I am assuming it is some sort of salted crust seasoning.  It was to the point that the person who ate this steak had to start scraping off the seasoning. It also came out a little bit too well done for a medium well.  The porterhouse for 2 is about double the size of the rib eye in therms of thickness which was about 2 inches.  The first bite I took melted in my mouth but, I soon to realized that after the first piece i ate that the steak was not medium rear but medium.  To be sure it wasn't me I asked the person in which I shared the steak with, he said the same thing.  This steak was also coated with the salted crust but, since my steak was a little bit thicker it didn't seem as salty as the rib eye.  The truffle cream corn - truffley (not a word but made up lol) creamy and corns where blended up like baby food.  If i were to eat this as a side i would not be happy with it. BUT it came to the rescue to use as a "steak sauce" to help kill the saltiness of the steak.   The broccoli was tender and good but it was also extremely salty.    SW fries - good crispy and season with some spicy seasoning. But would not recommend as it is just fries.    Ginger ale was flat.  I have 2 stars docked off because half the food was simply just too salty.  Both of our steaks was over cooked.  For a steak house at this level and expense is simply unforgivable especially with a house half packed.  Sadly the wow factor in my experiences was not the food but, in the staff it self whom provided with great service.  Other thoughts i wanted to use my hand to finish off the t-bone lol but I didn't since i feel that this steak house is a classy steak house.   I'll update this when or if comeback to this steakhouse. Perhaps it is just my luck.

bV2vlVf1U3PZhUKV4YO3Og.text: The restaurant met my expectations in every way. The staff were attentive and friendly and the food was well presented and tasted as you would expect for the price paid. The starter of tuna ceviche was well executed with a fantastic combination of flavours and textures. Whilst the crab liguine was absolutely delightful. The steaks were very good and cooked as requested, but overall I still prefer to eat the bife de lomo by Gaucho Grill over the steak that I had that evening, and actually any steak that I've eaten ever. The chocolate souffle was a bit of a let-down from what started off as a very promising night, but it was passable.  A $200+ bill for (2 starters, 2 mains, 2 sides, 1 dessert and large bottle of still water later) we left satisfied if not a whole lot lighter in the wallet.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZHO6bs9Hga45a_bkJr1wBQ.text: Hostess lied! Epic FAIL SW!  I had made a reservation couple months prior for my seventh year anniversary for my husband and I. So, when I had called to reconfirm, I did mention that we had arranged an outdoor seating by the railing to watch the little shows that go on every half hour on the water.   Yeah, no! Once we walked in... I told the hostess my name (which she found in the system easily, since we were staying in the Encore to begin with). Next, right when she took us towards the outside seating area, she turned right back in and pointed us to a seat looking towards a wall located INSIDE the restaurant! WHAT?!?! I was pretty mad at this moment and said these are not the seats I had requested months prior when I called and reserved. She kept saying, others had misplaced that info from the system and that she wasn't sure about what I was referring to. So, I asked to speak to the manager... she looked at me and had a laughing smirk on her face while she went back to the front desk. As I got up to look to see if she was going to change our seats to an outdoor seating (which by the way was empty!) (supposedly reserved!!!) saw her point at my table where she sat us and started laughing with the manager. She then came by my table and said, "I'm sorry, I have people that have booked in advance of 1 year, which are scheduled for tonight). Then she started laughing with a bitter smirk on her face again. At that moment, I just got up and walked out as my husband was shocked that what horrible service this was.  Yes, we have ate here before and I must tell you... The view from next to the railing is beautiful, yet the food is very close comparable to BJ's steaks. Lol! Cheap and heavy as they would say. HORRIBLE SERVICE and incredibly rude/non-professional management.  I DO NOT recommend anyone to waist their money here. There are better tasting food locations very close by, for a hint a really nice one in the Shops at the CRYSTALS! "Ends with the word Ocean Club."  Rating: F- (1 STAR)

eVMptRA8yEeAccwyErifnQ.text: It was amazing how bad the service we received at the SW Steakhouse was. We had a party of six, and waited over an hour for our entrees. Members of our group never received drinks that were ordered. Our service staff was disinterested in us and how our experience was. By far the most disappointing part of our Vegas trip. We will not be returning to SW.

R7o2Q9wxCbaQE1qLcFFarw.text: Best steak ever and one of the best Restsurants in Vegas. I would recommend sitting outside because of the waterfall and show that they play while you eat. Definitely will be back

v3O-aSBP2kMDBSlsLy7weA.text: We always make it a point to eat at the SW when we are in Vegas. Food is excellent. Try to get a table by the cascades, its different and entertaining.

gbqt8SgIHJEJx_c8fRhsDw.text: I'm a little late on writing this since I was in Vegas over Super Bowl weekend, but it's still worth writing about.  This WOULD HAVE been the best steakhouse I've ever been to, but it sadly wasn't.  This evening, I wanted to treat my gf out to a great dinner before hitting up Zumanity.    As usual, we ran a few minutes late, but 10 minutes isn't anything to fuss over at 99.9% of restaurants.  However, it took them over THIRTY minutes to seat us.  Umm...with a show we don't want to be late for, that's some crumby management of tables.  For the most part, the service was top notch and the sommelier was great.  For dinner we ordered the chateaubriand, the foir gras torchon, an iceberg salad, spinach and mushroom sides, and a great Bordeaux wine.  The food was, for the most part, SUPERB.  Even the sides were as decadent as the main entree.  I just wish we had had more time.  The meat in the chateaubriand was juicy, tender, and everything one could hope for as far as red meat goes.  The foie gras torchon was excellent, just a little rich for my palate.  I've had foie gras every way you could have it and honestly, I prefer pan seared.  In the end, we had a rushed dinner because of being seated late, getting the check took forever because of some "system problem", and we ended up being late to Zumanity!  GRRRR!  It ended up being okay though, because when we got there, one of the "actors" gave us shit about being late, but after we explained what happened, he hooked us up with front row/couch seats!  Thanks, SW for the Cirque upgrade, I guess...

nS81U_XNEKYoxE-o1wEFGw.text: I held a private dinner party in the back room and it was amazing. The special menu we selected ahead of time was on point .....I'm dreaming about that filet now. We were able to add some great special touches to the dinner that my guest really enjoyed.The restaurant prepared gluten free alternatives for the items I couldn't have which I appreciated.The entire staff from hostesses, waiters, sommelier, executive chef and manager where friendly and didn't have that pretentious attitude you often find at expensive restaurants.   If you are planning to have dinner here, I'd recommend making reservations a few days in advance as they book up fast and may have you waiting well over an hour to be seated.

fRTmKyKNv3SKq62_ONPNJA.text: First off, this place is expensive. Know that going in. But you get what you pay for... I ordered the king crab pasta... blew my mind. Yes I know its a steakhouse but this was pretty amazing... never had anything like it. The waiters were extremely nice and helpful when talking about the dishes and helping us decide on how/what to order. Overall: Positive: Amazing food, AMAZING steak (had some of my friend's), very good deserts and a great staff. Negative: Expensive, and be warned - There are 2 Wagyu beef specials that we saw... one for $22 one for $150... we ordered just the Wagyu beef. Guess which one they assumed?? Dont get me wrong... it was amazing, but just mind what you order!

tYYGc3-uGu-IOtNM9PgAYw.text: Best experience and steak of my life! I visited a few days ago with my Mom and had the pleasure of sitting in Phillip and Corey's section not once, but twice. We had a beautiful table on the terrace that we had.  requested, and exceptional service and suggestions. My mom likes her filet well done (sinful, I know) but they were able to cook it through without butter flying and she said it was the best steak of her life (and that means something coming from her!). All of the food was served sizzling hot and in an excellent manner. We had a show to see but wanted to return after dinner for dessert and to watch the Lake of Dreams. We returned around 10 pm and the hostess informed us that she couldn't seat on the terrace just for dessert and cocktails. But then our savior Corey walked by and welcomed us back warmly, and lo and behold we got an amazing table on the terrace to enjoy our cocktails and chocolate souffle! It was a perfect experience top to bottom and I will definitely recommend SW to others as well as return one day soon! Thanks Corey and Phillip!

HHVyEkDMu88isE78qd2Y4w.text: It just doesn't get better than this when it comes to prime steak. It's a classic.

QZmXhpyri44Lh3wupe6H7w.text: This is one of the best steaks I've ever had. I had the 20 oz rib eye and the meat was so juicy and just cooked right. As sides I had the cream corn and the au gratin potatoes and they were also really good.   For dessert I got the caramel cheesecake and it was so rich that I simply wasn't able to finish it.  Service here is also great our waiter was Chris and he did a great job. Definitely the best steakhouse in Vegas.   P. S. Make reservations as soon as possible if you plan on coming here.

GBsc4Sn68DGE6d5PnWg4gw.text: One of the best places I've eaten in a long time! We split the new york strip steak, roasted asparagus, mashed potatoes, then the funnel cake for dessert. Everything was so delicious and cooked perfectly! Service was excellent and if you can, get a seat outside cause it's a great view and they even do a show. Definitely coming back here next time we visit!

uNSNEEo6uODYWSDk-EA_PA.text: SW Steakhouse is the epitome of a 5 star steakhouse.   Situated in the Wynn Hotel & Casino, SW is one of the premier steakhouses in Las Vegas.  The ambiance here is just perfect as it is able to handle large groups with ease and cater to the romantic date nights.  Outdoor seating overlooks the waterfall and when the sunsets, the background is illuminated with multicolored pine trees that fade in and out with different hues every few minutes.   It's absolutely gorgeous.   The service here is impeccable.  We had a table for 8 and when a friend arrived last minute they instantly moved us to a table of 10 during a busy Saturday night.   Now lets talk about the food.   For starters, I ordered the Foie Gras Torchon.  This dish is absolutely perfect as the bourbon macerated cherries complements the foie gras to give it the right balance.  Amazing.   I ordered the Bone In New York, medium rare and it came out perfect.   I did ask for the Trio of Sauces (Bearnaise, Jalapeno Tropical Fruit, SW Original) and trust me you do not need them.   The True stand out is the side dishes.     Here's the overall ratings:  Foie Gras Torchon: 6/5 - thats right 6 out of 5! Truffled cream corn: 5/5 - you have to order this Parmesan Creamed Spinach: 4/5  Au Gratin Potatoes: 4/5 Bone in New York (Medium Rare): 5/5 Roasted Sonoma Foie Gras; 5/5 Service: 5/5 Ambiance: 5/5 Price: $$$$!

aO-_WgtnoFYiDmVJYdqmmQ.text: Very dissapointed in my visit to SW Steakhouse.  I made reservations 2 months ago for our anniversary and requested outdoor seating.  When we got to the restaurant they told me that wasn't on the reservation and tried to sit us inside in the corner.  My husband requested outside and they told us it would be a 1 hour wait.  We ended up waiting 30 minutes and they still ended up seating us inside.  Our service was awful.  We weren't drinking because I'm pregnant and my husband is training for a triathlon and I think the waiter was bugged that our bill wouldn't be as much.   After we finished our appetizer which was the lemon marinated shrimp we waited way too long for our entree.  Our waiter came by and filled up our drinks and didn't say a thing about our food so my husband asked is our entrees almost ready?  Then he said I will go check on it.   Our waiter was AWFUL and our food was ok.  During our dinner they sat a table of 15-20 next to us and we couldn't hear ourselves talk.  So much for a romantic anniversary dinner.  I will never go back to SW and I don't reccommend it to anyone.  There are much better steakhouses to eat at in Vegas.

xRT5GnEIZiR9WeROGi4XiQ.text: When I first decided to go here I figured it would just be an over priced, average steak. I was wrong. This was one of the best steaks I have ever had. I had the bone in rib-eye. It was perfectly seared so it had a nice crisp outside with a smooth, tender center. Perfectly cooked.  I also had the shrimp cocktail which only consisted of 3 shrimp, but they were huge.  For sides we had the creamed corn, potatoes au gratin, and the fries. All were very good. I don't really think its possible to have desert unless you are planing on it the whole time since the first few courses are likely to fill you up.  Overall, it was a great meal and as long as I can afford it, I would probably go again.

p1hjVLC6ZW2VBjZWNnS_Lg.text: Decoration: excellenta n very nice...which i would expect at a steak house like this one.  Food: RIb eye was cooked to the perfection but Mne was the short rib slowed cooked dish and it was SALTY, too salty which i would expect someone to try the food before servicng at a restaurtant like this when I am paying over $50 per person on main course....  Service: Generally Nice, but cocky at the same time

LP1PXhiSbQhrx94RS4nx6g.text: Rude staff and mediocre food!!!! We had made reservations from long ago to celebrate my birthday. When we get there right on time, hostess makes us wait over an hour and says that our reservation was actually for a later time. She was not apologetic at all and acted like she was doing me a favor allowing me to eat and pay the outrageous prices. Finally, we were sat at a table in the corner of the restaurant completely separated from the main dining room. We could not see the other patrons or the water show as it was blocked by pillars and silly plants that covered out view. It took half an hour for the waitress to come to take out order and another half hour to bring our drinks. By the time  the food came, we were already exhausted from waiting and had to eat cold undercooked meat. We asked for a hot plate, so we could at least make sure the food didn't get colder but never received that either. At the end when the bill comes, we were charged for drinks that we never ordered. And again the staff could care less to accommodate us. We love the Wynn hotel, but this was a below standard, that we will never home back!!!!! Mr. Wynn, time to start checking in on your restaurant and staff. Disappointing.

sGv0NeidWc9MTM1PFDOKNg.text: Great steaks and a great view. Had a very good table to see the show. The casino host set up the dinner and it did not disappoint. Steaks are very compare-able to craft in my opinion. But the service was more efficient here. Oh yeah ladies make sure you cover up a little cause I wore a sexy ass dress and got way too many stares. Its Vegas for gods sake

z8w16TMvSmXWZyn1Ll_hfA.text: BEST FILET MIGNON EVER, I tried it with cheese on top, delicious. Very good service, but very expensive restaurant. Anyways, its worth it!! Try to seat outside looking at Wynn Fountain

WgYx6B4ijXMBixx3O2bWOg.text: imppeccable service.  fantastic view of the wynn waterfall while you are dining.  superior food.  if you like steak, I would recommend this spot

sVls6gPKEKVaoGHGuox4NA.text: Best steaks and atmospere in town!!! We will choose Sw anytime.Great for parties, special occasions and just to eat!!

Fze8LYVe4F6fDUAcB2bPgg.text: I had dinner here with some girlfriends a few weeks ago and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!  The food was great and the service was excellent.  This is definitely a see and be seen kind of place!

3A5Lkon4sGGcG0FPT2x5Gw.text: I'm sorry I forgot to review the biggest fanciest steakhouse I went to in Las Vegas. This is SW steakhouse. As you can tell by the other reviews it has a ton of good options for a meat eater. In fact if you enjoy steak there is nothing you can do wrong here. The only thing might be not eating steak..... and that just makes you stupid. SW steakhouse is one of the most delightful restaurants I have ever had the pleasure to attend. The food is phenomenal, from start to finish. The steaks are obviously well prepared with a nice char on the outside and a melt in your mouth center. The NY strip was particularly delightful.  If your confused the staff works in teams and can easily point you to what your looking for with just a few simple questions.  I can't say much bad about this place other than  BEER. Where are your craft beers... It in truth, this is not their fault cause almost in all of Vegas, craft beer is missing. Well anyway this review is too be shuffled with the rest so if you'd like the abridged version.....  TLDR:   BE SURE TO TRY SW Steakhouse! If you don't you have made an error.

yTYG5UqUhyWoCyCq_cYyPA.text: $60 for a Filet Mignon and I didn't even feel like I got ripped off!  Our total bill $342 (not including tax) for only 3 people and the only question on anybody's mind was, "When are we coming back?"  Was it the best steak I've ever had?  It's close.  Definitely top 2.  But with the overall ambiance and the amazing appetizers, incredible side dishes, and the superb desserts...the whole experience makes it the best steakhouse I've been to...did I mention the stiff drinks!

Z0MWAsZCc3MUcqjcD1jxjg.text: Was here last Saturday night.  Came exactly at our reservation time of 9:30 and seeing how the place was packed I expected to wait awhile for our table only to be happily surprised to get seated almost immediately.  The outside was closed due to weather so they really had the tables close together but it worked out anyway as we were given a great table.  Mike our waiter was friendly, timely and attentive at all times we couldn't have asked for better. On to my steak...New York Strip, If not the best I've ever had it tied all the best I've ever had.  One word can't describe how much I enjoyed this steak, bite by bite. All in all a great dinner and I highly recommend this place.

db_VLvIRhQ2zonfQUMwc3g.text: Went to SW Steakhouse last night. Sat right next to water. Lovely scenery, but I personally thought the "show"on the lake was a little underwhelming. I would rather have just listened to some nice soft/classical music, myself. The service was good...especially from the host who took GREAT care of us despite our late arrival time. The food was just OK for me. Husband had chili-rubbed ribeye & I had the butter poached lobsters. For sides: potatoes au gratin, creamed corn & sauteed mushrooms.  We also shared the crab cake appetizer. Everything was just "pretty good". Nothing "WOW"'d me...and I REALLY wanted it to. I think, honestly, it's because we went to Wolfgang Puck's CUT Las Vegas a while back. It's a little more expensive but so wonderful...especially if you're celebrating a special occasion.  Spend a little more & go to CUT.... You'll thank me later!  ...And NO, Wolfgang Puck didn't pay me for this review, lol. I'm just being completely honest!!

VFyCLOQO-j3Wzp4IJwZrkQ.text: Don't bother. This steak house wanna be in the Wynn Hotel falls way way short. My bone in ribeye cooked medium was tough and chewy. Was cooked properly but I suspect the marbling wasn't there. Stick to Prime or DelMonico's if you want good ribeye. We also had the potato puree which was way too "watery". The creamed spinach was short on butter. The creamed corn was also watery but tasty.  Potatoes au gratin was OK, and my snow crab soup had a nice flavor but the crab was over cooked.  Nothing on the desert menu moved me enough to order any. That said, the ambience was fun, sit outside and watch the "water show", that was the best part of the meal. But if you want steak, there are better steak houses, so move on.

PcdB18v93kmGeqd5ckQozQ.text: Heads Up - if you want to eat here, you better make a reservation. My significant other and I wandered in here in hopes of having dinner. They were fully booked for the night before to leave there were two seats at the bar, where there is full service. Otherwise we wouldn't have been able to eat here. Keep in mind this entire review is for the service at the bar.  First Impressions - the ambience for this restaurant is absolutely incredible. They have a huge waterfall nestled in a beautiful frame of trees and lights. This is a fantastic place for a romantic date.  The Spread - because we were going out later we split a ribeye and two sides, the creamed spinach and the macaroni and cheese. The steak was absolute heaven, one of the best I've ever had. I would eat here again in a heartbeat just to have more of that steak.  The Service - again, we dined at the bar. The bartender had a great sense of humor, was attentive, and made some great conversation with us. I see a lot of reviews that was disappointed in the service they received, but that was not our experience.  Overall - I would love to come here again with the reservation and sit in a proper table for the full dining experience. But we had a fantastic time and the food was amazing. I hope to be back soon.

VcFS8S0mr6qHRHtkYQU3cw.text: Perhaps my expectations are too high but when you average $100 per person at a steakhouse, you should feel impressed when you leave.  This was not the case.  The best and most unique part of the meal was the breadbasket.  SW must stand for such a waste because that's how I felt after I paid the bill.  Nothing to write home about.

4hULPvm7m2ZJ0p7AYrAmEw.text: SW is probably my favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas. Everything is beautiful about it (atmosphere/service) and the food is on point. I wish I could elaborate a lot more on what I ordered but it was just a barrage of goodness.  I believe I ordered this: Chile Rubbed Double Rib Eye (for two) While this was amazing, I sort of wish I got something more purist like a simple porterhouse or any bone-in cut without fancy spices. Whatever you end up ordering, it'll probably be amazing.  If you're serious about having a great dining experience here, be sure to make a reservation and dress correct. One time I tried to do a walk-in and I was wearing shorts and they weren't having it. You could probably do a walk-in and wait for a table but make sure you're dressed appropriately. If you're trying to get some that night, get a reservation at a table that directly views the artificial waterfall outside.  SW is the truth.

lNd5PDgiN05EHLjxdW0SOQ.text: I left a negative review and saw a reply from management asking to comtact them. So I Contacted this establishment and have heard nothing back. Shows the lack of concern for customer service and quality.  Just Terribble.

YaNv_U4l20_Gze-856_i_Q.text: This place is very pricy!  But worth it if you want to have a memorable dining experience.  From the moment you walk in you'll notice an attention to detail absent from most restaurant establishments.  Service is A plus.  For starters the bread is outstanding.  Appetizers consisted of a kale salad which quite frankly may have been the best salad I ever had.  The boneless ribeye was excellent and the sides to die for.  My only complaint (and it's not really a complaint but rather an observation) is the Steaks are a bit large.  My right steak was 18 oz.  a friend of mine ordered the 42 oz porterhouse and yes, he finished it all.  Later he was in a "food coma" but that's another story.  Overall excellent and memorable dining experience.

r6ZiMVKxSEUD1acDaQaVbg.text: We are again at SW Steakhouse. This restaurant has become our go-to place for each trip to Vegas. We had the same server again,Alan. He is amazing and is very knowledgeable regarding the menu. I am vegan and my husband is omnivore. We both get to eat amazing food. We both left stuffed. The lake show takes place on the hour and :30.   Highly recommend!

ZomXv8FdNr_KD5b82kkUjA.text: My wife and I came here for the last night of this year Vegas trip! It was truly a memorable experience. My wife and I don't eat a ton so we usually split everything we order at a steakhouse to minimize leftovers and cost. This was no exception. However, it was one of the best meals either of us have had in a long time.   I started with a glass of Pinot Noir and my wife wasn't in a drinking mood (Vegas did it to her). We spooitna kale salad, 12oz filet, potatoes au gratin, and brussel sprouts. We had the best time sitting by the water and the staff was great! Highly recommend this restaurant if you're anywhere close to the Wynn!

j6Aw6zQcJZkzFhUSOIOFRg.text: I would recommend this restaurant. The service and food was very good. Next time, sit by the beautiful waterfall.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect Ribeye steak

aFS6rrEQNTv7rqACGqh98g.text: Food was great, but, am giving this 3 stars because of poor service. Our server was inattentive and seemed distracted.  He checked on us as soon as our food was served, not giving us a chance to even taste our food, we didn't see him again until it was time for him to push desserts, which we declined due to his attitude.   We expected better service from a restaurant of this calibre ...very disappointing.

D8um4MU24zLO0DnKjWffvw.text: What can I say about SW Steakhouse except that it's the whole package. Exceptional food, service and a magnificent and unique lagoon show. I had learned of SW from a fellow Yelpers review. I had made reservations weeks before and they only had a 9:45pm time slot available. The review mentioned the lagoon show started at 7:00pm so I thought I would surely have missed it. The evening could not have been more perfect. We sat outside lagoon front. I couldn't have asked for a better seat if I would have requested it. The lagoon and waterfall was stunning and shows are played every half hour and each 2 minute show has a different theme. SW Steakhouse is not just about the spectacular ambiance and show, they also offer top of the line steaks. For appetizer we started with the octopus which was served with a harissa sauce and garbanzos. The octopus was tender and the harissa sauce added a spicy punch to the dish. For entrees we had the NewYork Strip and a Crab Pasta. Both dishes were superb and for the show stopper we had the Rocky Road Dessert. The dessert is a chocolate dome, once a chocolate sauce is poured on top of the dome it melts away to reveal the rocky road dessert. The great reveal exposes ice cream, cake, and marshmallows. All and all SW Steakhouse is a must when visiting Las Vegas.   This definitely will not be my last visit. Can't wait for my return.

HVwDGiYtERjoTybpNXjF7w.text: Very good steak. I had the 9 oz. filet $59.00.  I normally don't pay that much but it was a special occasion.  We ordered shrimp cocktail. There were 4 jumbo size shrimp. They were good but priced too high     There is not a lot of prep work with boiled shrimp.  The side of lobster was okay.  Rubbery to chew.  They do prep the shell for easy removal of lobster meat.  We had to return the side of carrots. They were too salty and over cooked. They promptly replaced them with some fresh asparagus which were much better.  Upon receiving the bill, they charged me for both the carrots and asparagus.  They promptly corrected the error by removing the side of carrots charge.  I found the place to be a bit pretentious.  I will go back to Ruth's Chris as my go to steak restaurant.

GNWHMfknn97EPGgm_SvMIQ.text: SW is one of our favorite restaurants to visit when in Vegas. My wife and I have had dinner at the SW several times and it has never disappointed us. Steak is by far my favorite to have and not to mention the shrimp cocktail and oysters. Service is always great! They will go over and beyond to give you exceptional service.

7P4cC41_ZkocvrZX5hWf0g.text: Amazing honeymoon dinner and exceptional service! I would recommend the scallops!

1BxNAVz5J2wzcTSUU1QRtQ.text: Came with a party of six for one of our best friend's bach weekend. The bread butter provided to the table was phenomenal (especially the pretzel bread - I've had nothing like it before).  For the table we ordered the following: black truffle cream corn, cheesy mashed potatoes, sauteed wild mushroom, au grautin potatoes, along with the porterhouse steak and kosher steak. My personal favorites were the black truffle cream corn and wild mushroom. I was not too much of a fan of the steak choices. Also, I drinks have too much alcohol ratio. Nevertheless, exceptional service was provided, nothing short of a five star restaurant.

XxnbeIscyPu9lYP2qXPyHw.text: My favorite steakhouse in the world. I've been dining here for over 10 years, since they opened in 2005. Chef David Walzog is a culinary genius. Desserts are great too!

43oIGjXO2Kddqwmu75n0Iw.text: The food and services where right on. You have to try the Mac and cheese there, it was perfection.  I would definitely come again.

IhKCYv1WK4CAlDpjwhV0qg.text: Came out on a recommendation from a friend  that knows a chef here.  Came in for our late night reservation and was seated in the patio in front of the waterfall (Best seat in the house ). The place has very nice decor and on the higher end side of your steakhouses.    We ended up ordering bone in steak and lobster for dinner,  and was comped out kobe beef appetizer and an amazing desert complimentary from the chef.    The meat was cooked to perfection and every bite had an amazing taste that didn't  require any added flavors, as for the lobster it was amazing in flavor and couldnt have asked for more.   Another added bonus to the amazing  dinner was the shows they put on every 30 min that keep you entertained and very unique.    Reason for the 4 star and not 5 was because our server was very bad at following  up on us during our meal, and we would have to flag down other waiters to get assistance.

_SxGWZ_c7RJe0ci6Gjsr-g.text: I've been looking for a steakhouse that rivals Mastros and finally found it.   SW steakhouse is LEGIT. They have really good (really rich) food and their wine selection is great. I had a filet which was cooked perfectly. Our sides of Mac and cheese and creamed spinach were the die for.   Also had the shrimp cocktail appetizer which was ok, nothing special there. The bread tray is very very good. The better is already served on a warm plate with some kosher salt sprinkled on top. So good.   I can't wait to go back to this steakhouse the ambience is really nice and you are not stuck shouting over some guy at the piano bar like Mastros!!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My meal
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread

eV9f8OmPg_4P1RzQIRiS6w.text: SW Steakhouse is one of only three restaurants in the U.S. that offer certified authentic Kobe beef. That's why I selected this restaurant as my treat while in Vegas for my sister in law's wedding. To say I was excited to come here is an understatement. I specifically asked to reserve some Kobe. Expectations were at an all time high: could SW Steakhouse possibly deliver?  It's located inside the Wynn. They impressed me immediately. I arrived around 5:30 to gamble, so I had two hours to kill before my 7:30 reservation. Spur of the moment, I decided to head over to SW early, and as luck would have it, they were able to accommodate me. Sterling was very personable and asked me where I am from. Taylor brought me to my table and also chatted with me a bit. There is an aura about the customer service that you notice immediately when you are being serviced by a professional, courteous, and accomplished staff. Similar to other fine dining establishments (e.g. Mastro's), there is an unexplainable vibe that I feel when I dine here. I'm treated like a king; sometimes it almost makes me uncomfortable. I'm just a regular dude. I can see how some people would enjoy being pampered. I guess that's part of the appeal. When you're paying ridiculous prices, it comes with the territory. Multiple different porters filled my water glass constantly. My two servers always called me Mr. L. (my last name). This type of service really stands out, and I cannot compliment it enough. Since I began yelping, I rank the service at SW Steakhouse slightly above Mastro's and Houston's. It was purely exquisite, utterly professional, and wonderfully flattering.  Amy greeted me, and I went for the jugular right away (I asked about the Kobe). She wasn't sure if they had any. I explained that I came here specifically for the Kobe, and asked if they didn't have it, would another one of their restaurants (Mizumi)? She called upon my other server Mike to field my barrage of questions. At this point I was disappointed and panicking. I thought I was going to experience the mother of all wagyu, only to be let down and not even try it?  I think they were fearing that I would leave because I was not getting Kobe. I wasn't thinking of leaving, just trying to collect my thoughts after my hopes and dreams were shattered. Mike answered all of my questions in a polite and genuinely informative manner. He explained that their wagyu is from Steve Wynn's personal cattle in Japan. The marbling score is an 11 out of a possible 12, which is as high as any Kobe beef. (USDA Prime would fall between 5-8 on this scale.) He calmed my nerves and ultimately convinced me to try their A5 grade, marble score 11 wagyu. (Kobe is a specific type of wagyu.)  Exclusive outdoor seating showcases a waterfall show with all the colors of the rainbow.  This review marks the 2nd time I've hit the 5000 character limit (Gyu Kaku). So here's the rundown.  Bread basket - Bacon cheese muffins, pretzel, and classic bread. Great.  Complimentary butternut squash soup - Absolutely delicious. Beautiful flavor and perfectly hot temperature.  Hudson Valley foie gras - Now outlawed in California, a must-try. Superb. Rich, fatty, savory, luscious, magnificent.  Black truffle creamed corn - half order. Mealy, but tasty.  Sardinian Gnocchi: Burgundy truffle, Maine lobster, Parmesan cream - Delicious, creamy, rich, heavy, packed with flavor. Hearty and filling.  To my dismay, the truffles in the gnocchi and creamed corn were not impressive.  Mike asked what doneness I would like. I replied medium rare of course. He said the chef recommends medium in order to ensure that more of the beautifully marbled fat cooks down, melts, and infuses flavor into the meat.  A5 Grade, marble score 11, Ideue Farm, Kagoshima Prefecture Wagyu: 4 oz minimum, $176. $44 per additional oz. I was torn whether to get NY or ribeye when Mike told me I could do 2 oz each.  2 oz New York - Like eating butter. So flavorful and outstanding. Slightly less marbled than the ribeye. 2 oz ribeye - eye only, no cap. This was the single most marbled steak I've eaten in my entire life. Literallty melted in my mouth. Succulent, rich, gorgeous flavor. The best way I can describe it is I ate butter in the form of a steak.  Hawaiian volcanic black salt was available on my plate, along with veggies.  I need to win the lottery so I can eat like this all the time. It must be nice to be rich.  Did the Wagyu deliver? Aside from the initial shock and disappointment of not getting Kobe, the answer is yes. This was the most marbled steak I have ever consumed in my entire life. I highly enjoyed it; it was sensational, breathtaking, and scrumptious.  Would I come back? Absolutely.  The damage was $300 after tax and tip. Afterwards, I hit the casino floor in an attempt to recover some of the money I just spent. This is usually a bad idea, as it typically results in losing even more money. Read my Wynn review to find out what happened!
