qm5SiGs1eeCBce6g47S21A.text: We went on weekday.  You can sit in the dining room or outside overlooking the lagoon.  Service was efficient, but not rushed.  The steaks were very good and compares favorably to other Las Vegas steakhouses.  The wine list is extensive.  We would return.

e7v4NnJrTS-gKyGI1MPRIA.text: On par with the best in my book (Del Frisco's and BLT).  The ribeye was obviously cooked at some unimaginably hot temperature.  Crisp and salty outside, juicy medium inside.  It was not one of the hand massaged Beethoven listening cattle cuts, but this $56 bone in ribeye was good regardless.  However the most memorable item of the night was the creamed corn with truffle shavings.  I have thought about it everyday since our visit last week.  The scalloped potatoes were really good too.  I enjoyed the crab soup my wife did not.  It was a light tomato base soup I think, nothing creamy or overly filling.  The tomatoes on the wedge, or whatever they call it there, were quite an assortment of shape, color, and taste.  Service and decor were flawless, just like we witnessed throughout the entire hotel.  Its amazing how they bring elegance and intimacy to the middle of Vegas.  Definitely recommend this place.

Sbr3e1oJGseC9QBuMOj4eA.text: Great great steakhouse at the wynn - my favorite in Vegas. a buddy of mine had a great laid back several course dinner here prior to going out on a saturday night. The service was stellar and not snooty at all which you can sometimes expect from places like this. The 3 dipping sauces for my filet were worthy of an equal division of attention and the table to the rights ordering of a $700 glass of scotch wad a nice touch.

h1mYHKfd3YZHh7FTbO-N3A.text: Best steakhouse in Las Vegas. Very nice spot to sit on the lake of dreams and have a great meal. Service is alway very good. A must if traveling to The Wynn or to Las Vegas

9SG24S-PVZBD6B0Xn-CWoQ.text: Excellent steak and service. Not quite up to Cut but very good I think the quality of the meat at Cut is higher but this is a top notch steak house

9VmlK8-H3TLrHk8YXsG4Qg.text: Excellent steak. Sit outside. You can see the (bizarre) shows they have, such as the one with the giant frog singing Garth Brooks tunes.

M05JOvVKeCif7To8gqrx4A.text: Wonderful food, wonderful service, wonderful decor.  Main criticisms:  1. Too loud. 2. Tables too close together.

dOfFQf2A22Lf_FdEpYi8rw.text: We were staying at Encore again so decided to try SW for the first time.  On previous trips, we tried Cut, Craftsteak, Delmonico and Prime.  The front of the house was very nice to accomadate our request to sit outside.  I thought the steaks and sides were much better at the others.  The "show" that occurs every 30 minutes is really nothing and kind of annoying.  Didn't regret trying it, but for the price I think you can do better.

pVnzmZQUlKFMZOqNvbyp5Q.text: The best thing at the Wynn/Encore!  The host and wait staff was excellent. The food was amazing and ambiance was breath taking.  We were late for our 5:30pm reservation and had show tickets at 7pm.  They gave us excellent service, food came quickly and never had an empty drink.  Oh yeah their cheddar/bacon biscuits are to die for!!!!

HyoADGC19tf7zXa-PgHz-A.text: This past Friday night a friend and I had dinner at SW. We sat at the bar and they do offer a full menu at the bar. I ordered the steakhouse chopped salad which was very good, and in addition to the salad, I ordered the grilled shrimp. I had to send it back twice. Once because it was cold, the second time because it was raw. Receiving raw, uncooked shrimp is not what you would expect from this type of steakhouse.

1tCp8g2gpg9MtehHA8YCzQ.text: went friday night with a group of ten guys...excellent service and great experience (second time i've been here). everything was cooked perfectly. steaks rund $40 and up and sides are $10-20.  -creamed corn - best side dish..finely cut up corn mashed in with some kind of heavy cream. extremly creamy and great starter  -cream spiniach - solid creamed spinach but not anything that stands out  -bacon bread muffin (comes complimentary) - so delicious but watch out cause you don't wana fill up eating on this before you bite into your steak  -giant porterhouse for two - cut and placed in a giant sizzling platter with onions and carrots. the filet and strip portions were cooked perfectly and meat was extremely juicy. no sauce necessary  -bone in ribeye - extremely juicy and good ti'll the last bite.   -funnel cake tower - awesome funnel cakes..very light and nicely fried with three options to dip your sauce into.   excellent view of the man made waterfall and woody scenery. great service and all our meats were cooked to order.

MevpKNs6om6T2BrS8RAcHg.text: Food excellent. View is fantastik you have the waterfall. Service great.well worth going

Ar1wdaUKNQ_4jYou_O-xmQ.text: VERY good... VERY expensive, but VERY GOOD! The room is amazing and so too is the food. The service too is spot on. The only ding they get is that creepy show on the lake. Not only is the show very strange, but when you sit out there the temperature on the patio is not pleasant. I've been there MANY times and will continue to go there.

rGLGaaQ5NsnTuElvf86d1A.text: Absolutely the best steak I've ever had.  I felt like I was making out with it as I ate it.  Best Caesar salad too!  The light/frog-thingy show on the water wall was fun too.  Definitely recommend SW.

lpXmoEI9h13E3gqReTlA_w.text: My girlfriends took me here for a nicer dinner during my Bachelorette Party.  The steak was unbelievably delicious.  I wasn't expecting much as I'm used to Mastro, The Cut, etc.  But I was pretty much blown away by how tender the steak was. I got the filet while a couple of my girlfriends shared the rib eye.  No complaints from anyone at the table. The only reason why I give it 1 less of a star is because the sides are not as great.  The portions are small as well. We got the au gratin potatoes, cream of spinach, and the mushroom.  Out of the 3, I would have to say the au gratin potatoes wins the sides sections. Definitely a place to try out if you have the $$$ to afford a MINIMUM of $54 (filet only) + tax + tip.

j_MKalTo-wpbyd_LbJGYYw.text: The food and service was awesome.  We had the Wedge salad, very fresh and yummy. I had the scallops, which were absolutely wonderful.  My husband had the rib eye steak, which was also good.  The creamed of corn was excellant.  The waiters and water person, were very attentive to all our needs and extremely friendly.

nX_uivVVgTO7Te9xanyuPg.text: I'm not big on steaks - but this one do serve very good, tasty ones! We were staying at the Wynn (on comp of course!) last 12/2-12/5 and decided to try this one out one night.  Decor was subdued but when you walk in, you know there's a theatrical feel to it --after all, the dining room walls and ceiling folds and lights changes every half hour! Hence, the name Switch Steakhouse (wink!). Service was up to par - since I did not write this review right when we came back -forgive me but I totally forgot what we had for appetizers-but I do remember we had no complaints! I do remember what the main meal was- filet mignon bone-in! with side dishes of wild mushrooms, veggies. Let me tell you that the meat was truly like butter! We also shared lobster tails - two medium size ones. Those were delicious also and cooked just right. Needless to say, no desserts for us! too full and happy---and yes, we did ok in Vegas--I actually did not even spend all my 'gambling allowance' but with $200 left over--hubby was ahead by about $300...so overall, a good trip over there. By the way, Wynn is beautiful and the room we had was really nice and large--service was very good.

F_AMBiZC3cTyTGF7EpZLVA.text: We didn't receive the experience we were hoping for at SW Steakhouse.  We had been wanting to visit for several years and finally decided to make it happen during this past visit to Vegas.    We arrived at our appointed time and the people at the hostess desk were less than friendly.    It took them a while to acknowledge us and seat us.   Once we were seated someone did come by promptly to take our drink orders.   He didn't identify himself so we assumed he was the person who would be waiting on us.   After our drinks and bread were delivered someone else came by and asked us if we knew what we wanted to order.   I asked him if he was our server since we thought the other gentleman was waiting on us and his reply was "as long as someone waits on you."    He was very abrupt.  Never asked us if we had any questions on the menu and never explained anything.  Very disappointing.  Our orders consisted of:  special heirloom tomato salad, 1 1/2 pound king crab leg special, bone in New York strip, truffled creamed corn, onion rings and two glasses of wine.   The crab legs were broiled and didn't have much flavor.   The steak was wonderful along with the creamed corn.   We did not order dessert.   I would not go back to SW due to the poor service.   The decor is not that spectacular for the prices they charge.  I really wanted to like this place but not to be.  I gave it three stars since the steak was excellent and this is what they are known for.

N74SRfDpWRnVSBPsIGC_Xw.text: Where do I even begin? EVERYTHING was great! The FRESHEST SEAFOOD EVER!!!! Awesome service as well. Everything ordered just melted in my mouth. After eating here, no other place can compare, it just wasnt the same. The atmosphere is perfect not only perfect for date night but also large groups as well. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

YsKMseaIQtC1tIQ5F76IwQ.text: Steve Wynn wins me over every time with his customer service.  This restaurant, had the best servers and wait staff I have ever encountered.  If you can arrange seating outside during sunset so you can watch the Lake of Dreams, then I would recommend it.  However, a huge warning, if you have a hard time being around cigarette smoke then sitting outside might not be the best idea.  Unfortunately, there is an outside bar right next to the restaurant which allows cigar smoking and the fumes waft over right into your table.  It was so bad, that we had to ask to be moved inside (yeah, were from California, so we got spoiled with the no-smoking laws).  However, the staff were so kind and accommodating that they immediately found us a table inside.  And what was very pleasing was the fact that even inside we still were able to see the Lake of Dreams show.  The quality of the food was marvelous and the filet was so tender I could literally cut it with my fork.  Enjoy

mmKBAL4dNTgpAc7jTG0hLA.text: Food is always amazing. Great steak and amazing staff. If you're stuck on what to get ask the waiters they know it all and will guide you. Drinks are amazing too I recommend having one of their wines with the steaks

nphNZkqDXWoUDW5E_Z7Cng.text: We were excited to get out of town and looked forward to also have an amazing dinner, we decided on SW since we are staying at the Wynn, in the past we've always gone to Wolfgang's restaurant, Cut, just a quick walk next door, but we wanted to try a new place, I'm so sad to say we wasted a trip to Vegas for such a disappointment, my husband ordered the ribeye bone in, we were both in shock at how aweful it was, it tasted like water, I don't even know a better way to describe it, iit' like it was frozen, thawed out and quickly cooked, it was so bad, after they offered to replace, my husband had already lost his appetite and chose to just eat the sides we ordered, we also ordered the truffle creamed corn, it was great, but anything you put truffle salt on tastes wonderful, we also ordered the green beans, taste like something I could haha made at home, same with the potatoes....I'm just confused by the reviews we readt saying the food was so greatr, the service started great, until we said we weren't happy, then they just stopped serving us, rushed to clean our table and have us leave.. I hope this was just an off night, but sadly we won't be back to SW...I forgot to mention I ordered the scallops, they were good but nothing to get excited about...

QhKLxxaVuyIfyvY4bMqZfQ.text: Part 2: Moving next to entrees and sides, the Wagyu passed over in favor of SW's signature Rib-Eye, a Dry Aged Bone-In Strip and the newly added Fish n' Chips, those unafraid of spice and bored with the typical Steakhouse cuts would be well advised to invest $125 in the 42oz Chile-Rubbed Steak with two Ribs and lots of Peppers and Onions, the flavors all playing well off juicy flesh still sizzling in its pan and every bite far more interesting than the $72 Bone-In that lacks in flavor compared to that at Carnevino, Jean-Georges or the recently opened MB|Steak at Hard Rock where the exact same 18oz portion can be had with better texture and richness for $14 less.   Underwhelmed by the Fish n' Chips, a smallish-filet of Halibut that is baked beneath a crust of Malt-Vinegar Potatoes and served alongside overcooked Hashbrown Sticks on a bed of Lemon Beurre Blanc, SW Steakhouse makes up for a lack of creativity in its sides by way of quality and luxury ingredients, the Potato Rosti on a pedestal with Chive Cream a showstopper by any definition while Creamed Corn is still thick enough to have a tooth, though probably a bit more impressive during Black Truffle season.  Not a fan of Walzog's Brussels Sprouts, the Crucifers coming across like soggy slaw rather than the crispy orbs served elsewhere, sides were completed by a late-arriving daily special of Semolina Gnocchi with chunks of Lobster and a few flakes of Summer Truffle in Parmesan Cream, the mixture expectedly rich though quite delicious and thankfully portioned large enough to go around considering the cost of $24.  Cleansing the palate with a double Espresso, its arrival nearly fifteen minutes before Dessert not exactly ideal but better than long after, it was with mild curiosity that the description of a $100 Louis XIII 23-Karat Gold Bar Dessert was read twice, the decision to place a premium on variety eventually seeing Pastry Chef Svetlana Almonte send forth a quartet of sweets tallying $54, the Coconut Tapioca fairly harmless with the Passion Fruit easily scooped aside while both the Bread Pudding and Peaches and Cream were elegantly presented with fresh Fruit, great textures and restrained sweetness, the $22 Funnel Cake and Strawberries largely served for show with the fried Dough hung from metal Branches above a trio of luxurious Sauces.  ***Arguably the most expensive house of grilled Meats in Las Vegas, a fairly inauspicious title considering the competition, SW Steakhouse is a perfectly acceptable choice for those looking to enjoy a Steak and quality sides, but in the era of every Casino having its own signature spin on the genre there is nothing here all that compelling save for lakeside setting and even that seems a little contrived when compared to the dining rooms at Costa di Mare or Mizumi.

mMQDeYJj4610ERHPQ8ZYWA.text: Amazing experience with a beautiful view. It was my wife's birthday and the service was fantastic. We all ordered off the vegetarian menu (Yes! They have a separate vegetarian menu!) and the food was delicious. The decor is also beautiful which only added to the experience.

oIpxKjVdl2_sX7Eg4GCqtQ.text: This is definitely the best steakhouse I've ever been to in my life. Compared to Gordon Ramsay, Mastros. Harris Ranch, and Cut, and a bunch of little random ones worldwide, this steakhouse is above all of them. I got the porterhouse and the chili rubbed ribeye. Both were perfectly cooked - the ribeye melted whiled the porterhouse was extremely tender. Both were the best I've ever tasted  As for sides, we enjoyed the sauteed mushroom, truffle gnocchi, and truffle creamed corn. Hands down amazing.

32MzkErcr-4YMmiHc9--Bg.text: This is in my opinion the absolute best steak house in town. Having lived here in Vegas my whole Life id say I've tried pretty much every steakhouse out here through out the years and this is my favorite. The service is great the atmosphere is great you really can't go wrong here. And an added bonus the location is beautiful with a "show" every 30 minutes on the lake.

XevPA83OTzA6B8FJGN2Nog.text: We were totally blown away by SW on our visit to Vegas. The service, food, pace and atmosphere were on point. I was actually a little surprised, because last time we were here, the service was really rude and arrogant. We were so blown away by the experience this time, my doubts about SW have disappeared!   Our server, Anthony, was on the ball the entire meal. This really made the experience. He was around enough, but not too much. Friendly, but not too friendly.   To start, me and my brother shared the Caesar salad and my mom and dad shared the wedge salad. Both were perfect. The wedge salad had so much blue cheese, we were in blue cheese heaven. It paired nicely with the bread basket (which was also amazing).    I had the boneless rib eye, which was so so good. It was so juicy and perfectly cooked. Huge. But I had the table to help me finish it. We had it with the fries and hashbrown potato. The hashbrown (don't know if that's the official name), was made of shredded potatoes and looked like it was done in a skillet. Salty, crispy, amazing. The fries were also excellent. This was one of our favourite meals in Vegas.

7LhFo7vXd7LRMfe3Lsn-mQ.text: Next to Joe's....it's tough to decide which steakhouse is my favorite. Not just in Vegas, but any steakhouse.   I only ended up doing the steak, but can't wait to go back to do a full-on dinner with starters, yada yada. What I can say is that the NY strip is....I mean, dayum. Daaaayuuuummmmm. It was too damn good. Did fries on the side and also dayyyyuuummmmmm.   The steak, which was not waygu...was just so gooooood. Like, it came out perfectly cooked and basically cut like warm butter. Dat cross-section is what we all strive for, I tell ya whut. Dem fries were the perfect crispiness of precision. The best, around. No one is gonna take 'em down.   The bar staff is awesome. They don't take no shit and dish it right out. Cool dudes.   It has also come to my attention that smoking is allowed in the outside dining area...which is my mistake not doing that from the get-go...cause it's going to fulfill my dream of eating a stupid ass-delicious steak with some silly grape drank (wine) after a few scotches while smoking a cigar in public all while discussing the finer points of international trade markets primarily in emerging markets for while wearing a top-hat and saying 'quite' way too many times in an imperialistic accent.   Okay...maybe no top hat.

7tmZCVLLq-H52CJ56NBeUQ.text: One of the best stops in Las Vegas!  First and foremost, the atmosphere with the Lake of Dreams and "secluded" feel are bar none. The service is top notch and you will have several very attentive members of the waitstaff at your table regularly - all very helpful.  Secondly, the food was spectacular. I think the appetizer selection was somewhat understated, but will have to try more to provide a fair assessment. As for the entrees, both were amazing. The Alaskan King Crab Legs with Orange-Tarragon Butter were the best dish we have had in the entire city. This is a unique take on your traditional crab legs and whoever invented it deserves EVERY award. The Chile-Rubbed Ribeye was a ton of steak for any one person, but was quite flavorful with a little heat.  This is a MUST for any Las Vegas foodie experience, and trust me... get the Crab Legs!

udw-1G6-jPebplNsvIgv6A.text: WOW. just wow.  My boyfriend and I were both blown away. We are both foodies and were super excited to try SW. He is a steak guy and I live for sea food. I am also gluten free and I can say this restaurant went above and beyond on accommodating my allergy. They even had gluten free dinner rolls which were amazing. We had the tuna tatare appetizer and even though I was not crazy about the flavor it was still tasty. The scallops were really the high light of the meal. My boyfriend loved his filet but even said that he was amazed by how flavorful the scallops were. The black truffle sauce and risotto that sits underneath the scallops was heavenly and I honestly would have licked the plate if i was in my own house. We ended with a creme brulee desert and some espresso and that was very well prepared as well. Their wine list is also extensive we picked a featured bottle and enjoyed it. The ambiance of the restaurant is even above and beyond. We ate on the heated patio and really enjoyed the water show. I really cannot say enough good things about this place and as someone who has eaten at several fine dining establishments, SW really sets the bar high. Tempted to book a flight back to Vegas just to eat there again.

f-XTHMZWTdtOz5tWM3J4qg.text: Outstanding. One of the best steaks I've ever had. Worth the price. Service was excellent. But most importantly the service was smart. Great timing on food. Great execution everywhere. Eat here.   One suggestion for the crew there -- don't garnish the steak with those peppers, etc.  pointless. The steak speaks for itself. No need for a garnish.

KQye2SCtpuaqQG0sMt1YpA.text: Really awesome service and good food.  Was a little upset that my filet came out extremely well done and charred.  I asked for it well but specifically said not charred and a tiny pink would be preferred over very well.  The ly still brought it out charred and crispy, wasn't excited.  The people U was with all liked their steaks and the family style sides were good.

qAxPvcW26C3gDc1RzpkXbA.text: Very upscale traditional American steakhouse ... great selection of typical appetizers and cuts of beef.  Bone-in Ribeye was perfectly seasoned and prepared to medium-rare.  As expected, extensive wine selection ... had a Chateauneuf-du Pape to compliment the steaks and it was amazing.  Definitely worth a visit to the Encore.

cp7x3_nLugbLFneWcMwErQ.text: Perfect experience. Loved everything about this place- the service (from the friendly hosts to our waiter), the food, the ambiance, just amazing.  We made reservations a few hours before for 7:30 on a Tuesday and were seated shortly after arrival. The bread they brought to the table was the best pre-dinner bread I've had! It included two pieces of three types of bread, one of which was cheese bread, amazing! (We actually got a second order of the bread just to take home.)  Our waiter explained a few things on the menu and suggested we order 2-3 sides to share with our steaks. We both got the dry aged bone-in New York strip. I usually get my steak medium-well but boyfriend convinced me to get it medium to "not ruin it," fine fine... We settled on black truffle creamed corn and steak fries as the sides to share. The steaks were perfection, juicy and flavorful. The creamed corn was phenomenal and the fries were perfect (came with a side of bernaise sauce). Yum. We didn't finish all the food so requested to-go. They packed the food perfectly in separate containers for each item and included a separate container of butter and a set of utensils as well. So thoughtful! Loved this place and look forward to returning!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry-aged New York with Kobe butter

RK9FWZmOF_uLU-jtsWwQhg.text: This is a beautiful setting that you pay for in high prices . There was a wonderful visual show in man made water that was a visual delight . Drinks were outstanding as was service. Steaks were very good but not worth 65.00. Sides also good. Salads outstanding and presented great as we shared and there was enough for two. Overall this is a special place but it remains over priced. Worth going to once in a while. The show saved it

6-Yo_6crMZ9hEnRPku-Jmg.text: Great place to have awesome stake my cousins daughter Ani Ketcharian booked for us only 12 people not much. I am so proud of her she helped us with our reservation on the busy night. Love very much Ani you are very intelligent and beautiful. Thank you...

KdH75QF934794FlwMLkYkg.text: My #1 steakhouse pick in all of Vegas.   Everything from the drinks, appetizers, and steaks was to die for.   I've been to quite a few upscale steak places, but this one takes the cake. Rarely do I find these places to be worth the money since I make a pretty mean steak myself. This place and Herbs and Rye are the only two I am willing to vouch for.  Atmosphere and service were also great, but that is always expected at places of this caliber.

7jEqm-nDKeZYEYnB4X3rJA.text: My husband & I where celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and wanted to dine somewhere special.  Our concierge was able to get us a reservation. The ambience was beautiful on the patio overlooking the waterfall. The cocktails we ordered we made with care & actually strong, which was nice. The seafood tower was fresh & tasty. The creamed corn with truffle oil was incredible & a must side dish. But what really got me the write this was our servers, especially Tracy (I believe is her name)She really took her time to talk to us & really cared to hear what we shared. Made us feel very special  Thank you.

G4_uh6zcK-MemO5OQCcjHQ.text: I read the reviews and SW Steakhouse did not disappoint.  We were sat outside along the water and we got our first glimpse of the shows they put on every half hour.  Then came the bread!  You could make a meal just on the bread.  One of the offerings was a Cheddar Bacon roll which was incredible!  We started with a Caesar Salad, which a a little kick to it with good flavor.  I got the bone-in New York medium rare, and it came out seared on the outside which worried me, but was cooked perfectly and tasted great along with the Kobe Beef fat infused butter.  My wife had the Crab pasta which was rich and very flavorful and we shared the au gratin potatoes which were also good.  You can't go wrong because the service is also top notched!

F0mXdmo9O2_IZaaDqDWSdw.text: SW steakhouse has an amazing steak and Veal chop. The atmosphere was amazing and we had great service !!!!!! The only problem I had was all of the sides that involved pasta. The gnocchi was over cooked as was the macaroni. We changed it out two times and it was the same. I would have preferred to eat at Wolfgang Puck's Cut to be honest.

DXjSZYHq-M-Tn5_2jb88Ng.text: Terrible customer service, we walked in dressed casual and got treated as such. Don't judge a book by its cover. I can afford your shitty steak house on my worst day. If you want a better steak try CUT right across the street at palazzo. Better food and better service.

6zs1NERcbZRnOiGkJB5JwQ.text: My bone-in ribeye was good but for the price, there are better steak options in my opinion.  My steak was slightly overcooked for a medium-rare but it was still not too bad.  The complimentary bread basket was really good with a variety of different, freshly cooked breads.  The bread alone should give this place 5 stars but high-end steak restaurants all serve high quality bread so in comparison I'd prefer another steak restaurant.  They offer a lot of different sides which I've tried and cannot recommend a particular one that stood out.  Service was really good as one would expect but I cannot give this place 5 stars as a steak restaurant with so many other options out there.  5 stars for the bread 3 stars for the food

fRH6JdBWCCXIGSXQguHLqQ.text: Excellent customer service delicious food very beautiful view at the waterfall I highly recommend it to any one that is looking for an amazing restaurant to eat they make you feel very especially.

djxkxzdS-pl-53QWhidwvg.text: Superb service. Fantastic food and ambiance. Be sure to request a kosher steak when making your reservation.

2yVZOPpyjQazdnCBFLRn8w.text: This restaurant is amazing. Off the charts in every area. It is an Exceptional experience in all of the categories that I can think of. Food presentation it is a 10! Taste of food ...out of the ballpark 10+++ the comfort and beauty is outstanding. Servers and staff. So Great!  The details here are Fabulous!!  Visit here soon and enjoy one the most  lovely dining venues you will ever go to!  This restaurant is such a pleasure to review. Las Vegas has a True jewel in the SW.

Ucl0cz3rybUWVAx6crqMfQ.text: Brace yourself for my next statement. SW Steakhouse is the best vegan restaurant in Vegas. Crazy, right? Well, what isn't in Vegas? Since Steve Wynn's ethical evolution, all of his restaurants now have vegan menus. And when I say Vegan menus, I mean thoughtfully designed incredible vegan menus. SW Steakhouse is by far the best. We ordered two entrees each plus Steve's chopped salad (best vegan chopped salad in the world). Everything was fantastic. To all vegans visiting Vegas, if you can get past the name, you should definitely eat here. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steve Wynn&#39;s ethical maturation is upon us. And his chopped salad is appropriately amazing.

YMZUzkWqu_OWCDVhZxsKVg.text: As a local, I can say that the experience here is not up to par with the price.   In Las Vegas, it's about the food but also the CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE. The food is very good but, the service is inconsistent served with a side dish of arrogance!   There are many wonderful place to eat both on and off the strip.  Go somewhere that appreciates their clientele and leaves the attitude at home.

OzmVS0Y2Mi6h2UXE2MYO9A.text: Two important words: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTING! I didn't know until after dining here and going on Wynn's site once I got home, but SW managed to receive the AAA four diamond award four consecutive years starting from 2008. In one word, HOW?! My friends and I were in Vegas last weekend to celebrate our birthdays. After seeing SW on the Food Network's "The Best Thing I Ever Ate", my friend decided to have our dinner here since it was in walking distance because we were staying at the Encore. LOCATION: Wynn Hotel, across from Chanel, overlooking the Lake of Dreams. Tip: Request a table outside on the patio because there are frog and light shows during dinner (I just learned this while dining) FOOD: *Complimentary bread: Take a bacon cheese bread, spread the butter, sea salt, and olive oil brought to the table and enjoy! *Porterhouse for Two (40oz, $106) - Ugh, our meat was overcooked past a medium rare. Not knowing where SW was located, I called down to the front desk from our room and was told to try the Porterhouse because that's what SW was known for. My friend offered to split the dish with me and it was so disappointing. The steak lacked proper flavoring and probably all but one small piece (the very middle) was overcooked. I wasn't the only one complaining my meat was overcooked. Out of party of 7, only one was not overcooked. My friend ate nearly a third of his steak before we convinced him to send it back. SIDES: *Black Truffle Creamed Corn - Good and a must try! I loved the sweetness of the dish. *Parmesan Creamed Spinach - Ok, but I think the spinach could've been cooked more. Pieces were still a bit crunchy. *Fingerling Potatoes, Green Beans - The green beans and bacon were good, nothing memorable about this. *Mac & Cheese - Ok, you usually can't mess up mac and cheese. DESSERT: *Funnel Cake - Order it!! It was delicious. The presentation was beautiful with warm funnel cake pieces hanging on a tree branch setup. The funnel cake is meant to be dipped in one of the three accompanying sauces: vanilla, chocolate, or caramel. Sadly, dessert was the best part of my meal at a steakhouse. SERVICE: While our waitress did her typical duties of taking our order, she was MIA most of the time. She did not check up on us but found that if we wanted her attention, we had to wave our hands in the air. This happened NOT once, but twice. The second time, my friend said his steak was overcooked and she said she would take care of. She then looked at the rest of our table and asked if everyone else's was cooked to our liking with a snippy tone of voice. I did not appreciate her tone of voice nor her lacking in the customer service/waitressing department. The servers on the other hand were great and constantly kept our water glasses filled. AMBIANCE: Like I've said before, request a table on the patio. Every so often they have light shows on the patio water area. The frog show was odd, the colors were beautiful (yelp.com/user_local_phot...). The noise level wasn't loud and you were able to hear conversations.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio night show
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funnel cake dessert
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse for two

mxKxR43bvezUusjhe8jz1Q.text: We went to this restaurant based on reviews. We were told to book far in advance, which we did. I'm so glad we picked this restaurant. Some of the best food we've had in a long time. It's a bit pricey but well worth it.

IORFyoTBtdEzhDk26yqCRw.text: Make your reservation weeks in advance to guarantee a table. We sat outside this time because the weather was perfect. The chile rubbed ribeye was off the charts and you must, must, must try the black truffled creamed corn!!

QZtb7_pUIDHhMXm3f7stDQ.text: This place was amazing! The food, the atmosphere, and especially the service! I thoroughly enjoyed our server Tyler-such a pro! He spent the entire time making sure all of us were taken care of and enjoyed our dinner.  He really made the night so much better!! I can't wait to go back next time I'm in Vegas!

oSGbO5d32IC0D757gKxjJQ.text: As a group of six people, we all LOVED our dinner!!   Sat down, got wine service then a lag in returning service (we were there at 7:30 pm). Our order began close to 8:00 p.m. What tied me over and had me happy was the unexpected pretzel bread!  OMG!! SO GOOD!! I usually only eat a bite to taste or one piece. Once you smell and then taste the pretzel bread, you cave. We all did!! We had to ask for more!! (And I went back the next day just for the pretzel bread (via having a drink in the bar)!!   The entire meal was very good!! My entree was the all natural filet mignon cooked medium rare. It arrived as two 4 oz cuts which I loved as I got full on the pretzel bread and could only eat one of the filet mignon cuts. The next day I pulled the left over filet cut from the hotel room fridge and ate it cold. It was still just as amazing!!!!   Will certainly be back!! Tasting it as I type this review.  Thank you SW!!!  BTW: Would really love to know how to make the pretzel bread!! : )

9uw5uGtXC_IFksasSdXk1Q.text: This has to bee one of the best places I have ever ate at. I ordered the scallops and have to say they are the best thing I have ever ate in my life! The rest of the group that I was with agreed that their meals were perfect. Service was high quality and as was the food. I highly recommend this place. It was worth every penny!

SVGRJdE7zIwp81DGUnR1Jw.text: Service was fantastic down to every small detail. Patio is the place to sit if you can. Bread basket is the best I have tasted. Bone-in Ribeye with smoked blue cheese was amazing. Great wine list. This place can't be beat!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic service!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in Ribeye with smoked blue cheese
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waterfall

F1qO8S4hZ-C7Xov9PEvc7Q.text: Definitely try to get a seat by the fountain out on the patio. Let's put it this way, they have weird, funny, somewhat entertaining things going on while you eat. Call days in advance for a reservation!!  I LOVE their steak!!! So why the 4 stars? First, the service was not stellar. I think we just got a bad waiter during our last visit (the first time we went a year ago, we had amazing service). He didn't care to give us drink menus, and when we asked we got only one drink menu and not the wine list. He didn't care to give us bread until we asked. He rarely came by at all. We had other people come by pouring us water and things but honestly, I think we only saw him again when it came time to pay the bill. I totally expect more from an expensive steakhouse like this one.  Second, their side dishes are amazing....but their mac & cheese sucked. I can't believe I'm saying this, but it could be the worst mac & cheese I have ever eaten at a high end restaurant like this. Boo. And I love mac & cheese.  With that said, like I said, I LOVE their steak. I like it better than The Prime, Sinatra, STK and maybe even Craft (but I really did love Craft too).  Despite their mediocre service, which I think was a fluke, and their not-so-hot mac & cheese, I will DEFINITELY be back. Their steaks are that good.

WhjNYOGqWGl9XQaP0KShgA.text: Excellent steaks, sides and wine selection.  It was a great experience.  There was a slight mishap with my steak being overdone, but they quickly corrected and sent another out.  Great customer service and management.

EtSHSKPEmAMestC5zrsWgQ.text: There is a view of the large "Lake of Dreams" in the dinning area, a truly Vegas spectacle. It has a running track of different animations, songs, and lights to briefly look at during dinner.   Now this is a steakhouse. So before I mistakenly ordered fish, my server reminded me of this and I had the filet minot. Which was delicious and tender.   For sides we had the mashed potatoes and truffled gnocchi. Overall, great food and service.

45QYk28RA3OVAuUP96qxcg.text: As you would expect at a property like the Wynn, SW Steakhouse is top notch, particularly if you are sitting on the patio on a summer night well past sundown. The food is terrific even if classic steakhouse fare. The Oysters were FOB and a great way to start. Typical salad selection but I thought the chopped was the way to go. Wedge you can get anywhere and Caesar will never be outstanding when not made table side, which it is not. Have had the steaks here many times, which are first class so went with the lamb chops. Very tasty and perfectly cooked. Wine list is over priced but that is a consistent feature of every hotel restaurant, particularly in Las Vegas. Good selection though so while you will pay through the nose, at least you can get a really nice bottle.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On the patio enjoying the singing frog &#34;Oh Yeah&#34;.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W8aqW-_ga04Dx2BkreBVvw.text: My family and I came here as a special treat for my birthday. We all ordered steak, with mine being a Kobe wagyu. This was the best one, as you could imagine, but there was also a domestic wagyu as well as prime filets, which were quite yummy. The sides were asparagus and French fries which were all good. I chose the creme brule for desert and it didn't disappoint. As we were seated by the lake, we were able to enjoy a cool light show with some props about every 30 minutes, all this occurring after sunset, of course. All the servers were attentive and accommodating. If your budget allows, a visit here will be worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2yS0esMeZm40l-pow5Vjvw.text: Has been many steakhouses, we wanted something to be good adding our Vegas  trip. We finally picked SW steakhouse at Wynn because the buffet at Wynn is the best so we kindly gave in some credits to What Wynn offers. Yes, it is pricey but it is worth every penny. We ordered Pepper Crusted Chateaubriand with Black Truffle Creamed Corn as side dish. For Pepper Crusted Chateaubriand, it is well-seasoned and the sauce balances all oily from meat. We will definitely return on our next trip.

Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepper Crusted Chateaubriand
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pepper Crusted Chateaubriand

sSAJabCMVUIR7NCyo9drJQ.text: Only way to describe SW is perfect. From the ambience to the Decour to the food Steve knows how to keep us coming back. It's not a Vegas trip without dinner at SW.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

56nWFOkiMhi0Vj4zgMV0bg.text: Holy filet mignon, this place is spectacular! We sat on the patio for dinner and were able to watch the waterfall show every thirty minutes. The food was unreal. We had the filet with their signature chili rub, the king crab legs with orange tarragon butter, lobster gnocchi, and brussel sprout side. Everything was so amazing, I wish I had more room in my stomach. Hahahaha! The wait staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. Worth every penny!!

uI6hsVUfVYwSyRQn0L8flQ.text: Everytime I wanted steak I would go to STK. My friend took me here for my birthday and it's now my favorite steakhouse. The food was absolutely perfect. The servers had so much knowledge about their menu. We sat outside next to the water. Its beautiful at night.

nXwzaV84Qd3KQcziPHN5Zw.text: I felt very offended because me and my wife went to vegas just for that and they didn't let me in because I was wearing my Versace shorts and Gucci belt

coU1Pgkp1RBJNaV3FprW9Q.text: Delicious steaks and a beautiful ambiance! I would highly recommend coming to this beautiful restaurant to celebrate a special occasion or for a romantic date. My boyfriend loved his yummy ny strip and the delicious Asiago bread that they gave us when we sat down. You totally get what you pay for

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful show with dinner
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ny strip

Md4n_wWAI2pPgKA4Lo44aA.text: Love this place.  The little shows    The waterfall.   The food is top notch.   Is pricey but get what you pay for. And keeps the riff raff out. Definitely a must.  I go at least once a year. Never disappointed

IVjrTUsB5IwaAE89B0xvFg.text: Came here for a work dinner. My oh MY was this place insanely delicious!! Everything from the bread they give you before the meal to dessert was AMAZING!! Service and ambiance are good. They are very packed all the time and apparently you need to make reservations 7 weeks in advance.  I had the organic baked salmon. To die for. Ceasar salad = to die for.The potatoes au gratin were amazing. The creamed corn was soo good. The funnel cake and creme brulee were insane. Holy shit the creme brulee was magical. Dying to come back here already. So fancy fancy, never been to such a fancy place like this where they fold your napkin for you everytime you leave the table.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Insane $26,000 bottle of wine. So cool watching them uncork it and pour it
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funnel cake tree dessert
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French fries (potato wedges) to die for!!

WK2WOrKHMZd4GcMtXoLLbg.text: Dined on the evening of November 27, 2015 -  Our of all my dining experiences in Vegas, this one is the best! We dined in their general dining room for dinner and had such a wonderful server, Richard! He was fabulous!! Without him, I don't think the dining experience would have been as perfect!  Ordered: 9 oz. Filet Mignon Pan Roasted Sea Scallops - English pea risotto, pea views, black truffle sauce Side of: Chanterelle mushrooms and haricots verts - crisp shallots, lemon herb butter  A glass of the Cabernet Sauvignon, Foley Johnson, Napa Valley (perfect!!)  Let's just say Richard was very right when he said the glass of wine would pair well with the side and the overall meal! Just perfect!! :)   I hope SW Steakhouse realizes how wonderful Richard (1214005) is for their staff!! I truly wouldn't have enjoyed such a fabulous meal without him!!! THANK YOU RICHARD!!! You made this restaurant my favorite!!! ^_^

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu...
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful ceilings of moving upside down umbrellas before the entrance of SW Steakhouse.

AHeJPxWX9bIY0kkPMA6uDw.text: Every time I'm in Vegas I make sure to eat here, it never disappoints. Service is great, the food is phenomenal. One of the best steaks I've ever had. Only complaint if you could call it that is the wine list, I wish there were more lower end choices and more wines under 100.00, would make it easier to share more bottles or try something different. The funnel cake is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funnel cake bush 1/2 order
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dinner

lOMnzYBUcUv9n6CtwnQ8ew.text: 2014- this visit was very disappointing. Last time here Stephanie the hostess was fantastic. This time we walk in at 10:10, we had 9:30 reservations but were doing good in the casino and didn't want to leave. The hostess tells us you have to hurry and sit down the kitchen closes at 10:15 and we're like WHAT?  This is Vegas how can u close a kitchen at 10:15.   So we were like should we leave and the hostess was like no it's ok as long as you order by 10:15 you're ok. Well we sat down and we were like stressed out that we had to rush, that our food would be cooked by the dishwasher cause the chef got off work at 10:15. Or the food would be all rushed out at once. It was very unsettling to start the meal off this way..  Our servers were great they calmed us down and made us feel a lot more comfortable. BUT the damage was done.   Now for the food. The FoiGras was fantastic as usual, the bread and sea salted butter was fantastic. However the steaks came up way short. This is by no means a cheap meal! And the quality of the meat should be at the highest level and it is NOT. I ordered bone in ribeye and while it was cooked to perfection it was very chewy. So I sent it back and got the NY Strip and it was better but very pedestrian. It was definitely not a wow. My buddy ordered the filet and it was ok and nothing more.  To me the steak is not premium grade its more like a select choice and for the price it should be select premium. This is supermarket quality meat and not gourmet supermarket either!  I've decided to find a new steakhouse.  Will try Craft and Carnivore and see which will replace SW as my Vegas steakhouse.  SW I bid you a sad Adou   2012 What a great dinning experience from the very lovely hostess Stephanie to the final desert course. We sat outside watched the show and had some great food with great friendly service. Met a very nice couple from NY that we had a great Dow port together after dinner.   Highly recommend you dine here if you're going out for an expensive dinner. Foi Gras was great, all our steaks were cooked to perfection and tender. Unlike aureole where you would end up spending the same amount of money for dog food.  I also recommend Strip Steak, the Kobe Steak is to die for.

k0jjG1HHcu9i9lvJBIAybw.text: Seated quickly and atmosphere was good. Steaks were good. But, with all the other amazing steakhouses in Vegas, I have to say that I've had better. Steak sizes are definitely bigger but I'd recommend CUT by Wolfgang Puck or Gordon Ramsay Steak for much better steak in terms of flavor. We did not like the bone marrow appetizer at all. Tasted old.

R05Bfmz4rhl-0_2NpnZjDA.text: I brought my boyfriend here to celebrate his birthday. I made the reservation a few weeks earlier and I'm glad I did. The restaurant was definitely busy.   This place had a great vibe and excellent service. We were taken care of the entire night and had a wonderful meal.   We ordered the Filet minion, potatoes Roti, and Roasted corn and quinoa cakes for dinner and followed it with the Rocky road for dessert. Everything tastes great and was so fulfilling.   The only reason I docked one star was because I wish we were able to sit closer to the lake to have a better view of the water shows.

fFEisR03f5xBsm_GnoC6PQ.text: Best dining experience and most phenomenal steak in Vegas, hands down!  There is something so great about a waiter greeting you by name and I love how attentive they are.  Patio seating is a must as the show is entertaining throughout dinner.  Reservations aren't easy to come by as this place is packed every night of the week.  I won't go into great detail about the food because after all it's a steakhouse and I'm sure you are a fan of steak if you are searching for a steakhouse.  I will share with you that you should smother your steak in the butter they provide you because just when you thought it couldn't get better, it does!  You can't go wrong with any of the side dishes (I especially love the Brussel sprouts).  The wine list is fantastic with plenty to choose from including by the glass.  I haven't tried any of the desserts but I watch in envy while everyone else enjoys them.  Service is phenomenal!  It's very easy to spend $400 on 2 people here.

q7YWngHkTMff4sAIbn_Vbw.text: Lucked into an outdoor patio and it was fantastic. Great view of the water show. Service was excellent. I must say I've been to the majority of top steakhouses in Las Vegas and the prime boneless NY was probably the best I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned, perfectly cooked medium rare with a perfect sear. Truly memorable. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is in my mind the wine pricing is over the top exorbitant.  But for a special occasion it is a great choice. Heard you need to book outside well in advance.

zi5sANatjUvGphD9dTQMXQ.text: The atmosphere of the restaurant is incredible.  We had a lakeside table.  The lake shows were entertaining.  Our waitress and support staff were superb - the top two or three we've encountered in Las Vegas.   Our Sommelier recommended an amazing wine for us. We both had a filet - - surprisingly it was just average which was a disappointment to us.  I added a Maine Lobster to my steak - - it may have been the worst lobster I've had in decades - over cooked.  The caesar salad was what you would expect.  The octopus appetizer was over grilled - too crunchy (I'm guessing someone wasn't paying attention while cooking it).  The au gratin potatoes were among the best we've ever had...the baked fennel mac & cheese left a lot to be desired.  The cookie butter cheesecake is now among our favor desserts - it was simply delightful.

e5zsDBZ317X3b74lqLvfLg.text: Robert at the front greeting area was very arrogant and rude like he was doing us a favor by spending our money there, really , you should know and treat your guests like they deserve especially if they are hotel guests , why would you even have someone like that working at the front to greet guests in

1AyBZDG5tE25lrkb0TVWGg.text: Impeccable service from the on time seating to the check. The seafood spectacular was outstanding and tasty. The 12 oz filet was perfect. From beginning to end this place is the best and we will definitely return.   Las Vegas is not complete with out a visit to the SW.

I8jl5V2ihD0t2DlKyyKASA.text: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of getting a comped dinner here for our anniversary last month and we definitely enjoyed it. The space itself is lovely and overlooks a waterfall and there is a bit of a show experience out there. I thought the dining room was a bit too bright which made it less romantic than I was expecting. The sommelier helped us pick a delicious bottle of red wine and then we ordered our meals. My appetizer was a special they had which was a grilled octopus over chickpeas and tomatoes, it was nice and light. My boyfriend had a crab cake that was to die for! Oh by the way, our bread basket was easily one of the highlights of the meal- it had 3 different kinds of bread and they were all wonderful. I ordered a Filet Mignon medium rare and it was just perfect, perfectly cooked and the sauce on the side was the perfect compliment. I also ordered a side of the sauteed vegetables but unfortunately they were hard and undercooked. My boyfriend ordered a side of macaroni and cheese with bacon which I tried and it was very good. For dessert I had a trio of gelatos and sorbets which I was able to choose from several options, and they were unbelievable! My 2 favorites were the banana ice cream and the coconut sorbet, really rich and delicious. The chocolate was just ok, not quite sweet enough. Our service was very good and I definitely enjoyed this meal.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious gelato trio!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5jU8VgtxIQ7q5SchokXImg.text: For the price the SW does not meet expectations.  The service is excellent and the ambiance is beautiful.  The lighted waterfall with accompanying music makes for a lovely visual, but when the rib eye is $62 the meat needs to be as good as the view.  It wasn't.  The rib eye was average.  The scallops were good, but they were served on a bed of bland rice.  Perhaps this is a personal preference, but I like the kernels in my creamed corn to be nearly whole so that there is a bit of crunch and pop in each bite.  The SW's creamed corn is cut so fine it may as well have already been chewed.  On the bright side, the wedge salad was good and came with a delightful side of bacon.   The SW is a nice evening out if you don't mind the price and have average expectations for the food.  It is form over substance.

lxFEIXaAaEQkZBMTUoY6Hw.text: We wanted something fancy during our visit at Vegas on the Christmas weekend. So here we are.   Decor = Nice but not WOW.  Service =  Decent but would expect better. We waited for a while for our check. Our server was too busy taking care of the large parties (I don't blame him, more tips from them).  The View = We requested to sit by the window so we can enjoy the entertainment from "The Lake". But we were disappointed, the so call "show" was kinda ridiculous.   Anyway on to the food.  Crabcake: Crispy on the outside with lumps of crab on the inside. Delicious but the portion is small. Not worth the price.  Lamb Chop with a side of Truffle Creamed Corn: Delicious, it was the best lamb chop I've had. It's so tender and flavorful.   Filet Mignon with Foie Gras: The Foie Gras is a must try. I was kinda disappointed at the Filet Mignon. I ordered medium but it's still kinda dry and rough. Ruth's Chris is so much better.  The food are overall decent but it's way over priced. I guess that's VEGAS STYLE.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $54 Filet Mignon top with $24 Foie Gras. The Foie Gras was worth it not the filet.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Cream Corn $12
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Chop $51

XdZWqR-hnLZ0DJQCXFEawg.text: Eventhough with a reservation we still waited over 30 mins for table but it was worth it. We got a table by the Lake of Dreams and had a great view of the light show. The shellfish platter was out of this world. Our ribeye was overcooked but it was so late and so good that we still enjoyed it.  Cool place, tasty food, not so great service but still worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FZECD-JWkpJtsZ_NVyPTfw.text: It could not have been a better experience. The bar staff was great before the meal.  Very engaging, accomodating and fun.  The bartender made a special blueberry drink (off menu) with fresh blueberries for my wife due to her desire for a blueberry drink.  The hostesses were extremely friendly and their attire was appropriate to upscale dining / classic Vegas.  Our waiter was very good.  He was attentive and offered good suggestions / engaging conversation without becoming a member of the party.  The food was out of this world!! We ordered the Porterhouse for Two.  No need for a steak knife because it was cooked to perfection and fork tender.  The side dishes were just as wonderful.  Be careful of the bread basket. The bread basket offerings were the best we have ever had at any restaurant or bakery.  Pretty big deal for us since we usually have little / no interest in bread with dinner.  We ordered one dessert for my wife's birthday. It was very good as well but we could only eat a spoonful since we had already enjoyed a hearty / wonderful dinner.  Mr. Wynn and his team really know their craft.  This is now one of our top 3 favorite destinations for steak.  We highly recommend for an adult evening out with great food.

7cYHX0CJXBBFIf2Mz5M_rw.text: I would give it six stars if it was an option.  My wife and I went a few nights ago to celebrate our anniversary. I requested a table with a good view of the lake and they made sure we were right in front with an excellent view.  The front desk attendant was a little dry, but out waiter and good runners were awesome!  The food was excellent... My ribeye was delicious and my wife's filet was more pink that she normally orders but she and I both loved it (literally melts in your mouth it's so good).  We also shared a Cesar salad which was tasty (but not necessarily incredible), potatoes au gratin which were amazing, a half order of black truffle creamed corn, asparagus, and Mac and cheese which were also all excellent. We wanted to sample a number of sides so out waiter recommended that we do half orders instead of full which was a great suggestion and not something advertised on the menu as an option. Even the half portions were really large.  I also really liked some of the small touches that made the whole experience special... The assorted breads and salted butter were great, the after dinner chocolate mints, the tasty beer selections and drink options, and of course the beauty of the lake and the randomness of the shows every half hour.  We have decided that we will be back every time we decide to visit Vegas. Thanks SW for a great dinner!

qZbgSGn_2NRKexaDwDTZpw.text: Ate here on the company's dime, and still couldn't find a way to give it more stars.    5 of us walk in from a company event at Tao beach --- 2 in our party have shorts on and were not allowed in.  Get over yourselves, SW.  Understand the desire to keep riff raff out... But it's vegas and yokels aren't gonna drop $200+ per person.    Service was painfully slow --- was asked 3 times for drinks ... We had questions for the sommelier and they all said they would get him (looked really uncoordinated).  Wine (silver oak), Steaks, salad, and apps (foie) were solid.  Eat at a lot of steakhouses ... Had a better bone in ribeye at Emerils Delmonico the day before.  Post dinner we wanted a particular bourbon from a bar in the Wynn that we went to prior  --- one server said he would get it.  Guy comes back and says it doesn't exist anywhere in the casino.  Said he checked everywhere and even made calls to try to locate it.  A buddy walks out, gets the bourbon, takes a pic of the bottle, and shows it to the server ...who then shot out a bunch of lame excuses about how he couldn't find it.  You can easily do better in Vegas.

iVKtJYD9e9j29-zQOVT_GQ.text: If you're willing to splurge, this place is fantastic. I ordered a Tom Collins and it was made perfectly. They let you do half sides, so take advantage of that! I ordered the boneless prime rib and it was cooked exactly right. Super tender. Perfect amount of fat. My favorite part of the whole meal, and even as I sit at home in Texas I think about it, was the truffle oil cream corn. I could swim in that stuff. So good.

wujZUS8bkebZpV8-ffFdqA.text: We ate here on 9/21 our 1 year anniversary + honeymoon trip in one. I called a week prior to make outside table reservations and was told it would be no problem to accommodate us, especially being our anniversary. When we arrived I noticed several available seats on the patio as well as the inside of the restaurant was virtually vacant. The hostess proceeded to take us to the farthest back corner of the restaurant (inside). I asked her very politely about an outside table or at least one closer so we could have a nice view. She said (somewhat rudely) they were all booked. We were dressed very nice, we were polite, we had a glass of wine in the bar before, so not sure what the issue is unless the hostess need to be slipped $$ to get a nice table!   After sitting for about 45min in our private back corner, we were told they would have a table opening up closer if we wanted to move. The whole restaurant still seemed pretty open to me, but okay, we moved. After getting seated at our new table 2 waiters as well as the hostess made sure to come by our table and "comment" that we had moved. Again the hostess was snotty about it. Made us feel uncomfortable.   The service was slow especially since the place was empty. Staff just standing around. We ordered salmon and chicken. Salmon was WAY under cooked, chicken was very tender but had little to no flavor. We also ordered mashed potatoes, and the waitress offered us garlic mashed, we said yes. Once they came we quickly realized the garlic had not been cooked, it was mixed in raw and they were large chunks! It was instant dragon breath and we love garlic!  For $15/glass of wine, I would expect better. I had the pinot grigio. Maybe thats just because I live in wine country.   The bread basket should get 5 stars! They bacon cheese and pretzel breads were amazing!   All in all I wish we would have chosen the Eiffel Tower restaurant or the Billagio overlooking the fountains. Very disappointing memories made at SW Steakhouse.

rLtL1JJGyLVtk-mA9m8EtA.text: Great meal, the fillet was cooked perfect & the kale salad & cream corn were delicious. Beautiful view on the patio. Waiter was great. That was my 4th time there...had great meals every time

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DaolYzULmIwTl8VdljdrgQ.text: This place is out of this world good! We are two vegans who took some non-vegans out to eat at the Wynn who have never been there before. The vegan options were so amazing that I forgot to take photos of them! Our friends really enjoyed their dishes as well. The wait staff was amazing and very attentive to our needs. A little on the pricey side, but well worth having a spectacular meal on our vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amazing vegan soup. I could have taken gallons of this home with me!

qKZtK4vjdFb80LfAxJaaYg.text: This place lives up to the hype surrounding it. Boyfriend chose this as my birthday dinner venue and I am thrilled that he did. We sat lakeside and the ambiance is amazing. Very romantic scenery, however, not very intimate as you have to shout at each other in order to hear over the noise of the waterfall and everything else around.  The service was very friendly and accommodating. We had some trouble deciding on the wine and they offered us samples before we made our choices. Water was always refilled, plates cleared and server checked in regularly.   The bread basket was DELICIOUS. I started off with the appetizer of oysters on a half shell which were amazing. My entree was the pan roasted sea scallops which were cooked to perfection. The risotto complemented the dish incredibly. Boyfriend opted for the Snapper dish which I don't see on the online menu. That was tasty, but I was much more pleased with my selection. We shared a side of the black truffle creamed corn just because it had such rave reviews. It was fine. I did not find it as orgasmic as others seem to have, but it was tasty nevertheless.  Dress code seems to be strictly enforced.  Very enjoyable meal worth every penny.

heTmVKECoI25fl_Hh7iSrw.text: Amazing food and atmosphere, had some giant cocktail shrimp, chopped salad, creamed spinach, potatoes au gratin, and a filet mignonette cooked to perfection. They do an awesome little show every 45 minutes that was great to watch. Great time.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tree frog appeared during the show.

o8EHRHqa0eWH1AMaV_3pOQ.text: My husband and I eat at prime steakhouses once a week. Mastro's, Morton's, Ruth's Chris, Fleming's, Duane's, Jean Georges, and many more. I can safely tell you that the dry aged, prime tomahawk at this restaurant is the best steak we've ever eaten. We also loved the funnel cake dessert (especially dipped in the salted caramel sauce).

nxQMaxVDYjgMxL4hSI21hw.text: What a wonderful place.  It was especially windy out when we ate there.  The food was perfect and to have a wonderful view of outside while enjoy a perfect meal you couldn't ask for much more.  Well worth the money in my opinion.  We will be back and can't wait to introduce others.  Only negative thing is that we definitely over indulged and went into a food coma until the we hours of the morning.

3j4dlcWLHkiKvHEoy93xuw.text: This place is amazing! I've been to many steak houses across the country and have my favorites at home in NYC and SW is up there on the list. The decor is very sleek and classy and right outside is the waterfall at the Wynn. We had an excellent waiter who was so sweet and attentive and was always immediately available with water and more wine. For an appetizer we shared the bureaus which was to die for. We both had steak and was cooked to perfection. The meat tasted like butter (actually did) and was such a good size we barely had room to try the sides. SO good!!

CmTHUHLQABgMRo9ceMGX0Q.text: What better way to end a friend's birthday weekend in Vegas than at SW Steakhouse? Located in the Wynn and overlooking the Lake of Dreams, SW is a sight for sore eyes. Especially those that have been exposed to all things sinful about Vegas. Everything from the dishes to the view from the terrace were beautifully presented.  Service was top-notch. The waitstaff were polite and friendly, yet professional. They answered all of the questions that our party had although I had already had my heart set on something in particular due to a previous visit: a medium rare bone-in rib eye with sauteed Sonoma foie gras. We also shared the black truffle creamed corn and the potato au gratin.   First off, the bread basket of was pretty good. It came paired with sea salt crusted butter and consisted of pretzel loaves, cheddar/bacon biscuits, and some other bread I didn't sample for fear of overstuffing.  As for my entree, the foie gras was deliciously buttery with gorgeous dark golden sears on both sides. My steak was well seasoned and tender. Not the best steak I've ever had but it definitely ranked in the top 10. The creamed corn was savory with subtle notes of black truffle. It was absolutely delicious! The potato au gratin was mediocre and nothing to write home about. My counterparts had the NY strip and the 40 oz. chile rubbed rib-eye which they seemed to enjoy.  It was definitely quite an enjoyable meal so why the deduction of 1 star? My steak was served a tad over medium when I had requested medium-rare. Tsk tsk.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras atop a 20 oz. bone-in rib eye and sides of black truffle creamed corn and potato au gratin.

B--s-K8PJCkK7DzIMj7y-A.text: For the amount of money we paid for this $800 for 5 people, I rate it a 2 stars.   1. Service was quite slow, we had to wait a long time to get serviced, I had to ask for a water refill. For a place with this type of reputation, my standards are at a different level if I were dining at Applebee's.   2. Food - the lobster ($70) was overcooked and over buttered. The butter taste was overwhelming and the meat tasted tough   The ribeye wasn't seasoned well, a bit bland and also overwhelming butter taste.   Stake tar tar was mediocre. Nothing to write home about.   Overall - good Decor, but overall does not live up to the Steve Wynn reputation.

X9SBIhX5HlEJdsZIaPydRA.text: One of my favorite steakhouses in Vegas!! Service is always exceptional, we always have Ryan wait on us. They bring out an appetizer on them of wagyu beef! Price is about $100 per person w/alcohol but the experience is well worth it. They will split entrees and make any accommodations

nokPzBVeJHpj5jSjwZ-x3Q.text: I ate dinner here tonight and it was perfect.  I tend to judge a steakhouse on its ability to cook a ribeye (bone-in or otherwise) and SW didn't disappoint.  Like other high end steakhouses you order sides a la carte which tend to push up the bill price.  Prepare to spend about $100 / plate (depending on alcohol consumption of course), but rest assured your money is well spent.  All in all definitely a memorable meal.  I can easily file this one away with the top 1% meals of my life.

4Gu07YFNbHxbCTjq2QTm9g.text: Couldn't have had a better experience.  The wait staff were super helpful and explained everything.  Got the bone in Ribeye which was one of the best cuts of meat I've ever had.  Girlfriend had the 12oz filet which she really loved as well and cooked a perfect medium rare.   The bread they bring is out of this world.  We got 2 sides Au gratin potatoes and the creamy spinach.  Excellent choices and highly recommended.  Also was told to try the ceasar salad which I normally don't care for from just about everywhere (just was never a big fan of the dressing) but this salad was out of this world!!!  This was my first trip to Vegas and I don't have anything else to compare it to in regards of the other big steak houses in Vegas but if this place is on your list to try go for it.  Also nice water display as well which added to the mood!!!

nQAjC3a_2mMhRw5OD6w3VQ.text: This was my 2nd time dining here, the first time my medium rare steak was burnt. I really don't like returning my food, but when you are paying $70 for a steak, it should be made correctly.  I recently gave it another chance, our friends wanted to fine here. I believe is more for the name & location, not really the food & service. 4/4 of our med rare steaks were burnt, it might be the flames are too high to begun with. Our friends says it happened to them numerous times. The Salmon that our friend had was delicious, chop salad & crab cocktails were pretty good. Cocktails were on point! Bartender really know what he's doing. Over all the service was ok. Again, it did not meet our expectation. $1500.00 meal between 5 of us. I like it to be fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The steak are always burnt, is this how they always cook their steak?
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_BK0lFTAk2juDYGtMupNnw.text: Excellent food and service but just a bit loud to have a quiet conversation.  Maybe it was where we were sitting not sure but would definitely return.

xiMA-Y026PQP2tmPfCLyIQ.text: SW Steakhouse is located in The Wynn on the Las Vegas strip. We've heard lots of award winning, top notch reviews and had to check this place out. And what better occasion as one of my besties and her sister were staying at The Wynn.  The Wynn in itself has always been an eye catching, jaw dropping, elegant, classy, beautiful hotel!  SW Steakhouse is no different and fits perfectly into the character of this hotel!  So much to say, where do I start? SW is located down the escalators of this beautiful hotel closest to the south entrance doors, or valet doors. The second you walk through the restaurant doors there is the bar/lounge area to your left. There were flat screen TV's showcasing this evenings NBA prime time games.  As we walked further in we were greeted by our friendly and welcoming hosts! As we were heading to our table, this restaurant is huge, beautiful! This place is very elegant and very classy!  I read prior to making our reservation that this steakhouse is amongst the best in Las Vegas! "Chef David Walzog's Forbes Travel Guide Four-Star Award-winning SW Steakhouse offers steaks that are unparalleled in Las Vegas", as quoted.  As an FYI, the inside seating area is non-smoking,  while outside they do allow smoking. We were seated at the edge, just inside, but had a panoramic view of the lake and waterfall looking out. Yes, there is entertainment during your dining experience, which I think runs every 15 minutes on the lake and above the waterfall.  A True dining experience!  The dishes are priced four bills ($$$$), but this is not your ordinary steakhouse! The wine menu is a book, literally! I love my wines and champagnes, however, even I had to ask our servers there were so many to choose from! The cocktail menu was its own hook as well! LOL  The dinner featured the highest quality meats and seafood, complimented by a wide array of side dishes and homemade sauces! For you vegetarians and vegans, the menu is very accommodating to you as well! Just because this a steakhouse doesn't mean you too can't enjoy dining here!  Our dishes were creations of masterpieces!  I've dined at a lot of steakhouses but this night was an unforgettable experience! Dining at its finest!  We started with the house salad with two types of dressings on the side, a vinaigrette and a wasabi cream dressing! The dressings were really delicious!  For our main entrees, we ordered the 18 oz. Boneless Ribeye and 9 oz. Filet Mignon and shared amongst us three. Accompanying our steaks were six (6) house prepared sauces! Gosh, what an experience! Forbes rates this place 4-star experience, but my review of the SW is a 5-star experience!  To compliment our steaks, we ordered the Sauteed Wild Mushrooms, Roasted Jumbo Asparagus and a HUGE stuffed baked potato with everything on it! The highlight of the stuffed baked potato is it had real bacon or pork belly! Mouthwateringly Wow! And of course I can't forget that bread basket! Such a wide array of deliciousness!  We were so stuffed we didn't order any desserts, although they looked very tempting! Were we celebrating a birthday in our group so we were able to share what appeared to look like a macaroon but was a chocolate cake filled with peanut butter inside! Yummy!!   Overall, this was a wonderful night with wonderful friends, wonderful staff all around! I look forward to my next experience here!!! This experience rates a 5-star review in my book, and I look forward to my next experience here!!!   If you are ever at The Wynn, be sure to check out SW Restaurant! This is an experience to experience!!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak hot sauces
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak sauces

VNUPhF5y7xQ7042gdFSNzQ.text: I went here with two of my girlfriends for my birthday dinner and I was impressed! The steakhouse is beautiful, we got to sit outside that provided us a view of the waterfall. It was absolutely beautiful! We had two servers, they were both attentive and made the experience very pleasant.   I ordered the all natural 8oz filet since it said it was only 240 calories... which I really appreciated considering I'm watching my diet. I wouldn't say it was the best steak, but probably because it tasted "healthy". I also ordered the truffled cream corn which was probably my favorite dish of the night! I paired my meal with a glass of Cabernet which the server generously comped (I noticed when I was paying the bill)! We also shared the chocolate lava cake which wasn't the best that I've tried but it was still good!   As we were eating, the waterfall show would come on probably every 15 minutes or so. It's a genius idea to enjoy a show while enjoying your steak, however, the themes were a bit weird and didn't really go well with the atmosphere of the steakhouse.   All in all, I would definitely come back to try their scallops, since I've seen many raves about it. If you're looking for a romantic, date night dinner, come give this place a try!

2J9acRL_gxeFrfwS89_tgw.text: The filet melts in your mouth. You can literally cut it with one stroke of your knife. Huge portion and great sides. The bone-in ribeye was also fantastic. Cooked perfectly, tender, fatty and richly marbled.   The scene on the patio is truly bizarre.  There is a mini-show regularly with crazy effects.

lja0UsC-oSyhddZz8LV7AA.text: Absolute perfection! We had a wonderful time enjoying this restaurant for our tenth anniversary last night. Service was excellent and food was delicious.   I would suggest only selecting one side for two people, we had two and couldn't get through half of them.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SdSgWk5n547PQRqSIjavYA.text: The food was really good, we took the chili steak it was a little bit spicy but I still like that. The only thing I didn't like is I feel like the waiters were rushing us like right away bringing appetizer then right away main dish I am rushing to take away my plate

Nmsy_i0rjO2IrDSzV_qAqw.text: Best steakhouse in all of Vegas. It's classy, elegant but very comfortable atmosphere. The food was amazing and service was even better. If you're looking for the best steakhouse on the strip this is the place for you.

y8oFmStRW7yzeZ8U0FrVkA.text: Steve Wynn does it again with this fantastic fine dining restaurant which includes some creative vegan/vegetarian menu options - yay! My date ordered the filet with creamed spinach and couldn't stop raving about the tenderness and tastiness.   + Ambiance (indoor & patio dining) + Service (we had two servers taking care of us) + Mini Water Show For Patio Seating (every 30 mins) + Very Considerate Of Our Time (asked us what are plans were after to make sure we did not miss them)  - Pricey Drinks - Reservations Needed   Overall, I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone interested in delicious food, even if you're vegan like me, as well as a romantic evening with your sweetie ;)

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qdBRzWYXyKZXmEZot2j80A.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my dinner experience. I made reservations day of and they said it was a little difficult to get outside seating, no big deal.  When we checked in the gentleman at the front told us to hold to wait as I requested outside and was willing to wait. A table opened up right in the middle and in between inside and outside. Perfect.  The water, music, light shows were great. The atmosphere was phenomenal and very enjoyable. Got a drink at the bar first and Billy was a cool guy who got along with everyone and made a great drink. Super friendly and personalized the experience, which was great   The bread assortment and flavored butter were a nice start to the meal. We got the domestic wagyu New York strip and split it and crisp potato rosti along with the baked fennel Mac and cheese. Our server Andres was attentive, very nice, suggested and agreed with our food selection when I asked questions or recommended other items as well. And he smiled throughout serving us.   Overall experience, food, quality, ambience, staff service, and accommodations met and expectations. I'm glad I was able to eat here and I will again.

ytwi5EcaiOqmCl3hz4Wjuw.text: Dinner with friends Steak Rib Eye and Cocktail shrimp finish two bottles of wine they love the cheese bread I think we order three sets of it nice place for dinner a little pricey but worth it.
