y2QG64MsT8SeBcn9_UO1Bg.text: This place is SO overrated!  I have NEVER been impressed with a waiter that doesn't write anything down and forgets or screws up the order.   The Oscar is flat out terrible. Don't waste your money.  The seafood tower was meh  There are much better steak restaurants in Las Vegas

pwF4DQASJ1XJ9aGLujnXZg.text: Mmm. Everything here was so good. Scalloped potatoes were awesome. I wish dish was bigger. We had filet and mushrooms. The drinks were good as well. The steaks were delicious. My friend asked for peppercorn crusted and they did that nicely. We got the chocolate bomb dessert that was fun.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet

wdwKu5uPAODCk7xatKw0Xw.text: If you don't get the Wagyu here then you are missing out on a whole new world. It is by far...and I'm a foodie... the best steak I have ever tried. It is so good it has forever ruined my steak for me because now no steak will live up to that standard. I'm from LA and we have the top of the line steakhouses here so take my word for it. I also love love love the setup and beautiful lake outside.

ZDH7iynYsyblcT6f7NkyaA.text: My family and I came to Vegas over the Thanksgiving holiday and we decided to have our fancy dinner here. We sat out in the patio area overlooking the lake and the big screen that features different songs with some cool graphics and a singing frog. They have outdoor heaters so we were very comfortable.   We started with shrimp cocktails and a lobster bisque. The shrimp cocktail consisted of four HUGE shrimps. They were so delicious. For dinner we ordered two of the porterhouse steaks (split between four people) and the scallops. Hands down, this was the best steak I have ever had. It was cooked to perfection with a nice char on the outside. The side dishes we chose were the carrots, asparagus and whipped potatoes. Also really good but there is no doubt that the steak was the star of the show.  For dessert we ordered the creme brulee and the apple crisp. The creme brulee was fabulous. Just melted in your mouth. I didn't have the apple crisp but it looked amazing. It was also huge and is enough dessert for 4 people.    The service was impeccable. The servers circulate through the tables without missing a beat. There was never a need to ask for anything because they anticipated our needs ahead of time. I'm looking forward to dining here on our next trip. If you're looking for a fine dining experience, look no farther, SW is the place to go!!!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big screen entertainment
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big screen entertainment

rFZEfqM8x4PMqshxp_AjMA.text: Excellent service and unforgettable food  My wife and I loved setting out on the patio and watching the shows  Shrimp cocktail was excellent.  Followed by 9 oz filet   Don't miss this excellent steak house

32DilTNh7lqvuGipbYtCGw.text: They do have a great atmosphere, but their food quality does not meet the expectation. Medium rare steak is burnt on outsides and it was more of a medium well-done. Honestly, their food tastes like nothing, None. Its beyond good or bad. So was cocktails! I would't recommend to a friend.

2Rh-etbDuayq3l5Xsy-l0Q.text: SW is pricey but our meal was well worth it.  We had dinner Friday night at SW.  The place was packed the entire time we were there.  I overheard a hostess say if you wanted a table on the patio overlooking the waterfall you need to make reservations 6 months in advance.  So, be advised if you are wanting that experience.  We had a view of the waterfall from our table, and the weather was nice so they opened the wall to allow the breeze in.  It's definitely a cool place to have a meal.  Service was great throughout the evening.  We had a team of guys helping our table, and we also utilized the sommelier, who was very friendly and helpful.  We gave him a price range and a couple of bottles that we liked, and he provided us with 2 great recommendations.  No attempt to upsell either, which given how nice SW is, that was refreshing.  You are going to get a bread basket with pretzel buns, another type of bread, and these cheesy, bacon rolls.  Ignore the other bread and have the cheesy bacon rolls!  Everyone at our table loved them and I am pretty sure we all had at least 2.  I know I did.  I know everyone says not to fill up on bread and that's certainly True, but these rolls are worth not ignoring the bread basket.  To start, I had the tuna tartare.  The tuna was of very good quality and fresh.  However, there were too many pickled veggies and not enough gochujang for my taste.  The veggie to tuna ratio was off, and the tuna should have been the star of the dish.  It was good to be sure, but the construction was off.  I split the 30 ounce tomahawk ribeye with another guy at the table, and we all shared the following sides:  black truffle creamed corn, au gratin potatoes, asparagus, and mushrooms.  The server advised us that steaks at SW have a crust, and he was right.  This thing was textbook.  It had a slight crunch without being acrid at all.  If this wasn't a perfect steak crust it was pretty damn close.  The beef was dry aged 28 days and had the flavor and depth you expect of a dry aged prime steak.  It was cooked perfectly as well.  It's not cheap but it's a repeat order should I return.  The asparagus and mushrooms were prepared simply.  You have to like both of these items to like these sides, because there was nothing added.  The au gratin potatoes were small but excellent.  We had a group of 5 and needed to order another batch.  They were seasoned well, appropriately cheesy, and had a great crust.  SW may be fancy, but this was a great version of a classic steakhouse side.    While the potatoes were good, the winner of the side derby goes to the black truffle creamed corn.  Everyone at the table loved this stuff.  It had a lot of truffle flavor but it wasn't overpowering the dish.  And, the corn was creamed well, it wasn't too thick, but also wasn't runny.  5 star side.  You are going to pay a bunch for a meal at SW, but if you're eating there you are at the Wynn.  Steve Wynn built his empire on luxury, not deals.  I can't believe it took me so long to get to this place, but I would return on a future trip for sure.

Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black truffle creamed corn.

5lkTBWiNZNVbgYRjGkl5nw.text: What an experience!  7 of us went to dine at the restaurant. Because of the one person in our party frequents the restaurant, we were able to get an amazing table. Service was very tentative and the sommelier sounded like he knew what he was talking about. NY Strip medium rare came out perfectly red with warm center. Can't wait to go back on our next date night.

zKzwuXLpuRFSL63CO78b1w.text: Wow wow wow.  If you are lucky enough to get a seat at this restaurant, then you have struck gold.  Absolutely beautiful and stunning.  The restaurant is nestled at the Wynn casino.  Beautiful layout.   We were lucky enough to sit by the view of the show they put on at the pool every 30 minutes or so.  Food was absolutely delicious.  Not a single complaint.  Top notch service.  Celebrities sitting nearby and it is just all put together brilliantly.  Mr Wynn has outdone himself.    Prices are high but worth it for sure. It's impossible to get a table there on any given night.  We were lucky to have a great friend that helped us land a table on a Friday night.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese wagyu
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor patio view

hAZclLeylQCaZlRb4Ujz0Q.text: This rating is based on our total experience, not the food.  We dined at the SW Steakhouse on January 17 for my 70th birthday.  Steve Wynn also dined there that evening. Not surprisingly, he had a prime table on the patio. But Steve also ensured that the tables on either side of him remained unoccupied while he was there. Thus, he deprived paying guests from sitting at two of the best tables in the restaurant. Steve loves our money, but when he sits his pompous privileged posterior down for dinner, he does not want any of us sitting near him. We learned of this after requesting another table to move away from rowdy diners. The restaurant refused to sit us at the empty table next to Mr. Wynn. When I asked to speak with Robert, the Manager, he would not even give us the courtesy to come to our table. I had to find him. His excuse for Wynn's selfishness: Security.   The $71 filets at SW Steakhouse were tender and perfectly cooked. The sides were disappointing. The service was fine but simply could not compare to the orchestrated extravaganza going on at the Wynn table. He should be embarrassed to have his staff fawn over him while nearby (but not too nearby) his customers are receiving average service for their $175/$200 per person dinners.

_PQXaaYJxazyxHngYUK7VA.text: Beautiful view of the lake. They had a show that ran every 30 minutes. The steak was very flavorful a ours was the Chile rubbed. It was on the pricey side but well worth it overall.

Du5nsqMgQCKWHTXCAVHVNg.text: We were in town for Christmas Eve and wanted to splurge. SW was unbelievably fantastic; the food was memorable, and the service was the best we have had anywhere, and we have dined in great places around the world. We had the bone-in pepper ribeye; like all of their steaks, it is charred for a crispy crust, kind of Pittsburgh style, and absolutely succulent inside. I also suggest the Potato au gratin dish, and my son's salmon was equally tasty. Be sure to top off your desert with the funnel cake dessert- that was awesome! Thank you to managers Victoria and Robert and the staff for giving us an unforgettable experience. Very highly recommend.

u_aeasos4NBKF0HeG34XIQ.text: We thought we had the best steak of our lives in Montana, and then we came here. All you need to know in life: Chipotle rubbed double ribeye. This steak is incredible. Cooked perfectly, seasoning is mind blowing, and I love that it comes with seared onions and peppers. Perfect for two people or one really hungry person. We also got the cookie butter cheesecake, to die for!!! We came here for our 1 year anniversary dinner, it was absolutely perfect. Try to sit outside!

YWgzRgB-w1P3uY89cdCLVw.text: My fella said he wanted a really good steak for his birthday dinner. What my fella wants, my fella gets. We had a reservation and were seated immediately.  Service was superb and so was the food. We started with the half order of the cold seafood platter and I loved everything served. The crab salad was particularly addictive. One thing my fella and I couldn't agree on was what appetizers we wanted to try, but have no fear, they offer half orders of all of these so we were able to try everything our heart's desired. My favorite was the creamed corn. I actually wish I had a full order of this side all to myself. It was rich and creamy and so delicious.   For our main course, I ordered the bone-in New York and my fella ordered the Bone-in ribeye. Mine was good, but I only ordered it since the birthday boy picked the ribeye that I usually choose and I don't like to order two of the same thing. The ribeye was the star of the show.   Perfectly cooked and melt in your mouth delicious. We tried to save room for dessert, but no luck. We were stuffed.   Everything was superb, I only wish the waterfall wasn't so loud. It's a nice view, but ever so loud and distracting. My ears were ringing by the end of the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in ribeye
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waterfall

Wh0qZbGPVYqA5Xp8DFg5dw.text: Excellent food and service in a beautiful setting. Sit outside if you have the opportunity, the lake show starts around 8p in the summer and runs every 30min.   Service is top notch and always with a smile. We had the kobe filet and kobe cap. My kobe filet was excellent though a bit undersalted. Unfortunately hubby had to send the kobe cap back as it was very chewy and inedible. Fortunately the replacement kobe eye was the best of the 3 kobe steaks and staff had no qualms about accomdating us.  Lobster truffle gnocchi was excellent. Personally i think truffle gnocchi would be excellent sans lobster.   Rocky road dessert is a must for chocoholics. Thank-you Wynn for a wonderful meal!
