Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breadbasket
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters

DzsR9MGDtJM7URmKjKX4kw.text: I was staying in the Wynn Las Vegas, exhausted from a conference, and wanted to grab something to eat within the hotel.  I went to the bar at SW Steakhouse. I had never been to an SW before, and thought the prices were a little high, so I ordered a 9 ounce filet and a side that included Brussels sprouts. It's considered a modest order for the restaurant but still $150 with a drink. I thoroughly enjoyed every bite as well as the atmosphere. I definitely recommend dining at SW

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KPIcuv_7FrElpU9vzOHCYw.text: Everything you can ask from a steakhouse is delivered here. Food was exceptional: shrimp cocktail, charred octopus, foie gras, pepper crusted bone in ribeye.  Service was professional. Courteous and pleasant.

dx40KH0Xj8jhtFMz-jE4sw.text: This was probably the best stake house I have been to. I got the medium porterhouse and it came perfectly cooked. The waiter makes sure that you get whatever you want that enhances your dining experience. Be sure to DRESS PROPERLY. Be ready to spend a good amount of money (100-300 per person) but it is well worth it.

TPjLw0-x2yVpNes_cBohqg.text: Great service. Great steak. Great wine (the waiter intentionally overpoured the wine I ordered for me :). Unlike CA, Vegas has a dress code for these types of restaurants (long pants are required). Fortunately they have loaners at the front desk (even though I didn't take up the offer).

oJazp6TulEXQ511U2EY8iw.text: This place is remarkable.  Havent been to Vegas in such a long time. Close to 4 years and on our last night, we decided to go to SW for a dinner before seeing a show.  Let me start by saying this place definitely DELIVERED!!! From the reservations,  food, view and most importantly service. We were greeted by great host and was immediately taken to our seat. Our server Anthony was very knowledgeable and warmth towards us. He also have given us many options with the menu.  Ordered filet mignon and the tastey unique truffled cream corn. Yummy. Lets talk about the view, it can be hot if you sit outside but try to ask for inside by the window.  Waterfalls just bring a soft essence and soothing feel to the place. Overall experience is definitely memorable.  Thank you SW for making this trip very memorable and have changed my view to "crowded" Vegas.  Will definitely recommend and come back here with frienda and family.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breads. Get the pretzels
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

TUqok49ezedenaCePDp9KA.text: I never made it to dinner so my review is based on my experience rather than the food. I made a reservation with the concierge at check in to Encore. I let them know this was our 25th anniversary night. I requested a table on the patio as close to the water as possible. She said she couldn't guarantee where on the patio we would be but that we would be on the patio. I made the reservations just after they opened to make our chances a little better. Upon arriving the following evening the host started leading us to the back of the restaurant. I stopped him and said that I had reservations on the patio. He said that they could not seat us on the patio. I told him of my conversation with the concierge and he said sorry we are fully booked. I looked outside and I think maybe a couple tables were occupied. I told him I didn't want to sit inside and that we were leaving. I also thanked him for ruining our 25th anniversary. The smug SOB said and I quote "You're welcome, have a great night". If it hadn't been such a special occasion I would jumped down his throat but didn't want to ruin our evening. Will NEVER give them another chance. We walked over to Lakeside next door (same patio and view and almost identical menu) and asked it they by chance had any room on their patio for our dinner and explained our situation. They were very kind and gracious and sat us on the patio almost immediately. THAT is how your treat a guest.

ydKsbQVgLox9i1o12XK3TA.text: My biggest complaint about this restaurant is that it was very warm. I even asked if the AC was working and it was!  Aside from that, the service and food was perfect. I had the domestic wagyu which was less flavorful as expected, but still good.  Dessert was the molten chocolate cake with grand marnier ice cream. For the price the dessert was on the small side. Same for the au gratin potatoes. Barely enough for 2 people to share.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

2rF4LBJQI3yVRtM8hcY38g.text: Excellent food. Amazing service and the patio is THE BEST!!! The little shows that go on are entertaining and the overall mood of this restaurant is a 10/10. I even happened to sit next to Nick Jonas which was cool. I'll be back.

GK6NLocVEdX4qehj0n3F0w.text: We may have been on an off-night, but our meal was average at best. The Filet Mignon was flavorless, tough and overcooked - it's a hard cut to ruin, but they managed to do so. The sides were passable, but nothing jumped out.  At this price point, I'd expect a little more care in the kitchen.  The bright spot was the service. They wait staff was top notch and I would give them 5 stars. Attentive, friendly and helpful. They helped save and otherwise poor dining experience.

cSUFIUsRYOVdmJpdGR9h2g.text: Ordered some appetizers, would not rec grilled octopus, super hard, pretty much over cooked. Steak was a huge disappointment, we ordered bone in ribeye, medium rare. It was medium rare for sure, but absolutely tasteless and not tender at all. I say don't waste your money and go to Delmanico's steak house if u want nice meal .  This place is extremely overrated.  We live in NYC, so we r foodies, we were so excited to check it, but honestly it's very disappointing.

72yQuQrTwF90ubWW98Lr2w.text: Another Vegas Weekend - Another Fabulous meal @ SW Steakhouse.  This place sets the LV benchmark for consistent food and fine dining service.  Every single employee is a star.  Just make reservation, introduce yourself to the GM (Brad) or the MOD and you are on your way to a memorable evening.  P.S. Let the staff know if it is a special occasion - you'll be happy you did.

S2NaiPk9qa7xqPY8k0RiQA.text: Ate dinner with a group of friends at the SW Steakhouse in the Wynn Hotel in January 2018 and we all enjoyed our meal.  The Decor is very elegant, like everything else at the Wynn.  The Service was outstanding.  All of the servers were very friendly and attentive.  The food was incredible delicious.  All of the dishes were fantastic.  Probably the best NY strip steak I have ever eaten.  The portion sizes were average.  The prices are very expensive.  But if you want to indulge and experience first class service and food, it's worth the price.  if you have a drink and a side, expect to pay $150-$200 per person.  I would definitely eat here again.

tohW4__UXhF8ZNZAKPGhXA.text: I was at the lakeside restaurant 3 times for the food & show but it didn't impress me with the service, but the show until I try this restaurant where I can also watch the show with good food. They have good customer service here. We had Anthony served our table & he was good. We had chicken dish & risotto were good.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funnel cake half order
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The water show next to us
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The complementary bread

swtWbOSIQpliH8nK1qrXBA.text: The SW Steakhouse came highly recommended by a local resident from Vegas. My husband and I made reservations with plenty of notice, and we were tickled to get a first-class seat right on the patio along the water/pool! This made for an amazing, memorable experience for their nightly pool show (worth requesting these seats!).  Our server was great - super knowledgeable, great service, and very kind. I had the filet (small) and it was amazing. One of the top steaks I've ever had in my life (better than Manny's in Mineapolis!).  Overall, great dining experience. Two thumbs up.

EJG0BujpHKVLRvCNL0bF9A.text: Excellent first time at SW. Luckily, we were seated right next to the lake so the table location couldn't have been better. The house bread was great, with a nice piece of softened butter and Hawaiian sea salt to spread with it. For me, the clear winner of the sides we chose was the truffled creamed corn. The potatoes au gratin was delicious, but didn't wow me as much as the corn. The filet was excellent - perfectly cooked, charred, and seasoned. Unfortunately, dessert wasn't ordered because of how stuffed we were.  Service was also great, attentive but not overbearing. Ambiance could've been a little better. Outside, Top 40 music was playing a little loudly so that sorta diffused the "upscale" feeling of the restaurant. With the noise of the waterfall and the loud music, it detracted from the experience a little. That won't stop me from coming back though!

-GfNwddwt-Fm7VeOOv2f_Q.text: Two words... creamed corn. Two more words... creamed pants.   Worth noting that Yelp might need to add a few more "$" signs to the price range rating thingy. Dinner for two done properly with vino and fixin's was north of three hundo.

6iPCic1gpxpNxsAy3Ehyng.text: Came here to celebrate my husband's birthday, the food did not disappoint. We ordered shrimp cocktail as appetizer, hubby ordered filet mignon, medium, came out well seasoned and perfectly cooked. I ordered the scallop entree, it was delicious but a bit too salty for my liking. Overall the dining experience, the food, the ambience was nice. The missing one star was due to inconsistent service. We had 3 different people came by our table, one was rather "cold". However, Baracet, one of the servers, was wonderful and most definitely made our dinner more special tonight.

4QBMZ3Ibage9SojgD2B9Ag.text: The ambiance, decor, and service in SW are near 5-stars. However, I had high expectations for the food which wasn't quite met.  I first ordered the cider off the menu, which was an English import. I home brew craft cider and beer, and have an extensive palate for these drinks. The cider was excellent, and among the best I've tasted. Light, dry, crisp, but refreshing. My main course was bone in rib eye with blue cheese topping. The steak was overcooked, and my dining partner who got the filet also had an overcooked steak. My theory is they sat too long on warming deck and cooked too far through. It takes a while to be served, because they bring out main dish and sides all at the same time, which may've led to dry overcooked steak. Also, the blue cheese completely over powered the steak. However, when eating portions not drowned in cheese, the meat still was quite bland. The steak was really a 2-star type eat you could get in downtown Vegas for $10. I finished with chocolate cheesecake, which was excellent. Thick and rich, with chunks of chocolate embedded in the cake. It was paired excellently with the cider.  Overall I got some good food and service, but I can't give more than 3-stars for a "steakhouse" that is not serving excellent steak.

LsZqTQJUzD6f8d_0dXdNrw.text: The best steaks I've ever had. Everything you get here is great. If you're in a group the seafood tower is a good one to share. The Cesar salad has an awesome kick to it if you're just looking for something for yourself. The banana ice cream pie is hands down the best dessert on the menu. Now for the steaks, I've actually only ever got one type of steak here, but from others I've been told that the filet is good and the bone in rib eye is tough to beat. Personally, the Tomahawk Chop is where it's at. Light eaters, it can be split four ways, but if your like me and can put food away like a bear pre-hibernation, it can be a one man job.  On a non food related note, the restaurant overlooks the lake which plays cool water shows every 20ish minutes. And the main attraction of the shows, is the robotic frog which comes out over the waterfall and sings to everyone.

6b7Y_G8v05ey_bslmRaZeQ.text: Delicious steak and cool ambiance.  The singing frog is very fun.  My wife got the bone in ribeye and I got the filet.  We both had the bacon on top. The bacon was fantastic but probably shareable as there was so much.  Dinner rolls were very good too. Good steak restaurant.

yzDd1nK3zyZZNTwVHq8jZQ.text: Very good steakhouse - steak was perfectly cooked and the sides were good too. I had the filet with a side salad and both were the right amount of food.  I ate at the bar, basically facing the back wall of the bar, and so it's not the best ambiance. The bartenders were not very chatty and it is a relatively small area.  The dining area looks nice and somewhat upscale. I would lie to go back and sit in the dining room and try some other items. As far as steakhouses in Las Vegas go, this is one of the better ones with typical Vegas prices.  I would rank it better than DelMonico but not as good as Gordon Ramsey.

WuBipLZ_sd40DblgXs6Qxg.text: Everything you would expect from an expensive steakhouse.  They just nailed every facet of the experience.  Everything we ordered would go on the "last meal" list.  Besides my perfectly aged and cooked steak, the appetizer (a gnocchi with bacon, truffles, and a parmesan cream sauce) was one of the best (and most decadent) plates of food I have ever eaten.  My wife had the Main lobster, which was perfectly prepared as well.  Really, everything from the bread (omg the bread is insanely good--they bring you a basket with 6 kinds of bread--it's all you can do to not eat the entire thing) to the entrees was so fantastic you wish you had a spare stomach.  As for the restaurant itself, it is surprisingly understated inside, but the balcony (where the concierge hooked us up with prime seats for our anniversary) is really special.  Service was spot on the entire night, and we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving (reservation).    One reviewer compared this to Prime at the Bellagio and I would have trouble separating the two in terms of quality.  Both are among the best steakhouses I have ever eaten at (food, ambiance, service).

O7pFnP4E9IC2qGdRtRomog.text: First Night in Vegas with a group of friends & I decided to have dinner here at SW.   It was amazing, the atmosphere the service and especially the food. I had Filet Mignon Medium Rare, it was AMAZING. Enough said, must go. Beautiful place to have a dinner date.

YAOSLeP8LDwTj3g4QgCr6g.text: Very good. Very expensive. I honestly think the rolls were the best thing I had. But they were the best rolls I ever had. So in the end, would I go back - yes, for drinks, apps and rolls in the bar and head out to dinner some place later in the evening

YycTRbuUEnwqlSIBMHEYKQ.text: No reason to pay these exorbitant prices for grisly Ribeye and bad service. First time I've been seated outdoors and had such noise that we could not talk

xoUNHgb-ITrg7Uu888TG7Q.text: made reservations @ 6 couldn't get a seat near the lake but i was ok with that it was hot as hell out. seated in the back of the restaurant on the side. it was  quiet which i liked. we did see whats so great about that lake show ppl was talking about, i heard 1 song and it was over. didnt really get it but there are pretty lights lol.  ordered the 30oz ribeye $56, medium rare with side of truffle cream corn $12, came out hot n crispy on the outside, inside was pink n juicy! tender beef! i couldnt even finish it had to take it back to the hotel. cream corn was yummy sweet with truffle flavor! i really wanted dessert but i was so stuffed!  oh yea the bread i thought was ok came out warm didnt eat too much it cause i figured it'll fill me up fast. do like the cheese roll with bacon  service was excellent but at the end the waiter forgot to bring our check so we sat there bored for several minutes.  i do want to come back to try other beefy goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my 30oz ribeye wit creamed corn
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the lake thing nice ambient lights

ja-xH_xUKBFawH7ZQEeCsw.text: I came here memorial weekend with my girlfriend.  I was not too impressed.  I don't know.  Maybe my expectations for the Wynn signature steakhouse were too high.    First of all, i told them I was vegan when i originally made the reservation, which was a week in advance. I was there a week before but had drinks at Parasol Up/Down and it looked fantastic.  The hostess said that they get a lot of vegan diners all the time and that the kitchen would have no problem accomodating me.   So we get there and we are nicely seated.  Our server, whom i had to tell i was vegan, had no idea what to serve me.  He kept asking me "what do i want"?  What do you mean what do i want, i was thinking?  He did have the chef come out and talk to me.  He decided to make me a vegan rissotto with peas and carrots with a grilled veggie plate.    OMG.  This was horrible.  I barely touched the rissotto.  And i LOVE rissotto.  It was just bland, had no flavor and was awful.  The grilled veggies were that.  Grilled veggies.  Not marinated.  Not seasoned.  It was veggies that I coulda bought and held over a gas oven myself.   The only thing that saved my meal was the Strawberry Funnel Cake.  This was delicious.  Which is the only reason why i gave a review of 3 stars versus 2.    I know i know.. you're probably thinking, why the hell would my vegan ass go to a steakhouse?  (1) HOT GUYS go to steakhouses and (2) the hostess ranted and raved that they could accomodate me and that they accomodate vegans all the time.    Um, Yeah... Thanks Steve Wynn, but no thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gdtnw0Zo7MhJKeN0nBPSHQ.text: I was a waiter throughout college at a nicer restaurant. When I go to a pricier spot, I know the key things that I'm looking for: Stellar Service and Food. You should not have to compromise on either, when you are paying this kind of coin.  SW did not disappoint, and this little Piggy went to town on the following foods:  - 8 oz Filet w/ Crab Meat - Carpaccio  - Geese Fau Guais (Forgive the Spelling) - Blue Point Oysters  Also with my dinner, I had some great mixed drinks and a stellar Cab (Anomaly).   I would definitely recommend this to anyone, who is looking to spoil themselves with great service and food, while they are in Sin City.

Z_ia0q7v_fVB5tMuBBJdCQ.text: The worst experience ever! The " ribeye" was the worst! Waited for 1 and half and got piece of burnt meat!

kQpjPhT2t3uPsUseuYTuGw.text: We picked this restaurant purely on reviews to celebrate our anniversary with a great dinner and a show (La Reve). We arrived a few minutes prior to our reservation time and were asked to wait in the lounge for a few minutes while our table was being prepared. We were greeted by name and congratulated on our anniversary (nice touch). Shortly, we were escorted to our table and seated outside by the edge of the lake...pretty nice spot.   The first person (Sommelier?) to approach us at our table took our drink order and stated our waiter, Mark, would be with us shortly. Mark appeared and ran down the menu for us. We decided to order two different steaks to share, a salad for each and a couple of sides. Our salads arrived and all I have to say is "Mmmm". I had the Baby Iceberg Salad. It arrived, plated beautifully, and the bacon was just perfect. Just a small note...Ask the waiters assistant (Ryan is on point) for just the pretzel bread and an extra dish of the butter (you will understand once you get it). As I was nearing the end of my salad, our steaks arrived. The rib eye was cooked ok, but the filet was over cooked. Now, when I go to what is ostensibly one of the best steak houses in town, what is the ONE think you would expect to be cooked perfectly....the steak. They did offer and I accepted to have it replace with one cooked to my liking but the second arrived a bit undercooked but having tickets to a show forced me to accept the second piece of meat. The au gratin potatoes were just average and the Black Truffled Creamed Corn was soupy and reminded me of grits.   The ambiance was nice as the waterfall changed smoothly though a rainbow of colors. The strange thing was the misplaced "entertainment" on and around the waterfall every thirty minutes. Really...a singing country frog?!? Not sure why the strange distraction. They could omit this sideshow and everyone would have an uninterrupted meal and not sit there scratching their heads.  Overall, I really would like to have reviewed this restaurant better but after spending $200 for two people to dine, EVERYTHING should have been perfect.

tUVF5XbyV_gvqAnN4ghfXw.text: I have been five years ago and they sure have not missed a beat. Still one of best steaks in Las Vegas or anywhere in that matter. Great bread to start. The wedge is one of favorite, it comes with a thick piece of bacon, one of the best wedge salad's you will ever find. The bone in rib eye  is the star of the menu. A great piece of meat that is bursting with flavor. The corn might not look good, but the taste is out of the world.It is a must have. If you are lucky enough to sit outside on a beautiful night , you won't be disappointed. I can't wait to go back soon.

q4FzBhiraghvxAFgZim-4g.text: My fiance and I went for our anniversary and It was great! definitely make reservations to get an good table, I asked for the seat on the balcony and we were sat right next to the waterfall show. they played about every 15 minutes pretty weird I will admit  but entertaining.  food was delicious and the dessert funnel cake was also tasty.

BQTDqPUIG2WeXjqryST23w.text: Let's start off with the good stuff: the shrimp cocktail had four huge delicious shrimp.  Also, the bread was very tasty (they had three different kinds, all good). Finally the water show was a lot of fun: of course it's not a real Vegas show or anything, but it definitely makes the meal more memorable.  Now for the not so good stuff.  My wife and I both ordered the grass-fed steak, and my wife ordered the healthy version of it.  The waiter screwed up and gave me a healthy version too. It was incredibly bland, even for me (and I love bland food normally).  Make sure you are very clear with your waitstaff; evidently they can't handle two people ordering the same dish differently.  I also ordered the "Yukon gold" potatoes.  I don't know what they think "Yukon gold" means at S&W, but to me it means buttery delicious potatoes. What I got instead was very light, very flavorless potatoes.  My wife liked them though.  Then there was the real disappointment of the night: the lobster I ordered with my steak.  It was so overcooked and over-sauced that it literally did not taste like lobster.  Honestly it tasted much closer to the generic cheap fish you get in fish sticks than it did to lobster ... and it cost $40!  As for the service it was ok, but kinda slow given how much the meal costs. The thing that really bugged me was that the waiter didn't once ask me how my meal was, not even after I left the entire lobster dish un-eaten!   Ultimately my bill was about $250, and I really could have gotten a better meal at Red Lobster or Black Angus.  No joke.  If you want a great Vegas steakhouse try Craft Steak instead: their Yukon gold potatoes are AMAZING (as is everything else there). S&W has a great free show, but it's not nearly good enough to justify the low quality food at extraordinary prices.

kdBip_qNcjH7esHiuoEMpQ.text: This is the only place I can get Yoichi 20, the japanese whiskey. just for that, I wanna give this place 5 stars out of 5. Of course the food is extremely good.

PM5GbZybehHPD5RHIUarAg.text: I wasn't disappointed but I'm not screaming from the ceiling either. I've been to quite a few steakhouses so when I review a steakhouse, I compare it to the likes of Del Monico's, Alexander's, N9ne, etc.   The atmosphere is nice. Not too loud and not a library. The decor is nice and I like the bar setting. The crowd seemed a bit more professional type. At this point, I was pretty excited about this experience since I have never been here. And then......our waiter showed up. Mind you he showed up at our table after about 10-15 minutes of us sitting there sipping on water. Right away he asked us if we were ready to order! Dude, we haven't even ordered a cocktail yet! My friend asked him to slow down and get a Sommelier. The Sommelier was nice, friendly and very helpful. When we finally ordered our food, the waiter kept looking around like he was being stalked by the mafia instead of paying attention to us as we're ordering. Frankly, I'm surprised our order arrived without any mistakes.  I had a wedge salad with blue cheese and bacon. The bacon slice was amazing! I could have eaten a bowl of it. I then had the bone-in New York. It was cooked well but was lacking the charred outside which I so desire. It was a good steak nonetheless. I don't recall what I had for desert but I'm sure it was good.  Summary: Food was excellent but the service would keep me from going back there. When you pay $150/head for dinner, I expect great service which I'm used to getting at Del Monico's and N9ne. I don't think I'll be going back to SW (unless of course if someone else is paying).

-10qUphXoEI9HGn24VvLKQ.text: BOOOOORRRRRING.   This place made me want to go to sleep!   Barry Manilow on the radio, dim lighting, no artwork on the walls.  Service was OK.  Food was Amazing.  Great place to go in Vegas if you're 70+

v8QPwbgNUQu8SwQkjw2_Eg.text: Definitely a great experience with delicious steaks. When you call and make a reservation you should mention that you want to sit on the patio so you can get front row seats to the water shows. Don't worry, even tho it was hotter than hell in Vegas the patio was nice and cool.  The food was great if you are willing to trade an arm or a leg. Overall, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a unique and fancy dining experience in Vegas.   Pros: great restaurant setting and show.  Cons: very loud making it less of a romantic dining experience.

qr3xmqKVl4t04YtDU3gSeA.text: 1 word: WOW.  I came here with my parents for Christmas and this place was definitely the best steakhouse I've been to. My father and I shared the Porterhouse for Two, which was a 40oz slab of pure awesomeness. Expensive, but definitely well worth it. My mom had the Pan Roast Scallops which came with four delicious and suspiciously large scallops. Even though the decor wasn't eye candy, the food was definitely perfect. I'd definitely come back whenever I get the chance.

HC_f2JU8SAWBnGuHs0GzuQ.text: I love the Foie gras!   Their mushroom side was the first I've ever tasted.  I'm not sure what kind it was but it was big and steak-like.   Their rare steak wasn't rare enough for me.  I also noticed the bottom counter where they store their wine glasses are dirty with dust.  For an expensive place this was a turn off.

gUgQjTbgtWRHhbckt8zRbA.text: When the waiter said the chile rubbed double ribeye was the best thing they have in his opinion, we had to get it. We thought one order per couple would be fine since the waiter said it was good for sharing, but it turned out to be a lot of food. I'm not complaining though, because it was the most memorable dinner during our trip. I loved every bite of the steak. The second best thing I did in my hotel bed was eat SW leftovers the next morning. Yummm. The foie gras was good but I could've done without it. All our sides were enjoyable in this order of favorite...truffled creamed corn, mac and cheese, steamed asparagus. I was just amazed by how good the bread was. Bacon cheese bread...there were two of these in the basket among some delicious pretzel and wheat bread. We were trying to be polite and civilized by saying no, you can have it...but everybody wanted the bacon cheese bread! It was so good they brought out another basket of it and so we had bacon cheese bread for all, and no one got hurt. Oh and chocolate mint on the way out, I discretely grabbed two for myself 0;D

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M83M_Ts7YvUDr_xuTvVNwg.text: Prior to our most recent trip to Las Vegas, my New York friends had been talking about SW Steakhouse non stop.  "You have to try it, I can't wait to go back, best steakhouse ever" and so on.  Either my expectations going in were way too high, or SW just didn't deliver this time.    Don't get me wrong, it's a very good, very expensive steakhouse.  But best ever?  To quote Jim Carrey from Liar, Liar, "I've had better."  As for the "value-for-the-money," let's just say that Terrell Owens is proving to be a better value to the Buffalo Bills.  Football fans know what I am talking about.  SW Steakhouse is located just below the main casino floor, overlooking the beautiful fountain (if you are lucky to get a table by the fountain).  We didn't.  The four of us were seated right in the middle of the room, at a large rectangular table with a snow white tablecloth.  The only view we had was that of the beautifully dressed women walking to and from their tables.  Yeah, I had no, ahem, beef with the sights.  Our waitress was incredibly chatty and helpful in the very beginning.  She answered all of our questions and replied to every special request with a cheerful "That shouldn't be a problem."  We talked about steaks, discussed her second pregnancy and contemplated the role of mustard and horseradish in today's turbulent economic climate.  I am not exaggerating one bit.  However, towards the end of the meal, our waitress seemed to have disappeared altogether, resurfacing not nearly often enough to check up on us.  My friends brought 2 bottles of wine with them, and the sommelier gladly opened and decanted them . . . for a corkage fee of $50 a pop.  That's $100 in corkage fees alone, for those of you keeping score at home.  This is definitely on the higher end of the corkage range.  We ordered 4 appetizers ($16-$22 each).  I cannot speak to the quality of the shrimp cocktail or the crabcake due to my extreme aversion to shellfish.  I can speak, however, to the quantity: 3 jumbo shrimp and 1 crabcake, respectively.  That'll be $40, please.  The tuna and yellowtail tartar was by far my favorite appetizer, although the fish dish was simple and unoriginal.  The presentation was all Vegas, but the taste was . . . well, also all Vegas.  The chopped salad was refreshing but on the bland side.  We ordered three steaks: the 18-oz bone-in New York strip ($52), the tomahawk dry-aged 32-oz ribeye ($78) and their signature 42-oz chile rubbed double ribeye ($98).  The strip was mine, although my friends gave up on their steaks pretty quickly, so I got to try all of them.    The strip was very good.  It was cooked perfectly and all but melted in your mouth.  I should not have let my friends talk me into getting the jalapeno rub on my steak, however.  It was deceptively strong, and it overpowered any and all flavors of the $50 steak.  Although I am not a fan of ribeye, I have to say that theirs was delicious.  The dry aged ribeye was served on a gigantic bone hanging off the plate (cue The Flintstones music here).  The dry aging made the beef even more flavorful.  The chile rubbed ribeye was pan fried and juicy.  I was a little disappointed that the end pieces were FUBAR (fried up beyond all recognition).  Still, 5 big stars for the meat, with a 1/4 star deduction for the unnecessary jalapeno flavor.  The sides were $10 a pop, which is at the upper end of the range as well.  For $10 they were extremely small, and could hardly have been shared by 4 people.  The creamed corn with truffles tasted watery.  The mushrooms and the potatoes au gratin were good, but ordinary.  We shared two desserts, the chocolate souffle cake and the funnel cake.  The chocolate souffle was as uninspired as it gets; it tasted very rich but it was no different from any other chocolate souffle you'd get in any upscale restaurant.  The funnel cakes, on the other hand, were phenomenal.  Shaped like funnel donuts, they were hanging off the cast iron twigs set on the plate.  It's hard to describe, but it looked like a mini sculpture of twigs decorated with round funnel cakes.  Wow.  They were served with chocolate covered strawberries and 3 dipping sauces: chocolate, salted caramel and creme anglaise.  Oh man!  That funnel cake dipped in creme anglaise - yum!  It's not like the funnel cake you get at a ballpark or at a state fair.  I mean, sure, it's still fried dough and it's still bad for you, but that's where the similarities end.  Our dinner, including the corkage fee and the top cost us $580 or $145 per person.  I really enjoyed the steak and the funnel cakes, but SW is hardly worth the money.  I would take my business to Morton's, Del Frisco or Prime.

87fg2o-WjhIvpARQv7DShQ.text: One of the more memorable 9 oz. filets I've ever had, just cooked to perfection with a nice outer crust.  Heaven with a pink center.  Overall, a very good meal.  Wife had the Caesar salad, which I got to taste.  Very simple, very classic, very well done.  The crouton was amazing.  I went for an appetizer special:  Tuscan salami and duck ham over greens and mushrooms.  The salami was excellent, but everything else seemed to be overly competitive on the plate.  There was a lot going on.  I didn't care for any of the sauces that they present with the steaks, but then again I rarely put anything on a steak these days aside from the tines of my fork.  I had a side of truffled creamed corn, which just didn't work for me.  I enjoy hints of flavors and found the truffle a bit over the top and overwhelming.  Wife had the beef short ribs, which were outstanding, though I found the sauce to be a bit on the rich side.  For dessert we shared a nightly special chocolate souffle.  It was amazing.  It was well accompanied by a very nice cup of cappuccino.  The service was top-notch, attentive, and timely.  Overall, a very good experience worth the money.

OoLgCRQGenCqAlS79CkOmg.text: Simply put- this is one of the best steakhouses in the United States. We started with the chopped salad and Tuna ceviche.  The ceviche was a little plain for my taste, but quality was excellent.  The chopped salad was great when you had a little avocado in the bite. Make sure you find it because it's on the bottom of the tower. My girlfriend had a filet that sliced like butter, and had amazing flavor. I had the ribeye, and it was incredible as well. Compared to another high end steakhouse like say mastros, these steaks were on an even higher level. For sides we did a cream spinach and a mashed potato, both were very good. Every single employee from the water boy to the management was beyond nice. We had several waiters helping take care of our table for two. I would recommend this place to anyone. The views were beautiful as well. I would recommend SW in a heartbeat.

BvBdbXXm0POJ7X_G15vUDQ.text: Two stars for the filet mignon, which lived up to expectations and its high price point, but sadly I was disenchanted with almost everything else at SW Steakhouse...  The steak comes with three sauces (SW signature sauce aka bbq, Bearnaise and jalapeno fruit) and their just seemed to be something off with all of them, though the Bearnaise seemed to be the best of the bunch. Appetizer-wise, we had the foie gras torchon. Maybe I'm so used to having foie gras that's been seared, but I thought this preparation (poached) did not offer much flavor. And the sweet accompaniments (white chocolate biscuits, and golden raisins and cherries that tasted too boozey) did not help.  And of course, since steakhouses are now all a la carte, the sides were extra....As in $10 each extra, though they were enough for two people to share (if one person has a smallish appetite). The au gratin potatoes were fine, nothing special.  Besides the meat, the only other thing I really liked was the bread---baguette and bacon and cheese biscuits---and butter---topped with olive oil and Hawaiian volcanic salt.  I was surprised that this place was pretty packed on a Tuesday night. We may be in a recession, but apparently that hasn't quite caught up with the expense accounts of all the invading conventioners.

we0q9-ieRDwOBSu6XQowYw.text: Went to SW when visiting vegas for my boyfriends' birthday last weekend. The restaurant looked amazing when we came in and had beautiful views. I was very hopeful considering the reviews I had read online... We ordered Caesar salad and the shrimp cocktail to start. The shrimp was large and de-veined perfectly. Our Cesar was great as well and came out with a Parmesan crisp. We were very happy with our starters. Then the main course came out. My boyfriend had the filet and it was great! Good flavor and cut like butter. The char was not thick either. It was perfect. Then we ordered the au gratin potatoes and a Mac and cheese with poblanos and bacon. The au gratin potatoes were tasty and so was the Mac and cheese, although a little cold. THEN came my NY steak and lobster tail... The steak was slathered in so much butter that I thought I was eating a bowl of popcorn. The lobster had so much garlic I could choke. Took two bites of my steak. Took 2 of the lobster. Waitress never asked how my meal was after it was delivered. I was shocked they never asked us to cut open our steaks after they were delivered either. Only crumbed out table 1x as well. Very shocked at the service or lack thereof I should add. For 500 dollar meal for 2, you would expect more service training for the staff and cooks that don't over flavor food so horribly. Thought I was at a Paula Deen restaurant with all the butter flowing like a river. Will not be back to SW to spend my money in vegas.

oZWLUVdww2RkfOaK2VUsIA.text: It's steak. I like our Ruth Chris better back home. Why don't people understand all steak needs is a "little" salt and pepper?! Nice place, good service, huge price.

ON8CdHVvhqTfjtWoovRfzQ.text: Decent selection of steaks and sides. Many of the steaks are very large so you are better off splitting with someone because of the amount of meat and the high prices. The lower rating is because our service this night was really poor.  Waitress came up and just asked if we were ready with no real introduction or tips about the menu. We had to ask her. During dinner she disappeared for a long time and we never really met her replacement. We had to pour all our own wine and rarely got our water filled and they were slow to clear items from the table. We did complain nicely about this at the end and the manager removed the gravity and side dishes from our bill so they were classy about it but I would expect better service for the prices we were paying

lSCLn6g3V2KyGSOpRBVG_A.text: Food was great. First time eating octopus; wasn't disappointed. Beautiful outdoor lakeside view with the frequent shows provided for a pleasant, casual atmosphere.

YOPtrXji6ZuoIA0FwfrNHA.text: BEST steak we have had in a long time.  The ambience is fantastic and staff is lovely.  The wine selection is extensive.  We ordered the crab legs and foie gras for appetizers and they were scrumptious.  If it wasn't a 5 star restaurant, I would have licked my plate in front of everyone!  The bread also melted in your mouth.  They had these cheddar and bacon biscuits that were out of this world!  The pretzel ones are also fantastic.  The bone in Rib Eye is buttery and delicious.  The veal was probably the most flavorful veal I have head - it is extremely well seasoned and cooked to perfection.  The scallops are average, but every thing else was so phenomenal.  Also, do yourself a favor and get the chocolate souffle.  We have a fantastic experience from beginning to end and HIGHLY recommend checking this place out!

OCxj4A0Jv-nA_ZhnUni-3A.text: My husband selected SW based on the most discerning of evaluation processes..he saw Dwayne Wade come out of SW on a previous trip while we were at Parasol Down. Yes folks, that is why we dined there.   The space is very nice and finds a nice balance between trendy and classy, erring on the side of classy. (This is the Wynn afterall). The waitstaff was top notch and dealt with our rather loud party with grace, although I'm sure they have seen much worse. We were just loud.   The wine list left much to be desired so I selected a martini- pear lychee- that was actually quite good. I'm normally not a fan of sweet drinks but this had a real pear sweetness to it and not an artificial flavor. We started with oysters, 2 types, which 2 of our friends loved. My husband thought they were very good, but not the best (reserved for NOLA Gulf oysters).   For my entree I selected the scallops, which were some of the best, if not the best, that I've had since moving out west. One of my friends and I switched entrees halfway through so I could sample the seared tuna, which I found to be incredibly mediocre. The serving size was large but the lack of flavor detracted from the dish. My husband selected the filet mignon, which he said was just mediocre, only because it was a little overcooked. He had asked for medium and thought it was closer to medium-well, there wasn't much pink in the middle - since a filet is a fat piece of steak, medium usually means slightly charred on the outside but still pink in the middle (as opposed to medium rare which is slightly charred on the outside and very pink on the inside, or rare which is charred on the outside and red on the inside).   In the end the bill for a party of 7 came to about $500 which I think is more than reasonable for the caliber of steakhouse that SW is. I would return to SW and I'm sure I will recommend it to friends.

NaR6SolIhzBABgztb2SgeA.text: Fantastic restaurant with fantastic service.  2 main highlights: 1. excellent sommelier 2. tater tots  1. The sommelier was excellent and got us a new bottle of wine after we decided the 2nd bottle was not as good as the 1st.   2. Tater tots- there was something about the tater tots that was just fabulous.  They're more like flavorful potato puffs!  You must get them.    I would totally come here again if i had a craving for steak in Vegas!

ZrBVtwT-yZS4gTP3Kmeilw.text: Went there to try out the Chili Rubbed Rib Eye. There was an episode on the Food Network's, Best I Ever Ate, called the "Best I Ever Ate Vegas". The Chili Rubbed Rib Eye was on that list.  The view was amazing, There is a beautiful outdoor scenic view, which includes a breathtaking water fall. The view alone is  worth a visit to the SW Steakhouse. Ordered the Chili Rubbed Rib Eye for two, Cream of Spinach, Potatoes Au Gratin  and Steamed Asparagus.  Let me start with the sides: I have yet to find many places that serve the perfect Au Gratin, sometimes it is either undercooked, over cheesy or both. There is nothing worse than a undercooked potatoes. That was not the case with these  Potatoes.  They were cooked perfectly, tender like a good au gratin should be. The amount of cheese/cream was just balanced enough that you could still taste the potatoes. Truly one of the best Potatoes Au Gratins I have had. The cream of spinach was outstanding, did not have an overpowering garlic taste, simple and creamy.  The Chili Rubbed Rib Eye was incredible.  It melted in your mouth, very tender and perfect amount of yummy Rib Eye Fat,,. The flavors of the Chili Rub is a very unique twist on the traditional Rib Eye for Two.  Will be back next time in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili Rubbed Rib Eye- Seen on Best I Ever Ate Vegas Episode!

3h3eBadRRtH6vX1VFrYEAg.text: I went here recently with a group of 6...It was not pleasant. I will not be back.  #1-Steak orders...of 5 orders, not a single one was done correctly, even by THEIR standards. Uneven, overcooked, undercooked...you name it.  #2-No problem...you just tell your waiter and he'll make it right...right??? Um...no...the waiter did one of the fastest drive-bys I have EVER seen at ANY restaturant. He was actually running past us as he said "is everything ok?" and wasn't even within earshot by the time we responded 1 second later.  #3-Our reservation was lost. As we were there for a special event, and everything thusfar had been going well, we rolled with it... That is...until the host told us that he had a table, but we were going to have to give it up by 8pm. That left us with exactly 95 minutes to sit, order, sort through the screwups and pack out of there. It didn't happen.  On a good note...our somalier took some requests from us to find a wine suitable to our likes. It sure seemed easier than sorting through their 12 billion listings. What he selected was the best, most accurate selection I have ever tasted. NO arguments here.  Their "shows" aren't worth sticking around for more than once. Yeah...they're something new...but they're stale quickly.

O6udUIzMoYWtqcW0KmExLg.text: I rarely give a place four stars if I don't plan to return there. SW Steakhouse will be an exception to that rule. Although my husband and I aren't huge steakhouse people, which is especially True when we go to Vegas and want to try something really different or exotic, and therefore probably won't go back to SW Steakhouse, we enjoyed our experience there this past visit and thought that the service and food were really good.   We went with the group of 7 that Kristin S and Melissa H were also part of. I agree with Kristin that the restaurant's atmosphere is really nice--upscale without being over-the-top (a balance that is hard to strike in Vegas, I think). The bathrooms (located behind the bar) were also really sleek. I also agree with both of them that the service was attentive and professional. My meal flowed very nicely, and we were never short of refills on our water or alcoholic beverages.   Speaking of drinks, my husband and I really enjoyed our dirty vodka martinis and thought they were really well-mixed. I also thought that my friend's ginger pear martini was really smooth and had great fruit flavor without being saccharin. I can't comment on the wine or beer selection since I didn't have (or think about having) either.   In terms of food, we started off with a dozen oysters. Admittedly, I have not had the privilege or pleasure of tasting the best oysters our nation has to offer (part of the sacrifice you make by living in California and then Arizona), but I have still had many oysters in my time and thought that these were among the best. Many other upscale restaurants and bars in Vegas serve oysters, but they don't seem as committed as SW obviously did to serving the freshest and most flavorful.   For entrees, I shared the scallops and ahi tuna with my friend. We found the scallops to be really well cooked (not grainy or overly tough) and super fresh (no metallic taste at all) and the accompanying pea/parmesan risotto to be hearty yet delicate, but the ahi tuna was very disappointing. It was overcooked and had a very bland taste to it; we definitely didn't taste the Meyer lemon that was supposed to be the dish's signature flavor. This alone is worth docking SW a star over, since I think ahi tuna is a dish that every restaurant worth the salt should be able to produce a good (even if standard) version of.   I also tried a bite of my friend's steak and found it be very tender and flavorful, but I'm no steak connoisseur, so if you are deciding whether the steak at SW will pass the cut (no pun intended), I would read a few other reviews. The final thing I tried was my husband's goat cheese ravioli (ordered off of the appetizer section of the menu)--while the dish was un-original, the filling was rich and the ravioli perfectly al dente. Definitely a solidly flavorful dish.   Overall, SW definitely delivered, although upon returning to Vegas (which will be soon, I'm sure), I'll probably take the $80 per person my husband and I spent at SW and spend it somewhere with a bit more focus on culinary innovation and creative execution.

BZH_0UEqEUycmtqsBB7N5Q.text: This is my third time to this superb steakhouse. Always superior service to any other I've been to in Vegas. Shows on the water , amazing food, always a great experience ! Recommended to everyone looking for a nice place for good steak or many of their other dishes .

AlghnfqV4HWd3-yYb0U8dA.text: I gotta go 5 stars here.  We came for a bachelor party and it was perfect.  The ambiance is great, they have a half indoor/outdoor seating area.  The inside opens up to open air which is covered by a canopy.  You get nice views of the small lake and waterfall fountain.  At night I believe there is a light show that comes on but we didn't stay for that.  You could also sit outside on the patio if you please.  The waiters/hostesses are all very professional.  You feel like a BOSS when you're eating here.  The wine we had was excellent, just bear in mind you're at a nice steakhouse so it's going to be expensive.  Also, make sure to make reservations far in advance, this place gets booked.  Food was delicious and portions are huge.  Some of our group got the steaks that you can share with 2 people, and they still had leftovers.  They are cool items like the double ribeye and the Porterhouse.  I went with the individual bone in rib eye.  A nice add on with the individual steaks that I didn't see come out with the larger ones was the Kobe butter.  Put that on your steak and share the love.  It's amazing.  Everything was cooked to our liking as well.  Side dishes were also good, there is the truffle creamed corn which is solid.  The mushrooms are legit.  Also, it was hard to resist trying the different breads they bring out to you, I would try them but don't get full on them.  Still, it's hard to say no to pretzel bread.  You will be happy you dined here, you get what you pay for.  I'd definitely recommend this for a nice occasion and some solid steak.

CzDwa20JjLpVrr3gbKMMkA.text: So good it's criminal.  I've been many times and whenever I get a steak I ask for the chili rub. It's an amazing conception of spice that you wouldn't otherwise think of having in a steak but its perfection.  Everything they do here is delicious, from the unique cocktails, to seemingly simple soups, to the extraordinary steaks.

NMgriEjYtAMhIfUuJUdzng.text: This is our first dining experience with the SW Steakhouse located inside Wynn Casino. The ambiance was great and it is not your average steakhouse.  But sadly to report, the food is nothing specular that demands this kind of high end pricing reserved for Fine Dining.   For appetizers,  we had the Spanish Octopus, it was so so so salty that I had to dung it in my King Crab soup which was so bland and has no seafood smell less any hint of King Crab.  It had so much minced vegetable sank to the bottom that I was mistaken it to be a vegetable soup.  Then there was the chef special, a small pasta with King Crab and mushroom.  It was just so so.  For the main dish,  we shared the Dry Aged Tomahawk chop.  The flavor was good but not intensed enough for a dry aged steak to our liking.  At least the bottle of red came through for us to save the evening.  Coffee and Lava Cake rounded out the evening.  Our server could have been more attentive.  SW has a nice setting for special occasions.  We may give it another chance in the future.  Thanks.  12/23:  We treated our daughter, who is visiting from NYC, to SW Steakhouse for her birthday dinner .  For the occasion,  the manager reserved a beautiful table looking out into the Lake of Dreams - thank you Samantha .  For appetizers,  we opted for the Spanish Octopus which was tender and tasty, the Tuna Tartare has a nice flavor and presentation,  and the Steak Tartare was excellent.   For the main course,  our server recommended the 70 day aged Hokkaido Eye Round resting on a bed of minced broccolini.  The flavor was most intensed and meat so marbled that we spent the next four hours savoring every morsel between conversations. The Hokkaido import is indeed more marbled and superior than most similary aged meat we have tried and well worth its $50 per ounce price.  SW has redeemed itself before our second round of cocktails with its world class food and great service.  Our Foie Gras finale was prepared superbly and completed our dinner round. The birthday dessert presentation was a treat, it was beautifully done and decadent.  A melting chocolate Lava domed ice cream against  the backdrop of a forest with its trees bearing fruits in the form of Beignet.  A nice hot cup of coffee rounds out the evening for the birthday girl. Thanks.

-yMAHrEShVky-oQPAO-rEg.text: My wife and I enjoyed the food, started with Crab Cakes, a five star for sure, ordered the Tomahawk Chop, which I would rate a 4 (no need for onions and tomatoes to be served on top of the steak), the Au Gratin Potatoes and Creamed Spinach were also good a 4 and 5 rating respectively.  A few lower priced wines added to the selection would be nice.   The major drawback is the ambiance, it is way too loud and too bright in the restaurant,  I felt as though we were eating at a Diner.  I much prefer the experience at John Georges at the Aria, better tomahawk chop and a more relaxing eating environment.

7bssNhT3Ta6dzEdbkO6xsA.text: 5 stars!! I'd give it more if I could. I've been to just about every steakhouse in town.  We have great steakhouses in Las Vegas, BUT, SW stands above everyone else. I've been coming here for several years now. Every chance I have for a celebration, or treating some important guest, SW is on my list of venues to evaluate.  If you're looking for not only great food but also a superb service this is the place for you. SERVICE: Superb. There are several highly trained waiters tending to you and are barely noticeable at the same time.    FOOD: The Bone-In Rib-Eye (medium rare if I may suggest) is out of this world for the lack of a better term. My god the bread buns they bring are out of this world.  Typing this review makes me wanna drive down there.  I hereby declare it illegal to come to Vegas and not try SW! seriously

01Ccdks-T7N91zWYyMf7lQ.text: This was our first visit and we will probably not return. The food was good, but the service was Terrible!  When we spent what we did on the meal, we expected better service. The waitstaff was not very attentive and my water glass was empty much of the time. Again, the food was good, but we left with an icky taste in our mouth because of how we were treated and we noticed others were receiving the same mediocre service. We will go elsewhere next time.

EB6uW0AYfp7tAJxQsEeaGQ.text: SW Steakhouse does a body good.  The Food: How did I finish a 9oz Filet Mignon all by myself?! Ok.. I did share a few slices of my steak with my date, but only because I ate more of his 24oz Bone-In Rib Eye which was equally just as mouth-watering delicious! Accompanied with the Yukon Gold Potato Puree, Sauteed Veggies and Roasted Jumbo Asparagus. YUM & YUM.   The Service: ON POINT! From the time the hostess pulled my chair out and put the napkin on my lap.. to bringing out our complimentary SW chocolate covered macarons for dessert.. and everything in between - was perfect.  The Show: We were seated front row view of the Lake of Dreams. The heat lamps everywhere made it feel like a summer night in the freezing cold weather. As I took bites of my steak, I watched the dancing balls. The shows were weird.. yet funny & entertaining!  The Verdict: I'd come back here again and again for the food, but also for the giant singing frog that I somehow missed.

afrWswClJV_4KeE91v-ICg.text: As good as it gets!  I went here with six other ladies and had the time of my life.  We were a table of good vibes, laughing and telling jokes the entire night.  I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised by the ambience and setting too!!  It's just stunning!  I'd recommend a table out on the patio.  Those have the best views for the water shows on the lake.  That was a total surprise!  I loved it!!  And the service was ON POINT!  Tyler, thank you for being one of the coolest waiters I've ever had the pleasure of meeting.  You and your team were top notch!!  I honestly can't even remember what kind of meats we ordered, but everything was delicious.  Kudos to ALL the staff for making it a memorable night.  Thank you for your service.  I'm coming back when I want another special, celebratory night out!

v3S7JnKvRQpnqTLwA2b1ag.text: If you are looking for a traditional steakhouse with impeccable service, great menu and outstanding food then this is the place for you. My GF and I shared the porterhouse with scampi and as many 1/2 size portion sides as our table would fit...we highly recommend the cream corn and braised carrots, they where nothing short of awesome !!  Highly recommend this restaurant and we will definitely be adding this to our list of top steakhouses around the country.

NDS_BX9oVa8dcCfzZyUM2g.text: Probably one of the most high-class, refined restaurants you can find on the Las Vegas Strip. The unique food, precious decor, and amazing service make this restaurant one of my top choices when deciding on a steakhouse. Unfortunately, it is a bit pricey, but in the end, it is all worth it. Even their bread and butter is like no other. Their flavorful steaks and seafood are all too overwhelming.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Baby Iceberg Salad

EMDJj_JbvjFnAH7LpcA41A.text: Swanky, lively, crowded and a bit pricey.  Great wine selection if you are traveling on business :) . We enjoyed the seafood appetizer, breads were delicious and the aged chili rubbed rib eye was reason enough to recommend it to any meat lover.  I will be back with my wife.

o0v0GK_OtD_L3c0KSIs1Tw.text: Absolutely stunning meal.  Had dinner with my gf and some friends on a weekend in Vegas. We arrived on a Saturday evening with no reservations and were seated in about ten minutes. Ad usual I was dressed in jeans, T-shirt, and hoodie... no problem.   Started out with a SW Manhattan cocktail. The drink was flavorful and smooth. Had another to confirm.  For apps I ordered the king crab legs with sage butter (seasonal,) my friend ordered the tartare. The legs were out of this world. Firm flesh and huge size. The sage butter and lemon made for the vest crab experience I've ever had.  Entree was the Wagyu, gf got the bone in rib eye, medium. Steaks we're perfect and flavorful.   I will be back.

S7S5NG8oZ07d4iIbVwjniA.text: SW Steakhouse is easily in my Top 2 steakhouses of Las Vegas.  In my opinion, there's a sizable gap down to #3.  If you love steak, you owe it to yourself to give SW Steakhouse a visit.  This restaurant does every aspect of dining at a 5-star level:  Atmosphere:  Located on the Lake of Dreams that offers a quick "show" every 30 minutes, it really elevates the dining experience.  Service:  Always been top notch.  Food:  The bread, salad, appetizers, entree, sides and dessert are all amazing.  Here's my recommended order:  Bread:  Pretzel  Salad:  Half caesar  Appetizer:  I skip the appetizer to save room for the entree + sides and possibly dessert  Entree:  Pepper Crusted Chateaubriand for 2 prepared medium rare.  This obviously requires that you split the dish with another person, unless you're really hungry or an NFL linebacker.  Sides:  The Creamed Corn is an absolute must order.  I get it every single time.  After that I recommend the Yukon Gold Potato Puree.  Dessert:  I rarely have room for dessert after a meal of this caliber, so I'm not able to recommend any particular item.

SR0QEnzJL0QptS1TUmKFFw.text: The worst steakhouse I have ever been too. Wish i could give this place 0 stars. I ordered the chili double ribeye. It was ehhh...  Never been to a place where the temperature of the meat is different all over. I ordered my meat rare. Some pieces were rare, medium well, well done, and overcooked meat. The meat was so tough that I didn't even finish my meal. Either the chef didn't know how to cook or he's off and they just put someone  on to make something.   We paid $130 for something that taste like shit.   Definitely, never coming back to Sw to eat. I had better steakhouse! Alexander's steakhouse in San Francisco had the best kobe beef and cook their meat properly. Also Killen's steak house in houston is awesome too.

1ZPcQ5-scgqsZLd2ESGdRw.text: Just ok food, slow inattentive service. There are much better places to eat in Vegas .  We had high hopes despite reading negative reviews but unfortunately the negative reviews were correct

lRSDSSC70lcKn0Am1sn2Fw.text: This is the second time we've been to SW.  The first time we ate indoors which is pretty formal.  This last time however, we sat outside near the fountains.  They have a brief water show every few minutes...very Steve Wynn!! It was amazing how inform outside felt... and was quite a contrast to eating inside... Enough about that....The steaks were nothing short of wonderful!!  We started with the chopped salad, excellent!!  And finished the evening with espresso's. Our server was Alan and he was perfect!!  not there all the time, just when you needed him. Will I go back??  YOU BET!!

unBdEq4T6xxNMF8sXmOZtw.text: Best steak I have ever had. Wait staff was second to none. The tuna tartare was to die for. The show was also cute. I can't wait to go back

QFUq0FAd9sVKtvmENgZbxA.text: The quality of meat, services, and setting are top of the line. Getting the best seats and reservation might get tricky. Usually they won't take you to the best seats available. You will have to "request" it. Everyone knows the bone in rib eye is the best because of its softness.

Si5FR7Ljo6ovJKVjCRQVyQ.text: I stopped at SW last night wth my Babe and had a fabulous dinner at SW.  We arrived at 7 were seated a great table in the main dining room where we could check out the restuarant.  The place was packed for a Mon night.  Although we were at the rear of the restauarant, we could still see the Wynn Fountains and the bright lights that echoed off the water.  The decor and ambience is utter luxury and glam......just like the rest of the Wynn Hotel....very romantic.  After we ordered our Whiskies, we looked at the menu and decided to go with the Steak Tartare; 12 oz Bone-in Filet; Corn Puree and the Panna Cotta for desert.  The Steak Tartare was awesome.....full of beef flavor that was so freaking satisfying......almost as a good as a BJ.  I could have left after the appetizer and have been completely happy.  The Filet and Corn were also excellent...very tasty.  The Filet was prepared a perfect medium-rare and was sooooo good.  The Steak and Corn flavors melted very well together.  The Panna Cotta came with a Mango Sorbet ands was out of this world.  The service staff was OUTSTANDING!!!!!  We were waited on hand and foot all night.  Overall, the BEST Steakhouse in Las Vegas...its a tie with Gordon Ramsay!

tSafUItW4M3pIziFLleEWw.text: This review is long overdue but I didn't want to leave SW out of my Vegas chronicles, since our meal there was one of the best parts of my friend's bachelorette weekend earlier this month.   Our server, Juan, and the other gentleman who worked our table that night went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience. We were seated at a large round table right on the patio, providing awesome views for the water shows. No water glass went unfilled, and our (excellently made) drinks were promptly delivered to keep the happy buzz going through the night.   It should be noted that the bread basket at SW is insane. Cheddar bacon biscuits tasted more like mini breakfast sandwiches. Unreal.    Everyone ordered a starter although in hindsight we probably could have split them or shared a bunch because they were huge. But hey, it was our big night out and we were ready to treat ourselves. My crab salad (a special) was really delicious, but my friend's baby iceberg salad looked equally awesome.   Mostly everyone ordered steaks for their main courses which was obviously a good idea considering the place. My knife sliced through a medium rare filet like butter. Bernaise and peppercorn sauces added nice flavor but weren't entirely necessary, either. Sides of creamed spinach, au gratin potatoes, lobster mac and cheese and fingerlings with bacon were portioned to share. All were very rich so a dollop from each ramekin was perfect between the seven of us.   Desserts including one particularly delicious banana offering, along with a tree of individual-sized funnel cakes with chocolate and creme anglaise dipping sauces were divine. Everyone was full, everyone was happy and every penny was well spent. I will absolutely dine at SW again the next time I'm in Vegas.

YzZxgIJgO2t507RTFvAu3Q.text: I've been meaning to come to SW Steakhouse for quite sometime now and after a failed attempt to get a reservation back in April, I was determined to get one the next Vegas round.   We arrived a little past our reservation but we were promptly seated in the outdoor seating area next to the waterfall, which I might add was very beautiful and totally complimented the dining experience. They put on little shows for you as soon as the sun sets, they also have lights reflecting onto the water that change in color. So pretty! =)  APPETIZER SAUTEED FOIE GRAS w/ Grilled Pineapple, Brioche Toast and Blackberry Jam- Oh what a dish this was, the foie gras was perfectly seared (not burned, like the last foie gras I had). The pineapple added a nice contrast to the foie gras, at first I wasn't too sure it'd be a good combination BUT it was. Also the blackberry jam complimented the foie gras very well.  I'M GOING TO NEED MORE WATER 42OZ CHILI RUBBED DOUBLE RIBEYE- Like Cherylynn N. mentioned, this dish was featured on Food Networks "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" so we had fairly high hopes for this dish. SO DISAPPOINTING,  the chili rub was way too overpowering, too salty, too much seasoning, IT WAS JUST TOO MUCH and too much of something can't always be good.  I found myself having to drink a couple of glasses of water because the rub was too overbearing and took away from the steaks flavor! I'm shocked that this would be on "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" because this didn't come anywhere close to being the best thing I ever ate. Oh, might I add that our steak was OVERCOOKED!!  SIDELINERS BLACK TRUFFLE CREAMED CORN, PARMESAN CREAMED SPINACH, MAC 'N CHEESE, FINGERLING POTATOES w/ Green Beans & Bacon- Our of all the sides, I thought the mac n' cheese was the best. Why? Because I like mac n' cheese, that good enough for ya? =X   THERE'S ALWAYS ROOM FOR DESSERT FUNNEL CAKE & STRAWBERRIES w/ Anglaise, Salty Caramel and Fudge Sauce- THANK GOD FOR DESSERTS! This was the best out of all the dishes we had. The funnel cake was soft and warm and when dipped in any of the 3 dipping sauces was like taking a bite of heaven.   HI, YES WE'RE STILL HERE! (SERVICE) So, our waitress was MIA more than half the time. I don't remember her checking on us at all but I watched her multiple times go to tables where older customers were seated and checked up on them. The only times we saw her was when we placed our orders, when our friend had to complain about his steak because it was WAY OVERCOOKED and when she handed us the bill. A restaurant in the Wynn lacks service in their restaurants, I'm shocked.   OVERCOOKED Ah, now you must be wondering about the overcooked steak. If not, YOU BETTER START TO WONDER!! =X jk. All joking aside, our friend had to send his steak back because his steak was cooked well-done instead of medium-rare. How in God's name does a steakhouse overcook a steak? How can you call yourself a steakhouse if you can't properly cook a steak, I don't understand!   Our waitress then asked our party if everyone's steak was cooked to their liking but she said it in a tone, a tone like "UGH F%^&, ANYONE ELSE??" *flips the bird* WHATEVER LADY.  CONCLUSION Never coming back here, I'm so disappointed. The restaurant is a beautiful one but beauty can't mask what's truly inside and what's truly inside, an MIA waitress and overcooked steaks. The foie gras, dessert and enchanting waterfall could not save this review from being 2 stars because I didn't come here for either one of those things. I came here for a good steak and that's NOT what I got, all I got was a bag full of disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday Cherylynn N. and Nicole S.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RDtW3nOkmlvR8FidUJs6lw.text: Went there expecting great service and great good. Food was amazing when it came and service was terrible. Wait staff was rude and disrespectful. When escalated to management nothing happened. Took over 45 minutes to get bread and almost an hour to get the check. Horrible. Escalated again to management and was told "I talked to wrong person before. That was my fault why things didn't improve. " NEVER Going back. So disappointed.

cwxXjaW8CW-aGOzNna7_Cw.text: This was the ultimate dining experience.  Pampered from the moment I walked in to the very end.  The food was amazing, but watching the water fall made it mesmerizing.  It was a thoroughly perfect dining adventure.  The wait staff was amazing and so attentive every minute.  I dined on a shrimp cocktail for my appetizer and had the scallops with risotto for the main course. I had been warned to save room for dessert and am so happy that I did.  The Floating Island was to die for, thank you very much!   You won't go wrong with a trip to the Wynn and dinner  at SW Steakhouse.  Bon Appetite!

k421-ohptvQ1172_Xh4_Ag.text: Ate here for the first time and first impressions the wait staff is wonderful!  So we essentially has 3 people assigned to our table (it's been a week but I think there names are right) first Chris asked us about  drinks and got us started,  then Ken  (actually not sure about this one) asked us if he could help us with the menu and took our order.  Then Cesar was our table clearer water pourer. They are extremely attentive and eager to help make your meal wonderful. Unfortunately I am dairy free and they made sure that my meal remained such.  The "show" during dinner included a giant singing frog and flowers but was enjoyable.  Decor is warm. Food fantastic.  One minor complaint or annoyance for me on the menu there is an all natural filet.  Now if your into healthy eating you know all natural is bunch of nonsense all natural means mamy different things lots of then not actually being anything natural.  So when I asked what there all natural meant I was told organic.  I hope that was True because that is what I ordered so to the chef you may want to make that clear if it is indeed organic. Would I Return yes!

093MixVoozERDfRtC1sBRQ.text: There were 8 of us that ate here during the weekend, 4 ordered the filet mignon, 3 didn't finish their steaks. Too salty and not good quality was the consensus. I ordered the vegan meatballs with polenta (my stomach was hurting and needed something lighter than steak), tasted like real meat but again, way too salty. Sides of mac n cheese and potato gratin, I was told these were also salty. Get the theme here? Or maybe that's how Americans eat - with tons of salt on everything?  The bread they start you off with are really good though! Especially those bacon bits biscuits. Sloooooooooooooooo service. If you ain't paying the big bucks, you are getting served last, for everything (water, food, bill, etc).  Very nice view of the waterfall area they had.   It's not my cup o' tea and will not go back.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan &#34;meat&#34;balls with polenta

PrsIKaL-N68b0D1gbP84ng.text: A Saturday night out in Vegas with the man wouldn't be complete without a nice, romantic meal on the lake of dreams.   Service is top notch, drinks, decor and the food are all what you would expect from the only five-star, five Michelin restaurant in Vegas.   We started with the grilled shrimp...perfectly succulent, tender blackened shrimp served with a light, citrusy cucumber salad.   Next the 30 oz tomahawk steak was presented bone in and took. Me. Second to not wanna scream abba dabba doo, but was so tender and juicy. This is their most expensive steak coming with an $104 price tag, but since most of their steaks come in at around $50-$60, it's actually economical and delish!   The garlic broccolini was perfectly sauteed and swimming in garlic goodness.   Get their anytime after 730 to enjoy the show on the lake, and reveal I'm the romance and sin of sin city

Q4-nW0EcEecR6OfkCO8Bdg.text: I've been to a number of steakhouses in Las Vegas and none of them stand out - for the food. This place stood out for two things. First, the water show. Second, the prices. I have no qualms with paying exorbitant prices for outstanding food. I have a slight problem paying exorbitant prices for marginal food. This is marginal food.  The steaks were about as good as you can find at any other steakhouse. Some of the sides, appetizers and salads were above average. I think when you're spending $100+ per plate on dinner, it ought to be off the hook good. Not so at SW Steakhouse.  Slightly upturned face.

SZXNHkze3XrW4cu_HlXT4g.text: Quite disappointed.   My husband and I have been coming here every time we come to Vegas (about once a year) for at least the last 6 years. My husband made reservations for us to go last night and we were so excited for our anniversary date.   For starters the ambiance is beautiful. We sat outside which is our favorite place to sit because of the beautiful setting.  Our server: the reason we were so disappointed with our experience. He started the evening well, but the second we received our food he disappeared for over 45 minutes! No one checked on our food or asked us if my husband wanted a 3rd cocktail or me a 2nd glass of wine. Nope, instead we sat there with no additional drinks and by the time he did roll around he asked us if we wanted dessert and we were just over it.  Food: a couple things went wrong that don't usually last night. My husbands medium steak was cooked well done. Of course we were never checked on for this to be corrected. The au gratin potatoes we ordered were so strange. So salty and all cream (we literally had one small bite and left the rest). Since our waiter never checked on us, another server ended up coming and cleaning our table off (not even asking how things were or why we left our au gratin untouched or my husbands steak half eaten).   When you go to a restaurant of this caliber, you expect a certain level of service which gives you a good experience and honestly, we have been to restaurants before that have food issues (it happens) that were promptly corrected and we walked away with a smile on our face. But when your server doesn't even care to ask you how your meal is and you are stuck eating a rubberized steak and can't have more alcohol and can't eat the potatoes you were dreaming about for the last year you walk away quite disappointed.  I don't know if we will go back on our next trip. We might have to break our tradition and find a new home that appreciates its patrons a bit more.

pKAAZk4rdGzvVgcSTPo-WA.text: We had a group go here after a conference.  I have to admit the food was amazing but the service was terrible!  I didn't know the type of place we were going so was not compliant with their dress code.  It was 110 degrees outside and I was in shorts.  When I was not allowed to sit with the rest of my party, I went back to my room at another hotel and changed.  I get places having dress codes but we were sitting outside and I have no idea why it was so strict.  The girl who "talked" to me was rude and condescending.  I'm sure if I looked like I had a bunch of money, she would have let me be seated with the rest of my group.   That being said, when I got back after changing, we ordered and the food was amazing.  It was one of the best cooked steaks I've had.  The "show" entertainment out in the pond was interesting.  I'm pretty sure I saw a red giant ball and a blue giant ball have sex and produce a little purple ball.  I have no idea who comes up with this stuff but we were laughing a lot at the shows every thirty minutes or so.  So for food, 5 stars.  Service 1 or 2.  Gets me to this average.

gZOtPGSCBG9AXduetHUt8Q.text: This is one of my most favorite restaurants in Vegas....I need to start branching out a little more :)  We came her for a friends bachlorette party. We snacked on crab cakes, carpaccio, filets, scallops, salads and sides.   The service is impecable and the ambiance is somewhat romantic and formal.   My scallops were amazing..pretty much everything was to die for. Our mac and cheese was pretty bland, but i'll forgive them. We ordered cosmopolitians and wine, what a great selection.   I will most defintely be back.   My recommendation: scallops, good to eat before a long night out.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpaccio... Went to quick. BEST!!! Sautéd capers!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake $19
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea salt butter

5sTy4tGuZLqZ9sfxvCKR_g.text: Try to sit outside next to the waterfall/pond thing they have, as there are a handful of water shows that happen about every 15 minutes.  None of the shows are that great, but it breaks up the meal, it's a great setting, and the meal was amazing.  I took my (now) wife there for her birthday, and I arranged for their pastry chef to make a cake for her.  Apparently, their pastry chef won some national cake-making competition.  The one she made for us looked like a present with a bow on it!  Pretty amazing stuff.    Steaks and the service were very good, but the outdoor setting is what sets this apart.

rXhJwrYCh8KVKbC_PAiFGQ.text: i ate here on 10-25-14 around 6 pm.  i made reservations for 1 only a couple hours before.  when i arrived i was wearing a suit due to a previous business meeting.  as i was being seated i was slightly overdressed compared to other guests.  lol.  the service was impressive.  i'm not sure if i had great service because i ate early in the evening.  but i had 4 different staff meet my needs.  holy ambiance batman!  the interior of the restaurant was pretty dang nice!  not sure how one is able to sit outside.  i didn't bother and took a table inside the restaurant facing the water/light show.  the bread basket was freaking amazing!  best free bread i've ever had!  my caesar salad was good.  my taste buds do say the salad was a little over priced.  for dinner i ordered a 20 ounce bone-in ribeye and a side of mac & cheese.  The ribeye was great.  It was no different than any other $60 prime ribeye.  the steak was not caked in butter and seasoning.  it was quite tender and had good marbling and very juicy.  the mac & cheese was a huge portion and very good.  for dessert i have no idea what i ordered but it tasted good.  dinner for 1 adult before tip was $115.  i would definitely go back!!
