On this occasion, however, our experience was instantly tainted by a real stronzo (use google translate to Italian, if you'd like to know what that means) by the name of Fabrice.   Fabrice greeted us... or better, looked us up and down. Me in my Louboutin's, Nicole Miller gown and my husband in his Gucci shoes and Burberry suit... and apparently he was displeased. We had just gotten to Vegas, I had made our reservations months in advance and we smiled, said hello and told him of our reservation.   He said, "Patio" and I corrected him saying we'd made a reservation on the glass, on the patio. He intently stared and me, I stared right back and he said that it was 7:30pm on a Wednesday in Las Vegas and there was no glass seats on the patio available. I asked how long we'd need to wait and he said that there wouldn't be one available this evening.   I was not a happy girl. This was, up until now, our favorite restaurant in Vegas. We have been a dozen times, we have had friends go because we've suggested it and we always spend a pretty penny. Being So Cal folks, we love their foie gras, a delicacy we can no longer enjoy in the golden state!   A kind hostess, said she had a great table, wonderful view of the "show" and it was 1/2 inside and 1/2 outside... I looked at my husband, who really wanted some Foie Gras and we decided to stay. Despite my better judgement... there are a lot of fabulous restaurants in Las Vegas.   Upon being seated, something because strikingly obvious... there was not one, but two seats for two, right on the glass.   WHAT A STRONZO! We were furious......   Clearly this seems like an overreaction, but when you are accustomed to great service, at this restaurant (and other), this was just an obvious "he doesn't like us" "we don't belong here" kind of thing and that makes me mad.   I hate being discrimnated against and there was clearly a case of that going on.   As usual, the Foie Gras appetizer was fabulous, the ribeye topped with seared foie gras was  good (not great, the ribeye) our wine from James the Sommelier (Relic Cabernet) was perfect and our after dinner port was delightful.   Mike and Corey, our servers were fantastic, attentive and kind... but it's hard to put a better taste in our mouth after Fabrice.   I doubt we will go back to SW, having dined and spent nearly double at CUT the next night... with EXCEPTIONAL service and flawless food... I think we found a new favorite and a new place to recommend (at our favorite hotel too, Palazzo, where we stay).   All in all, I'm disappointed. We really liked SW... it was special to us. Perhaps one day we'll go back... but if it's Fabrice who's greeting us.... I will walk right back out.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We were told that when we have a reservation at 7:30 they can&#39;t give us a table requested, on the glass. Weird there&#39;s one open.

yvODoVbwOWarBMm5UvYZNg.text: Tbh SW didn't quite live up to the hype. Our steaks were pretty standard, we've had much flavorful quality steaks at our favorite steakhouse back in Seattle. The brussel sprouts were quite different. They were served with a mustard cream sauce, which may win some taste buds over, maybe just not mine. Would have preferred just a roasted brussel sprout with a vinaigrette or garlic.   We did love the pretzel bread, took that to go. Best pretzel bread ever!

1yBGtcMBB2_Rmqs_tXVgRg.text: The bone in ribeye was phenomenal! Perfectly medium rare on the inside and grilled to perfection on the outside. The creamed corn and spinach were just astoundingly delicious!! We sat right in front of the waterfall and to say the view is amazing is an understatement. There was a show occurring every 30 min that I felt was a little too bizarre for me, but maybe it's bc I had a little too much champagne lol

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IQYIXBGnO02QUdhqd0Tnhw.text: This place...  I had extremely high hopes for this place after reading reviews, and seeing some youtube videos on the chef.  Sadly the night went horribly and I was stuck with a bad taste in my mouth and a 300 dollar check.  Me and a group of friends started planned this outing as we visit high end restaurants around town around every month or so.  It's normally a great light hearted excursion were we cast aside price, and focus on getting some really great food.  We started at the bar right outside, and waited for our reservation time, and were seated a few minutes later.  Me and the GF started with the crab cakes.  These were incredible.  Light and fluffy, yet firm enough to eat with a fork.  By far the best part of the meal as the service slid quickly down hill shortly after.  The GF doesn't eat red meat, so she got the fish, and how can I pass up the 130 dollar big boy of them all... The porter house.  So the time comes for our table to receive our main course, and right off the bat, they forgot my Girlfriend's fish...  WTF?  The waiter checks in note pad, and there it is glaring him in his face that he just botched up a meal that will cost more than he is going to make in the day.  Not a good start.  They manage to hustle one out for her from the kitchen about 10 minutes after we all started eating.  So the couple sitting across from me got the same steak as me, only they were planning on splitting it.  Makes sense, it is steak for 2 right? I wanted left overs, so I got one just for me.  So our steaks come out, along with about 10 people serving our table of 6, and there is silverware, and vegetables flying everywhere as these people quickly and efficiently serve taters, and veggies.  Than comes time for them to serve the meat...  My 130 dollar piece of delicious porterhouse was put on other people's plates.  Let that sink in.  130 dollar steak, gets it's serving botched.  I'm pissed when I see this, but calmly call over the waiter after the dust settles.  He asks me what can he do for me to make me happy?  Good answer right?  WRONG!  I tell him I just paid 130 bucks to have my meat given to everyone else, and I don't think I should have to pay for 130 dollars in steak, when 85 bucks worth of it is sitting on other people's plates!  I'n not going to eat the other couples meat, as they had their grubby mits in it already, and hell that's their steak not mine.  His response was to comp me a Jim Beam and Coke from the bar.  yes...  Comp me a 6 dollar drink...  that should make up for your incompetence.  You ruined my entire dining experience, and now I'm vegan...  Next Christmas will not be spent at this establishment.

PthNbYtkwMolUbuKIbaaow.text: Horrible service, I don't know if it was because my girlfriend and I look young or what was going on. Server was short and abrupt, food took forever for both our starters and entrees, then we wanted our food to go but they threw it away instead so he took mine off the bill.... all in all lousy service come on sw steakhouse up your game.

u4IdmnqfnjkUbjsASVrwrg.text: I've been a yelping freeloader for many years. I use yelp everyday. This is my first review. I'm also a chef. So I hold very high standards to fine dining.  I'll make it sweet and short.  We had a group of about 15 on a Friday night during Memorial Day weekend. Very busy night. They put us in one of the private rooms in the back. I would have to say the food was executed very well. We had Wagyu steak, King Crab legs which was absolutely delicious. Halibut, Filets, Chicken, Ribeye.  I didn't have one bad thing to say. That is very rare believe me when I say that.  Bread was really good especially the pretzel.   Servers were a little slow at clearing plates. But did hustle when asked to clear them.  I would recommend SW to anyone who appreciates a great meal that's done right.

7aF1mRxo8HTuUunLEcM5PA.text: Completely overrated.  Steaks tasted old like meat were not fresh..service way below par....don't waste you time or $$$.  Entire Wynn is on a fast downhill track.  Venetian however is wonderful.  Checked out of Wynn and switched to Venetian due to overall bad experiences at Wynn.  Lots of prostitutes everywhere. Not a safe place.

GK2DRviuL4_skJ9mvzG-CQ.text: A MUST go to while in Vegas First Class all the way as the Staff go Above and Beyond to make you feel welcome and treat you like royalty I must say and the Food is incredible.Ive eaten at a lot of Top Notch steakhouses all over the US and this one is at the top of my list between the environment the decor the food the entertainment and the staff Five Star all day every day and my wife and I will definitely be back SOON!!

GxKdqolhdXZ2DOy-zXNu-A.text: I went with my cutie petutie for our anniversary and it was a memorable night.  The service was excellent... it felt like we had a 2:1 server to client ratio.  People were popping out of nowhere to refill water, bring us bread, serve appetizers and the main meals.    The food was great as well... our steaks were cooked to perfection and I recommend getting your steak topped with the crispy garlic and rosemary.  Absolutely fantastic!  My cutie petutie didn't mind the water show and talked me out of reducing the rating from 5 to a 4.  I personally thought the water show was cheesy and almost distracting to the nice evening.    We already planned our next anniversary... we will be heading back the SW!

eqLLsnPTfsoZd_zjA9XBYA.text: Very nice---but noisy--place. Why is it so noisy at the Wynn and Encore? Fellow Yelper Jim T. and I went to this place because we like a good steak and will try it anywhere. We decided to split the 40 ounce Porterhouse. Not only do you get more meat, but it is cheaper than getting two steaks of any size separately.   I started with a wedge that I asked to be chopped. They chopped it, but it was way overdone with Bleu Cheese. The bacon was not very flavorful and overdoing the Bleu Cheese only made this dish average.   Now to the steak: We ordered it medium. It came Medium-rare on the strip side, but well done (no pink) on the fillet side. What saved the day here, is Jim T didn't mind the medium rare and the flavor was very good. It was crusted just so, with a hint of salt and pepper.   I asked for the SW sauce and the server brought out a trio of sauces: The SW sauce, (which is sort of an A-1/barbeque blend thingy), Worcestershire, and a hot pepper sauce. I skipped the hot pepper stuff.   Side dishes were grilled asparagus and au gratin potatoes. The sides were very nice and complimented the meal.   After dinner we felt like a drink. I noticed they had vanilla ice cream for desert and asked if they could do a Brandy Alexander for me. "Sorry, Sir, we can not do that since there is not a blender at the bar."  "No blender anywhere?" I said.  "Sorry, sir. It would take forever to get drinks out of the bar if we were blending drinks." He said. Really. He said this! Interesting that Applebees and Chili's can figure out how to run an efficient bar, but The Wynn can't? Really?   Anyway we settled for a glass of Port that was very good.   I really wanted to like this place. And will if I have a better experience next time. The steak was very good--if not how we ordered it. So, I will give it a provisional two stars now--may change it later.   Overall I enjoyed Switch more (see my yelp on that) because the steak was better.   And Steve, get the bar a blender.

3w7_LcvSWf4XVUbxogDQJQ.text: SW is the perfect place for a business dinner. I've had better steak at the Nine at the Palms, but the SHOW and the view here are spectacular. Your corporate guests will be over the top pleased.   Located in the Wynn hotel, on the lower level, the restaurant is in cased in all glass with outdoor seating that looks out to a waterfall that cascades into a still body of water. On the top of the waterfall there is a gigantic fabric frog lite up and sways in the wind. Once the show starts, the frog disappears and huge flowers come out from the wall. It's Vegas fabulous for sure. They have the water show about every 30 minutes that will have you and all your guests mesmerized. No one does it like they do in Vegas. The show is spectacular.   3 1/2 stars for food  4 stars for the ambiance and show   Best place for a business dinner, or to impress first timers to Vegas.

7Pz40x1XBlIJyIbR_gsrcg.text: This place is expensive!!! Great steak, lobster tail and martinis. This is something I totally expected, but the black truffle oil risotto was outstanding and you may laugh but the bread was outrageous. My only criticism was that the mashed potatoes where a little salty.

4iHezDFdlMrKhyiVIYtJCA.text: For starters I'm not really a 'Steak Guy'.  I like steak enough I'm just rarely in the mood for it and it's never something i crave.  We dined at SW @ The Wynn last night and while the staff was great and the wine list was well rounded I felt the food and the atmosphere were just OK.    The decor looks like just about any hotel restaurant in any big city and doesn't really have an distinguishing features.  The tables are nice and big and our table of 7 had plenty of room for glasses, side plates etc.    As for the menu the starters looked more inter sting then the mains for the most part.  I guess if you are looking for a straight-ahead steak then you'd not be disappointed.  The Roasted Hen was also quite nice as was the rack of lamb.  My heirloom tomato was trying a little to hard and over sauced.    Maybe I'm just not used to the no frills attitude that most steak houses tend to rock and need to adjust my expectations.  The nice thing about the Wynn is that there's always somewhere else to try.

98E078MQusWAMS4MrpsERQ.text: One of the best steaks I've ever had. Ordered the following sides for a table of 5:  -Truffled cream corn (super good) -Mac and cheese (above average) -Asparagus (I don't know what to do with green vegetables at a steak house. They confuse me) -Fries (meh)  My bone-in rib-eye was perfectly cooked and seasoned. I topped it with the seared foie gras, and honestly, while I love buttery, fatty goose liver, the steak didn't need it. I just figured that I would go all-out over-the-top VEGAS, BABY, VEGAS! with it.   As many reviewers have already mentioned, the fresh bread basket was superb. The fresh sourdough and bacon cheddar bread were warm out of the oven and delicious. When we were packing to go, I mentioned that "I wouldn't mind if some of those bacon cheddar rolls somehow ended up in there" and our server packed up an entire container of extra bread for us!   Next time, I will try the funnel cake, because that looks awesome. Total tab (with a moderately expensive bottle of wine) came out to about $110 pp. Not too shabs.

IbRFQKIsbrONBh7f-mJZQw.text: Ordered a rib eye, it was seasoned well and the taste was good. The sides were  small though (and expensive).  I was  impressed with the dessert (yes overpriced but Vegas). We also enjoyed the lake shows, especially the singing frog  Will I go back there? Maybe, Vegas offers a lot of alternative  Why 4 stars? There were larger business dinners when we're there and seems that the waiters were more focused to their tables. Took them a while to refill my water and my client's drink

lVuPEsWYOoMLwlbPTPS4aw.text: Decent steakhouse, but not the "best of the best' as Wynn is outspoken about. The steaks were cooked well, but the meat quality is mediocre. Their rib-eye was a bit fatty and had too many tendons. It didn't taste like a well-aged steak. Their sides were excellent as were other dishes, such as their scallops and oysters. Overall I would have given this place four stars for all of their food, but it's a steakhouse and that's where I'm weighing my review.  Also I know I'm from Chicago (and a lover of meats) when I looked at their menu and read that their 40 ounce porterhouse was for two and thought it should be for one.

zaJxnb4V2M0CNRkqGyzGuQ.text: One word, HORRID.  Service was atrocious and food was disgusting.  Will not be back.  Waiter could not be bothered to bring water or check on how our meal was even though he could clearly see that we were not eating it. Threw the check on the table and walked away.

bRsDZ44CD3uhGnRY3NeQhQ.text: I've been to SW a few times now, most recently tonight, and I think they get it 95% right. The only thing really keeping them from a five star rating is the front end service at the hostess stand. I've read that is a problem for some of the other reviewers, so if I was SW, I'd really get to retraining the hostess to learn to handle that front station and first impression of the place much better.  We stood and waited for the hostess's attention for about 8 minutes and finally walked up to someone else and asked if we could be seated. He immediately apologized and sat us at a perfect table waterside with an ideal view of the Lake of Dreams and its shows.  The food was outstanding. We shared a Chateaubriand with peppercorn crust, cooked medium rare and it was perfectly cooked. The Brussels sprouts with bacon and creamed corn with truffle oil were both fabulous and the SW chopped salad and heirloom tomato salad were also perfect.  Service was spectacular with five different people plus a knowledgeable sommelier serving us. Our glasses were never dry, and iced tea and water not just Champagne stayed full, which I think is a great sign of how good the service is.  For dessert we shared a chocolate souffle cake which was just okay as souffles go, really more of a flourless chocolate cake than a souffle. Iced tea was also not that great, which is surprising since the tea at Wynn's Terrace Point Cafe and the former Sugar & Ice (now a pizza place) are China Mist, one of the best.  Overall, a place with killer atmosphere, great views, entertaining shows, outstanding service, fabulous food and only lacking in front of house hostess service, iced tea and chocolate souffle.

kkgVHcY6nz2Qd1B3iaNwgA.text: This place was great!  If you go, request a seat outside near the lake.  You're in for a fun, somewhat cheesy but whimsical Vegas treat!  My filet mignon was to die for!  Service was amazing and our group was a decent size.  We had a show to get to so we weren't able to stay and enjoy dessert - but the menu looked amazing.

ZV52qdXFGrTruITCeva2Tg.text: This is as good as it gets.  After I got married we spent part of our honeymoon in Vegas.  I did my research to find the best steakhouse in Vegas.  All signs pointed to here.    Wife and I dressed up nice and took a cab to the Wynn.  The atmosphere is out of this world.  We had a seat right along the waterfall and was treated to some of the trippiest artistic visuals I've ever experience (and I've visualized quite a bit if you know what I mean)    I got the ribeye and wife got the filet with bleu cheese.  We both made grunts and groans with every bite.  I was so impressed.  This was the best steak I have ever had.    Our meal cost a lot of money, but we knew that going in.  This was probably one of the most memorable dining experiences I have ever had.  I hope one day I can go back.

zOphaw3Bdg3cT9oh2zeA8w.text: This is inside Wynn hotel facing the Lake of Dreams.  We had dinner there at night.  The hotel runs mini automated shows at the Lake of Dreams every half an hour or so.  If you manage to get a table with a window view, you would see the shows while you enjoy your meal.  The food was expensive, but good.  Service was good too.  They have dress code.  Business casual.  Gentlemen require at least a shirt with collar and a pair of designer jeans with no holes.  Jacket is optional.  Of course you can wear anything more formal than that.  No spec for ladies though.  The lack of lady dress code reminds me of the movie "Pretty Woman".  I've just noticed I have passed the 200 reviews mark with this review.

IIU9mOMu0U8Vv2R8hCykGQ.text: We went here for our anniversary and made a reservation requesting to be seated near the window which looks out onto the waterfall.  The view is gorgeous but the the odd piece to this is the two naked statues in the waterfall.  kinda funny actually...  The outside seating was unavailable due to the extreme 115 degree heat (not that I would sit outside anyway, the thought of sweating white eating makes me gag).    Upon our arrival, the hostess seats us in the back of the restaurant in which I complained, however the reply I received was, "I'm sorry, there are no seats available in that section.  You can speak to the manager if you have any further questions."  Then why do I see seats available in that section?  Argh, then what's the point of making an effing reservation.  Anyway, that soured the beginning of my experience with the SW steakhouse.  We shared the 42 oz double cut rib eye and had the creamed spinach for a side.  The rib eye was satisfactory, Kenny liked it a lot better than I did (perhaps I still had a sour taste in my mouth from the whole seating arrangement).    Initially, I give this restaurant 2 stars.  I think customer service is extremely important in any institution. However their redeeming point is that they gave us a complimentary creme brulee dessert plate etched in chocolate, "Happy Anniversary."  Flemmings is still my number one steakhouse

PJixtO88XdG0hCQUFqev-w.text: Had some high expectations when we booked our reservation here. Friends from home highly recommended SW Steakhouse for the food, drink, and atmosphere. Sadly, I was underwhelmed with the most important part of that list - the food. The bone-in ribeye came cooked exactly as I requested but it was way too salty. Like whoa - go easy on that thick ass seasoning you guys rub into it. The three sauces provided for the steak puzzled me, as I'm used to eating steak two different ways - the fancy crap that is cooked well enough to eat 'as-is' (shout-out to my boys at Flemmings), and the Denny's cooked meat that I drown in A1 sauce. So yeah - if you need to provide sauce with your steaks, then you'd better be a family franchise with a kids-menu and crayons. I do recognize that some people may enjoy the sauces for some slight variations on their plate... but it ain't for me.  There is a dress code here, but I didn't see it enforced for several people being served that night. I suppose if you roll in with some Uncle Benjamins, any rule can be broken in Vegas. Service was top-notch and the atmosphere is relaxing with the Wynn waterfall right outside the lounge area.  Someone try the Wagyu Beef from Japan ($175 for 7oz) or the Ohmi Beef ($245 for 7oz). I wasn't crazy enough to order those, but I figure if you hit the jackpot, then you might as well try it and tell us how it is... along with the strippers you hire that night afterwards. Word.

YunoNnWPpSqSqI6wW51kHw.text: Really cool dinner experience if you happen to be staying at the Wynn. I had the shrimp cocktail to start, followed by the salmon (excellent) and shared a couple of sides with my husband (charred jalapenos, creamed spinach, and a combo of the fingerling potatoes and green beans).. then we were given a truly divine dessert sampler which included chocolate cake (amazing), strawberry bread pudding (pretty good) and the funnel cakes with dipping sauces (excellent). What really makes the evening special is the ambiance and the interesting light/music shows on the lake every half hour. Our server was attentive and we had a really wonderful time. Highly recommend it for a date night.

Vrzs-xMn8RJA9oNKU1R-Fw.text: If you're in Vegas and want dinner to be a memorable experience rather than just a meal, whether it's to impress a client, a big date, or for some other special occasion, I'd recommend SW Steakhouse.    It's IMPORTANT to note that when you make your reservation you should request a view of the waterfall; there's no point in going to SW if you can't see it.  Many of the tables are positioned in a semicircle around the waterfall, which cascades into a pool of water.  But the waterfall itself isn't particularly picturesque; instead, what's impressive is the music/light show that takes place around it approximately every 30 minutes.  The night I ate at SW there were numerous interludes including a Garth Brooks song sang by a giant frog (I realize that may sound rather annoying ... you just had to be there).  Other interludes were more low key, including classical music while giant flowers appear and twirl about the waterfall.  The service was top notch and the wine server was very knowledgeable about the wine list (but as other reviewers have noted, the wine is very overpriced).    We enjoyed our steak and the sides of potatoes and asparagus were delicious.  Overall, I'd say the food quite good, but not notably better than at any other quality steak house.  *BUT*, the show's the thing at SW; it turns what would otherwise be a nice but overpriced steakhouse into a noteworthy dining experience.

yfkHg14DqRKA1wh2Ak4rbg.text: Every time I came to Vegas I wanted to try this place but it was always over booked, so this time I did it in advance and was kind of exited. Honestly this place is way overrated and I think mainly because of it's view to the show. If you take away this experience then you end up with overpriced steak house. Food is is not bad but not superb ether. If you are staying at Wynn I'd suggest trying Bortallota restaurant, it's more expensive but food is amazing!

LGVU5JRaAX4Jv_KHTUjwOQ.text: We celebrated an early Valentines Day at the SW steakhouse. Service was great, they kept an eye on our drinks and service was prompt on everything we ordered. My wife ordered a Sangria which she loved. One of our favorite things about SW and Lakeside Seafood right across from SW is they serve fresh preztel bread right out of the oven. Unreal! We couldn't get enough of it. For our salad we have Steve's salad kind of like a ceasar salad with a little more zest, excellent. We split a crab cake for our appetizer which was wonderful, great fresh crab flavors. We both had salmon for our entree which was perfectly cooked, even better than the fish we had at Lakeside Seafood next door. It came with a mushroom sauce underneath the fish which you dip your fish into, very savory deep flavors. I had mine blackened which I loved, just the right amount of spice and my wife had hers broiled, she was very pleased. We ordered a side of garlic mashed potatoes which was a garlic lovers dream come True, tons of fresh garlic in there.   For dessert we shared a chocolate cake with a little dish of vanilla custard, it was small but just enough to give us a little finishing touch for dessert. The coffee we ordered was excellent as well. Our waiter Mark and bus people Lea and Jesus did an excellent job of taking care of us.     I almost forgot the show on the lake makes this even more worth the price of admission. They have four or five different 2min holographic shows on the lake every half hour. Really makes the whole night special. Highly recommended.

ECQMy4njNNel2sDNak3W-A.text: amazing lakeside and waterfall view.  more of a classic steakhouse feel ordered the: chile rubbed ribeye doublecut and pepper crusted chateaubriand (tenderloin) with sides of black truffle cream corn and roasted mushrooms a lot of meat even for the four of us paired with domaine de la janasse 2006 chateauneuf du pape the meats were prepared well, the pepper crusting was very bold, and the meat soft.  bacon cheese bread to start so after a beef tasting, burgers, and now more steak, detox is necessary.

_re_6dbzSvPW9AXAM4AwfA.text: Best steak dinner I ever had. A must to visit at the Wynn.

YIEr0jZOA9U7XG5fdlLs1g.text: Went back and had another good experience..  to sum it up, it's a good steak at a good value (if you're used to NY steakhouse prices).   The decor is very modern. There's a nice view of the Wynn waterfalls from inside and out, where ever you might choose to dine. Although in my opinion, the person who designed the waterfall shows is really, um, unique?  Interesting to say the least.  The food was great, from the cheese bread in the beginning to the desserts at the end. The caeser salad, creamed spinach and cheese potatoes are some of the best we've had.  Not to mention the tender juicy steaks.  You can't lose here.  Still not cheap, but a good value in vegas.

6n-395FM-HJbCl4LEMWHWA.text: Upon arriving at the restaurant, my husband and I were informed by the host that our reservations had been listed for the FOLLOWING night, obviously not what we'd requested. We were told to "have a seat", but that it might "be a while", since this was a Friday night. Not long after, we were seated at the most awkwardly placed table near the corner of the restaurant. Absolutely no view of the Lake (which was one of the selling points from everyone, and something I was looking forward to!), and we were crowded into a half-booth/half-table between two other couples. The serving staff was nice enough, considering we were terribly disappointed, but they didn't do much to make our experience any more personal, due to the fact that they were taking care of our "boothmates" as well. I lost my interest in ordering any appetizers, and focused on the steak. Now, that filet was AMAZING! So much flavor, cooked to perfection, and just wonderful. I was pretty anxious to leave after that, I just couldn't justify spending any more time and money here when I was not having a good time.  So, we passed on the desserts as well (sooooo not like me!). I don't think I will be back here again, which is a shame because the food was fabulous! But right from the start we were made to feel as though we were a bother, since there was a mix-up with our reservation. The decor is beautiful and I'm sure the show is great, but if you're looking for a more intimate experience, keep looking!

rvcx-omYStYemwnNUCixWQ.text: Awesome! Accommodated 10 on short notice. Top notch from beginning to end! Steaks were Fantastic! The only thing that would make it better is the views.. Or lack of ....may turn up the ambiance?

ZI7ffbB7AT02IR-NL5OVGw.text: Celebrated our 15th wedding anniversary. The meal and service was amazing. I had the scallops which was cooked to perfection. My husband had in the boned in rib-eye which was flavorful with the best crust. The special side dish was the gnocchi with lobster. We sat outside and watched the light show. Best restaurant in Vegas!

UrmAGLjsNk7hjD-rZvHp2g.text: Was this the best steakhouse in Vegas-absolutely not!  I've been to at least two that I'd prefer - craftsteak and nine.  Was it better than many - hell yeah. Try the fries, macaroni, Caesar salad and ny strip, all of which were excellant. Avoid the other two salads on the menu and many of the sides which are just ok. The biggest negative was the inattentive service which matches some of earlier reviews, which tells me - hey we really don't give a shit!

T4_Z30Goyk5ltZNSqzCHgQ.text: Hands down my favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas.  Nothing beats the combination of outstanding service, delicious food, and great atmosphere.   Here's what we like to order: Tomahawk split for 2 (it's 30 oz , so plenty enough for 2 people), the truffle corn,  caprese salad (if in season), the tuna ceviche,  the crab pasta appetizer, and dessert. .. You must try dessert, a lot of effort is put into the desserts here and the menu changes regularly. ... Just ask your server for suggestions.  If you're looking for a great steakhouse experience,  this is the place to go.  The only suggestion I have is that they update the music they play, the restaurant has a very alive, energetic feeling that needs more up-to-date and slightly more upbeat music.

BT6vnLxX_LA5VX2MtEOL3A.text: Love coming to this place from the time you enter it just is an amazing experience great salads entrees as well as sides the wagyu beef here is not as good as jean George's but still great. Love the pretzel break and chopped salad, cream corn and baked potato.

q5FVLEDZkJtkP-Gjk7Z1gw.text: Let me start by saying OMG!  As I was on my plane to Vegas this weekend. I enjoyed my complimentary DirectTV and of course I am on the FOOD NETWORK. BY FATE its  THE BEST THING I EVER ATE LAS VEGAS.  Here is the run down with out all the BS intro.  WHAT TO ORDER:  BEEF CARPACCIO (super yum for starters)  CHILE RUBBED RIB EYE (it feeds 2 if youre hungry) the dish is to DIE FOR the best thing on the entree menu TRUST ME  Meat was so soft so melt in your mouth delish. My mouth is watering thinking about it. (109$)  As for the side dishes try the Black truffle creamed corn...and the au gratin is meh so just get the fries or its just nothing since the entree is huge.  Must try the Banana Creme Brule. and the dessert wine Torque or something ask the wine/beverage guy he knows what its called.   Or the Cool ass looking funnel cake thingys with 4 diff sauces to dip.  Oh and the bread basket is freaking good too, cheddar bacon bread thing and hot and fresh.   5 star service.    HAPPY EATING!

V4tyOdcA9B2LhIczMN-Lkg.text: This is a wonderful restaurant, although very touristy and busy, busy, busy. The food is delicious. I had a fillet that was heavenly. Make sure you get a seat facing the waterfall. It's fun to watch as it "performs" for you about ever ten or fifteen minutes, with a new song and video show (or in the case of the Garth Brooks song, puppet show). My one word of caution is look at the wine menu before ordering a glass. We blindly just asked for a cab and found ourselves enjoying a $30 glass (not unreasonable, no, but not what we were expecting either).

Ay7qbuwH0jQKjh8001nXWA.text: The steak alone is worth a visit.  I have eaten outstanding steaks in some of the beef centers of the United States -- the stockyards in Oklahoma City; the stockyards in Fort Worth, Texas; Kansas City; and Kamuela, Hawaii.  But all those steaks cannot compare to the bone-in New York steak and filet mignon at SW Steakhouse.  Fork-tender, trimmed to perfection, flavored to enhance but not outshine the beef; and grilled absolutely right!  The New York steak was prepared medium as ordered, and the filet mignon was exactly medium rare also as ordered.  The creamed corn with truffle and SW fries were excellent, and the chocolate souffle was warm and decadent.  But the True star of the dinner was the steaks!  If you appreciate quality steaks, you must dine at SW Steakhouse at the Wynn!  Nothing else needs to be written about this restaurant except that the quality of the beef and the skillful preparation are A+.

Hv6uAk9ELdTDKcjguMIgGw.text: My husband took me to SW Steakhouse for my birthday last week. We started shared the Jumbo Shrimp, Chopped Salad, Rib-eye, Asparagus, Gratin potatoes and Velvet Cake ending with coffee. Too bad it made me vomit right after the meal. When we notified the SW Steakhouse they informed us no one beside my husband and I became ill and no other complaints for food borne illness for June 21, 2011. DO NOT GO HERE!  I felt they did not take our concern for the safety of the customers seriously.   Shame Shame Mr. Wynn and your staff!

lHDqYETGwId0u2z7gWoIOw.text: Went here with my wife. I had the bone-in ribeye. She had the the filet mignon. We switched halfway through. My steak was good, but her filet was the driest I have ever eaten. Basically had to cover it in butter to make it edible. We also had the creamed corn. It was way to fine. It felt like that corn went through a food processor. Given how expensive this place is (extremely expensive) we were very disappointed. Service was good.

57ALcuSAtx_KqwyEqU_6jA.text: The steaks are really good, everything else is so-so.  This is definitely the kind of place that cares more about looking fancy than making exquisite food. There's nothing memorable about the food here. If you're looking for a steakhouse for a special occasion, I would highly recommend Craftsteak at the MGM Grand instead, which has a lot more polish, attention to detail and much better food.  Salad -- Overdressed, but ok. King Crab Pasta -- a terrible, creamy mess.  Mushroom side -- Incredibly salty and inedible. Asparagus side -- ok.  Filet Mignon -- excellent, cooked perfectly. Funnel cake dessert -- really fun, cool presentation, ok taste.   We ordered two bottles of wine at the table and the sommelier was solid. I didn't sit at the bar, but I'd imagine that it would be pretty good there.   Bottom line: If you're staying at the Wynn and looking for a good place to eat and drink, this will do -- the food is good. If you're looking for a place to dine for a special occasion, look elsewhere.

UDB--5amb02os0ABzcf3VA.text: Horrible horrible horrible service. Food was good when you finally got it...I even mentioned the bad service but it continued.  They served one entree and it sat there for 10 minutes and no one else got any food....we sent it back and said everything should come out together. It's not rocket science.

D9HB9jdHjoap8G_lLyUsqA.text: Not even close to New York steakhouses. The meat was overcooked, the sides were sub par and just full of grease. I spend way too much money here to eat the way we did. We had the porterhouse and chili rubbed rib eye, and both were not great. I guess the price doesn't match the flavor or taste.  On the upside, the outdoor waterfall was beautiful. The service was pretty good and the rioja was tasty.

txxtBwilxszsKvs3QUfiqQ.text: In Vegas celebrating a buddy's birthday. 9 guys and all good. Sat outside and enjoyed the scene. Food was on point. I came for the steak but had the scallops. Solid choice. Absolutely great. 4 guys split the double cutbrib eye with chili rub. Also great. Sharing was a good idea as it would have been too much food for 2 and we are not lite eaters. Yes it is expens oh very but people who rate a restaurant  low because of the price suck. It is what it is and you generally know what youbare getting before you arrive. Two resounding thumbs up for SW!

YWxM9jY7awba257Fepwimg.text: SW was an absolutely amazing dining experience. I came with a group of 9. The table we had was right next to the outdoor waterfall area, which was perfect for a hot summer evening. The staff always made sure to check in on how everyone was doing. The 20 oz bone-in ribeye was cooked perfectly medium rare and was so tender and flavorful. The creamed corn was delicious and the wild mushrooms were sauteed well. The shrimp scampi were huge and a little on the saltier side, but cooked well and buttery. The lobster tail was decadent. Overall this was a great experience and I would highly recommend trying it at least once while you are in Vegas!

-8hPq2nNvbNgOWay0xQrcQ.text: LDW 2011 in Vegas!!!! We were celebrating my birthday at SW on Monday night because Sunday night at Mastro's was a bust due to food poisoning from the Lobby Bar in Encore. Read my review and be advised to stay away from the spicy shrimp!!!!   Ok on to SW --  Service - 3.5 stars He was attentive but not annoying. Just wish he could've mustered up a little more enthusiasm. I heard they pool the tips so I guess they don't really have any incentive to pretend they are happy to serve us dinner.  Food - 2.75 Are you kidding me with $62 for a 12oz filet and $12 per side?!  I know it's Encore and I know it's Vegas, but I also know what these things cost at the grocery store and I don't even buy in bulk like a hotel!!!  My husband and I decided to split everything. We started with the iceberg lettuce salad with blue cheese, bacon and tomato. It did not wow me, but it didn't break the bank either.  We ordered the 12oz filet and a side of creamed corn. I like my filets still mooing and he likes leather shoes.  Mine came out medium and his came out medium well.   Not good for a steak restaurant to mess up their main event, but we were in a time crunch, so there was no sending food back to the kitchen!!!   I have to say it certainly was not the best I ever ate and not worth the ridiculous amount of money.  The creamed corn was just plain odd. Our friends ordered a caesar salad, filets, and a side of mac & cheese. They enjoyed their filet, but the mac and cheese was sub par.  The decor and ambience - 3 stars Nothing super fancy especially considering the overpriced food and the view of the dreamscape was a little much during dinner.   Yeah yeah cool your jets!!!  I know it's Vegas, but I want to know what  kind of drugs the creator was on that decided that set up was a good idea. The demographics for the peeps that can afford to eat there and those who may be interested in that wackiness is way off!!!  Bartenders - 3.5 stars for heavy hands on the liquor Watch out the drinks will knock you out with one punch. So order wisely and proceed with caution.  3.5 stars for bringing me mints and a plate with a birthday greeting on it.   Overall 3.0 stars for the experience Would I return to SW? Probably not because there are so many fine restaurants that are truly worth every penny in Vegas. Encore I think you can do better.

pbpAqCumzjuN1NKtoj0KKw.text: Beautiful and totally amazing. We ate here for our wedding dinner, and I will never forget it. The service was impeccable and the filet was perfection. We will go back every year to celebrate! And it will go down in history as the best filet we've ever had. Bravo

JhW3kqY2Suzn2WHEPsyemQ.text: Best Steakhouse IMO. Atmosphere and service are second to none. Need I say More? Also a must try:  Experience the decadent dessert that is the Louis XIII Gold Bar at SW Steakhouse.   The ultra-extravagant candy bar combines Valrhona Caraibe dark chocolate ganache with praline crunch and Louis XIII infused caramel topped with 23K gold and decadent Louis XIII caramel ice cream.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

--EHQtxAc3b5qyRMpJkRFw.text: Amazing food! Atmosphere beautiful. The things I believe need to be addressed are. This is a high end steakhouse therefore why isn't the wait staff cleaning the table of any crumbs? Yes this may seem silly. However, other high end restaurants in NYC and overseas that I have been to will clean the table in between plate change. Second thing, we had a very fine French red wine 2012, released in 2017. This bottle was not placed in a decanter therefore the sediment was in the bottle and our glasses. Our bill was over $500 for two, so service could be a lot better.

bvsg6xlhMvBetlfq312OTA.text: Super old school place with excellent service. Amazing Waygu beef and Scallops. A must for a romantic dinner in Vegas.

YmTwP_XQ_DPFMKV4WLkJhg.text: This review is long overdue. My fiance took me here for my birthday. Food was mostly good. Customer service, however, was lacking. They carded me 3 times and not once did they acknowledge it was my birthday. We felt like they were very uppity, and they only cater to certain people. Honestly, for the customer service here, I'd say it's not worth it. Very disappointing. We would've tipped you more if you weren't being such a-holes.

q-hEq1lAxcGBqEHCnRbshQ.text: My wife and I went last week to the SW steak house  at the Wynn Casino Resort. I ordered a 16 oz New York Steak and she ordered the T Bone steak I believe also 16 oz. The server happily sat us outside so that we can see they entertainment on the water. The little demonstrations were not the most amazing but it was pleasant to watch during our meal. It's a great spot for a special occasion. We will be back.

XMtNnD_pE15I4hUXv-2U0g.text: We had the best time SW steakhouse or waiter  Anthony suggested some things and everything you suggested was amazing.  Anthony 5 stars Sw steakhouse 5stars

ZjGJ4i_lKdlXlIfNiGalYQ.text: I love this place! Every dish is tasty. Yes it is on the pricy side but this is expected on the strip. Located inside the Wynn on top of that. I've had the ribeye, sea bass, scallops and almost all of the appetizers. The service is impeccable! We always get the private room since we have a large party and they always take great care of us.

qi8y4xHaZjaCsGQjITfyNA.text: Phenomenal experience. We were seated right by the water, we got to enjoy the nice views while having some amazing food. I had the bone in rib-eye, this was the best piece of steak I've ever had. The oysters were fresh and really delicious, must try! The mashed potatoes melted in my mouth, so creamy and smooth. The truffle corn was alright (not a fan of truffle) so that's probably why I'd pass on that next time.  SW is definitely worth a visit, we had an exceptional dining experience. From the service to the food, everything was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oysters were delicious!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib-eye with mashed potatoes and sweet corn

LLq12r6tcqf6JO-NSzejvg.text: As soon as I knew I was going to Vegas I started to scout out some pretty nice steakhouses. I read a lot of reviews from other steak places but SW seemed to be the winner and I couln't wait to eat there. So two days before I got there I made reservations for 6pm and had no problems doing that.  So one of the main attractions is the lake and the light show which I missed because I left before it got too dark. I thought it was require to wear a jacket or at least a tie so I wore a tie. When I got there I was the only one wearing a tie and I thought wtf? Well anyway it's cool because I was there for the steak and boy was it good. The service was outstanding and my waitress was Katie who was so attentive. I couldn't believe how GREAT she was and I could probably write a whole review on just her.  Okay so food time, I ordered a Candied Orange cocktail which was very good but very STRONG too. I did like it but I'm also a light weight so I was out of my league with that one. I ordered a NY medium rare with smoked blu cheese and that's what I got. It was very good but I thought it was going to blow my socks off but it didn't. So that's why I'm only giving 4 stars and not 5 but the service is definetly 5 stars no doubt about it. I also got some mashed potatoes which they called Yukon puree or something which I thought was funny. I didn't get any apperziters because I had big plans for that NY, plus they give me some very delicous bread with butter that had Hawaiian sea salt on it with olive oil. WOW !!! That butter was so damn good I think they should sell it somehow.  When I come back to Vegas I just may stop by to give Katie an extra tip, yeah she was that damn good. I would most likey eat here again also but I would try a different drink. I had a great time at the SW and can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New York.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Decent View.

ZS_j0Z1drAEMw5md_ONqQA.text: I could give SW a five star rating based on the chile rubbed double ribeye alone. We dined here on a Saturday night with friends visiting from out of town. It was a risk bringing friends to a restaurant I hadn't tried, but my co-workers insisted this was a safe bet. They weren't wrong.  We started with drinks and a lovely variety of breads. For dinner my husband and I shared the chile rubbed double rib-eye that lived up to all of the hype. There was plenty of steak and flavor for the two of us. It was perfectly tender on the inside of the slices with the perfect amount of crisp on the outside. We ordered a potato dish that had lavender mixed in and a chive topping. It was a unique twist on the usual potato. My pecan blonde brownie was very tasty and had just the right amount of bourbon flavor.   The ambiance and vibe of the restaurant would make this great for a date or a group gathering.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato rosti
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile rubbed double rib-eye
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The pecan blond brownie

Zs3Ko9zClIARDHvjDqoAlg.text: This place has amazing ambience as you get to look out towards the waterfall in the Wynn. They have amazing steaks as well! This is probably one of the most top notch steaks I've ever had. The highlights were:  - Truffled cream corn (delish!!) - rib eye (medium rare): shared this dish with a friend and it was tender and juicy - Funnel cakes with strawberries and chocolate, creme fraiche and salted caramel  - pretzel bread and salted butter  Would definitely come back again. A great place to celebrate a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of the 20 oz. rib eye medium rare
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French fries
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side dishes wild mushrooms, green beans

E_JXLRGH6BHlxeGJp9G5AA.text: Went to SW Steakhouse on 06/27 for my friends 50th birthday. When we come to Vegas we usually go to Prime at the Bellagio but after being disappointed last time, we decided to give SW a try and I am glad we did.   We arrived a few minutes early for our reservation and had a cocktail at the bar right outside. When it was time for our reservation, the hostess came to the bar to get us-very good first impression    Our servers were very knowledgeable and super sweet. They kept very good care of us the entire time we were there.   We both had shrimp cocktails and then the 8oz filets which were cooked to perfection. The steaks were delicious and tender.   One last kudo for SW. When they brought my friends dessert, they had written "Happy Birthday" in chocolate on the plate.  We will be back to SW!!

DiGYqv4Ax6HRaMuHwHRGVA.text: I did a LOT of research to find the BEST steakhouse in town and this was it. The view. The ambience. The waterfall. The steak . All were perfect - and to make things even better than that, because perfect meals and dinning can be ruined instantly by imperfect service, our server Corey was probably one of the coolest, helpful and friendliest  servers we have ever had. Thanks Corey and SW - you made our evening magical.

mopehQ6k6IxpxIV6AhxJBQ.text: Nothing to bring me back or rave about. Everything was just your average steakhouse quality; service, food, drinks, decor, etc... Nothing to set themself apart from other steak restaurants, just average and that is not good enough with so many places to choose.

LWwwq9N6uMRDyXCXD54ARQ.text: So i brought my mother for Mother's Day and there was a bit of an issue with the reservation but they definitely made up for it the manager was so sweet and nice. The waiter was extremely attentive. The food was absolutely phenomenal. The shrimp cocktail were so big! The Mac and cheese was honestly heavenly, so gooey and cheesy definitely don't forget to order that. The scallops were divine, so soft and cooked to perfection. And the funnel cakes were the best funnel cakes I've ever had. Definitely an experience you won't to miss.

fwsmcv34IdwEwbAclV07Ag.text: Really great menu and the steaks are cooked perfectly (as they should be for the price). I had the spring pea soup, a fillet and shared a couple sides. Their wine prices are a little steep, but it's Vegas, so that's normal.  They also bring over the whole bottle of wine and pour you a glass, which makes for a nice presentation.

GS8gqO2v2baKNpnJOs_GuQ.text: This is the second time I have been here, I loved the scallops, so we came here for that.  I again loved them.  I had a pea soup for starter, and it was not my cup of tea.  It was just not tasty enough and it had way too many beans in it to the point where my wife and just couldn't finish it, and to be honest, the beans were way undercooked and under seasoned soup in general.  It kinda ruined the meal for me.  My wife and I got 2 cocktails, one was Lychee and it tasted like it had no alcohol in it at all.    We tried our friends vegan food and all of it was amazing.  From the salad to the entire was all excellent.    For a restaurant this high end, we just expected more and although parts were great, it was disappointing for the value we felt we got.

hn_Ppp_B5B-LLmng7i2w4A.text: What is  a vegetarian doing in a steakhouse? Forget that, what is a vegetarian doing giving a 4-stars rating to a steakhouse? Yes and Yes! Quite a $$$$ place but, believe it or not, it has a very good vegan selection (see pic). I was part of s group and was planning to "feast" on salads and bread but was rather pleasantly surprised by their menu.  Ordered white truffle cauliflower risotto. It was very well prepared and went along great with the 2010 Chianti! Not surprising - their beer selection is quite sub-par. Can you offer draft beer and still be classy? Yes, of course IMO, but guess the glitterati here does not agree with me. In any case they had one IPA - a l micro-brew from San Diego. Loved it!  Decadent desserts were to follow. The group went for it but I preferred the espresso double-shot. Mediocre brew at best. Avoid the temptation - don't leave room for dessert- LOL!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Over the top (literally) decor!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inviting enough?
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two thumbs up for the tannins in this bottle!

_3jRg1I0tYU7-6DzflgNdg.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great service. Get the chopped salad to start, a steak to your liking and any side you can imagine. They are all great and compliment the steak. Good options for vegans as well. Cocktails are strong, but expensive.

eKWrkz6XpX_ja7nOdtmmNg.text: I took my wife here for a late valentine day date,  my expectations were very high for service food and atmosphere and for the most part they were all exceeded. -The food was of extremely high quality and cooked beyond perfection. - The atmosphere was far better than expected, they have little shoes every 30min in the fountain that are very quirky and fun, I def recommend eating on the balcony if possible. - the price was very expensive however I rate my reviews based on the level of food/experience  compared to price and the price was justified. -The service however very professional, they did lack in coming around and checking on us, it took a very long time to get drinks even though there seemed to be a million wait staff standing around.  My recommendations - * creamed truffle corn * porter house (1 serving is enough for 2) * eating on the balcony

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle cream corn
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck liver

XVSx8kNBYzLcVNwlbSQiRg.text: First time here with group of four reservation required  Excellent food,gourmet appetizers elegant ambience beautiful Winn waterfall show view  Love black caviar .....remind me of my home Russia  Will be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Russian caviar

uEDa0THrqexgddjyRibfMg.text: Ask for perfection and you shall receive. I see why it's sometimes too hard to get a reservation. This place is fabulous. The service is amazing. It is defiantly what you would expect from a five star hotel. The foods good and the scene is very lively. If you haven't been yet, make an effort and go

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0QNKo5XPm3ocO_sDB4RDWA.text: Hands down this is my favorite steak house in LV. Any and every time there is a a special event, I always pick this restaurant :)  To start, this is the first placed i've tried caviar at, the Kolikof caviar they carry is superior, I swear I wish I could order it every time (but its $$$$)  Appetizers are always delicious. I usually like to order some of the a5 for a nice little appetizer.   Steaks are amazing, I am a sucker for seafood so I always order the lobster tail, the preparation on the lobster tail is phenomenal, by far one of the best i've ever had.

HBJ8oRRv27oPssRuhr1gHA.text: Theres not too much i can say about this place besides the service was A+ and the food was A+ and the Atmosphere was A+... I celebrate my birthday here on May 02 2019 and  We showed up almost 45 mins early because I was afraid for the parking but it was the day Wynn decided to make their parking FREE!!!!.... and to top it off they were extra kind to take us in 30 mins early so we didn't have to wait. " I wish I remembered my waiters name" but I had 1 too many drinks lol....  Oysters on the 1/2 shell and that was sooooo delish!!!! cold and fresh!!! Jidori Chicken Breast ... according to my partner it was juicy and it was like chicken butter. I got the 24 oz Bone in rib eye..(Medium Rare outside crisp). OMG to die for seriously... cooked to perfection and melts in your mouth and i couldn't finish it because it was so big hahaha..... Au Gratin potatoes as a side was delish too!!!... what a treat for me to spend my 36th birthday!!!! will be back again =) Oh and the complimentary birthday cake was amazing too even though I dont eat cake hahha... had a few bites.  Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 24 oz bone in prime rib

fP6OJ7f11XfjBbQg3ngvdw.text: This restaurant has gone way downhill.  They served me a $60+ ribeye that was just garbage.  I've had a better steak from Waffle House.  To make matters worse, when I asked our waitress about the toughness of my steak, she refused to answer my question and became incredibly rude.  As a matter of fact, the only time we saw her again was when she brought us the bill after dinner.  The cheddar bacon biscuits are as good as ever, but I simply cannot endorse going to this restaurant ever again after this experience.  I used to tell people that SW had the best steak I've ever had.  Sadly, this is no longer True.  Vegas has many fine restaurants at this price point.  Look elsewhere.

kvOjDRYcWybJ_4LcZMLTzw.text: I made a last minute dinner reservation through AMEX concierge couple days before our last minute Vegas trip. We arrived at our reservation on Sunday at 8:00pm sharp since we were staying at the Wynn. Even though the restaurant was pretty empty, we still had to wait over 10 minutes. We were also seated at the VERY BACK of the restaurant on a very small table top when the restaurant was empty. We had ZERO view and the hostess seated a group of 2 next to our table when the restaurant was empty. We ordered a bottle of wine (+$800), seafood tower (+$100) and Kobe steak ($250). The food and service was great, but I will never be returning to this restaurant after we were seated at literally the WORST table in the restaurant when the restaurant never became full.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine and seafood tower was great!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q_gwINsdHe97T0enY6-nZQ.text: This place was pretty good, my gf took me here for our anniversary and I really enjoyed the food and service here, we were sat quickly upon our arrival (we had reservations) and we told our server we had a flight to catch so he tried to get our food out as quickly as possible which I definitely appreciated.  We started off with the crab cakes (3.5/5) Shared the 30oz dry aged porter house (4.5/5)  and they finished off with their complimentary dessert for our anniversary (3.5/5)  the steak was cooked a perfect medium rare, the only reason it wasn't a 5/5 was the the flavor lacked a bit for some of the pieces, overall though very nicely done

eExaRZ0lbH-xVvXdzFkuVA.text: SW steakhouse was a wonderful experience for us! I made the reservation 3 weeks ago and requested a lakeside table which was denied as they give preference to reservations made chronologically.  I was a bit disappointed but so glad we stayed.  Our hostess was young, beautiful and poised. It was refreshing.  The clientele is fashionable, put together and very civilized. The restaurant itself is beautiful, perfect lighting and feels classy. We waited near the bar while our table was being set. The bartenders know how to make a straight Goose martini . We were seated in the far back corner. A very private corner booth table. While we were unable to see the lake show, we did have a nice view of other tables in the restaurant. Our servers were down to earth, fun, friendly and attentive. We were attended to by Nicole, Chris, Jorge, and other gentleman who was also very helpful.  The bread basket was a nice treat. My boyfriend being German, was particularly impressed by the pretzel roll. Don't eat too much bread because the menu items are worth the wait!  We ordered the steak- perfect MR with bearnaise sauce on the side. It was not too rich. We also had fries, lobster gnocchi and the chopped salad. We shared everything and it was the perfect amount of food for the both of us. We were both stuffed and happy. The coffee and cookie cheesecake were a perfect way to end the meal.  Throughout dinner, our servers were attentive but not overbearing.  They had the right finesse when coming to our table and the perfect sense to know when we  needed something.  It was 1130pm by the time we finished our meal and the tables near the lake of dreams were emptying. We sat at one of the tables to watch the lake show. And honestly, it was so underwhelming. In hindsight, I'm glad we didn't sit outside because we were able to focus on each other and our delicious meal. And we had the nicest servers in our area that it couldn't had been any more wonderful. I hope our next visit at SW is just as wonderful. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iDDGnuFHTOAQcXe9zZdnDA.text: Hands down, my best Wagyu experience! Had the an 8 oz. Kobe Rib Cap which was way overpriced for an A5 BMS grade 8-10, but it was phenomenal! I asked for a warm red (a rare medium rare) and they delivered with crispy bark and tender meat butter interior. I opted to have it with just salt, but they serve it was a soy citrus sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g1xk-R9YTWZFMJ4MYbLZyQ.text: My husband and I love SW. This restaurant was the first place we ate at on our honeymoon. So this place brings back good memories for us. Always excellent service and great food.   We ordered a Caesar salad and crab cakes as starters. Then ordered a tomahawk steak to share with sides of mash potatoes and mushrooms.   In all we had an excellent time and recommend this restaurant. My only complaint is that it took so long for our steaks and sides to come out (40 min).   Appetizers came out quick but main dish took a little long.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_I28-5XoPs7x0lAZG7AqyA.text: My coworkers and I dined in large private dining room (and stepped out to see the light show, so pretty!). We ordered a couple bottles of Dom Perignon and Pinot Noir for table and crab legs to start.  I started with a Caesar salad and had a piece of pretzel bread from the bread basket as well, both were good.  For my main, I ordered an 8oz Filet (medium) with blue cheese topping. The blue cheese is a tad overwhelming but pairs nicely. On its own, the steak isn't as seasoned as Id like so I would recommend a topping or sauce  For my side, I ordered potatoes au gratin, which were seriously delicious!   Overall, I was happy with my meal!   And the restaurant itself is very pretty and has very kind service!!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uxWnnM-LAebF1K85BgB3eg.text: The Oysters here were some of the best I've ever had. The vegetarian Ravioli & also meatballs were good as was the truffle corn. The Kale w goat cheese was so-so... Finished off w screen Brulee which was very good!  Recommend seating on the "out door" area as it provided good scenery and good entertainment throughout dinner.  Would recommend and would visit again!

SzdxcVt6y9RLcX9-dJbzww.text: Beautiful experience. On the hour they have a light show at night. However, the experience was deflated by several things. The waiter we had almost seemed irritated when we asked for a drink, salt and pepper, the check.  No pleasantries from him what so ever. He just seemed unhappy to be there. And for the price we paid for two steaks, mashed potatoes and Mac & cheese, seltzer water and one drink ($$$$$). The service was well under par. Waiter disappeared toward the end and we waited for about 15 mins before he check on us again. The steak (Bone in Rob eye) medium-rare was a low quality meat for the price. There was a substantial amount of grissel in the meat making it harder to chew. I'd recommend well or medium well if order it.

U0tek909yc-jns_N-sAxVQ.text: This is probably my favorite steakhouse when visiting Las Vegas. They have the best service here and truly are accommodating. On Friday and Saturday nights are the busiest so make sure you have a reservation. I love sitting outside because there is a cute show that plays about every 30 min.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ceasar salad, gnocchi, shrimp with butter sauce, foie gras
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 orders of bone In rib eye on a hot skillet
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churros

iveAqQOa9qpxwa6B5a29Iw.text: Awesome place to dine. Little pricey, but hey in Vegas your $100 on a $1 machine can go in 3 minutes! Requested a table outside to partake in the outside entertaining show every 1/2 hour and was seated next to the lake. We did go in November and the heaters warmed ya efficiently. Nicole was our waitress and was so down to earth, gave us recommendations that we loved, and so funny and friendly.    Ordered the Ahi Tartare for starters. Splurged on the A5 certified Kobe Rib Eye, filet, 2 lobster tails, and truffle creamed corn and asparagus for sides.  The A5 Kobe is so delicate and delicious I would definitely recommend ordering once in your life. The lobster tails were good size and also included the claws.  For dessert we had the cheesecake which was unbelievable!!   Overall, SW exceeded our expectations with their quality, quantity of food and all the staff are well trained and very friendly. We will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black truffle creamed corn - very tasty big portion
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Tartare
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster add on, comes with split tail and claws drenched in melted butter - must try

nHmFVd2JTuTn2bzptp6vaQ.text: Great atmosphere.  Love the dining room layout and the waterfall view that changes color. My wife had the dry aged boneless ribeye and I opted to get the HUGE tomahawk steak. Both steaks were juicy and cooked to perfection.  This restaurant is more of a purest, so you won't find any accoutrements for your steak.  So if your looking for some herb butter or chanterelle mushrooms for your steak you won't find it there. Overall great service great food and you leave very satisfied. You can't ask for more than that!    We ended the meal with a delicious creme brulee. It was topped with blackberries and small meringue cookies which gave a good contrast to the smooth velvety creme brulee.   If your in the Las Vegas strip, definitely make it SW Steakhouse.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boneless ribeeye

1jMnV8D1noNg-UMbY_V3xw.text: I researched and researched to find the "best steak" in Vegas. Everything led me to SW. Reservations looked hard to come by. My only option was 6pm, so I jumped on it.  I wish the world was not so ill informed. We paid $100 a steak and I actually had to salt it. I had the dry aged porterhouse and there was no flavor whatsoever. A little taste of charcoaly grill but other than that nothing. Mashed potatoes were runny, octopus was bland.  Service was good and the view of the waterfall was incredible though we were seated in the back behind a column.  To top it all off I would estimate there were about 125 tables in the restaurant and about 60 of them were empty at 6pm. When we left at 7:30pm I would say 40 of them were open. So whose defrauding the people with showing the restaurant was booked solid and why?  Have a reputation to keep?  I wouldn't never waste a precious vacation dinner here again.

oKl4Md-cnp0ENU3g8yx7Ug.text: Yessssss. Just yesss.   The steaks are really great, and the sides are perfect. Every time we come here we fall deeper in love with this place. We just had the funnel cake dessert for the first time, oh my god. Must must must get that!   Must come.   Everything is unbelievable.   Service 10/10 Food 10/10 Menu 10/10 Quality 10/10

AnBzmcs1CqfNGk6uyndvgg.text: Still one of the best steakhouses in Las Vegas!  The service and ambiance is like no other in town. And the cuisine speaks for itself. The filets were cooked to perfection, while sipping on a beautiful red wine that the sommelier recommended   Will be back!

EjeBd_C_ypulLHBAXXc0kw.text: One of the best meals i have ever had.  ribeye was perfect and the seafood was so fresh.  well worth the money and wait.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PUp3_cJkb8rqszcro_vBrg.text: As with most everything else at the Wynn/Encore properties, this steakhouse isn't necessarily cheap to dine at, but it's exceptional, and it's worth it!  I came here with a group of 10 at 9:30 on a Friday night for dinner.  We were seated in a private dining area due to the size of our group and the amount of patrons who were in this restaurant when we arrived at our reserved time, but the main dining area and portico have an amazing view of the waterfall, pond and folliage-filled area that make up the "Lake of Dreams" just outside this restaurant where the color and texture of the waterfall seems to change every few minutes (due to some high tech projection technology), and a "show" plays out I believe every 30 minutes that features music, even more projection and some very cool effects.  Appetizers (salads, crab cakes, tuna civiche, oysters, etc.) average about $21 each, main courses (chicken, fish, lamb, scallops) will run about $40 each, most steaks are in the ball park of $60, and sides to go with your meat or main course are about $12 per side.  An interesting note is that there are a number of vegan options on the menu, which can be a rare find at a steakhouse.  The service was incredible - The staff were obviously professionally trained, polished and were thoroughly knowledgeable about the menu; the food was excellent and the aforementioned atmosphere was pretty amazing as well.  In all, the SW Steakhouse may not be the cheapest dining option in Vegas, but it's well worth it in my opinion, and is definitely a treat in many regards.

uH5guH-bfmYLhCMZJ1170Q.text: I eat at SW almost every time I go to Vegas. There service and quality is incredible. I also have a severe dairy allergy and the amount of dairy free sides they have is better than anywhere else in the world. Highly recommend asking to sit with John. He's a tall gentle giant and has been working their since day one. He also went next door to Lakeside and brought me the dairy free Carrot cake! Service is no joke.   Steve Wynn for POTUS  Dairy Free Delicious Options:  Risotto is awesome!  Creamed Corn amazing!  Creamed Spinach!

e0kxXeOfW-FYX6Km079WGw.text: This is the best steakhouse I have ever been to from food to service, it was 10 stars for me

k2tT4lP5CGAPgpa_3YJk5A.text: Food was amazing.  Foie gras was light, and rich at the same time.  The marbling of the Australian Filet was A12 grade.  $330 for 6oz but worth every penny.  My wife had the Halbut and said it was quite moist and tender every bite.  Service was the best I've had throughout any dining experience at Vegas.  Oysters were a bit overpriced for the size even for a caraquet oyster.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras... Extremely rich and flavorful.  Definitely one of our favorite places for this delicacy.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe Filet Mignon - Australian Beef, Grass Fed - A12 Quality

FocbyaDSEGa4cT2b7YZGpg.text: 5stars and plus 5 more....  Exquisite!   Enjoyed a very romantic early dinner with my husband on a very special date. This Valentines Day is another unforgettable moment in our lives and this restaurant is a very big reason why.  Everything, and I mean every thing was perfect.  Amazing table for two, best spot in the house.  Our captain and his amazing crew did not miss a beat.  They prepared our entire menu, we trusted their suggestions and they did not let us down. Thank you again for a very romantic evening...

FexcjtvZoRdvRu-oF_lpXg.text: Solid 4.5 stars. Ribeye was sliced table side and perfect medium rare. Sauces were not my favorite but the steak was good enough without a sauce. Impeccable service!!! We requested to sit on the patio and had an awesome view of the lake of dreams water show!

YZay4sUOR5wiV0Vun3qIVA.text: Great atmosphere.  It's as expensive as you'd expect - but they do it right.  From the amazing rolls to start (the bacon and cheese muffins are can't miss) to the fresh fish on the menu (I had ceviche to start and the scallops as my entree). I also had the chile rubbed rib-eye, which was incredibly juicy and so flavorful.   Save room for dessert, because the presentations alone are worth it - and the flavor matches the presentation. Why not 5-star?  I thought that the service should be a little more detail-oriented for the price.  Our server didn't have strong recommendations, left us way too much time before taking our orders.  The soda that they offer are in the 8-ounce bottles - so you're paying about 5 times more for a diet coke than you would elsewhere.

OemIr23wpdGi7Seex7ghTw.text: Great steakhouse!!! The best thing I had was the truffle cream corn....It's definitely worth coming back for!! The filers was great and so was the chop salad.  Also the service was excellent...my server was nice enough to let me order half size orders of sides and salad so I could try more items on the menu!! Perfect dining experience!!

c7mJ022D5emQqonFiLVwZg.text: Just GREAT!   Hostess are nice and welcoming, the bartenders recommend their best drinks and severs are courteous and make sure you always have what you need  We got there for a birthday and I made a note on the reservation, and at the end the came with a small plate with mint chocolate and a note! A small detail that put a smile on us!   steaks are cooked perfectly and side dishes are delicious! I couldn't get enough of that place!

R3i5ouylCq_R4P0VC30qIg.text: So every time I've gone here, there is always a problem with their food.  The first time, I got the worst heart burn which I only experience from bad or old food.  The next time, the scallops were just made of salt as was the risotto.  It was very unfortunate and the waiter didn't come by for a while for us to inform them.  They didn't offer us to order something else instead.  While it seems to be a very popular place at the Wynn, it is the least best food they feature and I've been to many of their restaurants.  There are also so many other great steak houses in Las Vegas.  I am only giving it two stars for the ambiance.

Tqj06PBf8eQZW2Ytgv0QCQ.text: I had the New York Strip while my party had Rib Eye and the Pork Chops. We started with the appetizers: kale salad was good, chopped salad was okay, but the foie gras was amazing. So much flavor! From appetizers we went to the sides: roasted asparagus was very finely cooked while the mushrooms were plentiful and hearty. Was unfortunate to not taste the black truffle cream of corn but had some good reviews from my fellow guests. Finally, the main course! The New York strip was huge, but may had a little too much seasoning. But nevertheless, I've never had a medium rare steak so good before. The rib eye that my partners had was a little too salty. However, the main attraction for me was the pork chops - they tasted fabulous with flavor in every bite. If anything, definitely get the pork chops and foie gras if you go!

xKnMJOk3bqVjrt07x1EXXQ.text: My new favourite Steakhouse in Vegas. This was a great experience from start to finish. We got there and we were seated promptly, just in time to see the 8 o'clock Lake of Dreams light show. It was my girlfriend's birthday and every staff member who came to the table made a point of wishing her happy birthday. Highlight of the meal was definitely the double cut pepper crusted chateaubriand we shared. It was so tender I was actually able to cut a piece off with my fork! Meal was topped off with a creme brulee that they made special for the birthday girl. All this being said, it is on the expensive side. But if you're someone who doesn't mind paying up for quality, I highly recommend SW Steak!

OHYJ9MNVWTsKLe_KOWFMpA.text: Food Bomb. Service Bomb. Ambiance Bomb. Pricey, but expected. Lots of Redbook girls there with older guys, but didn't bother me.

2sTk-GMnmOz9eSrAxVXRDg.text: Came here for the third time and all I can say is this spot is my favorite place!!! The service was great and the food was even better.  The Rib was to die for and can't say enough about how tender and tasty it was.  The Mac n Cheese was excellent as well as the Creamy Corn.  Oh, and let's not forget about the pretzel bread.  Thumbs up x2!!  I'll be back soon!!!

sO_oWoiDQDEd8m0F6eCY6g.text: Bone in rib eye- 20oz. This dish is amazing, It is a very large piece of meat that is (in my opinion) a lot more then one person could eat.  I ordered mine Med- Rare but it was a little more towards the rare side, which I didn't mind.  For sides we ordered -  SW french fries - possibly the best fries I've tried in a while! perfectly seasoned, perfectly crispy.  Black truffle cream corn - Very good! a little liquidity but still great flavor especially for corn lovers!  Sauteed wild mushrooms - these don't look like wild mushrooms, more like your standard little brown mushrooms from the supermarket, They are good but nothing special.  Brussels sprouts with sausage and mustard cream - I didn't see any meat in our dish... maybe it all got eaten in the blink of an eye but I tasted no mustard or meat flavor... plan roasted (half raw) brussels!   Glazed carrots - no one really touched this dish. Went uneaten.  We also had the red quinoa farro salad which was really good.  Dessert was the chocolate lava cake with ice cream and cherries on the side, very good! the cherries were soaked in rum and very strong, ice cream was pecan and very yummy!  The best part was the show that happens outside, its very colorful and very weird, if you site for long enough youll get to see more then one (i think they happen every 20min-30min)  Overall great experience, if you have having a special occasion I suggest you give this place a try.)

HrXubAXmEpUmzaW_DsL2vg.text: Very disappointed.  Although the food was good it was not on the level I expected after reading several reviews.   There are much better steakhouses in Vegas in the same price range, in other words this was extremely overpriced for what you really get.   Perhaps the terrible drinks at the bar set the wrong tone for the rest of the evening.  Wait staff was friendly and courteous but it felt like they were really pushing certain items especially wine.   Gave the feeling of a used car salesman taking you to dinner. Food was good, but not worth the price.
