DErrulpmL47tAjd0yyTT6g.text: Everything was delicious here the service was impeccable and food I'm craving already my next time back here! Just make sure to make reservations in advanced

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poblano and bacon Mac and cheese was excellent
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best rib eye everrrrr!!!

rIkNlmEsxXTS8_9TtR4USw.text: Came here after watching the Le Reve show.  we were seated right up in front of the show, primo positioning!  The weather was perfect, the seating was great.     Ambience is very lively.  usually it's very hush-toned in steakhouses, but this place was bustling.   The first waiter that approached us gave us menus, and wandered away.  When he came back, i asked for a drink menu, and he walked away to get it and never came back.  The chain-smokin' draggin' lady behind my wife killed it for us.  She was smoking up a storm.  I get that we're in vegas, and smoking is allowed just about anywhere you're at, but for an upscale steakhouse like this, the entire joint should be non-smoking.   Another waiter saw my wife in distress and came over right away to ask if all was ok.  we got reseated inside in a non-smoking area and were still in view of the waterfall, so that was a good thing.  From then on, we were waited on hand and foot without fail.  Mark and the other waiter were totally awesome.    Food:  i ordered the lamb chops and my wife ordered the chicken breast.  both were cooked perfectly and very delicious.  They have a decent selection of craft beers both in bottle and on tap.    I'd give it 5 stars if it were a completely non-smoking restaurant.  -1 star since for such an upscale restaurant i would expect it to be a little more classy.

PTT1dJUs6aikxMCaOlADQA.text: Make no mistake, you're paying dearly for the "SW" name and atmosphere. I read somewhere that back in the old days when Steve Wynn designed the Bellagio, he regretted having those Fountains out in the public because people wouldn't have to go inside the casino (and be tempted to gamble). He also said he wanted a signature restaurant overlooking the fountains.  Well, when he designed the Wynn, he made sure to get what he wanted. The SW Steakhouse overlooks the Lake of Dreams, which obviously isn't quite as spectacular as the Fountain, but is entertaining in its own quirky and eccentric way. My wife and I sat right on the patio overlooking the lake, and with the sun going down, it was the perfect setting for an anniversary dinner.  We started off with a fantastic bread basket, which included some tasty pretzel rolls. But he cheddar and bacon biscuits were clearly the star. Along with a smear of butter, which had a sprinkle of black Hawaiian sea salt, we had to restrain ourselves before the real food arrived. Here's the breakdown of what we ordered:  - Seafood spectacular: a gorgeous display of chilled seafood, consisting of mussels, clams, jump shrimp, crab spread, King crab legs, and lobster tails. Everything was incredibly tender and flavorful, except for the lobster tails which we saved for the end. It was bland and chewy, and drawn butter probably couldn't even save its life.  - Dry aged tomahawk chop (rib eye): requested medium, this steak had great marbling (almost too much fat), tender, well-seasoned, and had an excellent crust. It came with a small arugula salad directly on top of the steak, which I thought was weird. Apparently, this was the only dry aged steak on the menu, but I didn't quite get that robust, beefy flavor that I was looking for.   I thought about getting the much talked about chili-rubbed rib eye for 2, but I just didn't want the spiciness and seasonings to take away from the flavor of the steak. I also got to sample some of their steak sauces -- they all were okay as a dipping sauce for something else, but I just didn't think they belonged on a good piece of steak.  - Truffle creamed corn: an okay side dish for me, as I didn't taste much of the truffle flavor. I don't really eat much creamed corn, so I kept thinking baby food for some odd reason. That would be the most expensive baby food in the world, that's for sure. Looking back, I probably would've preferred some mashed potatoes or some mushrooms for the sides.  - Peanut butter and banana crunch: a stunning dessert, both in taste and presentation. A beautiful "Happy Anniversary" was written on the plate in chocolate. I'm not good at describing dessert, so all I can tell you is that it was rich and decadent, without being overly sweet. The peanut butter and banana flavors are so well-balanced, so if you're a fan of both, check out this dessert.  Overall, this was a good meal -- definitely not cheap, that's for sure. The ambiance isn't one of those quiet, dark, and dimly lit steakhouses. It's more loud, vibrant, and airy -- with the water from the fountain as the background noise. We even got a chance to see the giant mutant frog serenade Louis Armstrong's "What a Wonderful World" just as we finished dinner. I heard people plan their trips just to see that frog!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peanut butter banana crunch
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffled creamed corn

dA9sJfVlXTwl6cmwpjB2Cg.text: Heart in Vegas?  My mom turned 60 years old last year and SW Steakhouse didn't care one bit.  Even tho I booked my mom at their hotel, there was no love towards us.  I spent over $100,000 easily at the Wynn/Encore and I can't request patio dining for my Mom on her 60th birthday?!?!?   There is something very wrong with this picture.....     I was even willing to accommodate any of the 4 days my mom was staying at Encore for her 60th bday, but even that wasn't good enough for the ruthless managers at SW.  I had other family members there visiting Vegas, which would of easily made my bill about $2k+ for dinner.  It's very sad when you try to do a good thing for your Mom, and their is some control freak blocking you from entertaining your family.    Go somewhere else...  Johnathan

WxEsn1Icn5r8qW-ZrSmbPA.text: Bone in ribeye is the best I have EVER tasted!! Service is 5 star and the view of the waterfall & music show adds wonderful ambiance.  I would recommend this restaurant to EVERYONE that visits Vegas.

U8TzE-cBU0cHduU1lQ-7Ig.text: My favorite steak house in Vegas. You need a reservation and its best you get outside so you can get the amazing waterfall view.

7_-ugLyPH9NHxryNWQMW5Q.text: We were staying at the Wynn and called for a reservation for Saturday evening.  We called around 4 so weren't sure we could get in.  Were told they had a 5 or 9:30.  Didn't work for us, but when I called back to see about Sunday, the hostess said they were pretty open on Saturday until 7:30.  Not sure why the confusion.   When we arrived at 7, there were at least 5 tables open on the outdoor patio overlooking the water.  We asked to be seated there and were told that they would "see what they could do".  Of course, after waiting a half hour (and the seats still being open), we were seated in the back.   Our server was very busy with two large obvious "business meeting" tables spending amazing amounts of money on wine and appetizers.  Felt like we were a secondary concern.  He was very helpful and knowledgable when at our table.   SW is as expensive as any of the other "high end" restaurants on the strip, maybe higher.  What is much more expensive at the entire Wynn resort is wine.  I don't mind paying more for good wine, but $17 a glass to start.  No bottle under $125.  Was prepared to spend $250 for dinner, but couldn't get a decent bottle of wine with that.   I'm from Nebraska, so am spoiled on beef.  The $58 bone-in ribeye was average.  Its prime beef, but was quite fatty and not seasoned well.  My wife had the salmon which was good.  Sides were all excellent (especially Yukon potatoes).   My advice is to get a filet, make sure you call ahead to get seated by the water, and plan on spending a ton on wine if you love like we do.   Best advice is to be in a big group spending big expense account money.

PjrWqv5qwgKxESh0JSSvzA.text: Before I start this review, a quick disclaimer -- I did not pay for this meal, nor see the bill, so I am focusing purely on the food, service, and ambiance!  It has been a long time since I last experienced an unquestionable 5 star restaurant and SW was just that.  Perfect!  I am not a huge red meat eater, so I was incredibly happy when SW nailed every dish, whether meat or not.  What really makes this place special, is the little extras at every turn.  For starters, we had a wonderful window seat overlooking the water show that they do every 30 minutes, which is both varied and entertaining.  Next, came the breads, of which there were two to choose from and came with butter topped with black sea salt.  We sampled several dishes, including the:  - seafood tower -- VERY tasty and loved the extra horseradish that they brought out - tuna tartar -- this was the most surprising dish of the night, as I was blown away by how well they prepared it for a steak restaurant - crab cakes -- no nonsense here folks, just the crab goodness you want - wagyu beef skewers -- served on a salt stone with mixed veggies, small, but terrific - caesar salad - tomahawk chop -- it was shared and they happily brought it out medium rare and took a few pieces back to the kitchen to serve them medium - lamb chops -- tender, delicious, LOVED the fruit chutney it was served on  As mentioned to start the review, had I paid for the meal, my rating might drop to 4 stars, but probably not.  The service, food quality, ambiance, and little touches made this the second greatest food experience of my life.

ejDKoEDAbdDSAq55IWo-_g.text: This is a wonderful special occasion restaurant. SW Steakhouse takes their steak seriously, the portions are huge and delicious. I had the New York Strip and it was so large I couldn't finish it. If you're planning a visit here, skip lunch that day so that you can make the most of dinner.  We went here for a bachelor party dinner and all of the guys loved it. We sampled nearly every side dish on the menu and they all get five stars. The sommelier was attentive and very helpful in offering selections to fit the diverse linkings of a table of 14 guys.  It's expensive, but it's worth it.

Jd1_gtRisTqpvyVH9HRerA.text: Poor planning on our part BUT, we had a party of 8 with theater tickets for a 9:30 show.  We had reservations for 7:30 at SW.  We didn't get seated till 7:45 and explained to our server that we needed to be done by 9:15. OK was the response.  We all made our selections quickly so we could order everything at once and our server would not have to come back to our table more than once to take our orders.  DAMN if we didn't sit there munching on bread and drinking wine (some other dude came by and asked if we wanted wine and brought it and served it. HE offered the best service we'd seen and came by three times) till 8:20 before our server came back to take out orders.  Again I told her we had theater tickets and to just bring everything at once, don't stagger anything.  Our entrees showed up at 9:07.  Everyone took a few bites of their steaks or fish and we had to leave. All side dished were nearly untouched.  75% of the meal was left on the table.  When the food was being served I AGAIN told her we had theater tickets and to get the check ready as we had to leave in 5 minutes.  She promptly brought the bill. The ONLY thing she'd done promptly all night.  The one bite of my steak was excellent. For me, the service has to match the food to be five Yelp stars. Side note:  server explained the gratuity was already included for party of 8 when she brought  the bill. No expression of being sorry or concern the we did not eat our meal.

BoPfpnT8TmRt-cLxP9tAew.text: I chose this restaurant for my birthday dinner.  My cousin highly recommended the food.  We were able to make reservations with one of their private rooms for our group.  It was awesome!  Our room had a flat panel tv in there and it was a comfortable environment.  The restaurant also has a beautiful large outdoor patio outside and you can take some cool photos when the lights and images flash on the waterfall.  Our server knew a lot about the cuts and types of steaks they prepared.  The appetizers were delicious and the food didn't take as long to prepare as I thought it would have for our party of 9 people.  The wine was yummy... I went with a Pinot Noir.  I ordered a petite filet and scallops.  It was yummy!  Small portion but it was very filling. I sampled my friend's prime rib and steak.  Both had different tastes and very juicy and tasty.   The best part was the desserts!  I had a chocolate souffle with ice cream and fresh fruit. We also had an almond coconut cake, a peanut butter cake, and sorbets and ice cream samples.  It was all so good I had to sample a bite of it all.  YUM YUM YUM!!! You will love this place!  Make sure you take care of your servers and wait staff... they take excellent care of you here!!!  Everyone is very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dk8zVpIROD5JQnPdW7lCSg.text: I was very disappointed. I had my share of good steakhouses and this high end restaurant did not measure up at all to my expectations. If i'm paying 200 dollars for a steak, i expect it to be delicious.   The venue is very nice... you see the outdoor water light show at the wynn/encore.  I had the halibut.. was a bit dry... Boulud next door tasted way better.  Ny steak - dry  Ribeye... was actually ok... better than the NY steak  the seafood platter.. over price for the lil amt of seafood they had  Foie Gras - wasn't as good as i thought... i had way better  Cream Spinach, Mushrooms, Lobster Mac and Cheesse was all just ok.... and there were hardly ANY lobster in the mac and cheese.   I was really disappointed.... expected more from the wynn

qWYgJ6v7ig7RpF0OvTT2og.text: Excellent, from start to finish. Dined at SW on Friday 4/5/13 with 5 friends. We did have a reservation and didn't have to wait at all for our table which I like. We even made a last minute change and got a table outside with a great view. The entire staff was great, very friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable. They have some great selections in the bread basket so be sure to check those out. Had a shrimp cocktail appetizer which I enjoyed. A friend and I shared the Porterhouse for two instead of each ordering a bone-in rib eye. A good call. I had great mac & cheese at Chef Neil Perry's Rockpool in Melbourne so I decided to give SW's a try. Not as good as Neil's but still a nice side dish and worth the money as it can be shared with multiple people. They have a Vegan page on the menu which is pretty cool for a steakhouse. For dessert I went with the daily special which was Chocolate Souffle: AWESOME. I snapped a few pics for your enjoyment... Definitely go to SW for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everyone was happy.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse for two, what&#39;s left that is. :)
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turf and turf. I don&#39;t know how those vegetables got on the plate.

J4pcUdYiVL5KBD4aZiMPiA.text: Anything Steve Wynn touches turns to gold. So when a restaurant carries his initials nothing but complete excellence is a must. The atmosphere is amazing. This small, cozy steakhouse overlooks the waterfall at the lake of dreams. The waterfall shows run frequently on the hour & to say they are amazing is an understatement. The menu is filled with delicious, fatty options. Pretty much anything you order will suit your palate. The wine list is vast & martinis are strong. But beware! You will never dine here unless you plan ahead. Weekend reservations need to be made days in advance.

cSJHMv_sN8jWhw37GsVhEA.text: Outstanding service.  Outstanding food.  It's not Peter Luger, but it's very good.  By far, it is my favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas.   They serve aged steaks and excellent appetizers.  Overall a better experience than all of the trendy steakhouses.  NB Try to sit outside and watch the laser "animatronic" show.  It's a visual feast.

81LF8cK-3YqJW0d3da3Ncg.text: We ate here a year ago and I thought this place was untouchable.  We went again yesterday and I was very underwhelmed.  The service is still top notch but the food was just blah.  I had the shrimp scampi appetizer.  It had very little flavor.  My mom ate the halibut and it was OK not great.  I had the porterhouse.  It was charred so bad all I could taste is the char.  The asparagus and the Au gratin potatoes were awesome.  We shared a strawberry shortcake for desert.  It was unbelievably good. All in all not what I would expect from Steve Wynn's own restaurant.  Some real good some not so good.

ZU4iPXnAwDxg4XjbOW969g.text: All the hotel information talked this up as the best restaurant in town with entertainment provided with a show over the lake and waterfall. When we got there for our reservation the host was fairly gruff - I guess he wasn't impressed with us. We were promptly seated but walked past all the empty tables with a view of the lake and were seated in the back corner with NO view of the lake. Not the way I was expecting to start off my hot date night with the wife before Le Reve. On to the food. Wife had the ribeye well done. I ordered the NY strip with bacon shallops. Also had a side of potatoes au gratin. Unfortunately they forgot the bacon shallots and mixed up our orders, so the strip came well done and the ribeye medium. We switched which was alright but you wouldn't expect that from this level of restaurant. The potatoes were delicious and the bacon shallots were pretty good too.  So I would say the food here is a solid 4 stars. I was going to give it a lower overall rating but our waitress was very nice and did comp the meal due to their mistake.  Seemed like the staff was a little snooty which is somewhat expected at a nice place like this but it's not like I showed up in sweatpants...

KLr8fn6NIsC1M64eCfBBmw.text: I was a little thrown back at the fact the head host carried a long lengthy conversation with a gentleman who walked up to her the same time that I did. She didn't even acknowledge the fact that I was waiting there by myself.   The waiter who assisted us was friendly, however he messed up our order by giving us two foie gras pate, when we asked for the pan seared foie gras. It wasn't that much of a big deal to me, so I didn't want to bring attention to it. However, my filet mignon wasn't up to my expectations. It was too salty... a little too much sodium intake for me. Overall, I would say that SW was okay. If you asked me if I would visit again- I would, but probably prefer sitting outside with the beautiful lighting, and not deal with the rude hostess.

q93PZ1rcHabdQkRWla0cqw.text: I try not to write these negative reviews, however today, making an exception.  I have been coming to this steakhouse for over 3 years proclaiming it one of my favorite steak joints on the strip from feasting with friends to client dinners.  I ate at plenty of steakhouses and know there are many good ones on and off strip.  I travel to Texas 1-2 a month and have a decent palate for good beef.  Within this timeframe, I probably spent over $12K with SW, which isn't pocket change when it is from my own wallet and it is not comped.  :(  For this dinner engagement, we were celebrating my finance's recent promotion and our post private engagement dinner.  During the reservation process, I made a couple of special requests.  Dining inside and a romantic spot if they had availability.  They did not come through on either, which the later, I wasn't expecting much when sitting indoors at this establishment.  When we check in, they tried to sit us outside?!  It is 114 degree's and reaching record highs!  We asked the floor manager our preference was to sit inside and that I specifically asked to be sat indoors due to the torturous heat.  Instead of informing us they would look for availability, the floor manager became difficult and tried to convince us to eat outside.  We finally said, no thank you, please sit us indoors.  What surprised us is that he became very rude.  I wasn't expecting that?!  Even his congratulatory comment to us was basically sarcastic and unprofessional.  My finance was shocked because she didn't expect that type of comment or service at the Wynn.  I was ready to say a few unpleasant words and then leave the place.  Instead, my better half said, let's just forget about it and enjoy this day.  When expecting to pay hundreds to thousands of dollars at a restaurant like the SW, you would expect great Service from beginning to end.  Seriously, the floor manager needs to be re-train to be considerate to customers and not dictate things to people.  People show up to your restaurant to experience a wonderful dining opportunity.  On the positive, the dinner started to get better when the waiter started to serve us.  He was very helpful and provided A+ service.  We were served a bad porterhouse which was very stringy and difficult to eat.  It happens, so they corrected it and gave us a complimentary bone in rib eye to replace it.  The truffle (something?) was yum, as well as the grilled onions. The filet was very juicy and delicious.  I would say, SW prepares some of the better ones.  Nice and juicy for this cut.  The wine pairing was ok, but that's what happens when you move from NY to rib eye.  All in all, we had a decent dinner and left full.  :/

OUtp8i7q3P84P0HQvC3e8Q.text: The best steak I've had anywhere.   We ate at SW in October when we were in Vegas for vacation and all I can say is WOW!!!!!   The dining room was elegant and had a view of a pond with a light show and the service was world class.   Steve Wynn really out did himself this time. The food was among the best I've had anywhere. To start the bacon and cheese biscuits were to die for, the sides were all outstanding and my steak..oh my god my steak was an orgasm for my mouth. My Meal was prepared exactly to my requests and exceeded my expectations. I just can't say enough good things about my experience here. My girlfriend and I were both wooed.   This is definitely a special occasion place but with this kind of food I'll be flying to Vegas a lot more for special occasion meals.   If your looking for THE BEST steakhouse in Vegas this is it. There are some good ones out there too but for my money SW takes the prize.

_BWGhTJX192TVyZ-dfLkWw.text: We came to SW Steakhouse on a Wednesday night with a group of 10 for a friends birthday. I was surprised at how busy the place was for a Wednesday night.   I love how the restaurant is open to the outside and you can see the show on the water... until you start having conversations and a big table of 10 in a rather noisy restaurant competing with the show. It got old real fast.   We ordered a few bottles of wine and a plethora of appetizers. I wasn't "running the show" so I can't speak of their wine selection but from what I drank, I was impressed.   Appetizers:  Grilled Shrimp  Kobe Beef Carpaccio  giant seafood sampler with oysters, lobster...  some kind of Beet Salad  all delish   I had the Steve's Chopped Salad which was quite large and very good.   At the advice of our dinner host/birthday boy. My husband had the Rib-Eye. I had the Ahi Tuna. I asked for rare and it came out more like medium rare, so that was kind of a disappointment. But the rib-eye, ahhhh, like heaven. The spice rub/crust was amazing. Melt in your mouth.   We had quite a few bottles of wine and were in such good company with conversation going on so I can honestly say I didn't pay much attention to the staff or the service. That leads me to believe that all was well, because only bad service is really noticeable. Good service should blend right in!   For desert my husband and I shared the cheesecake. Excellent choice. I was jealous of the people who ordered the funnel cake. That looked amazing and they were quite satisfied. Next time, I'll try the funnel cake for sure.   Overall a great dining experience. Lost a star because my tuna was overcooked. Quite pricey, but can be expected from a fine dining establishment at the Wynn.

E0rJRWpH4qWp1NS8R4Cl7Q.text: Great spot in restaurant-rich vegas.  Less stuffy than Prime, my other favorite.  If the weather's good be sure to sit outside to enjoy the trippy little "show" they do every half hour or so.  Steaks were supurb (had an ancho chili rubbed bone in ribeye) and the sides were fantastic.  Did the scallops as an app as well and they were stellar.  Very good overall.

v1hyyS6L9Zuojoh1L8y3Pw.text: I am so sorry to write such a negative review because we have loved the food and service here and have been a patron EVERY time we visit from the East Coast, which is once every six months. I was hoping to introduce my entire family to an amazing restaurant to share my 50th birthday. I'm not someone who would normally even take the time to write a review, however our experience this evening was so awful that I feel inclined to let others know not to expect too much, even if you have been a customer here for several years.  There are so many other options in Las Vegas, I suggest you try them.  The service was so poor I can't believe these are professional waiters.  After eating at Carbone the night before, with the most amazing food and service I can't imagine why I would come back here.  So very disappointing and disgusted!!! I would try one of the hundreds of other steakhouses that would blow this one away!!! You have lost me and my family as  customers forever!!

XLLvoxqxWB1_agM4ax0avQ.text: Great steakhouse... The sides are very generous.. One is enough for 4-6...so order less... The wait for the outdoor table was 45 min with the reservation ... Get there early ... The lake show is the highlight of this place... Still enjoying this after 8 years... Unique and its so vegas... Overall great food great service...they should improve the check in ...

_2JmYAqmADVH0i4COu6gwA.text: Atmosphere and service were fantastic,  unfortunately the weather was bad, so no seating on the patio.  My husband's NY Strip was perfectly cooked,  I ordered the filet mignon medium, maybe that was my mistake but there was NO pink in it,  it was almost well done.  Bummer.  Yukon mash and roasted asparagus didn't wow me, but the gluten free bread they brought was amazing.  I have celiac disease and appreciate any restaurant that has a gluten free menu and offers bread especially!

HzXAFAUvcTVCL-ZzaT9nxQ.text: SW was pretty darn tasty. We went in a large group and were seated in the patio area overlooking the Lake of Dreams. The service was excellent and the food was solid but not OMG good.  I had the bone in ribeye and also had the Funnel Cake for dessert.

9bt9dWKWBRBkWFR6QNlDNA.text: Friday 8:30p.m reservation was right on time with a table ready and waiting for us.  Our party of 6 dined at the outdoor terrace that overlooks the Lake of Dreams.   The outdoor heaters kept us perfectly warm in January.  There are a few different water shows that play periodically in the lake which is a bonus to sitting outside if you are looking for an entertaining dining experience.   Some of the shows are odd but still entertaining.  Ambiance outside is great and I would never sit inside here.  I wasn't very hungry so I ordered 2 starters and no entree.  I love beet salad and order it whenever I see it on a menu.  The beet salad here was small and not something that I would ever ordered again at SW.  Most of the beets were grated on the plate with only a few small chunks of red and yellow beets on top w/ hardly any greens.  I also ordered the Steak Tartare.  They put the steak pieces in a metal ring and only usually sear the steak in the top of the ring.  I requested that they sear the top and bottom so it wasn't totally raw on the bottom. It came out cooked just like I had wanted. It included 4 pieces of toasted bread, Worcestershire Dijon Aioli,  crumbled hard boiled egg, with chives. Excellent flavor and very filling for being a starter.  I had a few of my friends steak fries that were phenomenal and seemed to keep their heat for a while. I am sure we can all agree that really hot french fries are the best!    Dessert:  Funnel cake was excellent.  It came with about 6 cakes on a metal tree. It was served with some strawberries and a trio of chocolate and carmel dipping sauces. 5/5 --a must try.  They do offer quite a few vegan options if that is something that you are looking for.  The negatives:  The table that was right next to us had 3 or 4 people smoking and the smoke wafted our way which is always unpleasant.   Smoking shouldn't be allowed at SW even if you are outside--Yuck! We had to look for our waiter to order more drinks which is really annoying.  They didn't keep the iced teas full and I sat with an empty glass for quite a while before I had to request a new tea because they were oblivious.  My friends requested the wine list but they took so long coming back to see what they selected that they changed their minds because it was getting late and most were working early the next day.  A "fine dining" steakhouse like SW should give exceptional service for the prices you are paying and should absolutely NOT allow smoking. Don't just drop the food off and vanish.  You shouldn't have to hunt the waiter down for drinks especially when they have multiple servers looking after your table.    Hidden Restrooms: You either have to know where they are located or ask someone where they are???  They are hidden behind the large back wall area of the bar.  There isn't a sign indicating restrooms are behind the wall and it looks like an area for staff only.  The ladies room has frosted glass doors that had smudges and fingerprints all over the doors giving it a grungy feeling.

YzvdW_Zl1uiBF1cDlZQETw.text: I have dreams of the rib eye from time to time. I heard Steve Wynn is a vegetarian yet he still lends his initial to this place. C'mon bro, have you TRIED your steaks here. Come back to the dark side Steve.

Byw_4YxTeqTWOsJdy6cs0A.text: Had a reservation and were promptly seated.  Waiter took drink orders and came back quickly.  Told him we needed a little while to study the menu.  After they kind of forgot about us, we finally got our order taken.    Had a great time with the shrimp cocktail!!!  Some of my guests at the table did not know what real horse radish looks like (they wrapped the shrimp for the shrimp cocktail around it - see my photos).  So if you're one step ahead of the pack, ask everyone to take a good bite of the stick and then have them tell you what it is..........by that time, they'll know what it is.  Hahahaha......nice game to pass the time.  I have to say, quality of the meat was very good.  We had 4 x the club chop which was very well cooked.  Well seasoned and slightly gristled on the outside and pink inside as we wanted it.    Do order the truffled creamed corn as it is fantastic, as was the potato gratin.  We ordered a nice Italian bottle of wine, rather inexpensive compared to what was on the menu.  When we ordered the second bottle, which took forever to get, they came out with a 2007, we had been drinking a 2006.  As it took so long and was handled poorly, we declined the second the bottle.  Next time, just be up front with the guest, or mention that THIS is the last bottle.  We'd understand.  Don't try and sneak a fast one.  That's not appreciated.  Overall, I'd return.  Get a table facing the window with the show outside.  In between the show, the real thing to watch are the gold diggers pretending that they know what they are eating and trying to look thin.  I mean we saw one bimbo sitting at a table with her GF sitting next to a "john" and she was texting someone the entire time and trying not to be noticed doing so.  It was hilarious.  It's great to people watch when the show's not going on.  Enjoy it, its a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After the battle.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The club chop - fantastic piece of meat!!!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lonely crab cake.

h2yo_Szh0A1bDrT9XWlM8w.text: It has a great view of the waterfall show.  But the only steaks they had were wet aged so for steaks I prefer Lawry's for prime rib or if you can splurge on several types of meat CUT by Wolfgang Puck or if you want sort of a hidden gem the steakhouse at Circus Circus.

Rm1UTMjDlj2Qxznm1CysDw.text: Great view of the Lake of Dreams...  Great food...  Okay service.  I felt like our waiter thought he was too cool to be taking food orders or something.

NIQar7mCnGVlCCDZ3iDVEg.text: I took my boyfriend here for his 22nd birthday and we very much enjoyed our dinner. When we got there just on time for our dinner reservations, we were seated promptly, and even asked if we could sit in the patio so we could watch the little show that they show starting from 7:30. My boyfriend and I expected so much from that show based on the yelp reviews, but honestly it's not that big of a deal. The show consisted of barely two minutes of a giant frog singing a song. It was enjoyable to watch however we waited for two hours just to watch this show since we both were curious about it. Other than the show, everything was perfect, the view from the patio is very pretty, the weather made it even more phenomenal, and the food was delicious. We ordered the crab cake, my bf got the bone in rib eye and a side of fries, which in my opinion was not worth $12.00, tastes the same as five guys. I ordered the Bone in New York which the server recommended to get in rare and I'm so glad I did! With a side of the cream corn which is a must try if you're planning on dining here! Soooo delicious! This place is pretty pricy but worth giving a try once the occasion is right! Definitely not a regular place to eat since it is expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The two minute show
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream corn nom!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in New York steak rare

b91FWJCI9BKeJTtoi4BM2Q.text: Host: 2.0 Waiter: 3.5 Food-taste, presentation: 3.0 Property-style, decor, ambiance: 4.5  In the city where excess is the norm; this "most coveted" (per the hotel's concierge) did not meet expections.

F31rKIbu7lp-3Z84u-hHQg.text: The only place in vegas with certified real authentic Kobe beef (although they do not always have all the cuts in stock).   One of the best overall dining experiences I've ever had including service, decor, how they make their Old Fashioned's, sides, and steak prep.  I never order dessert but every time I go here, I always have to get their funnel cake.

tPpjtGsSwqYOQh2607JwoA.text: My boyfriend and I had quite a great dining experience. The steak is great and the truffle corn is to die for, but as for the lobster.. I can't really agree it's maine lobster.

9NAz7bPwiv8CkKtYSs1Lrw.text: Food is delicious. Service wonderful. Pricy, but great for a special occasion in our world :) Wine list is ridiculous.  I understand paying for more the food, it's their craft.  The wine is not made of gold.

VDy2kKgktU9Bz_bRBOoqAg.text: Damn good every time we've visited. I hope I can say that.  Really and truly our no 1 choice for steakhouses in all USA. That's strong stuff, but that's SW.

8IRho9Nn8evDYDPd3rJVrg.text: I thought the atmosphere was nice and the staff knew their stuff. I was immediately blown away by the ridiculous prices. Yes, it's Las Vegas. So they take full advantage of marking everything up quite well. The portions are fairly small except for the steaks. They're pretty large and rich. I got the halibut ($38). It was good but a little dry. I tried my friend's steak and it was quite tasty.  The sides are good but small ($12 each). The potatoes, creamed spinach, sauteed mushrooms and peppers were the best.  The wine list is HUGE. Be sure to bring your gold bars for the $60,000 bottles. And there are more expensive ones than this one.  I don't plan on going back. I went for a bachelor party. There were 14 of us and we each paid $130 at the end. I'm sure there are good steakhouses in the area that are a little easier on the wallet and still give you good value and quality.  Get the chocolate souffle. It's very good.  Be aware that the prices may be higher on some items than what is shown on their website.

pzQfuvtaYra-0YVo_AO_fQ.text: What would you expect from the signature steakhouse in the Wynn - excellence .... and that is what you get.  Excellent service...... Food cooked to perfection ...... Phenomenal wine list .... Supurb ambiance.  We ate dinner during the christmas season, the crowd being a little light and it just added to the enjoyment of our meal.   We started with the lump crab cake and it melted in our mouth .... The bread basket has some enjoyable treats - pre meal.....  I dined on the New York strip and it could not have been cooked better - just excellent.  I asked for some steak sauce and was presented with a small platter of three outstanding choices -  a signature chipotle BBQ sauce, hollandaise and a spicey mango sauce. We also had rack of lamb and scallops, again cooked to perfection....... A supurb bottle of wine accented the meal. A real christmas treat.  Try not to miss thiswonderful dining spot with the beauriful views. We viewed two fo the water shows during our meal.  You will not regret your choice of eating at SW.

o8nPJEeg_ymqQFxiozjX2Q.text: Some of the best steak I've had. The fact that I enjoyed my ribeye, cooked to perfection knowing that I had to pay for it even though I could have gotten it for free from a job recruitment dinner says alot (people always know that food tastes better free).  Still enjoyed the meal even though I lost at credit card roulette and payed half the meal with a friend for 7 people with drinks says even more.  Must try is the bacon bread included free in the bread basket.  Sick.  Probably helped out that I won enough money at the tables prior to the meal to buffer the hit a little :)

iT3a5QNpz3VNKrnn7ZSYpQ.text: Great Steak, Great View, Great service. Probably the best resturant in Vegas. I'm from LA and have been fortunate to enjoy many high-end resturants. The service here made this resturant a step above other "famous" steakhouses in the area

NRMsGgf5yeCcflya8Ev6_w.text: We came here for my Birthday. In short it's a great steakhouse. Great food and a fun atmosphere. Its not as elegant as the Prime steakhouse in Bellagio. But the food is very decent.  It was a Friday night. And it was a packed house. We had 7:30 reservations and waited 15 minutes to be seated. The crowd was a mix of old school well to do and dome really sleazy looking guys dressed in Jersey Shore style tight Ed Hardy like t-shirts even though they clearly tell you a  few times button down dressed shirts are required. That was odd for me. I felt that took away from their integrity.  What's the point of having a rule if you won't enforce it. then just take if off the front door sign.  We had the bone-in rib eye and the lamp chops. The rib eye was good. A bit too tough for my taste even though I had it medium. The lamp chops were probably the best I've ever had. The literary melted off the bone. The steak sauces were uninspired.  Trendy yes, but tasty no.. kind of disappointing.  The desert was ok. We had the banana bread pudding.  Tip: they allow you to bring your own cake from the hotel Bakery which is amazing. I would definitely do that next time over ordering from  their desert menu.  We had the spinach dip as a side dish and it was OK. I've had better ones at the Cheesecake factory.  The bread was ok. I was hoping / expecting for much more.   In general everything here is fine. It's  a great restaurant well thought out with great meats and ingredients. But I was hoping for much more. I was hoping to be a convert, and that did not happen  The service was confusing. They have two guys tend to you. One for all your drink needs. And one for your food and desert. Even with that we waited 20 minutes to get our order taken. But to be fair the food was  brought to our table within 10 minutes of the order,  which tells me they have very impressive kitchen.  The bill was $250 for an appetizer,  two main courses, desert, and a glass of wine. Nothing here blew me away. But it's good all around.  Where an amazing night out dining gets a 5 start rating. This place gets  4 stars. As they concentrate on volume. It's a Volume joint and attention is not given to detail. The personal touch is not here. For that you'll go to the Prime at the Bellagio.

KaB6nWcv48v0inHwLKYCTA.text: What an enchanting dining establishment. Our reservation was for shortly after the restaurant opened, so for a short time we were one of just a few other patrons. I will say that not having any background noise from other patrons made the music stand out, and what was playing didn't seem to fit the vibe of the room. Pop and top 40 really isn't what any of us were expecting and we commented on it throughout our meal.  The servers were polite and informative. It was also a treat to have the ladies served first. It's been quite some time since I've seen a server pass over the male patron to serve the female first. Old-fashioned I know, but I still enjoyed it.   I have to say the filet mignon was perfection. I enjoy mine medium rare and with a thick cut of meat, getting the middle of it done just right can be tricky. My cut was done exactly as I like it, and the flavoring of the meat was fantastic. I also have to gush about the truffle cream corn. It was so good I almost wanted to take a bath in it.   We also had the treat of them opening up the shades and doors to the outside seating area part way through out meal. Initially it was too warm out to have done so, but as the evening set in and the sun eased off they threw open the doors to the terrace and let in the sweet desert air.   I will say the attire of several other diners surprised me. Flannel and jeans...really? Couldn't even be bothered to put on a pair of slacks, huh? Listen up, if I can be bothered to put on a damn dress, the least you can do is find a damn tie.   Overall, I enjoyed SW and would recommend it to friends, but the should really enforce a certain level of attire and think about changing up the music.

UFr7VOSwQVb4FMmodIcx6A.text: Always impeccable service. This time courtesy of Alan our server and his crew. Went with the grilled octopus to start and was so flavorful and would get as an entry if available. Adult beverages were Margarita and leeches martini. Both were excellent. We will always come here for the service and exemplary cuisine.

nnN3EjzAkXUmAC0g1lfEug.text: They didnt allow our child in on a stroller which is a violation of the American Disability Act.  So we went elsehwere and didnt spend the $2000 on the overpriced meal n wine..

xkyHIUSAStCxJwKPBOH__Q.text: Good food BUT beware of HOT Plate which they don't tell you about and you can get a really bad burn from the plate!!!!!! And employees Don't care if you burn yourself and do absolutely nothing !!!! Come with your own burn kit!!

w0yzXicOuD42840nXKCTdA.text: Steak, yes steak, more steak please!!!!   Impressive entry down a circular escalator ( how is the possible?) in a brightly lit lobby with "dancing lighting "   Three of us went for a Business dinner, but of course my business did not pay because if we did we'd be bankrupt.   Pricey, very pricey. We shared the chateaubriand and bone in ribeye medium rare.  Cooked perfectly medium rare and both obviously perfect cuts of beef. We had the seafood tower as an appetizer it was loaded with goodness.   We sat near the outside on a wonderful night and I really enjoyed the little electronic light and music shows that went on from time to time. I did not know about this feature. It was very creative.   Food all was wonderful and enjoyed bay all. Our waiter was attentive and staff was courteous for the most part ( stepping aside when you walked by and many thank you's and may I's )   As expected the bill for 3 with wine was 600 dollars plus tip. Worth every penny ( if someone else is paying unless it's your last meal but  it will be a great one.

a_5PFY3tP7-mY6ykfhmuRg.text: Food was not 5 star quality  Venue was not 5 Star   Overall this place is not a big deal as I had heard   Will not return

wMPKWXr7cA0XcvjrOL0xtQ.text: High end steak house at the Wynn. Great decor and ambiance. Food was good but simple. For appetizer we had the apple kale salad and Sea food tower both were amazing. Scallops were perfectly cooked (salty for my taste). Rib eye was served medium rare and it was delicious and our side dishes were mac n cheese, asparagus, mushrooms (my fave) and French fries. I didn't like the risotto it lacked flavor. For dessert we had the funnel cake which was displayed beautifully and cheesecake both were very good. Customer service was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funnel cake with chocolate, caramel and marshmallow dippings :)
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Cheesecake

KukIip6vomp4aXXqP-Ik4g.text: Wanted to update since they responded asking me to reach out to them.... I did email them as they asked and received an email stating they would get back to me within 5-7 business days. Hasn't happened... I sent the email Nov 9th and have yet to get a response so I feel like their response on here isn't out of concern but to try and make it seem like they want to resolve the issue. Again, totally ridiculous considering you pay $200+ per person at this restaurant. I lowered to 1 star because at this point I feel insulted that they would act like they want to hear my issue but then ignore me.

p3TfdVuBWlEyjDMCjoF2Vg.text: Can't get any better than SW Steakhouse. Everything was just amazing. Food was over the top. Service was over the top. My go to place when I'm in Las Vegas.

4XJG-_OFP3tvATRFkksUVg.text: Dined here for our Christmas dinner.  Other than the fact that I waited 45 mins when we clearly had our reservation... I guess it was OK. I do have to say our waiter was very attentive and accommodating but I felt rushed during our whole dining experience. Since we had our O show booked for the later evening, that 45 mins delay was crucial.   Rib eye was delish but not so much of that domestic Wagyu (and this was recommended by our waiter). It just did not lived up to the expectation.   After all, it is one of the nice steakhouse in Vegas. Worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l89yPTTPiLa5twR4yfdodg.text: My husband and I booked a trip to Vegas from April 4, 2018 thru April 8, 2018 for a friend's birthday celebration. We stayed at the Encore - we love the Encore....one of our favorites! We had reservations for SW Steakhouse at the Wynn on April 5, 2018 at 5:30 PM. There were 5 of us in the party - one guest, Anthony, arrived after we had already ordered - a friend of the birthday girl - my husband and I just met him at dinner for the first time.  First, I'd like to say, the service was impeccable, the setting was perfect with the waterfall just outside the restaurant and the food was amazing, until...  ...the next morning, my husband woke up nauseated, needing to vomit. I purchased Pepto Bismol from Sundries in the lobby at Encore. This did not help, it just prolonged the inevitable. Just a bit later, he was hunched over the toilet vomiting meat from the evening before - Japanese Wagyu - Kobe, Hyogo Perfecture Rib Eye $220 4 oz + $55/additional ounce - my husband had 6 oz cooked medium rare.  I tried to convince him to go to an Urgent Care but he didn't feel well enough to get dressed and into a cab.  He was unable to eat much at all for 3 days and by the 4th day, he almost felt normal again - of course this was the day we were heading home.  I contacted the SW Steakhouse on Saturday evening, April 7, 2018 by phone and asked to speak with the Manager regarding food poisoning. I was told he was very busy since it was a peak time in the evening - which I understand though they don't open until the evening so there are no other options of times to call - regardless; the hostess assured me the Manager would call me back shortly.  About  1/2 hour later, I receive a phone call from Security asking me if I had lost an item in the hotel or at a restaurant ??? Though I "now" understand this is the process for SW Steakhouse and the Wynn with regards to food poisoning - the gentlemen had no idea why he was contacting me. I explained I expected a call back from the SW Steakhouse Manager and since I was told I would receive a call from him, could he please call me back. Security then had the SW Steakhouse Manager call back.  At this point, I was pretty fed up with the treatment I was receiving and handed the phone to my husband. My husband explained the situation to the Manager. After he was off the phone, my husband told me the Manager was very polite and empathetic though we had to go through Risk Management/Security to file a claim for the food poisoning. We were told Risk Management/Security would contact us at 10:00 am the next morning - no one called.  We returned home that Sunday evening, April 8, 2018 and received a phone call around 9:00 pm from Risk Management/Security.  Maybe the Manager meant to say 10:00 pm???  My husband explained the details to Risk Management/Security, to include; *I had ordered the same dish and had an upset stomach for the whole next day and a lot of acid reflux - I ordered my Rib Eye - medium well. *Anthony, the friend of the birthday girl, we had learned from the birthday girl was also vomiting and sick for the remainder of the trip - he stayed in his room for 3 days as well - he ordered the same Rib Eye - rare  A few days later I received a phone call from Risk Management/Security stating they "investigated" the restaurant, the food prep process, the clean up and questioned all the employees to ensure they knew the process for prepping/handling food properly which is how the health department would inspect the premises.  I was also told, no one was sick 48 hours prior to our meal and no one was sick 48 hours after our meal.  She questioned the validity of our sicknesses though in the same sentence hoped we all felt better.  I was told due to their findings, our sicknesses were not food poisoning and they were not responsible.  I was baffled by the explanation of their investigation - I honestly thought they had a way of finding out what made 3 of us sick when I was told they would investigate.   I DON'T CARE IF NO OTHER GUESTS WERE SICK - MY HUSBAND WAS VIOLENTLY SICK!!!   I was asked if we had sought medical help.  I've now learned by reading online reviews from others who did seek medical help; this would not have changed their findings. All that have claims of food poisoning from the Wynn received the same result/treatment we did.   We honestly didn't expect a refund even though we were unable to attend any of the Birthday Girl's events planned for the next 2 days (we were told Anthony did not attend these events either) and it ruined out trip but to insinuate we were lying is very offensive.   My husband and I travel a lot.  We visit Las Vegas about 3-4 times a year and love the Encore/Wynn...well, "loved" it. We had planned to make many more trips there in future.  We will definitely let all our friends know about the food poisoning and treatment we received. We will not visit the Wynn/Encore again.

fbU2FwW5l5QwdFWsunb40g.text: The Wagyu is the way to go.  I'm slowly converting to this beef variant, and the NY cut is good since it's marbleized so it's tender and tasty, more so than a standard Rib Eye or Fillet Mignon.  Here, there's an $80 priced 10 oz steak which is perfect.  I've had Wagyu at Wolfgang Puck's "Cut" as well as "Flemming's" and this is on par to perfection.  If you've never had Wagyu, it's worth trying.  I've had traditional Kobe Beef which is more oily rich and a bit too decadent for my palete at times in comparison 'tho really good, much more expensive, so for taste and value, I'd always go with the Wagyu over Kobe.  The service was friendly and fast.  I also had the King Crab Soup which was zesty and tasty 'tho not a lot of crab in it, it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu menu
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Crab tomato based soup... Zesty!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American Wagyu steak, highly recommended

QkZKsGN4hvuobRWIQlpaMQ.text: I am a pretty big fan of eating steak. I was referred over to try SW steak house at the Wynn and boy was I IMPRESSED.   Service.  The service isn't bad at all. The hosts were very welcoming unlike other steakhouses where they are just straight rude. My servers kept my water full at all times. He must have asked if I needed anything at least 5 times. My servers assistant even asked if they could serve/plate my food for me. Thank you so very much for asking!   Food.  We had a party of two. So we got an appetizer and two entrees. For our appetizer we got the crab cakes to share. It was basically one crab cake per person. I am a very huge fan of crab cakes and I was again very impressed with the SW's cakes. For our entrees we got the 40oz Porter House and the sea scallops. The meat was delicious, however the meat wasnt as tender as some of the other steakhouses around. STILL DELICIOUS THOUGH! The sea scallops were a different story. It was just ehh, nothing spectacular at all. 4 scallops with a little bit of risotto. The risotto was nothing but salt. For our side we ordered jumbo size asparagus . Very delicious. I would seriously recommend it.   Price.  Not bad at all. Party of two came out to $130 a person. Honestly it was a perfect night.   Dining.  We sat outside and had a view of the waterfall. They have a show like every thirty minutes. It was beautiful.   Check the pictures.

7HEFQ6C--xAE87nKJgLRaA.text: Went to this steak house on Friday and had to return on Saturday because it was great.   Steak melted in my mouth - service was excellent.

udqXCEn2qnFoSVarH1LSkQ.text: This is a must do when you come to Vegas! The food is amazing and service is superb! Make reservations early and request the patio so you can enjoy to view of the lake of dreams and experience the excitement that comes with it.

JoYRgpnDGpuxes4nR9nLCA.text: It was our anniversary so decided to splurge. -Japanese Wagyu Kobe Tenderloin -Filet Mignon -Au Gratin Potatoes -Mustard Greens -Deep Fried Peach Pie w/rasberry ice cream -Coconut Tapioca First time having such high end quality Japanese wagyu and it was definitely delicious and worth trying. Unfortunately we cannot afford that on a regular basis, it is definitely expensive. The filet was great. The sides were decent. I would say mustard greens in general is not the tastiest vegetable but I had a need to eat something green. The desserts were GREAT.  Service was amazing. We never had to wait for anything or flag down anyone. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable.

32Xe8i93hA9ym5o1rFnRmA.text: By far the best steak house I have ever too and was so glad I was able to come back this past weekend with my bf and friends who have never been here. Very nice restaurant and has a beautiful outside area with a waterfall wall and show every 15 minutes.   We all ordered different steaks and shared: truffled cream corn, mashed potatoes, Brussel sprouts, and foie gras.  Everything came out perfectly, steaks were cooked nicely, some sides were better than others and the service was superb.   If I were to come back again I would get the rib eye, and truffled cream corn. Brussel sprouts I thought weren't too bad but didn't really like the bacon too much with it. Foie gras was okay as well but then again I can't eat too much of it and mashed potatoes were good but not the best I've had. Make sure to try the bacon and cheese bread they give you in your bread basket when it comes out cause it taste the best when it's warm with the butter melted on it. Also has the Hennessy car bomb with a sugar tin which was pretty good and would order again.

m1LqhWaDHn7FqM-vsQBbkg.text: Good bye to the ratchet Vegas days of drinking all day and night and MAYBE having a cup of noodle the entire weekend and HELLO SW STEAKHOUSE!  Restaurant located in the Wynn so that alone should scream top-notch. Upscale and upbeat. I arrived slightly buzzed and a little after our reservation, but they were able to seat us right away. We were indoors, but our table faced the lake/waterfall. Every half hour or so they put on a little show... It was cute. and somewhat entertaining (not really).   + 20 oz. bone-in rib eye - Again, slightly buzzed so I let my boyfriend order me a 20oz. bone-in rib eye. Otherwise I would've stopped him because omg that's just way too much food. I think he was plotting though because he had plenty of my steak left over lol. Anyway, I barely finished a quarter of it, but my oh my. JUICY, FLAVORFUL, MELT-IN-YOUR-MOUTH, HEAVENLY, etc. etc. etc.  + sides - mushroom, cream corn ... staple steak sides that were really good. BUT if you have to choose at least one... get the jalapeno/onion/pepper dish. SOOOO amazing (if you like spicy food). My boyfriend and I loved it so much we went home that weekend and cooked steak just to eat it with our sorry version of that side. SO GOOD.  + foie gras - I've had way better. I would've been happier without it.  Great experience, but still not my favorite steakhouse ever.

aByTlJFaHq41oCBRFaM-7A.text: I have had the salmon and the chicken breast. Delicious every time. Service is excellent, as well. Nice view! The rocky road dessert is video worthy and delicious

soJ2hUNqqErN-MYXwU9dbQ.text: We had dinner during our last stay a few weeks ago. The food succeeded our expectations. We had the chilli-rubbed steak to share, the mac & cheese and potatoes and everything was perfectly delicious. This is by far the best steakhouse we've tried in Vegas. My only disappointment was the check in. We had called the day before for reservations and unfortunately couldn't get a table by the water, but the hostess could have been a lot more polite about it. Please have people with customer service skills in the front. Initially, her service ruined the expectations I had for this place, but the rest of the service we received from the staff was exceptional. We were very happy with everything else. We will be coming back, next time we will make sure we make reservations with plenty of time so we don't have any issues.

ExzcVKK2mNXqFuawdgR0Kw.text: 9 friends, 4-5 different meals and we all loved our food. The outside tables are close to the lake with great surroundings and a small show every 30 mins. It's expensive like everything is in Vegas, but good sized meals and very good taste.

1l1PtqIhBa_5aGryETbv6Q.text: Had the bone in ribeye and crab Oscar, Mac and cheese,everything was amazing! This is one of my favorite place in Las Vegas.

JBl9iaBkmW-PA8KGAnGYCg.text: AMAZING!!! Best place to get Kobe beef steak!   Had their lobster as well and it was perfectly cooked! They have delicious sides and desserts!   This is the best steakhouse I've been to so far! Had steaks at many other places, but nothing compares to the high grade quality Kobe beef and cooked perfectly medium rare! Had a very interesting display for desserts.   The service is superb! They have a great view when they open up the restaurant during the evening and the weather is nice outside right in front of a waterfall!   Overall, nice ambience and view. Steaks and sides compliment each well! But one thing, be ready to pay a hefty bill, but it's totally worth the experience!!

xG0FXzH2s6vXZHpvDZmCJg.text: Usually one of my go to steakhouse in Vegas when friends visit us.    I highly recommend you make reservations.  The restaurant requires for no sport attire- rubber shoes or t shirt- they remind you on reservation and on online reservation BUT MY RECENT VISIT- their standards have gone done- they let groups of tourist in with tennis shoes, shorts, and t shirt- not just one table but multiple tables.    If like great service and ambience, this the place.  Steak are excellent as usual. Later in the evening, the lake has a show usually every 30 minutes.   Must get the hash brown pie for side dish.  Make room for dessert.

teTy_u6jmTr9EsRUHW0hdg.text: Finally back after 8 years and everything is still excellent. Hubby and I came to SW for our 8th year anniversary. I made reservations online a few weeks before our visit and we were seated right away when we arrived. All the waiters were very courteous and attentive. We enjoyed: Bread basket: 5/5 the three complimentary types of breads were fresh and warm. Pretzel was my fav. Pink sangria: 4/5 pretty tasty! Lychee martini: 3/5 this was ok, kinda sweet Tomato salad: 5/5 light and refreshing Cowboy ribeye: 5/5 cooked to perfection. I was able to finish about 3/4 of it. Our waiter said he was impressed. Potato au gratin: 3/5 not what I remember it to be. Texture and flavor was very average. I would skip this. Anniversary truffles: 5/5 these complimentary truffles were absolutely delicious. The white ones were amazing!  Service and steak were top notch. Definitely recommend this place if you need a steak fix.

uq0B_snA8dRtLNMruVt9Lg.text: SW is located downstairs of the Wynn's north entrance. It's a fairly large restaurant and the hostess asks if you have a preference to sit inside or out on the patio. I chose to sit outside which was very calming and relaxing overlooking the water. Although the temperature was was over 100 it was not hot at all.  I was leaning towards ordering the Kobe because I didn't feel like having a large steak. Corey our waiter recommended the Ohmi instead. I'm glad I followed his advise because the texture was different from wagyu that I've had from Kobe or Kagoshima. I really enjoyed it. For sides I had the Black Truffle Creamed Corn (which I highly recommend) and Asparagus.  There were two waiters assigned to a table and service was impeccable. Corey did an excellent job explaining the menu and checking up to see how things were.  SW is definitely a high end restaurant you want to go to if you are celebrating something special. If you are a romantic, ask for patio seating. Will I return? You bet!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SW Chopped Salad, Black Truffle Creamed Corn, Roasted Asparagus and Ohmi New York Strip

1kihrqvJykh00wTtmah9GA.text: SW Steakhouse is a unique steakhouse because of the beefs they offer that are not available elsewhere in USA, i.e, the Kobe beef. Only three places in the USA have permission to import and serve Kobe beef. For YELPers who are not familiar with Kobe beef, do not mistake this for "Kobe-style" beef or "kobe" or any similar misleading claims/terms at restaurants. True Kobe beef is from Japan and the cattle are literally hand-massaged and feed beer and pampered to death to produce a meat that is unrivaled in quality and flavor. My brother and I chose the "cheap" Kobe which was 180 dollars for a four-ounce portion but my brother chose an additional two ounces at an extra forty-five dollars per ounce. I got the King Krab Oscar add-on and requested it on the side as not to interfere with the Kobe. The four-ounces was perfectly adequate amount due to its richness and flavor punch. It has a flavor profile all its own and doesn't remotely resemble any steak or meat you have experienced. Forget your dry-aged hand-rubbed Capitol Grille-type stuff -there is no comparison. Kobe is very rich and, needless to say, tender and the fat is evenly marbled and melted throughout to provide a highly distinct strong gamey taste and a supreme edibility. The Kobe was served with an Oriental-type sauce for dipping but I recommend eating the Kobe straight up or "neat" just as you would want to appreciate your Louis XIII Cognac straight up or neat as opposed to making an Incredible Hulk Cocktail using Louis XIII Cognac mixed with Hypnotic. The Oscar was a generous portion at 28 dollars and had asparagus and a hollandaise-type sauce. Moey got a steak which was an 8-ounce grass-fed organic USA steak for 62 bucks with a Maine lobster tail for additional 40 bucks which was a good size tail. Hers was very good and would satisfy any steak connoisseur. All steaks came with excellent veggies and sundries and were garnished with H2O 'cress. The service was great and it was reasonably quiet as it was devoid of families and toddlers. Our octopus app was tasty and tender (for an octopus) and had a slick presentation and ausum sauce. I would recommend SW highly. Please do spend the extra $$$ and get the Kobe beef and you'll see what the hype is all about. See you in Vegas, YELPers! $$$$$$$$$$$$$$

LLjLCuwoziABuIuqsB7mRA.text: I am actually so hurt. I CALLED 5 HOURS! ahead twice requesting the chocolate flowerless cake  (that comes with ice cream) ON THE MENU to come out and say happy birthday for my husbands birthday. When it was time for dessert, instead they gave us menus. I sat there confused then they bring out a one bite cake in what looked like a tea light candle holder with NO birthday message. I called back and the manager just apologizes like a kid, won't do ANYTHING and tells me I was supposed to order the cake ahead of time but I called 5 hours ahead of time! I feel extremely insulted.  I thought the evening was gonna be perfect a beautiful place with great food but I'm crushed and this ruined the whole experience. When I seen that tiny cake smaller than a ring ding that cost 1$ come out my heart fell and my husband felt I didn't care about his birthday as the bite sized cake that actually came out seemed like an afterthought by our waiter.

0kqogNbLwHXSkZxZZ0-iNg.text: Amazzzing steakhouse located inside Wynn hotel! I've been to many steakhouses so I'm pretty snooty about my places. The restaurant is quit big and they offer inside and patio seatings. Restaurant is definitely super gorgeous and very upscale....like no jeans even dark jeans kinda upscale. Came in for dinner on a Monday and place was pretty pack inside, but lots of seating in the patio....sheesh I wonder why? Maybe the sweltering heat had something to do with it. Lol Make reservations ahead just in case. The bar area is super cute and sleek so grab a drink if you have to wait for a table. Hostess was friendly and sat us down right away since I had reservations.   We sat in the patio just cause it was less crowded, but it was definitely hot even at 7pm. It just felt more romantic sitting in the patio facing the water so if on a dinner date and weather ain't scolding do patio. Our waitress and waiter was fabulous!!! It seems each table is assigned to two waiters or maybe just the patio area hmmmm anyways let me tell you it was fabulous though! You don't ever really have to wait for anything except for your meals. Seriously, service was impeccable!!! Our drinks came out fast and I mean many many drinks, we were checked on regularly, our water cups were never empty. Oh, bread basket was the shitzzzz, pardon my language, but the pretzel bread with their butter....hallelujah! Beyond delicious!!!   We order octopus for appetizer, scallops, and wagyu steak for our entrees. Octopus was delicious just the right amount of seasoning and smoky chard. It was super soft and can be cut with a butter knife. Scallop was super tender and seasoned to perfection! It sat on top of this creamy pea risotto and presentation was just gorgeous! It was a good size portion and will definitely fill you up. The wagyu steak was seriously like butter and cooked to perfectly! Our only side we order was the mushrooms. Everything was so rich and decadent taking your time to eat is a must! For dessert we order the rocky road. Yesssss that is a must! We spent close to four hours dinning/drinking and not once did we ever felt rushed. Staffs were just amazzzing and super professional. It was a bonus as well getting to watch the water shows while dinning. From the beginning entrance to the end of our drinks/meal SW deserves a standing ovation!

gGRcpQIw63L99LheWe7Bcw.text: Came here to try the pepper crusted chateaubriand. We started with foie gras for appetizer and ordered the butter poached lobster, and macaroni and cheese and creamed spinach for sides. For dessert we went with the cookie butter cheesecake, a must order item. The steak was perfectly cooked and the pepper crust was more flavorful than I expected. The lobster was amazing, just oozing with flavor. The macaroni was rich and the creamed spinach went well with the meat. The complimentary bread basket, especially the pretzel bread was great. The whole meal from start to finish was extremely good. The waterfall outside just added to the perfect ambience.

b5JynidCAaNt0lXacBbAMg.text: Dining experience was perfect. Very very attentive staff that never fails to refill your water or alcohol. Checking up on you continuously and making sure all the dishes are to your liking. 1 of 5 restaurants in the US that has 100% Kobe beef is a distinction in it self but the price is a whopping $260 for 4 oz and you have to order minimum of 4 oz. I settled for their American wagyu from Snake River Farms 10 oz NY Strip which was excellent. The marbling was just right in very bite all throughout the meat which I highly recommend. Desert i chose was their rocky road (boujee version) it was unforgettable to say the least. Not too overly sweet and was a great finish to an excellent 4 hr dinner. Forgot to mention the scallops, mushroom and charred octopus that was also great. My steal was that good

2bAiiDFQavMBGFByuvQLkQ.text: Out standing! Let's put it like this we dine out at some of the most finest places in the world and we are here in Las Vegas and decided to give those join a trial. It was an excellent idea as we arrived close to 6:00 p.m. and simply had a fantastic time in this ultra clean and very pleasant environments. You can sit inside or outside but you better be warned it's like a 109 here in Las Vegas and sitting outside you gonna be really hot. I had a 16 oz New York strip and it was simply amazing. The big portion is good to cause you eating like as if you had a buffet. We had some potatoes and mushrooms for sides as well and that was great.   We have been drinking all day so this talk to text thing is really good and some of you might actually ask why am I writing reviews at this hour? It's for you! For you to be able to go to some of the best places 1/2 confidence that you will be enjoying your meal and that your date afterwards will give you some dessert.

fzR5mibajfXDy7sQ0rFewA.text: REVIEW ON KOBE BEEF: SW Steakhouse is one of 9 restaurants in the United States (and one of 3 restaurants in Las Vegas) that serves certified Kobe beef. I knew I wanted to splurge during my vacation to Vegas and treat myself to some real Kobe beef. I choose SW Steakhouse over the other two restaurants that served it because: (1) SW had better reviews than the other 2 restaurants, (2) from looking at the photos on Yelp the presentation of Kobe at SW was much better, and (3) it wasn't the most expensive option price/oz wise and it wasn't the least expensive option. In hindsight I am really glad I chose to get Kobe at SW. I was incredibly impressed; the steak was cooked to perfection and the meat was incredibly juicy and mouthwatering. (I'm getting hungry and craving Kobe just writing this review.)  REVIEW ON EVERYTHING ELSE: The ambiance at SW Steakhouse is great. We were lucky and got seated right by the waterfall/pool. (The waterfall/pool has a light show with a giant frog that was a little weird but also pretty cool and entertaining.) The service at SW Steakhouse is top notch. I thought the food (that wasn't the Kobe beef) was good, fairly standard for an expensive steakhouse, but nothing to write home about.

f8wUygCJauLY7qPhtBf5IQ.text: Jessica was wonderful and seated us at a better table with a nice view of the show. We had Fernando as our waiter my friend said that her and her hubby came here for her birthday and that Fernando was wonderful! Well he absolutely was! He suggested a nice wine for my friend to have with her steak. She ordered the peppercorn crusted 9 inch filet. She also ordered the fennel mac and cheese and we shared a chopped salad. Due to my food allergies I was told that I couldn't have the vegan meatballs. I was really looking forward to having them. Apparently they have red onion in them. I chose to order the ravioli instead. The ravioli had a weird taste. They were topped with olives and peas, sun dried tomatoes and had a lemony sauce. The flavors just didn't mesh well for me. I tried the mac and cheese and wasn't impressed. Loved the chopped salad it was refreshing and a perfect portion size split between the two of us. I saw a basket of fries and they looked delicious so we ordered those. Good thing I did because they were the best fries I've ever had! Nice and crisp and flavored perfectly! Fernando gave us a chocolate molten cake to enjoy. It was phenomenal! Cooked perfectly and the chocolate that poured out of it was to die for! Thank you to Jessica and Fernando for making what started off as a bad experience a memorable one!  The show was great as well it started at 08:30 and a new scene happens every 30 minutes. We got to see 4 different scenes.   Oh, and the bread basket is amazing!!

t-tlkdV-hKE8cs6upchFoQ.text: Came here for a birthday dinner we were able to get front row seats by the water as I asked and everything was perfect. The steak was unreal and the water show really made it a unique experience. Service was great I would love to come back here. My only complaint was that I couldn't get my favorite champagne by the glass (vueve cliq) We got creamed corn and mashed potatoes and they were so yummy. My lychee martini was perfect. 3cVOrQn02feI1-_BOFaqDw.text: First time going here. Was celebrating wifey's bday. We made reservations a month in advanced. The food was excellent. I had the dry aged NY steak - and I was curios how it compared to a local steakhouse in San Diego - Born and Raised. Just as good if not better!Service was good; as expected for a restaurant of this caliber.  I would have given 5 stars but that it was a bit disappointing that we were seated at a corner with minimal view of the waterfall. It appeared that the center area, where the view is best, is reserved for larger parties.   .

TkrpmCJAzbgFP8IFLxqZag.text: I made dinner reservations for my girlfriend's bachelorette dinner. I heard that they have a water show every night at around 7PM. Unfortunately, we had to leave earlier and skip out on the show because one of the girls had a flight to catch.  SW was beautiful, even without experiencing the water show. We sat at the table facing the waterand it was so soothing and peaceful to have dinner with that view. We were given complimentary bread and butter and ordered the crab cake to start with. I could do without the crab cake next time - there was nothing special about it. Then we ordered the dry aged bone in new york, rib eye, and the jidori chicken. All of it was amazing! The steaks and chicken were cooked to perfection - not one bit dry!

7ejSlVpN7lBkwD4m5QtmAA.text: Do you like your steak cooked a certain way like most human beings?  Unless that preferred steak temp is well done, don't eat here. Or at least don't order the steak.   It's ballsy for a place with the word "Steakhouse" in their name to not know how to cook a single steak to the correct requested temperature.   Maybe this place is like that friend you tell a different party time to so they show up on time instead of late.   If you must eat here, tell them a steak temp rarer than you'd actually like.   And if you're like me and love your steak blue, just ask for it still mooing. Maybe they'll be able to figure it out. Not holding my breath.

Ms8SLi6gcHcbtxNfNt2vww.text: Great steak house, not the best I've been to in Vegas but done well.  Steak had a gold crust and potato side was great not overly greasy.  Check this place out or the one in bellagio.

OY6b-Q34B98vhWMcQTDCeg.text: If you are up for a great steakhouse..this is the place for you!  Service was amazing. Servers were courteous and prompt to sit us right away.
