-i-jFd0tf9xpBVwRKmypww.text: No shorts for men and women Collard shirts for guys No sandals/flip flops Make reservations way in advanced they get busy Bone rib eye was good Black truffle creamed corn was so yummy Creamed spinach was okay typical creamed spinach Had another side with small potato and green beans not very good not sure what the menu called it Funnel cake was good.  We had a nice view of the waterfall. The service was okay. I am a meat eater so this was a great place for me.I would go back next time I am in Vegas.

l0B_x9MOKkrAR8v3nql89g.text: Yelps 365 Review Challenge 2014 - Los Angeles #46 - #365  Did you know that, SW are initials for Steve Wynn?  Executive Chef: David Wolzag   That's right! Most of his restaurants are names after famous Chefs who grace most of Steve Wynn's fine dining spots but he wanted to mark his name in one of his restaurants.   Me and my friend were thinking about eating in a nice fancy restaurant after our Le Reve (The Dream) show and decided to eat at SW Steakhouse, plus they had a great view of the lake show. The Steakhouse is located next to Parasol Down, just take the curved escalator down to the Lake of Dreams and it will be located on your left side. We made reservations but still had to wait for a table, I thought was unacceptable, the wait ended being 30 minutes, plus we were a little late so that was a major factor.   The clientele is very classy and mostly an older crowd as Steve Wynn targets for his world renowned resorts. Our server was very friendly and bubbly and made us feel comfortable during our dining experience. He asked us what we would like to drink and we said, "Ice cold water" than he started explaining different kinds of water from non carbonated to carbonated, it was just confusing but a fun experience. We were seated right next to the lake show and we enjoyed the view from our table as we ate and drank our $$$$ meal! Sadly, we requested to eat on the patio but they said it's not permitted because of the hot summer weather, which would ruin the ambiance our dining experience.   We ordered:   + Steve's Chopped Salad $17  - Avocado, crisp potatoes, Dijon vinaigrette  +Roasted Skuna Baked Salmon $36  - White asparagus, fava beans, whole grain mustard sauce  +Fillet Mignon 9 ounces  $54 - Aged Nebraska Corn-Fed beef is 100% USDA Prime  We were blown away from the presentation to the taste of the food, this was truly the fine dining experience we were looking for, especially at Wynn.  I will definitely  be back to try more items on the menu and experience the classiness that is of Wynn Resorts.

KFNLBpV7FO8VowuxLcjmWQ.text: What a beautiful place! Classy, elegant, chill ambiance & peaceful. The husband & I came in for dinner before our show, we were not disappointed. Impeccable wine list. The sommelier will lend a hand if needed. Our filets were so tasty. We left full & in time for our show. Thanks to the waitstaff for being mindful of our show time. We will be back!!!

OAurjB4eCkUOB6thxYBUOw.text: Having dinner, but the show starts at 830.. it's 710 now. The steak was amazing the macaroni and cheese was phenomenal this service is really really great the show was adorable and the strawberry Moscow Mule was amazing

Gemd_rUOsEnHiFhsMwd48A.text: My boyfriend and I were looking so forward to eating here. He is really into steak, and we were very careful in choosing a place with a great reputation for real wagyu. The atmosphere was beautiful and the service was great, but we were both so underwhelmed with the wagyu. We spent close to $1000 on dinner for the two of us, and we really didnt feel the wagyu was good. It certainly wasn't bad, but it wasnt the awesome experience we were expecting.

y5AQ9XuvDPpRRIa4SRk7oQ.text: Amazing experience! I love the coffee and ancho chili rub on my fillet. Great ambience, the Lake of Dreams is amazing especially after 5:30 when the shows start on the half hour. Steak tartare is unbeatable as is the truffled corn.  Had the cookie butter cheesecake for dessert it doesn't get better than this. Service is phenomenal.

PxP2VCwXHZE2iUQDQE-qKg.text: There are few restaurants in the world I have been to that top my experience at SW Steakhouse. While some of the food was not necessarily to my liking, that is more of a personal preference and not really a reflection of the restaurant itself.  I was in Vegas for work and had a few nights where I was wined and dined by some clients/vendors, and was lucky enough that SW was one of the places we had scheduled to have dinner. At a table for 10, I can safely say I probably managed to have a taste of just about anything on the menu that looked any good on paper.  Let me say first of all that the ambience and service level at the SW is unparalleled by any restaurant I've been to (and not to toot my own horn, but I've been to a lot). The hostess was courteous, and our server Nina was friendly, engaging, knowledgeable and accommodating.  They have a great selection of wine and liquor. We shared a few bottles of cab throughout the meal and I had an amazing glass of Yoichi Japanese whiskey.  On to the good stuff: We started with the Seafood Spectacular, which included oysters on the half shell, king crab legs, lobster, and jumbo shrimp. By far, I'd say that the oysters were the best part. The freshness and flavor were unlike any oysters I've ever had. The jumbo shrimp were also particularly tasty. I personally felt that the crab was a little lacking, but others in my party seemed to really enjoy them. Lobster was also quite good.  For entree, I ordered the bone-in ribeye after reading some of the glowing reviews I'd seen for it on Yelp. I also had some of the creamed corn, creamed spinach, smoked bacon mac and cheese, and sauteed mushrooms.   I ordered my ribeye Rare-plus, which is a sort of middle ground between rare and medium-rare. As a serious steak lover, I am convinced that the flavor and texture of steak is best at this temperature. If you are reading this review and would like to try it though, please please PLEASE only do it at a good steakhouse that knows what it's doing. Anywhere else and you might get sick. Don't say I didn't warn you!  Unfortunately my steak came at what seemed to me more like a medium-rare, almost medium. I hate to do this usually but at a restaurant of this calibre I had to flag down the waitress and send it back. Nina was more than willing to trade it for a rarer one. The replacement they brought out was exactly how I wanted it: rare but warm, almost purple on the inside when you cut it open. I don't say this about food often, but that bone-in ribeye is one of my favorite experiences in the world. My only criticism is that it was a little less seasoned than I would've preferred, but this is not necessarily a bad thing.  I wish I could say such glowing things about the sides. I didn't enjoy the sort of mashed, gritty texture of the creamed corn. Flavor was great, but ultimately it just reminded me of really buttery grits. Creamed spinach and sauteed mushrooms were okay but nothing special. I was sorely disappointed by the mac and cheese - I would've rather had Kraft mac and cheese. The flavors they used just didn't work well for me. Everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy them though, as virtually all of the plates wound up empty at the end of the night.  Either way, I had a very enjoyable time at SW and would happily come back.

p9hJhTiQEj9JyUhXxm9YIg.text: We went here for our anniversary, the food was exceptional. Recommend the filet mignon and the poblano bacon Mac & cheese. The water shows are fun. The welcomed surprise was the complimentary mint chocolate macaroons for our celebration. Classy.

nyHMRHvZi3GfREB17gGXMg.text: I can't believe that I haven't reviewed SW yet. I've eaten here many times & I believe that this is one of the finest restaurants in America. I don't say that lightly.  Where to begin. OK the venue is elegant & sumptuous. Sitting outside is essential, next to the Lake Of Dreams & the waterfall. During your dinner you will be treated to a beautiful kaleidoscopic show with multicolored lights, projections and three-dimensional figurines. The setting & decor is money, plain & simple.  There's very few steakhouses that make Mastro's seafood tower & filet mignon look like a total joke. This is definitely one of them. And that should be all you need to know.  If you're in Vegas & you can afford to eat at SW, it's an absolute must. You can thank me later.

oMsFRj2WTU-Wv29XzzMgSA.text: Bottom line up front -- SW is my favorite restaurant to visit in Vegas  for the top notch service, elegance, and quality food that is consistent with the offerings at the Wynn/Encore.    Tips:  1.  Despite the urge to consume the delectable carbs known as the bread basket (pretzel roll is my personal favorite) hold out for the "main event".    2. The chile double rubbed ribeye may be the most amazing steak I've ever had in my life ("Smoke if you got 'em").  A must try!   3. First time diners are encouraged to book in advance and ask for outdoor seating (weather permitting) or indoor seating with a view of the lake show [begins at 730].    4.  I typically don't stay at the hotel/casino (I'm an M Life points whore) but I highly recommend diners take time before or after dinner to explore the property as it's absolutely amazing (Steve Wynn is a genius and has my lifetime endorsement).    Enjoy!

_8PTrE4IjgKHbiDwN-P25Q.text: Great restaurant with great view and service. If you get lucky to make a reservation outside around the Showtime, you will enjoy your food while watching the show: ) you can also just step outside if you are having a dinner inside. Service is pretty good, steaks are amazing , exactly how an upscale restaurant should be. The only complain would be that food is on the heavier side. Everyone from our party had discomfort later as our food felt really greasy / fat, even the scallops.

AvoSE4bLu-wi_YJD1l029A.text: Amazing experience ! We ate outside with a view of the lake of dreams . The food was perfect ! Great flavor , hot, unique sides and deserts. Service was first rate I In every regard . Well done !

IZRmbnxN74CbzsOTCS42jg.text: The classiest steak house establishment in Nevada.  My favorite besides our Tomahawk was the wine pairing and creamy corn.  Also of course the dessert was beautifully executed as expect!  The ambiance, food, and service were excellent. A must go!

BMg07jYhRcadkbYIa-4Fww.text: The bad: 20% of our dinners were not prepared correctly, then had to wait for a third try before they came out in mediocre state, had much higher expectations for a steakhouse. The other dinners were 5-star quality.  Service was also 5-star until the main courses arrived, then they all disappeared not too be seen at the table for way too long.

oUay6MMh2fZKGsFzrDgwZA.text: Very nice Steakhouse! Don't wear jeans!   Even with a suit coat jeans are unacceptable here, same with shorts . A couple guys in our group wore jeans, had to toss them the company card form them to quickly (took like 30mins wtf) run up to the closest designer clothing store for men (a very expensive lesson for everyone). Once we had our table out on the lovely terrace that had a very nice mini pool/ pond with a big waterfall and a interesting (to say the least) show that would start every 15mins. The shows were a very smart idea for the restaurant to use, I couldn't tell you how long it took for food to come out cause I didn't even pay attention. Food was delicious, I had a filet with a little of each of the various sides we ordered for our group. Desert came and was truly a great way to top the night off there. Food, cocktails, service, decor, ambience, and of course the interesting water shows were all awesome!   made for an unforgettable evening and of course very worthy of another visit.

NVaoOEGj9QGvKOdURlkaXg.text: Ok this was amazing I will always eat there when I visit Vegas . Quality ambience and experience incredible.

poP4tu8kCdW99uZ2I-EDZw.text: Absolutely phenomenal cuisine. We came here for our anniversary and were treated with 5 star service through and throughout . The gentleman at the host stand in particular was very attentive . We will definitely be back for more!!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They brought this out without even telling us. Very thoughtful.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Grilled Octopus served on a bed of warm chickpeas . Delicious!

ehvPrWWSlPzk3vzA7w_BLg.text: We decided to come here because while in Paris we met a nice young man at dinner who was the Wine Director at SW Steakhouse. He gave us his card and told us to stop by when in Vegas. Unfortunately the night we went he was off. Initially when I made reservations I requested seating outside so we could watch the light/water show they have at the Wynn. It was 106 day that day but when we were seated I was very surprised at how cool it was on the patio. It felt like 80.  We started with a couple glasses of Champagne and the Seafood Spectacular. OMG! We were in heaven. There were huge King Crab legs that were already split and ready to eat, a large lobster tail split in half, 8 huge prawns, a crab salad and oysters. It was $85 which actually was a very good deal for such a fancy place. We also split some sauteed Foie Gras which was very rich and buttery. Foie is my favorite. The bread they serve throughout the meal is also amazing.  We decided to order the 42 ounce chili rubbed ribeye. This is meant for two people. By this point we were already very full and struggled just to eat a few pieces of the ribeye. The ribeye was seasoned very well and was spicier than I expected. It was cooked to perfection but unfortunately we couldn't even come close to finishing it. We also ordered lobster gnocchi and french fries as our sides. Both were very good but hardly touched.  Overall we had a great experience at SW. The service was great from start to finish and the food was what you'd expect from a place with Steve Wynn's name on it. The bill was a  little over $400 after tip but is worth the splurge.

Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 42oz chili rubbed ribeye with lobster gnocchi and fries.

fB98LpTwn--BhT6Qtv0uRg.text: Always a fun time here! The food is delicious. I love the little shows outside that play every 15 minutes or so.

GN0aP2FTFjy9CbH9NiA7pQ.text: What an Experience!!! This restaurant inside the Wynn Casino is hands down my favorite!!!  I was quite the regular for a time and just could not get enough of the food, the atmosphere and the feeling I got when dining here. I am a local to Vegas to this should speak to its credibility. SW has an incredible menu to chose from and an insane wine list that a novice or expert can enjoy. I had nothing but great to offer up about SW. Gotta try and get s seat on the outdoor patio in the spring. Amazing!!

Dsi9jQAaVD6LiLvB4abU-A.text: Amazing steaks. Great service My wife went to celebrate our 25th anniversary  We loved it !! Expensive but worth it

nmwO1SgKd_-eqbBgalnx_A.text: After finding out Rosemary's closed it's doors we were on the hunt to quickly find a restaurant to dine at for the weekend in Vegas. Apparently Robuchon is closed to remodel and L'Atelier was fully booked so we opted for a steakhouse. Having heard good things of SW, we quickly made reservations. Arrived a tad bit early to find the restaurant pretty dead with only a few tables being utilized. SW has an awesome view of a waterfall which you preview while taking the escalator down. Patrons can be seated in or outside for dining. Since it was 105, we opted to dine inside. Have heard so many good things about their chili rubbed ribeye so I knew ahead of time what I'd be ordering. Quickly ordered a glass of wine and opted for the regular ribeye but w/ the chili rub. Bread basket (yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL...). The bacon and cheese bread was awesome, not as good as Scarpetta's salami and mozzarella but it was very very tasty. Served with the bread basket is butter seasoned with Hawaiian black and red sea salt (yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL...). For the side we shared the black truffle creamed corn (yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL...). Not what I was expecting as it was a very sweet side almost tasted dessert like but the black truffles really enhanced the corn. Bone-in ribeye (yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL...). Luckily I didn't have to order the double bone-in ribeye inorder to sample SW's famous chili rub (yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL...). The steak was cooked perfectly and although I like my meat just sea salt and pepper, the chili rub did live up to the hype. It added a nice flavor to the steak and wished it was cooked with the sauce instead of being served on the side. For dessert we ordered the dark chocolate souffle cake (yelp.com/biz_photos/L_ZL...). A great way to end a good meal and the brandied cherries were the highlight of the dessert. I thought that the souffle cake was more of a molten chocolate cake than a souffle, still was tasty. Only complaint for the night is that we had little flies buzzing around as they opened up the glass door to the patio and also the fact that it got a little warm inside towards the end of dinner. Service was awesome and would definitely be back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark chocolate souffle cake
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chili rub sauce
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in ribeye

UYr00PtqJT9TZhwlpxU3zw.text: This place surely changed in the last 2 times we have come in! Steak was terrible and undercooked, after they returned it I spit it out into my napkin (it was burned all around black edges). My boyfriend got the wrong steak brought out to him. Anyway, as much as I loved this place few years ago. It is no longer the amazing place it was. I would pass on this place and go somewhere else. I dont want to write anymore and sound like a complete meany. So just pass not worth the $$$$.

42r-IW9-1PujUTnwvDk1mw.text: SW is one of those restaurants where you are blown away by almost everything in the place. The dining room is open, well lit, classy, and clean cut. The food is impeccable. The waitstaff is phenomenal, attentive, and friendly.   The first time I came, I sat in the dining room. It spectacular. I sat with Amanda and Julio. They were both on spot. I did not have to ask for a thing. The second time, a friend and I sat at the bar.   The beef carpaccio is good. The meat is delicious, but the friscee salad elevates the dish. Break off a piece of the cheese crisp and add that to it for the perfect bite. It gives a much needed saltiness to the dish. The beet salad is the appetizer I would go for though. Large cuts of beautiful red and golden beets, tossed in a light vinaigrette, and an aged goat cheese. Delicious. I must have eaten the whole plate by myself. The NY strip is my friend's go to cut. It is charred on the outside and retains all its flavor on the inside. Ask for the chile sauce on the side to dip the steak in. Especially if you go for the cream corn. The balance of fat, spice, and sweetness from all these items are exquisite. The desserts were not my favorite. I had a bite of the key lime cheesecake and didn't get the other components it boasted. At this point, I was stuffed and didn't care for any more.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream. Corn
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strip steak with cream corn.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee martini

i-BXxpmoLGgx-C--6e0GKg.text: 2 stars are given for the kind, attentive and courteous staff as well as for the atmosphere and to their signature drink called "The Dream" which was the only thing I enjoyed in this first time SW experience.  However the remaining 3 stars are lacking mainly because flavor was lacking in everything we ordered for dinner :(   For starters we ordered the Tuscan Kale salad which was nothing impressive and had no hint of Apple.  For main courses, we ordered New York steak and asked for it medium, but when served it was clearly well cooked.  Our server was very quick and accommodating to take it back and oddly enough a medium steak was given within 5 minutes.  So either they mistakenly gave us another table's well done steak or they went ahead and gave us someone else's medium steak since ours was not prepared medium as requested.  It required a lot of side sauce to even enjoy a few small bites from the tasteless steak.  We also ordered their Alaskan Halibut which was very bland and unexpected because the presentation was beautiful but the taste did not mactch, which was very disappointing.  We also ordered sauteed wild mushrooms which were very undercooked and and the Mac and Cheese was extremely bland.  We were both very hungry but didn't even enjoy the food and a lot was left untouched.  The bill was paid, the generous tip given for the kind staff, however we left very disappointed as we had heard great things about this place. We ended up eating pizza shortly after.   Overall, regretted coming here for dinner.

SgwlrGQaGYYEngjKmKpvkg.text: Second time I have dined at SW Steakhouse... every aspect of both visits was exceptional.  The dishes were well served, and the  chateau briand was tender, evenly cooked and full flavored (ordered natural with no black pepper.   Can't wait to dine here again.

_HSVRP-MSC9LJqU1t4Qaug.text: I make it a point to go here whenever we're in Vegas. The ambiance is great and so is the food.  As far as the steak goes we stick to the same thing; the Chile Rubbed Double Rib Eye. It is d-e-l-i-c-i--o-u-s. Their crab cakes are also great. Unlike a lot of the crab cakes that are full of mayo, these are mostly crab.  The sides are large enough to share. We've tried the au gratin potatoes, creamed spinach, and Yukon gold potato puree. The were all great!  If you're thinking about going and want a reservation, I would suggest booking it way in advance because the reservations do fill up fast.  You can also walk in and wait to be seated but if you have a tight schedule, I would recommend a reservation.  Can't wait til' we go to Vegas again so that I can get my SW fix.

tqppyYvO5wEmnNmsCcgVKg.text: My fiance surprised me with a Vegas trip for my birthday, and of course we stayed at the Wynn.   Regularly, we would have had dinner at Botero. But this time, Vegas was packed and the reservations were all booked. Somehow he had managed to get a reservation at SW... And I was so HAPPY he did!  I had never been here before, but let me just say, WOW! (Our view of the waterfall was perfect as well)  Everything and I mean EVERYTHING tasted and looked amazing. I was in heaven through every bite of my meal.   We both had the ribeye, melt in your mouth, cooked to perfection, juicy, full of marbling, taste bud indulging... keeping it short... I'm just drooling as I type this. Just. Go.

mx1iuiQHRWHNrhrNlVIlVg.text: Best food I've had in awhile!! The chateaubriand was worth the money!!! Such a wonderful meal.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tell them if it is your anniversary

wRwSSVJFvurm5-y2YD2_sw.text: What a beautiful place! From the setting to the food and service, it was done perfectly. We had it ALL and we will be back, most definitely. We had such a pleasant evening (inside because you can't get outside seating unless you book it weeks in advance... We didn't know, but we will try that next time) Definitely go for the bleu cheese wedge, there is something about that bacon that is unreal and if you like lychee, that lychee martini is  see you soon, SW Steak!

gf2GbWAZFxRwv-Wm2kZAwg.text: We had the bone in filet which was great! It was flavorful like a ribeye but tender like a filet. I loved the black truffle and lobster gnocchi and potatoes Au gratin. The waiters were friendly, took our picture and let us split for no extra charge.

-GecOeO819bg8B25qJ26Vw.text: My wife and I stayed at the Wynn for Memorial Day weekend. We were excited to make reservations at the SW for our final night. She ordered her filet medium and I ordered my bone in ribeye medium rare. I confirmed to the server that I wanted a warm red center. The server was quick to instruct us that because of the lighting in the restaurant the steaks might appear over cooked. I found this odd but thought nothing more about it. When the steaks came out it was obvious that my wife had gotten medium rare and mine was medium. She does not mind a medium rare steak so she ate hers. My ribeye was way over cooked for my tastes. I mentioned it to the server and she apologized and immediately had the kitchen cook another. This steak came out way undercooked. I would have eaten it except the center was cold and I just don't want a cold center in my 92.00 dollar steak. I sent the steak back without hesitation. At this point my wife had finished eating and I was frustrated. The manager came over to apologize. She stated that the chef overcompensated with the second steak and she admitted it was undercooked. Then she told me that the first steak was cooked perfectly. I am not a chef but I do order medium rare steaks often at many less fancy restaurants and never have a problem. I also grill steaks for my family often. The SW is a nice place with beautiful scenery but if you can't cook a steak to temperature after two tries I can not recommend them to other patrons

36l53WGzaRd-IA3dII0zmw.text: Very high quality restaurant, the best steak I've ever eaten, excellent service, highly recommended only desirable to make a reservation before going and ask to sit outside enjoy and Bona appetite

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h1JTNq1mQijMmoMr8zmG8Q.text: Great steakhouse at the Wynn! I went to Vegas with my family for Thanksgiving weekend and we ate dinner here on Friday. The only reservation that was available online a week before was at 9:30pm for 4. However, I called at 8:30pm the day of to ask if we could come early and they said yes! We had to wait about 10 minutes when we got there and there were some nice couches by the bar. They originally wanted to seat us inside but luckily, there was a table available on the patio! There is a really nice fountain overlooking the patio and a bunch of heat lamps so you don't have to worry about the cold. We started with a bottle of wine and the chilled seafood tower. It was delicious and came with shrimp, king crab legs, lobster, oyster, and a cole slaw ceviche. Great to share for the table! We then each ordered a steak: New York, Filet, Rib Eye, and they even have a grass fed one with very little calories for health freaks! Sides cost additional and we got asparagus, mushrooms, and mac & cheese for the table. Everything tasted great but the one complaint is that the outside of the steak was pretty charred, while some parts of the inside were RARE when we ordered medium rare. Maybe that's just their style? The fountain plays a different light/music show every 15-20 minutes or so. The waitress said there's about 15 different ones they rotate through. The service was great and everyone was always checking up on us. They had brought us the baby tabasco bottles for the oysters and my brother and dad thought it was so adorable, they brought us another 5 to take home! Didn't have room for dessert, but we definitely had a great night here!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese, asparagus and mushrooms
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in New York with wine and sides

oJcTkfFCf6UIWgrrUmNqxw.text: Fantastic food and beautiful atmosphere.  The Rocky Road dessert is delicious and magical!!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fantastic food and beautiful atmosphere.  The Rocky Road dessert is delicious and magical!!

UjMqO6oHO9Mlm1cEJ-K8dA.text: Visited this past weekend super yummy and romantic. I think our servers name was Leaa. She recommended a terrific wine. We had a nice table right along the railing in front of the waterfall. Theres a dress code but i dont believe its heavily enforced saw a couple guys in tshirts. Everything was super delicious. I think we tried to order almost everything on the menu. Unfortunately my bf had a headache and hated the shows but i thought they were hilarious especially after the wine. So we started with shrimp cocktail and tuna tartare the shrimp were hugeeee! Then i think i got the new york n my bf got filet the only reason i rated 4 stars was because i didnt order the kagoshima wagyu which is my go to favorite! So i cant fully rate without trying that. Side lobster tail bf got the crab i liked his crab better than my lobster it melts in your mouth. We order the potato gratin brussel sprouts asparagus and cream spinach. Definitely order the spinach! Its perfect. Then we shared a banana fostered bread pudding...which my bf scarfed down n barely shared w me! They just combined two of my fav desserts absolute points for that! All in all if youre in vegas definitely check this place out its so delish.  Great food good wine selection great atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana fostered bread pudding
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster definitely full amount and not a tiny order
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New york w a house made butter

31KjtQVJOxpArTsdkA8KcQ.text: SW makes me so happy.   The steaks were seasoned and cooked *amazingly* and they give you kobe beef infused butter to melt on top of the it.   The portions are large so you can definitely share a plate with a friend. There were six of us dining and we were all stuffed with just three entrees and three sides.   There seems to be a lot of truffle infused items on their menu. We got the truffled creamed corn. It was delicious but keep in mind that it is not whole kernels of corn it's more of an oatmeal consistency.   There's an extensive wine list offering wine by the glass, half bottles, and full bottles. From what I saw glasses started at $16, half bottles at $80, and full bottles cost more than my hotel room.   I recommend sitting on or near the patio to see the waterfall. If the weather cooperates they will open up the floor to ceiling doors so you get indoor dining with some outdoor feel.   There's a giant mechanical frog that comes out on top of the waterfall....and it sings!! Completely random. I almost choked on my food when I saw it. So creepy.   Other than that, the service is ah-mazing. They even split the checks for us according to what each person ordered.   If you're not staying at the Wynn, there's complimentary valet for those driving. Go early and take pictures with the elaborate foliage at the entrance of the hotel!

KCz38SMdqMwgMAbzF7EVXA.text: What a treat! Service was impeccable with such attention and care to our experience. The courteous gestures, such as providing a complimentary soup taste, and no request denied made this an effortless dining experience. The steaks were prepared perfectly and the sides were generous portions. We did experience a lengthier wait for our table as the patio was closed due to the weather. But the hostess did ensure we had our prefer seating and was not bothered when we would inquire about the wait.

cwuOQWCEQglWbO3GOe9eCg.text: Best steak house in the Las Vegas strip.  I've been to a lot of steakhouses and Vegas but this is still top of my list.   The steak almost melts in your mouth, and the restaurant is good about spitting the portions. The restaurant also has entertainment outside, which is great.   I love this restaurant and it is my go to spot in Vegas

p_aehtmtleVQpUGS0QqFpA.text: Ate here a couple times, and I absolutely hated the atmosphere.  Too many people walking past our table, everyone was standing up and loud, so distracting, almost like the tables needed to be separated farther apart. The food was nice though, but nothing I had stood out as memorable

vLGksjfLa1WDgUrthcqcxg.text: First time eating at SW. It was for a business meeting with my boss. I ordered the 20oz bone-in ribeye per his suggestion. I also ordered the bacon Mac and cheese. The steak was very juicy and seasoned just right. The Mac and cheese was creamy and tasted delicious. I like the variety of breads they offered. The pretzel bread and cheesy bread muffin were really good. The service was great feeling your water every few minutes. The waiter kind of disappeared towards the end so service wise I would rate it only four stars but overall a five-star experience.

xqLU3e8SG5zZxJVo-oAPbA.text: So this review is a bit late but I just recently started using yelp to actually post reviews so I figured why not post a review about this restaurant now. I visited Vegas in June with my bf and a couple of friends. My bf and I wanted to have a romantic evening at a real steakhouse in Vegas on our last night and we chose SW located in the Wynn hotel.   This place is a great place for a romantic outing. I suggest getting a seat outside if possible we weren't able to since it is a higher demand and we would have had to wait longer and I was starving. Our server(s) were very attentive, and polite. To start we got the kale salad, which was huge and very tasty. We also split the 16 oz steak, which would have been too much steak for us to eat alone and for a side we got the au gratin potatoes, which were delicious and left us wanting more. The steak was a bit more red than I prefer but it was absolutely delicious so I didn't complain. We were too full to try in dessert. All in all it was a very nice dining experience and I would consider visiting again if I'm ever in Vegas.

eO4y1Vw8BaDj7KvCbSP3Og.text: Sw steakhouse has been on my watchlist for restaurants to visit. At first I though it's a normal steak house, until I read that it had Kobe beef. Kobe beef is a beef from japan. It's made from Kobe cattle and is very good. The cattle are pampered wth fans and rundowns. This enhances the flavor of the meat. Finally I went to the restaurant and it surprised me in more than one way.   First of all, the atmosphere. It was nice. It felt expensive and all of the walls didn't have any stains on them. We got seated and the chairs where very nice. They where very comfortable. Ultimately the atmosphere is fantastic, they shouldn't change a thing.   The staff. They where friendly and helpful. They where willing to meet your demands and always help you anyway the can.   Cleanliness. People say you can judge a restaurants cleanliness. Well sw passes the test. It was very clean and nice. Marble hallways leading to it. Also the soap, water, and toilets where all automated. Good job you passed the test.   Food. Well i ordered the Kobe beef and got the tenderloin. I think I made the right choice. I cant even describe the taste. It was buttery smokey and delicious. On the side I got bok Choy. Delicious as well.  Overall impression. Sw steakhouse has earned a special place in my heart as one of the best places to eat.

6ACpS_2kqI5TywyYs210NA.text: One of the most overrated, expensive restaurants I've ever been to with quite average service.  Too many other better places to try in Las Vegas than this place.  Crowded, male dominant clientele (we were taking clients and they wanted a steak place) and we were seated next to wait station so trays etc. were carried literally over a guest's head all night.  Steak was presented on a white plate with nothing else on it so food presentation was hardly note-worthy and it was over cooked for requested done-ness.  The only really great food item that night was the pretzel rolls in the breadbasket.  Salad was enough for a meal unto itself - which I hate when restaurants do that.  Maybe because I just don't love Vegas I was looking for faults but I had a fabulous meal the night before in Sinatra - which I would go back to before heading here again.  Not a fan...

1m0eO-CyK6ls99uSX55dww.text: I wanted to love this place simply because I thought I should love it considering the pomp and circumstance about it. Upon arrival, we waited in the bar about 10 minutes, but the bartenders were too busy talking to a group of girls (who all had full drinks) to pay attention to other patrons, so we were never served. When we got to our table, I immediately noticed my wine glass was caked with food particles, inside and out. I might expect this anywhere else, but not here. The waitress took it away as soon as she saw me examining it, or I would have taken a picture to post here. The meat was okay, but I have had better (more flavor other than charcoal). The potato side we got was so hard there were parts I couldn't chew. It also tasted like charcoal. It was far too loud in there as well. Had to yell to talk to my husband across the table. Not worth the time, anticipation, or money.

mCtgdInAOBIBZGUvfxRgUw.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas!!! Reservations is always full esp for dinner so make sure to book ahead of time. When i say ahead of time, i mean at least weeks or months before. That's how hard it is to make a resevation here. But it's definitely worth the wait!  I love the ambiance of this place, its so romantic and they also did well on the decor, simple yet looks beautiful and classy. It makes you think you're really beside the lake.  My favorite here are their lobster gnocchi, black truffle cream corn and the Ribeye! For desserts, I'm not sure what it's called but its a funnel cake with strawberries and chocolate, it was soo good!

DpP1qWYpEJfRCkOqgU1Ppw.text: The service and atmosphere were top notch. Chris was our main server.  Spent 3 hours there and never felt rushed.  Thoroughly enjoyed the whole evening.  I had the $220 4oz Kobe NY Strip. While it was a unique experience and delicious I'm not a convert mostly due to price.  But for a special occasion or just because it's Las Vegas maybe. The texture is fine and velvety and dissolves as you gently chew. Beautiful fat flavor without the heavy texture of fat on your palate Definitely something like I've never had. The drinks and apps and sides were all incredible. Highly recommend SW at Wynn.

88SEkr4MCOo0tP0hwEAwWA.text: This has got to be one of my favorite steakhouses!! I wish I can go more often, but only when visiting vegas. T.T I ordered the filet and my boyfriend got the bone in ribeye, and we got the truffle creamed corn and mushrooms for our sides. Every single dish was SPECTACULAR!!!!! Even the complimentary bread that they serve you in the beginning was amazing--like, I've never tasted bread at a restaurant that's THIS appetizing! They serve you several types of bread, and all of them were soso yummy! I seriously wanted to eat all of them, but I had to redeem myself and save room for my steak and sides. Must eat here when you're in vegas and craving for some steak! Try to get a table by the water so you can enjoy the view :)

Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushrooms

d8bPZROCiyj0sGMFjCvTMQ.text: My favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas out of the 5 or 6 I have tried. Amazing atmosphere with indoor and outdoor seating. The outdoor seating is right on a man made lake with a waterfall surrounded by huge trees.  A truly beautiful setting with a show every 30 minutes or so with lights and music.   The service was fantastic too, very helpful servers who can take you through the menu. We had a very simple jumbo shrimp cocktail to start with a kale salad a Cesar salad and a bouwl of soup. I enjoyed the shrimp and my Ceasar salad and was told that the other salads and soup was delicous as well.   I had a 12 oz filet with 3 of there sauces all of which were great. In our group we also had the scallops, halibut, and another filet.  Everyone raved about there food.    The molton lava cake at the end was a nice finish. Small portion but very rich, wouldn't need more than a few bites to enjoy it. Overall a very cool trendy place to enjoy in Vegas. I would recommend to anyone who loves steakhouses or is looking for a great setting to enjoy.

JegkycfVeOMjCNhGX8DfEA.text: The Wynn never disappoints with its restaurants. Make a reservation and ask to sit outside!! Great ambiance, romantic and classy!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red snapper, mac and cheese, filet mignon, truffled cream corn and potatoes.

Dwsm4fCuU8to8cg6uXsnlw.text: Service great, ambiance great, steaks ok, don't believe the hype.  140 bucks but steak was as good as longhorns, shout out.

LyXNzNwhPZr8okn_Dt8O5Q.text: High end steak house with great service and views.  Unfortunately the food is not as good as the service.  Try to get a seat on the outside patio on the water.

-QXkPr7IG8MpXEgpK24d2A.text: The SW Steakhouse is located on the lower level of the Wynn Hotel and Casino. Hard to believe ten years have already passed since this property made its debut as a supposed competitor to the Bellagio for that best - in - class luxury property on the strip.  The SW Steakhouse is Wynn's answer to Bellagio's Prime.   The view from your table is spectacular. You look out at a stunning waterfall with lush trees and flowers on each side. It is gorgeous yet it gives off a very private feel as the tables are spread out yet SW can accommodate parties of all sizes in its large dining facility.   The top notch service you expect from a 5 star restaurant  is handled by a team of three servers for each table. A water glass never went unfilled yet we never felt they were being intrusive. I like that. There were several sommeliers on the floor to help with the extensive wine list (bottles priced more for celebrities like Tom Cruise, Katie Holmes, David Beckham and Posh Spice who dined there last week or high rollers than common folk like us). We settled on a nice glass of Cabernet Sauvignon for 23 dollars each - a bargain on the wine per glass list as far as we were concerned.   The bread basket had mini torpedo rolls, bacon and cheddar muffins and pretzel bread sticks. The butter had a drizzle of olive oil and spices on top. I enjoyed the tasty torpedo roll, she enjoyed the pretzel stick. We each just had a taste.  First course was a split Caesar salad. The Parmesan crisp was incredible. The non- conventional dressing was heavy - perhaps a little overdressed. Still, it was a good choice.  For dinner we ordered the New York Bone In Dry Aged Strip. My lady ordered hers medium rare, mine was medium. Steaks arrived exactly as ordered. As advertised, they were extremely tender. Maybe the most tender steak we ever had. But beyond tenderness here is where we had a different opinion. I was very unhappy with the taste. It didn't stand out. Not for 68 dollars. Compared to steaks I've had at other fine steakhouses, this was a huge disappointment. Thankfully, the three in house sauces made it edible (I liked the more traditional of the choices) My lady disagreed and enjoyed hers very much and thought it tasted great.  We had mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus for our sides and they were more than enough to share.  We were too full to order desert.   There are so many steakhouses in Vegas. If we return, we will seek them out before returning to SW. They are seeking to be world class and in my opinion, they fall short.

OEu3_KZNNjDPTGE-vgF-lw.text: For me this is the best restaurant inside the Wynn ! ( I have been In all the restaurants inside this hotel)  The cauliflower white truffle risotto is out of this world! I know this place is amazing on red meats but I always try to go to lighter meals specially for dinner so I ordered the risotto without much expectation. To my surprise it has been the best risotto I ever ate! And of course you get beautiful view of the waterfall show at nite.

-ULSgcNIF0S5IdwCZSbILg.text: You guys have to be kidding !! I make reservations ahead , looking forward to a beautiful evening and you try to sit me in the corner ? I walked right out !! You must have been rudest person I have ever met. Mr SW remove your name from that Steakhouse.

tVt8i0geKlDgP0NuaqrgwQ.text: Our favorite place to have dinner. We have never been disappointed. Excellent service, excellent wine and food choices. Love the fact that no small children are allowed.

oTw182q06-F8hHmDzUj2ew.text: Without exception, the best steak I have ever had. We went to SW Steakhouse for my friends bachelor's dinner. We had an early evening reservations and were promptly seated as we arrived. The restaurant has a beautiful ambiance and we were seated close to the wonderful view of the outside lagoon/waterfall.   For starters, we ordered Foie Gras both sauteed and terrine, and Tomatoes with Swiss cheese. Our main course was Chile Rubbed Double Rib Eye, and Double Cut Colorado Lamb Chops. Some sort of onion dish and Black Truffled Cream Corn as our side for the main course. We had Riesling for whites and Optimus cuvee for reds.    They offered 3 different breads, of which the jalapeno(or some other cheese?) with bacon was outstanding. As always, there will be no argument that Foie Gras, both sauteed and terrine, is heavenly; creamy, buttery, rich. My longing for Foie Gras is even more as it is now banned here in California. The Tomatoes with Swiss cheese was okay.  The main star of the show is the Chile Rubbed Double Rib Eye. Its hard to find a dinner table real estate to house this bad boy. It is placed in an manly cast iron casserole, with all the drippings, onions, and chile peppers in it. But the Colorado Lamb Chops didn't fade from the limelight. Four ribs sticking out stimulating your salivary glands: Eat Me. I obliged and took a bite of the lamb chop first. The first thoughts on my mind were: 'this cannot be?!' A well made steak always trumps over any lamb chop. And as far as I can remember, this is the best meat I have ever tasted (of course I haven't taken a bite of the Chile Rubbed Rib Eye yet!) It was so tender, and those little fat marbles melt in your mouth like butter. That classic lamb gaminess is still there, but it so well orchestrated (and no, not muted) its sooo good!   Then I went over to the Rib Eye. As soon as it got acclimated into my mouth, a lot of thoughts came rushing into me. I wish my grad father, who was a steak lover,  is still alive to taste is obnoxious rib eye. I wish I resided in Las Vegas. I wish this meat kept coming to our table. ITS THAT GOOD!!! The skin well charred but not burned. That chile gave a slight kick to the rib eye. Like the lamb chop, the rib eye fat marble melts in your mouth like butter! The meat is cooked perfectly. Everything about it is perfect. The Chile Rubbed Double Rib Eye was sooo good, it took me a while to realize that the Black Truffle Cream Corn was delicious as well.   The SW Steakhouse serves the best steak ever. The bar is set high with their excellent meats and awesome preparations.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile Rubbed Double Rib Eye is heavenly!

w8nXHOLr7qIIqqhF4oN-ag.text: Best bone in rib-eye steak I have ever had! I came here with my besties to have a girls' trip to Vegas, we we're celebrating our friendship. The restaurant was very accomodating with the increase in our reservation from five to seven people. We got to sit on the outside terrace by the waterfall where there was an entertaining show every thirty minutes, each show was different. Attire was business dressy with optional jacket for the men. The ladies were in cocktail dresses.  This place was packed within thirty minutes of opening. Good thing we had reservations! The drinks were good. We had sweet lychee martinis and two bottles of Veuve Clicquot Rose.   Our waiter was very attentive and so sweet, he took multiple pictures for our group, even suggesting fun poses. He had excellent recommendations for wine pairings.   Food  The bread basket, ohhh emmmm geeee! The bacon cheddar muffin was so yummy. I gobbled down two of those, I couldn't help it. But I later regretted it when I was too full to finish my meal. There were also French croissants and pretzel bread too. But the bacon muffins were the best.   Foie gras As a Californian, I must say I have missed eating this back home. Very rich and flavorful.  Bone in rib-eye steak This was a good piece of steak, prepared medium-rare. Each bite essentially melted in my mouth n was very flavorful.   Lobster gnocchi with black truffle I still dream of this dish. The most decadent "mac n cheese" style dish I have ever had. There were actual shaved truffles n big chunks of lobster. I would've been happy just to simply eat this as my main entree for the rest of my life. It's so rich n extremely cheesy.  Ambiance is great, good spot to be seen before heading out for the night.

JUnKwKNtibU3CCKzmHQpYA.text: My wife and I just left there satisfied. She called months in advance to get a window seat for my birthday and it was promised to us.  We get there and we're told first come first serve for window seating.   We were then placed in the back of the restaurant. The service was confusing because we had three waiters help us even though we were supposed to have one. My cocktail had to be sent back due to lack of alcohol.    We orders are steaks and found them to redeem everything else.  Overall service was subpar but food was good. We will not be going back though because you can get good steaks and better service other places.  Oh. Also they allowed a dog in the restaurant! It was with an older man and did not have any service dog tags.  Because if this they lost another star.

sP7GrzFwdlkpos3Xy1Fe6w.text: Restaurant is beautiful.   I had a New York strip and my wife had scallops.  Both were good.  We shared puree potatoes.  Service had been good but servers seemed to all ways be trying to get you to buy more.  Sometimes it had a come look at are time share feel.  Expensive even for Vegas.  Cool water show if you sit by the Windows every thirty minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potatoes
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

zLTutnjO3zvMKpR3-FJFzQ.text: This place didn't stand out to me much from other steakhouses I've been to, but the view is definitely one of a kind! (If you can get a table outside that is...)  The food was delicious! The bone-in ribeye was juicy and the filet mignon was perfectly tender. I also really enjoyed the variety of bread given before the meal. The appetizers weren't too appealing, unfortunately, but the main course makes up for it! The sides are also a good portion so plan on sharing those!   The service on the other hand was a little under par. Our waiter was friendly and nice, but most of the workers seemed uptight and were a little slow.  Overall, I would recommend it to a friend! Might try another place next time I'm in Vegas, but this place is definitely worth a visit!

__5du_tEBLosXsf72dzaUw.text: I have been to SW about half a dozen times, and it is still my favorite steakhouse in Sin City. From start to finish, every single experience I've had here has been nothing short of impeccable. Shall we begin?  NOTE: Book reservations as far ahead as you can! Putting in a request for a view of the Lake of Dreams doesn't hurt either. This place gets packed very quickly and we've never risked going without rezzys.   SERVICE here has always been top of the line. I wouldn't expect anything else from within a Steve Wynn property. Water glasses are always filled and the table is frequently straightened out and picked up, be it actual plates/silverware or the microscopic piece of a sugar packet.   First of all: THE BREAD. OHHHHH, THE BREAD. While I will skip over their baguette type bread, I cannot rave enough about their cheddar-bacon rolls. Sheer bliss. Just take my word for it, especially if you're a fan of salt. However, there is a drawback...one time we were here, I hadn't eaten almost all day, so I quickly devoured almost three of these rolls. I was full for the rest of the dinner...whoops.   THE SALADS: TIP! Make sure you split these with someone else at your table. These lettuce and vegetable concoctions are monstrously sized and are worthy of the cut in half.  --Caesar: Standard Caesar, but I really like the tangier-and-creamier-than-normal dressing and the Parmesan crisp. --(Steve's?) Chopped Vegetable: Phenomenal. The avocado adheres the vegetables together and it is smoooooth sailing.  --Wedge: Ask for the dressing on the side! Also, there is a large offering of thick-cut bacon on the side, just off the cooker. AMAZING. Uhh...is there a trend with the bacon here?  THE STEAKS: I have had steak here each time, naturally. And out of the six or so times, I would say five of them have been incredible. The other one, while good, just lacked that oomph that the others had. I generally get the large Filet and split it with one of my family members or we will get the NY Strip. I prefer the NY.  --Perfect crusting, locks in the juices and is still immaculately cooked inside to your preference. --The trio of sauces you will probably have to ask for; there is a creamy Bearnaise, their house steak sauce (kind of..it's red-ish), and my favorite: Jalapeno Tropical Fruit. Just a dab on each bite really kicks up the taste notch. It's like fruity Tabasco almost.   THE SIDES:  --Black Truffle Creamed Corn: If you don't get this, you aren't getting your full SW experience. So good...you might order a second one (if you have room!) --Mac & Cheese: Not as memorable as the creamed corn. Kind of boring but still good.  --Au Gratin Potatoes: Some of the best I've had, but too rich. I always eat the least of these because they're so rich and filling.  --I know we've had other sides..but I can't think of them at the moment.   THE DESSERT: --Funnel Cakes: I promise you...this will be the perfect cap on your evening. The 5 or so fried dough pieces come hanging on a foot-tall metal "tree" presentation, accompanied by a trio of sauces: Chocolate, Salted Caramel, and a Vanilla one. The vanilla one is worth licking the bowl for. Even those are $18 or so...they are not an item to be passed up (...if you have room somehow after the 27 pounds of food you may have just consumed in your 1.5 hour sitting).  ...Oh, and the decor is nice too.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their &#34;exclusive&#34; wine menu...and, yes, that is a $100,000 bottle of red.

3lofAE0uqkce3ZLcD4p1Kw.text: Wonderful!  Great atmosphere (sit outside if you can), wonderful service, delicious food. Since I had steak the night prior, I opted for the scallops and they were incredible... buttery and melty with a fantastic risotto. My friend had the salmon... she might as well have licked her plate afterwards. The steak tartar was soooo good and the kale salad was perfect. Although I am not vegan, I would strongly encourage you to try the vegan cheesecake as it is unreal!  This ranks as one of my favorite spots in Las Vegas. You won't go wrong here.

k6SJZvjJraQ9ag7voqYLNA.text: 4.5 stars  Went to SW for NYE. Dinner lived up to expectations from last visit. Porterhouse was excellent and cooked to perfection. Crab legs with orange tarragon butter were delicious as well. All of the sides (creamed corn, creamed spinach, asparagus) were all outstanding.

3RKHzWHUThmbAWm3jGWlSg.text: SIMPLY AMAZING.   This place was so delicious we went two nights in a row during our recent trip to LV.   Our combined visits were just this past weekend. I requested lake views both nights and they did not disappoint. Even if you do not get a lake side table, the view and visual shows every thirty minutes are not hard to miss.    We ordered the following:   Oysters on the half shell. I don't eat these raw, but the fiance said they were delicious and of different variations.  Jumbo Shrimp cocktail - always a good cold choice.  Tomahawk Chop w/ Crab Legs Oscar style - there are no words for this. My fiance was simply in awe. Perfectly cooked 30oz chop with crab legs and asparagus covered in bearniase sauce on top. YUM.  9oz Filet - Butter-like! Best steak I've ever had and I've dined in some swanky places all over LV. Could not have been more perfect.  Colorado Lamb Chops - Heavenly and of course, perfectly seasoned and cooked.  Au Gratin Potatos - worth every damn calorie.  Creamed Corned - I'm not a fan of corn, tried this one, still wasn't a fan, but my group def loved it.    Their selection of breads is incredible. Bacon muffins?! YES, PLEASE. This place is a definite must try if you're looking for an incredible dining experience with food and service to match.   I over indulged each visit so I didn't get to try their funnel cake dessert! Plenty of tables around us ordered it and it looks divine!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tomahawk chop, filet, shrimp, Au gratin potatoes and bacon muffin!

_cY9Aqof3eFA12ofJ5LSrw.text: I LOVE it!!! Great Service - had the chopped salad (so good i wanted a second). My main entree was a Wagyu Kobe Beef steak and it was AMAZING! Nothing compares! Dessert - Service - Cocktails - Everything was EXCELLENT!!!

ECy8kOeiKKo2EQStuINR8w.text: Overall, 5 star experience. Reservations are a must here. Service was top notch. Food and Drinks were amazing and the ambience with water show made the night even better. Will definitely be back.

RHqtcOYYd-WCLtgCVw7JHQ.text: Short: Probably the worst dining experience I've ever had. Want to get full and feel just as disgusted afterwards? Just swing by your local McD's (and that's an insult to fast food everywhere). This birthday meal was so disappointing that it took 8 months of editing to write a balanced review. Do yourself a favor and take your business elsewhere; folks on Yelp sometimes remark that they wish they could award 0 stars but that would be rating SW too highly.   Long: Four knocks against SW that keeps it from being a True fine dining establishment.  First- Regardless of whether the wine is inexpensive or a bottle of Chateau Lafite Rothschild, if you don't know the vintage, say you don't know! Please don't lie to us when you pour a far inferior vintage to the one you've listed on your wine list. That's borderline fraud. Second- When we catch you, you might want to admit fault and actually offer an apology instead of waving it off as an administrative mistake when the inferior vintage isn't even on your wine list. How many diners have you gotten away with cheating?  Third- If you serve tough, chewy A5 Wagyu (or what you claim to be A5 Wagyu) at $220/4 oz and then offer to replace and comp it, don't turn around and charge us for the inedible piece of meat that your kitchen messed up.  Fourth- After you've messed up A5 Wagyu, try expediting the order so that 1) the food doesn't arrive after the bill and 2) the victim doesn't need to dine alone.  One of the great things about Las Vegas is that you've got quality fine dining in just about every cuisine/genre imaginable. That means as diners, you've got choices! Don't squander a meal by eating at SW, you'll never get your time or money back.

XOjxTFCQeX_nFQde-PX0pA.text: I am giving SW a 4 and not a 5 bc I do believe it is a little overpriced.  But, with that being said, it was very very delicious and the service was amazing.  My husband and I split the pound of alaskan crab legs for 90$ as well as mashed potatoes, and then I got the small filet mignon and he got the boneless ribeye.  Both our steaks were cooked perfectly, the potatoes were great and the bread on the table was amazing.  We werent looking to break the bank, so we ordered the 2 least expensive red wines on the menu for about 25$ a glass, and they were also fabulous, one from spain and one cabernet/merlot mix. They are very accommodating, you are able to split about anything, they even offered to cook our steak at 2 different temperatures if we decided we wanted to split a steak.  The crab legs were okay, im not the biggest fan, but my husband loved them... not so sure they were worth 90$.  All in all the experience was amazing, it was one of the best steaks we have ever had, and were happy we went.  On our next trip we will probably visit another steak house to compare, and hopefully save a little money. Our meal came to about 330$ including tip. And they gave us 4 free little chocolate balls that said happy anniversary on the plate for free, so that was very nice.

NSBZakoMV2HbjdtG7JKrUg.text: Meh... I've had better cow before.  We were recommended to dine here by the front desk guy for a good steak but honestly, my dude has grilled up better steaks from Ralphs.  I had the 9oz Fillet Mignon which was good but certainly didn't make me do the happy dance and boss lady had a NY Strip that was just not good, at all.  Very chewy.  Both steaks were barely warm.  However, we did enjoy the Creamed Corn with Black Truffles but how can you f*ck up cream and truffles?  Impossible.  Also, you can't get a bottle of wine here for less than 300 bucks.  And we're not talking about rare, hard to find wines here.  We're talking stuff that you can buy at BevMo for 40 bucks.  The atmosphere is your traditional steakhouse feel.  If I was to dine here again, I'd prefer to sit outdoors.  Indoors was a bit stuffy.    The service was very friendly and if it wasn't for our waiter, I'd give this place 2 stars.  I know it's rude to mention another restaurant in a review but if you're looking for a good steak, trek on over to Eiffel Tower.  Now THAT is good cow.

q9qCmTf2mnzYF-pWkVgmHQ.text: Hands down the best restaurant in Vegas.  I ate at SW this past weekend in celebration of my sister in laws upcoming birthday.  I made the reservation 2.5 weeks in advance and put a special note indicating my sister's birthday.  From the moment we got there the level of customer service was unlike any I've ever experienced. When I checked in with the host he was friendly and even went as far as wishing my sister a happy birthday, we were then brought to our table which was located dead center and against the glass partition at the edge of the patio. The shows (which occur every half hour) were wonderful additions to the phenomenal food we had. The menu has a great selection of food and is accommodating to those who do not eat steak. I knew we were in for a treat the second we got the bread basket, perhaps the best arrangements of bread I've ever had; warm soft pretzels, mini baguettes and  cheddar & bacon muffins, and that's just to start!! I had a new york strip and it was cooked perfectly. The sides are delicious but I would recommend ordering a few for the table and sharing, we got the black truffle creamed corn (fantastic), mashed potatoes (perfectly seasoned) and the jumbo asparagus (so fresh). To finish off we ordered a creme brulee for the table and some coffee, both of which were great. The staff was so great about letting us enjoy our meal and our dining experience, unlike at other restaurants where you feel rushed. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone, however there are a few things to keep in mind.  1) If you want patio seating make a reservation!  2) This restaurant is a la carte so don't expect potatoes and veggie to come with your steak. That being said, the sides are large enough to share.  3)  It is on the expensive side but the quality of food and service makes it well worth it.

JGU2loONw3koNxcmdnrzjw.text: Probably the tenth time I have been here. Hands down best steak restaurant in Vegas. Atmosphere is pure class and oozes sophistication which is a rarity in many restaurants in Vegas. The Mac n cheese i strongly recommend l, paired with the chile rubbed ribeye steak. For dessert go for the creme brulee!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile rubbed ribeye!

6HyP6nD-hCeErRUTU1a83Q.text: Definitely a solid steakhouse with an amazing show every half hour on the lake -enjoyed my steak would come back- definitely a different experience from my previous visit - I had a flavorful prime rib and my wife the filet. Iceberg salads were big and bread excellent - cheesecake was very good.  Wine list left a bit desired - definitely near the top when it comes to steakhouses in Vegas - sw and prime are my go to in Vegas for steak - cut isn't bad either or the one in mgm craft steak also in the top area with Gordon Ramsay .  1. Prime  2. Sw  3. Craft steak 4. Cut  5. Gordon Ramsay

T95_Zdy2013B5OLY50HArQ.text: Amazing steakhouse, they also have a Kosher rib eye steak at the kitchen most of the time and they make it great.  This restaurant is one of my favorite steakhouse in town, they also have really dishes for Vegan , Such as Vegan 'meatballs'.

NYoyOhiHM0VmCzyHb6Ck1Q.text: My first time in Wynn and SW turned out to be a huge success! We had the caesar salad, which was the perfect starter, chile rubbed double ribeye, and black truffled cream corn. A lot of people have commented on the chile rub (which was why we ordered it), and I thought the chile, while interesting, overwhelmed the steak. It was spicy and flavorful but overpowered the taste of the cut. If I'm paying $ for a quality steak, I want to be able to taste the quality. My suggestion would be to get the chile on a less expensive cut of meat, because I did think it was pretty good.   The black truffled cream corn (why hasn't anyone thought of this before?) was fantastic, and so was the house bread. I didn't think the decor was topnotch (felt too plain), and it was rather noisy and bustling because it was packed, but all in all, it was a memorable meal and somewhere I'd recommend to friends and family.

wOD-APnnuJ-h1GLyjiyatA.text: Spectacular restaurant. They ambiance is unreal. There was a massive frog that came out of no where located out by the fountain and sang a song. Trippy. Then all the apps we crazy. All the expensive shit. Caviar, patte, foie gras, oysters, tartare. All were some of the best I've ever had. They had a fantastic staff and were able to quickly accommodate a new patron at our table. There is a really nice breezeway table and it felt so amazing bc it created some type of wind tunnel. The steak was phenomenal but the ambiance and views are the reason you must stop and make sure you check out Steve Wynn's steakhouse. There was also a crazy red white and blue ball show, which could have been for the 4th of July but nonetheless it was an amazing dining experience.

IoGdz7wSkB_p5J8nGlFCMg.text: Vegan's paradise. Steve Wynn never forgets about us vegans when he designs his menus. I celebrated my 33rd birthday here and it was beyond amazing. We got a table that looked out onto the terrace which looks out onto a pond that features a series of shorts shows throughout the night. It was a magical night and we always love dining in his restaurants.

tsJHk5zbYt5mt_t9yykXHA.text: Beware! The two members of our party who ate the crab salad at the top of the "Seafood Spectacular" became violently ill hours later. I alerted the front desk the next day, and the agent offered to comp the bill to my room. However I had paid by credit card. This began a frustrating process that ultimately led to an apology for their front desk agent "misspeaking" and refusing to honor their offer.  Great service while dining, solid but not spectacular flavors, overpriced, fun presentation, intestinal distress, awful customer service in the end.

pHfQsHs--RU0KVXDv_hS-w.text: Most of these reviews should not be taken seriously. Not to be rude, but if in your review you're telling people how to order their sides, you've obviously never been to a real steakhouse and should keep your comments to yourself.   I'm giving 3 stars because the food was ok and the manager pretended to be concerned. Aside from that, this place is a joke. You're seriously better off going down the street to Morton's where the food and the prices are better.   We were seated at 7:40 PM and did not get out of there until 10:40. It was an insanely horrible experience.   It took 40 minutes and asking twice to get bread, and when we asked for coffee, we were told that someone would be around to ask us if we'd like coffee. Seriously?  I cannot have coffee without you asking me first!?  Aside from the poor service the food is just ok. The Filet Mignon was cooked perfectly, however it is completely tasteless and served with cheap sauce to put on it. I felt like I was at one of those restaurants where you cook your steak on a hot stone at the table.   Seriously, if this is a dinner you've saved up to afford, don't waste your time or money. Go to Morton's, Fleming's or Ruth's Chris. I promise the food and service are 10 times better.   I do not recommend this place and will never be back.   And just so you know, we eat at restaurants like this once a week.....I guess it's Vegas though. No one will be back, so screw quality

ZM3dfZoju-QDsJtGUzuSeA.text: This is the best steakhouse I have ever eaten at, and I always look for the best anytime I travel. My wife and I visited here during our trip to Vegas to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary.  We had reservations and arrived 10 minutes early and were seated almost immediately at an outside table right on the water, best seat in the house. The waitress came over right away with menus and the beverage server was very quick to take our order. My grey goose martini was made perfectly and my wife said her specialty drink ( orange rose I believe) was delicious. The staff was very attentive and efficient the entire time.  For an appetizer we ordered the steak tartare. We never order things that are very very rare but we wanted to try something new. It was very good, prepared with a mayonnaise based sauce and toasted bread.   For dinner we both ordered the all natural grass fed filet, mine with a blue cheese crust and hers Oscar style. We also shared the teriyaki green beans. Everything was absolutely delicious, the seafood was fresh, meat cooked perfectly and the beans were crisp and flavorful. The blue cheese crust was perfectly balanced and prepared, I recommend that to anyone that likes toppings on their steak.   The dessert menu looked very good but we had no room left from dinner so decided to skip that.  We were given a few passion fruit truffles as a gift for our anniversary and these were excellent as well.    Prices are high but on par with any other high end steakhouse so I have no complaints there. If you can, be sure to get a table outside so you can watch the light show every 30 minutes. Next time you are in Vegas this place is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki green beans
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Oscar style
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7OEj18MKRIvUsV1m3XgOWg.text: From the start great service! Phenomenal service actually.  The ambiance of the restaurant is beautiful.  We ordered octopus, king crab pasta (my favorite), bone in ribeye, snapper, potatoes au gratin, -and mushrooms. The bread basket was even terrific.  Can't say enough.  A great special occasion meal.   Honestly can't say enough good things about there entire meal.  This was a perfect celebration birthday dinner.  Very impressed. The patio seating was amazing and I highly recommend.  Also bar was quaint but TVs to watch sports.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian Snapper
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom side
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Au gratin potatoes

1vuGnbKub_ZZA3MF-8rgdQ.text: What can I say about this place?  It's so AMAZING that we ate here back to back nights.  The giant colossal shrimps, crab legs, oysters, crab cakes, was just the tip of the iceberg.  We came here with a group of 8.  The atmosphere was Amazing, very relaxing, music playing, everyone seemed to be having a great time.  If you decide to come here, please order the Filet, you will not regret it.  The steak was great and all the sides were great also. I would highly recommend SW to anyone that is visiting Las Vegas.....

guHuw6C8iMJOaWybqo2blA.text: Rude bartender named bob. Poor service overall   I do not recommend this place! Go here if you want to be treated poorly and eat average steak and not feel welcomed.

QC3XgnC8zbOogbATUXpzug.text: WOW. We came here for my husbands birthday and it was phenomenal. Make sure you ask to sit on the patio when you make reservations. we had a seat right on the water and it was the best atmosphere ive ever experienced for a romantic dinner. The food was amazing, the shrimp cocktail was out of this world good. The steaks are great, even though I ordered mine medium, it came out more medium well, but my husbands was cooked perfectly. The mushrooms and the mac and cheese sides were delicious was well.  We finished with the molten cake and cheesecake and everything we had was incredible. This is definitely worth checking out

2oTdaf3Iolp2uvad9hg8sg.text: My boyfriend and I have came to this restaurant around  5 times. This last time my boyfriend made reservations 2 days before and requested to sit outside. The lady asked for how many people. He said,"table for two please."  The lady said," we only have outdoor sitting at 5:25 pm and 6:00 PM. My boyfriend then said ," we'll take the 6:00 PM. We get there at 5:40 PM and the general manager Bradley Brown was very Condescending. He told us that we were not allowed to sit outside. We reminded him of our 6:00 PM reservation and he bluntly told us that there wasn't and tables reserved for us outdoors. Mr. Brown made us feel so uncomfortable. He offered us a corner table inside and basically told us to take it or leave it.  My boyfriend then just didn't want to stay anymore. Mr. Brown was a real jerk about our outdoor sitting reservation and didn't even intend to make it right by offering us a curtesy drink or anything. Meanwhile there was still a few empty tables outside. My boyfriend and I were hungry and decided to sit inside. Away from the corner table we were offered of course. Once we sat the food and drinks were great as usual but the general manager just ruined our reason for a revisit to this Steakhouse. It saddens me that such a delicious restaurant has an employee with such horrible attitude.  I just thought I should share this bad experience with you. Hope you never feel mistreated by this Manager.

ULW-OPthjVquhffowkyBWQ.text: New favorite steak house. This place is amazing from the bread all the way to the dessert, the wagyu beef and the bone in rib eye was so good definitely will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UmnZV1uLiheHV6vBMdQE_w.text: There's no way anyone could have a bad review on the food. It is pure amazing!!!!! I really can't even afford it but I'd for sure go back. Sea scallops were DELICIOUS and filling.

X-rLxvhJ5HPCEP-sbrNemg.text: Wow, just wow!! This was one of the best meals I've had in a while. Everything was prepared to perfection. I started with the wedge salad, it was amazing! Then I had the filet accompanied by the pepper shrimp. The filet was like butter and the shrimp were cooked perfectly with a unique and very flavorful sauce. We shared the creamed spinach and dessert, both were delicious as well. I will definitely be back on my next visit to Vegas.

kGrvU2ILhY78lKqLGuVhSg.text: Never come to a place like this with a semi-full tummy! Best believe they are going to feed you like they're your gramma telling you 'you never eat...you're so thin!'  We walked in knowing what we were going to order based on a friend's suggestion and on a show from Food Network where someone pegged the chill-rubbed steak as one of the BEST things they ever ate.. my friend agreed so, we were sold!  There was a weird seafoodie smell either in the corner where we were sitting or it was a scent wafting thru the restaurant.. it threw me off bigtime. My hubby thinks someone dropped a piece of crabcake in the booth somewhere but.. it was a disgusting odor that, unfortunately, ruined my appetite somewhat and I just knew not to order the crabcake if it was what was stinking up the place!  First off.. let's talk about the bread basket with the adorable pretzel sticks...soft baked, so so warm and soft! They also had a bacon cheddar roll, but I was getting full at this point, as we'd had appetizers a couple hours prior so.. this was gonna fuck everything up if i went crazy with those cheese rolls too! I stuck to the pretzels and we befriended our bus person so we could get even more (oink oink!)  Dinner came and.. omg, that steak was FANTASTIC!! I took a photo, but it does it NO justice.. because the flavors in this steak are where the magic is! I saw someone else describe it as a grown-up Carne Asada and that's about the best description possible. I really could have used some corn tortillas to accompany this steak!  We opted for the potato puree and brussel sprouts. I hated the bacon in the brussels and was way too stuffed to take on more than a spoonful of potatoes!  Food here was amazing, I just wish we could have eaten more! Wine pairing and suggestions were also amazing! Dress code isn't as strict as you'd think.. I saw a man in here in a polo shirt and a poofy vest.. so best believe the folks that work here are not trippin if you're not fancy pantstin.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm meat!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That bread! Those pretzel sticks!!

UQjgXejvk98I_cOs1XPYNg.text: Exceptional service and really one of the best steaks I have ever had.  Get the steak tartare also, really delicious.  Can't recommend it enough, ask for a table outside so that you can enjoy the fountain shows

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aXy85KSu3xtUY41KjlLw0w.text: Enjoyed a great dinner at the SW Steakhouse! I was a little worried because Open Table showed no availability for seating prior to 10pm. However my husband & I took a chance and showed up around 7pm on a Saturday without any reservations and we were immediately seated.  We started with some mixed oysters, which were disappointing and the reason I cannot give SW a 5 star review despite loving everything else. The mixed oysters were small and flavorless. Also, the server never introduced the oysters to us, so we had no idea what we were eating. We also shared a Caesar salad which was delicious and generous in portion.   As a main I ordered the Hawaiian snapper with green olives, tomatoes, capers, lime. It was delicious. Also very generous portion size which I couldn't finish.  The sides, which were great, consisted of creamed spinach and french fries.  I was overall really pleased with the meal and the experience. The only hiccup was the oysters but I'd definitely come back!

Xq5yp9NCjeNYRbfOXdhCsQ.text: This place great.  We sat inside right across the waterfall.  There are some neat shows that happen every 20min at the waterfall.
