Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. potatoes au gratin
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hawaiian grilled swordfish

tT_x4-V31O7KNr-LQLFzrg.text: We went to SW for dinner while staying at the Wynn. The restaurant is amazing with views of the lake and special effects show that runs every half hour. Everything on the menu looked awesome. We started with Crab Legs...excellent-large and meaty. We ordered Rib Eye Steak and Rack of Lamb. Both were delicious. Their wine selection is huge varying in price from $100 to thousands. We will definitely go back on our next visit to Vegas.

EDc84OwFpE6MaDEuBzU4Ww.text: Every year for my birthday I pick the best steakhouse to celebrate. This year was my 30th birthday so I decided to pick the renowned SW steakhouse because I didn't want anything to go wrong.   I had requested the porch because I wanted to watch the shows on the lake. We were placed in a great table with a wonderful view.  The service was good but was not as attentive as you would expect for such an established and well known Steakhouse with Wynns name on it. Staff took a long time to come around to take orders, and was not very knowledgable of the food. Didn't feel as special as expected  from a establish of this level.   The food on the other hand was amazing. Everything we ordered from soups to steaks was unbelievable.   ATTENTION !! If it wasn't for the food being so great I would of rated this restaurant a 1. Once I got done eating an amazing meal I was engulfed in cigarette smoke. The table behind me all started smoking and ruined the entire experience. I asked the waiter if he could tell them to put it out and he said he could not. It was really sad to end such a great meal in such a bad way. Food was amazing but everything else sub par.

pvT8l8p8gaSGs6DZcIucPg.text: Spent my birthday here. Host sat us right on time and at a very nice area by the lake. servers were all very nice and attentive. Our apps and salad came very fast. and our steaks.... Simply amazing! Havent had this good of a steak since NY. That Very first salty caramelized burnt bite still lingers in my taste buds. I wont forget it! One of the best steaks ive ever had!

8ZDpWc0EiLs2rGTKY-lFRA.text: Hands down, best steak house in Las Vegas, a lot of close competition but I've been going ever since 2006 and is still my favorite. A must go if you ever visit Vegas!

SLYtoIPD8zsGNY5Z8IuB0Q.text: As always, before making the important decision on where to eat, I did my research.  The reviews on this place left me scratching my head.  It was either really good or really bad. I actually considered changing our reservations for this reason and I'm so glad I didn't.     Our waitstaff team was excellent, friendly but not intrusive and very helpful.   I keep reading on complaints about the pricing?  Let me remind you that you are eating at the Wynn.  At their signature steakhouse.  You were expecting what exactly?   SW is a spectacular restaurant with excellent food, service and beautiful decor.   My only complaint is that they don't offer group dining for anymore than 20-25 people.  I would have easily chosen this for my rehearsal or wedding reception dinner.

zxmVJxXLPgVMJQyzH9-FCg.text: Went Saturday night for dinner with our bachelor party and gotta say food was incredible.  Our reservations were for 10pm and got seated around 10:10pm in what was a packed restaurant.  I didn't partake in any of the appetizers but they looked good, was holding out for the main course.  I went with the 9 ounce filet mignon butterflied and it was the best filet I've ever had.  Came with some herb butter which was a great compliment. Sides we got were creamed corn, asparagus, mushrooms and a gnocchi special.  All amazing but the creamed corn was on another level, so delicious.  Finally got the cookie butter cheesecake which the waiter kindly suggested, absolutely amazing.  The place isn't cheap but you get your money's worth and then some.  If you can try to get a seat where you see the water light show they have by the restaurant, very cool show! Will be back next time Im in Vegas!

C9X5od2ljE1yOnuZ_BpiFA.text: Went to SW on a weekday to celebrate a friends birthday.  Staff was very professional, however when asked a few detailed questions he had to leave he table and return with an answer.  There were always several bussers and water fillers on hand and came at appropriate times to service the table.  The room is also very modern with high ceilings and large windows which look out to a patio and waterfall.  Needless to say my expectations weren't completely fulfilled dining here.  I was surprised at not the biggest selection of cuts (maybe 4) for a establishment specializing in steak.  My rib eye was seasoned very well but I wasn't given as much of a kick of flavor as I hoped for.  As any typical steakhouse, the sides were expensive and small.  I was really impressed with the dessert selection and I noticed other tables ordering some very creative things for their large groups!  Needless to say it wasn't bad, but in my opinion not completely worth the price.  With so many other options in Las Vegas, I would most likely spend my dollar elsewhere.

pNROyh3ymNhEaoPQluSU9A.text: In one word... "eh..." Most expensive of our three dinners this weekend and the weakest as it goes... We shared the entire meal and had 2 glasses of their most inexpensive wine (it was good though)... Ap, Steak + 2-sides and dessert... $250 - holy cow batman...  Service was excellent! Seared Foie Gras... excellent! Bone-in ribeye - "eh" just ok... so as this is a steakhouse, how do you rate it any higher... sides were ok... can't remember em so go figure... Chocolate dessert was pretty good...  BUT NOT $250 GOOD - for a shared meal....

1W2_cC2hQKXFQKdOmlR3MA.text: The food is way overrated. The ambiance, patio, service, decor, and drinks are fantastic, and the shows on the lake are bizarre, I loved them.  The staff were very accommodating as our party went from 4 to 6 to 7 to 6. We asked for and received awesome patio seating in VERY uncomfortable patio chairs. Note to management: get some cushions for those chair backs!   The server was well trained, as were all of the staff. Didn't love the description of what makes beef Kobe, but she didn't hedge with the info and I give her credit for that. Her "I don't mind, I'm not doing it to the animals" was a little snarky, but that's ok.   I was surprised that the only grass-fed beef option was a special. I would assume they'd have had more options.   The staff were flexible with our late-comer who I was ordering for ahead of time, and were concerned about when to start his food; they came up with a plan for that, which was very kind.   The patio is great, especially on a beautiful night like we had. The interior is really beautiful, in a very simple, modern way. Very comfortable looking, while maintaining sophistication.   But back to the food--it was fine. My scallops were good though overpriced, everyone's dinners were fine; no complaining, but no raving at all. And this is a food-raving bunch when it's warranted.   There was nothing special about the scallops, the risotto under, or the grass-fed NY strip. The asparagus was fine, the scalloped potatoes were too much goo and not enough potato, and I'd say the only to-die-for item on the table were the sauteed mushrooms. They were heavenly--but with enough butter, anyone can make heavenly mushrooms.  My bottomline: Won't be back here. We'll try Morels or Del Monico's at the Venetian next time, or continue on our hunt for A++++ restaurants at $$ prices. Because that's when something is really special!

Roia1YUk37MsoDOKrQ3Ueg.text: Delicious steak and lobster with a fabulous wine selection as well.  S&W is a great high end steakhouse at the Wynn.  If you can see out the window to the lake, you'll be graced by the Wynn's trippy little show every so often.  The service is great and the staff is friendly.  If you can swing it, I'd definitely recommend a dinner at S&W on your next Vegas trip.

3-40s5bt6-bhBP8kMBV7hg.text: This place is awesome!  We eat here regularly when in Vegas, usually at the bar.   The bartenders are extremely friendly and efficient, always making suggestions on drinks and food!  I know that the name is a steakhouse, but you can't always judge a great book by its cover.  In this case, you can!  They have the best steak hands down.  We stopped in a couple of nights ago and I had the New York strip steak, the flavoring was amazing and it was extremely tender.  You also have to try the creamed spinach of course, it is delicious.   When in Vegas a must SW

kSjmo5zN_N3pSQJWwFxyUg.text: Well if I could give them more than 5 stars I would. The service, food, and ambiance was wonderfully memorable! We will be back!

hjIB5rZ6R8w4PeRmMj2fPw.text: WOW.WOW.WOW.  This restaurant is spectacular! Dining here is definitely an experience. I came to Vegas for Memorial Day Weekend and dined at SW the first night. Everyone in my group wished we ate there the last night of our trip, so we wouldn't have to compare everything else to SW!!  The ambiance is simply incomparable to any other restaurant. When we went, there was a light show and really cute entertainment (a giant frog popped above the waterfall and sang, with lyrics projected over the water to sing-along).  The food was great! If you're a big steak eater, I would definitely recommend the porter house. If not, the lobster tail is delicious. And OMG, that bread is to die for (there was a cheddar bacon bread, pretzel bread, and one other that I didn't try). The best bread of my life! It is freshly baked and comes out warm to your table :). Also, the oyster appetizer is bomb.   Dining experiences are never going to be perfect, especially when there are a lot of people at the restaurant. Mistakes will happen now and again. The mark of a great restaurant is how you handle those mistakes. When someone in my party got a vodka-based drink instead of the gin one they ordered, and when someone's risotto was a bit over-salted, our server was on it! He immediately brought back the correct drink, made jokes, and even took the risotto off our bill.   If you're coming to Vegas, dine here! It' expensive but worth it.

eH1t9ol64gnZHbct_GQbKA.text: The atmosphere is nice and the menu is appealing. The scallops were good, as was the filet, cream corn, and Tuscan salad. Would suggest planning to spend several hours for dinner if you can to enjoy the patio and water show.

-cPmdUkhPV_9x9mLNUatJg.text: 3 1/2 star review. Honestly, I'm disappointed in SW. I was expecting a five-star meal, at a five-star price, and didn't get the meal (but I did get the price).  The biggest complaint is that the steaks and sides seemed overseasoned. Everything was salty. It's too bad, because the quality of the meat was outstanding. And I'm not going to lie, I finished my ribeye as it was tender and good, but the salty taste kind of ruined it for me. My wife did not finish her filet and all of our sides had leftovers.   I also thought that the service was good but a little overwhelming. Our server kept trying to upsell us on wine and would come around almost too frequently to check on us. He bordered on annoying.   Combine all that with what was a nearly $500 check for four people (with wine) and I left feeling a little underwhelmed.   I will say that the ambience at SW is five stars. Just an amazing experience sitting outside on the Lake of Dreams and watching all of the shows that Wynn puts on. If you do decide to dine at SW, ask to sit on the patio.  Also, the bread they serve before dinner is really great. I might walk down there and slip someone a 5 for some of those bacon cheese rolls and pretzel bread.   Just not sure if I'll have that bread before dinner there again anytime soon.

IISUmiGf_IJR1ruUVBXpHg.text: What a beautiful establishment!  My friend made our reservation and what a great choice. We chose this as our fancy night out while on vacation.  I did have a filet with brussel sprouts and potatoes au gratin.  I am usually a heavy A-1 user but the steak was so delicious it didn't even cross my mind to embellish the steak.  I had never had chopped brussel spouts- I wasn't a huge fan but it was more me than them not nailing it. The au gratin potatoes were delish. Having a great view of the water show was an added extra to our dinner.  It was very loud in the establishment. I did  not expect a place this fancy to get so loud.  But if you like good food and don't mind the price- its a nice play to try.

O0Aw_DQrhJg4t8zCmd1GWA.text: Btw they responded to this review and someone from management was suppose to contact me and never did. Just like the service it's a disappointment. Lies all around!!! Lies!!!  From Aug 2016! Cheap etiquette, horrible customer service, overly salty steak, under quality less than average restaurant!   Not sure if Vegas falling under the economy but this restaurant does not do justice. It's prob the worst dinning experience I've ever had in Vegas. We went with a party of 5 and my friends 9 year old son was wearing shorts. The host informed us that we need to get him pants and they had loners there. My friends son did not want to wear someone else's pants, therefore we had to buy him some pants hence the shops at the Wynn is not the average mall shops.   We went to Givenchy and his dad spent 3k to get him pants and some dress shoes. So this would prove to u how excited we were to dine at SW.   Finally we are the restaurant again, the waiter did not give us any formal greeting, he basically gave us our menus and asked if we were ready. No big deal, we were extremely hungry so that did not bother us.  We ordered a round of drinks, water and our main entrees. Everyone had the filet minion and about 5 sides in total for the table. We were anticipating on the steaks only to be extremely disappointed.!!!!! We all got our filets and it was so salty that it was hard to consume. As hungry as we were it was hard to eat. We all asked each other If the steak is too salty and everyone said yes without hesitation but didn't want to ruin the experience so after one confessed that it's hard to take another bite we finally decided to get the waiter.   The waiter did not apologize, he said I will go get my manager and be right back. My boyfriend told the waiter even before he went to get the manager that we were not looking for any discounts bc no one had taken more than 3 bites. So we waited for the manager to come and see he what could possibly do so that we weren't chewing on grams of salt.  The manager never came by. We did not hear from the waiter, we waited over 1 hour to see if we can get the steaks made so we just ate the side dishes and agreed that this restaurant has no integrity, they have cheap mannerism, horrible customer service and simply just rude and to top it off saying the food is mediocre is an overstatement.   We watched the waiter finally come by and he said he was going to comp the dessert lol we ordered 1 dessert for 5 people just to let them know that it was the classless act of not being hospitable and at the very least having the manager with his sharp suit walking around looking on the mirrors had better things to do than to stop by and at the very least apologize. He needs to be fired on the spot.   The staff needs to come to LA and learn a thing or two from restaurants so they wouldn't have cheap etiquette. Stay away from this restaurant if u love your steak and like customer service find STK @ the Cosmo at least u will treated decently.

FMznnSXgzTpwxMuRmbP9tw.text: Came here with my girlfriend for our anniversary. We had reservation there at 7:30PM and we were promptly seated. We ordered Fillet Mignon, Boneless Rib eye, Mac & Cheese, kale salad(I forgot what that was, but it comes with amazing pecan), and shrimp cocktail. We had bread as an appetizer, and that bacon and cheese bread was the killer. It really was the best bread I've ever had as an appetizer. Server was really nice, had everything we needed.   Shrimp Cocktail : I am not big fan of seafood (but my girl do), since she enjoyed it, I would not deduct any point based upon this.  Kale Salad : Salad was amazing and maybe next time, I will be here just to have this salad. Trust me, it is that good. Coated pecan harmonized with the dressing and salad, which really  was amazing  Fillet Mignon : Again, best fillet I've ever had, never had as tender fillet as the one in SW.  Boneless Rib Eye : Amazingly juicy from the beginning, but I would not give rib eye by itself as 5 out of 5. I understand that Rib Eye comes with some fat part, but the steak that I had, it was too fatty. Also, by the time that I was eating, I could tell that it was getting dried. It was never been juicy at the end.  Mac & Cheese : 1 star out of 5. Nothing special, too hot to eat, cheese did not go well with mac. To be honest, I was disappointed about their Mac & Cheese, but I would say, I just made my menu selection wrongly. Should not have ordered this.  Overall experience, I had great time. There were some waterfall show that were going on also, which was pretty romantic. But if I have to compare this place with my past experience that I had in STK, I would say I had better experience in STK. Better side dish, as good steak as SW, amazingly friendly and attentive server,  better atmosphere with lighting (I am still young).

cDI35iqi_tDSBkq5BiFb9A.text: Magic happens in Vegas...  I'm not talkin' about the cliche, "you put a quarter into the slot machine and win a million bucks" situation... I wish I won a million bucks, but that didn't happen during my mini getaway. Instead, my amazing husband managed to get a last minute outside seating at SW. Don't ask how, I won't tell.  To my surprise, I had no idea how wonderful SW was until the outside "show" began. A giant green frog appeared from behind the massive waterfall and began to sing a lovely tune. The next show was two orbs singing and dancing in the pool with a little surprise at the end.  I enjoyed my time at SW, it's an experience and a must go to restaurant during a Vegas stay (outside seating is mandatory!)

VBLNfFdrPFXuXL2mhgSWBw.text: We came here for a birthday dinner and were really excited to try the steakhouse.  The ambiance is very elegant and the noise level appropriate.  The pretzel bread was delicious.  The butter was fresh and if you missed it, the olive oil the butter is sitting on, is delicious.  This was a nice start.  The large group ordered different types of steaks, meats, etc.  I had the truffle risotto.  We also did a family style order of sides: Yukon Gold potato puree, steak fries, Cipollini Onions & Jalapeno, Sauteed Wild Mushrooms and Shaved Brussels Sprouts.    The food was delicious.  We may have ordered too much.  The truffle risotto was delicate and the cauliflower added a similar yet unique texture.   The food itself was excellent.  I removed 2 stars due to the service.  This was a special event and the waiter argued with the guest of honor on how to serve his drink.  He seemed grumpy after that.  After our meals were served, our service significantly declined.  Our waiter was not to be seen (if you're on break, let us know or give a replacement).  We couldn't ask for the bill so we sat there.  The bill came 20 minutes after we were done with our meal.    I really enjoyed the food and for an expensive restaurant, the service was sub par.  This is something I've seen at other Encore restaurants and I feel management needs to step it up.  I would want the truffle risotto again but I'm sure I can find it another restaurant.

7Q-xaVflJeJkQIiqAm0sDw.text: A and I came with another couple and we've been to the only restaurant in New York that serves real kobe beef so we were excited to come and try this place, which is one of two places only in Las Vegas that serves it. We originally had reservations at Jose Andres Bazaar Meat but decided last minute to change it to here since it was closer in location to us and was also fully booked, which we thought meant it must be better. The pricing is actually higher than New York's but unfortunately, the kobe beef didn't taste as amazingly delicious as we hoped. We all felt we've had better. We tried 4 oz of the rib cap, which is one of the cuts that has the most marbling. In addition to this, we split the 40 oz dry aged steak, filet mignon, SW fries, creamed spinach, brussel sprouts, and crispy potato rosti. The steaks and sides were all very good, as were the complimentary bread basket - I ate too much of the bacon cheese roll and pretzel roll. The fries were especially good but we were so full, we barely made a dent in them and we ordered all the sides in half portions too with the exception of the rosti.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4oz rib cap kobe steak

XWFnPslqZGJg-C0pnf2-Hg.text: My hubby and I love this place! They are beyond consistent!!!! This is probably one of the best steakhouses in all of Vegas! Their cold foie gras is INCREDIBLE!!!!!!!!

2PerHSQT6uBbvTqri8sJmQ.text: I hate to do this, but I must.  First let me say that some of the following review may have just been bad luck for us.  But at the same time, it was our entire experience, so here we go.  I'll do a brief summary, and then you can read the rest in detail if you still want to know more.  First of, let me say that my Wife and I have always tried to make a trip to SW part of any trip to Las Vegas for the past 10 years or so.  They lost our reservation, and we had to re-book for another night.  MINUS ONE STAR...  The Restaurant was incredibly loud on a Monday night...it was a strain to talk among ourselves at the table it was so loud.  MINUS ONE STAR..  Our Table was tucked away in a corner, with absolutely no view of the 'Lake of Dreams' show, which is part of what helps to separate SW from every other Steak House on the Strip.  MINUS ONE STAR...  Corkage Policy, I dare you to try and find it posted anywhere on their website.  Let me save you the trouble...100 dollars per bottle.    MINUS ONE STAR...  The Full Story of our experience:   I had called and booked a table for our group two weeks prior to our visit.  I called the night before to confirm, but they had no record of us.  We were able to re-book for the following night for our party, which while not ideal, would still work for us.  ***MINUS ONE STAR***  So two days later we arrive on time, and have a short wait to be seated.  The restaurant was packed and seemed far louder than we have ever experienced before.  It's never been quiet, but this seemed extreme.  The Signature SW cocktails are now over 20 bucks each, (our group had a Manhattan and pair of Martini's) and honestly while prepared well, did not provide the sort of experience their price tag would justify.  We were then seated in a far corner of the restaurant, behind a pillar with no view of the 'Lake of Dreams' water show, which has always been part of made dining at SW so great.  And it was LOUD.  So loud that we all struggled to hear one another, really destroying the atmosphere.  I don't know if it was the location of our table, or the if they have added more tables into the space, but after an hour of our dinner, I was starting to get a headache from the noise.  ***MINUS TWO STARS*** (One for no view, one for the noise)  Backing up, this was special evening for the other couple with us (anniversary) and we brought a couple of amazing bottles from our private collections to help celebrate the moment.  As we're being seated, the Hostess asked if we knew they had a corkage policy, I said yes, we've had many bottles here in the past.  I'd like to make a point here...Nowhere on the SW Website, do they list the current corkage policy.  It turns out, they currently charge ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS per bottle.  We discovered that when the bill came.  I don't begrudge restaurants charging corkage, as a wine guy I get it.  But for those prices, the service should have been flawless.  Instead, they ended up with some sediment in both decanters from the wine, and the glasses were honestly low rent, the Riedel glasses you can buy at Target are better than the stems we were given. ***MINUS ONE STAR***  The food was great, expensive, but everything was prepared perfectly, and we have no complaints there.  But lots of places have expensive, well prepared food in Vegas.   What made SW special for us in the past was the total experience.  After this event, we'll probably never be back, and we're sad for that, as we had so many great dinners with them in the past.  One last note, SW proudly displays signage about enforcing a dress code, and in years past it was nice.  But the number dinners in jeans and t-shirts really hurts the image of the place.  At least require a collared shirt for men if you're going to worry about a dress code at all.

gIu2cmo22_SC896H9wf_xw.text: This restaurant is fantastic.  Well-deserved of its high rating.  We arrived early and had a couple of drinks at the bar - small, intimate bar with great service and great conversation.  We sat down promptly and had two servers - both extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the restaurant and the menu.  We started with the tuna tartar, shared the 24oz bone-in ribeye (which they sliced for us since we were sharing), and the seasonal lobster mac and cheese as a side, along with parmesan spinach.  Absolutely fantastic and cooked to perfection.  Don't be turned off if you can't get a reservation here.  You may have some luck (1) eating at the bar, or (2) asking the host if they can squeeze you in whenever possible ;)

ntfTpWkQ2we8pLmndIbJlw.text: I rarely eat somewhere and do a review within a couple of days but our service at SW was impeccable! My husband brought his team of 8 and their spouses to celebrate their success here! We had a private room in the back by the patio and it was the most beautiful and elegant private room I have ever seen! We had the option of several set menus to choose from which I have to say were absolutely phenomenal! They brought out several seafood platters which had crab legs, shrimp, several kind of oysters, and it was absolutely amazing!!! Then we have the choice of several salads and soups. For the third course it was roasted chicken, salmon, and a few different kinds of steaks all which came with a side dish. Then of course came dessert which was a chocolate mousse cake! I have the bone in ribeye and it was to dye for!! It was cooked to perfection! Our side dishes were mushrooms, broccolini, and mashed potatoes! I had to have more mashed potatoes so I got an order to go!!! They were some of the best ever! The price for each person was 165 and absolutely well worth every single penny! Everyone enjoyed their food and thought it was absolutely phenomenal!  A huge thank you to SW for accommodating us and we will definitely be back. Hey what can I say, I am a sucker for red meat, good food,and great drinks; and SW steakhouse satisfied all three!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter

AKyf-sre_E0QCSVjzj7Tbg.text: Wonderful ambience and service but my date and I both got food poisoning the next day from the king crab legs. Sucks next time I come back I'll make sure to get a steak instead of the seafood options they have. :( ... The melting chocolate dish was amazing though I have to say that is definitely worth coming for!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was SoOoOo good and made me SO SICK!

daQDo6gmd0R5-hwBFvxZAA.text: This place could have been a four if it wasn't for our unattentive waiter. EVERYTHING JUST TOOK FOREVER. He didn't really came and check up on us much and even when we were done and took a LONG time to bring us our check. It was a bit ridiculous as I decide to give this place a 3 stars.  Honestly, the only thing that really stand out was the Chile rubbed double ribeye that made this restaurant standout. There were a plate full of bread that I really didn't enjoy much. It's not even because I find Craft's steakhouse's dinner roll 100x better but i just didn't like the breads they provided. I thought it was cool that they provided high quality butter with pepper on top and olive oil on the bottom. However, I just simply didn't enjoy the bread.  The things that we did get besides Chili rubbed double rib eye were the truffled cream corn, potato puree, bone in ribeye, and gnocchi  and cream spinach. I thought the sides were really mediocre. The one I liked the least was the cream spinach as the cheese totally overwhelmed the dish that I simply can't forced myself to eat more. The potato puree wasn't anything special and I've definitely had better potato puree. The truffled cream corn was a bit interesting. This is one of those times where don't let the looks deceived you. (TO BE HONEST) I thought it looked like puke but when I had a bite of it, it was actually pretty good cream corn. It's not your regular cream corn that is super creamy. this cream corn is a light dish where the sauce is a bit runny. My complain would be that I didn't taste the truffle at all.   The bone-in rib eye and the Chili rubbed double rib eye: The bone in rib eye was fairly decent as I know they charred the top on purpose to have that burnt look. I didn't mind it as I quite enjoy the charred top. The bone-in rib eye was only decent but as I was smart enough and have the the chili rubbed double rib eye right in front of me, I indulged the regular rib eye with that amazing chile rubbed.   The party of the meal was the Chile rubbed double rib eye which came in a HUGE PLATE. IT was simply amazing and the most unique steak I've had. That Chile rubbed oil sauce was just that cheese to your grill cheese sandwich. I almost indulge everything aftewards(the sides, the other steak ) with the chile rubbed oil. It was that good and it definitely went well with that steak it comes with as it had a great charred to it. A bunch of peppers, onions(mmm), and the rest of the 40ish something oz steak. It is a must get if you haven't tried this place.   I say you should go give it a run with another person just to solely try the chile rubbed double rib eye and that's it. That was a standoff and nothing else on that dining table even compared to this dish. The service could use a bit of an adjustment but I REALLY LOVE the atmosphere of the outside as you could watch the waterfall while eating your dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xzUWBJ8QJ7bd-j2uNw_Jgw.text: First time here was okay over price for a bad stake burnt I don't mind paying for a great stake but this was a disappointment no flavor drinks were water down beautiful place but if u charge a lot and have a beautiful stake house u better make sure u serve a great meal and drinks very disappointing and Oslo ur chef suppose to over see what comes out to customer before we get it abs for the chef and ur waiter to let my burnt stake to get to my table bad service and quality control and bad on me for not saying nothing I just don't like to make a seen but it's on them will never come back or refer anyone here I go to Vegas a lot and this was very disappointing and it shows management don't care about there high end stake house they don't reach out to there costumers it shows they don't care

PF0ERV-7OCDbXwIza8OngA.text: Lived up to the hype. Service was fantastic, view was great, food was superior. Shared the porterhouse with my friend, almost finished the whole 40oz between us two. Mac n cheese was super good, although the sauce tasted a little more like a rich alfredo lol.  It's too bad Steve Wynn's reputation is in the toilet but lucky for you my friends, this restaurant is not.

UxxSSKTdAf-vQXHnKHpSTQ.text: You can't find a better steak house than this. Personally I've dined at SW maybe 15 or 20 times and I have never ever had a less than perfect dining experience every single time so for *some* of the reviews that are not 5 stars I find to be biased and not trustworthy based on averages. Seeing comments like complaining about about snobbery, loudness, wine corking fees etc., yes this is Vegas after all, room service for a hamburger and fries will run you at the least $65. To bring some perspective to the table they see a lot of millionaires and even some billionaires dine in their restaurant every week. Many are regulars of the hotel and pretty big fish, some are celebrities. That's not to say that if you're not one of these you won't have the most amazing meal and service of your life, you probably will. But don't be upset if you didn't get the best table in the restaurant because you made a reservation in advance. If this is something of your deepest desires you need a great casino host they have the keys to the city.   I have been coming to Vegas for about 20 years and have eaten at Prime, Picasso's, Alex and too many others to count that were all once part of the original Wynn empire, and a few others including Craft which I didn't care for. Out of all of the restaurants to choose from in Vegas this is my favorite. The service is impeccable. You can't just apply to work here these people are scouted and are the best of the best. They know what you want faster than you do, they are more polite than you will ever meet, they live eat and breathe this. When you have a table of 8 and dinner is brought to the table it is like a choreographed dance.   Now the steak... the steak. The steak. This is what dreams are made of. I usually go for the bigger cuts and bone in and never a filet. All though I can never finish it these are the best cuts and where the flavor is. I also always go medium rare so that the steak is at its juiciest. The last steak I had was not on the menu but was a sous vide steak. I'm embarrassed to say had we not been late for a show I may have eaten the entire thing and I don't think anyone at the table would have judged me for doing so. It was the most tender flavorful best steak I've ever had in my life. All their sides are great too we typically will get an au gratin and maybe a veg. Don't fill up on their delicious crack bread, it's a trick you have more amazing food coming. Do get the Caesar salad If I was a Kardashian I would hire the chef who prepares this to make every day. It's really good! All their seafood is also amazing, the Wynn always has the best oysters and caviar. And for sure you must get the Churros you won't have room but that won't matter when they arrive. Try to score a spot close to the patio when they open the doors on a warm Vegas night, and sit back relax fine dining is not meant to be rushed. You may even spot Steve Wynn and his entourage float through the restaurant to the private dining room in the back.

cpims9JO2hpbLYTUP08HBQ.text: Good steakhouse, great service as always from a super expensive steak houses.  Do: Get potatoes au gratin they are delicious perfectly crisped cheese and cooked potatoes... but there is one catch... it is far too small of a serving.  Do: Eat the bread because... they have three choices all of them are delicious... the bacon bread, the pretzel bread and the random red head step child bread that was thrown in for fun. Bacon bread yum and pretzel bread yum.  Do: Get a big steak and cook it lower than medium (if you are at a steak ordering above medium... why are you here? go to sizzler and save money, quit ruining meat)  Do Not: Get the mac and cheese. just very underwhelming, and not creamy enough. Dont get it and thank me later.  Do: get dessert because why go otherwise.   THE VERDICT: i think i like del friscos more... wait i know i like del friscos more. Every place has something delicious... this is a good place but if you are going to drop 200 dollars just once in your visit to vegas id suggest somewhere else. but if you like trying new places gotta go yo.

I5JQEIjAQEUs-tLnm8xiFA.text: The American wage was worth the price. The sides are all excellent, the cream of corn was my favorite.

SePiqeH77jOU_pqIcMwxsA.text: The first time at this steakhouse and normally I would have ordered a steak but I decided to to go with the fish that was excellent. We also ordered a crab cake. The service was really good. There was nothing on the dessert menu that really jumped out at me. One only negative feedback that I have was the fact that we wanted to sit by window to watch the water show and were told someone had reserved that seat In November.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. John Dory fish.

MYtH7_sK4QQVIkksdRkoEQ.text: I would say it was just about average. We basically ordered majority of chef recommended food and we were just happy . There was nothing so special about their food. The ambiance was quite nice. But what annoyed me so much was that they were keep turning all the walk ins away  while  during they 2 hour and 45 minutes that we were dining there was there at least 7 tables empty . So they just pretend that it's difficult to book it even though really is something else . To be fair and waiter was such an amazing friendly guy even though he made a mistake in our order but we were really happy with him.  So if you are in Vegas and would like to have some options this one is okay but don't get your hopes so up !!!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f2LjRubDpEJjrqB3ruGVvg.text: I have to say that I'm actually shocked by the fact I have to write a 3 star review for a Wynn restaurant.  I've dined at several Wynn & Encore restaurants and grown accustomed to having fantastic service and food, but this one missed the mark.  I am giving 3 stars since the food was good, but I should be giving less stars for the service.  One thing I will say, maybe the servers were aggravated by a vegan dining at a steakhouse, but my money spends, right?  Every restaurant at Wynn has a vegan menu and I like trying different things.  When I asked to see the vegan menu the male server seemed annoyed.  Not the usual "any other food allergies we should be aware of?" .  It just made me feel uncomfortable, like he didn't think I should be/wasn't good enough to be dining there.  While I was waiting to order I saw servers chatting and laughing for a few minutes.  I'm sure I'm just being paranoid, but after already feeling uncomfortable I was wondering if they were talking about me?  Now onto the food...  A female server came to take my order.  She was pleasant.  I placed my order and she said she would bring out vegan bread and butter.  So they brought out my bread and butter, but I'm glad I asked if it was vegan because it was dairy butter and two different kinds of non vegan bread.  One bread was a cheese and bacon biscuit.  I'm vegan due to food allergies of cows milk and eggs, so this is a big deal.  Usually at Wynn I don't have to hound them with "Is this really vegan?", but I'm glad I did this time.  They brought out my correct bread and butter, but no one even apologized for the mistake.  My kale and apple salad came out next.  It was good, I was pleased with it.  Very shortly after came my mushroom dish with white bean puree.  It was presently well and tasted great.  Even though my food was good (minus the almost eating dairy/egg filled foods), the mediocre service left a bad taste in my mouth.  I passed on dessert and left.  On my way out no one thanked me for visiting or told me to have a good night.  Rude.  The restaurant is beautiful and the ambiance and waterfall is spectacular, but after the poor service, I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan mushroom and white bean purée entree
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan kale and gala apple salad

21KlcyGjG-42dv_gv91WWQ.text: Girlfriend took me here for my birthday. The hostess sat us outside for the show, and the entire meal was spectacular.   Pros- fantastic steak (blew away joes seafood and steaks), attentive and professional server, everything we had was amazing (rib eye for me, fillet for her), the molten chocolate dessert was awesome to watch them prep  Cons - nothing! (I so rarely say this)  Just do yourself a favor and book your next special occasion here. The sw steakhouse is a first class steakhouse, in every way.

d_RaxT_N0HCIfFfRswGSaQ.text: Disappointed...3 hours to complete a meal that had minimal drinks and no desserts...severely overpriced for the quality of the food.  Steaks were good but the sides were just average for the exorbitant prices...insane wine prices even for their house labels ($35 a glass for Inglenook Cabernet?). Staff was not attentive...periods of 20-30 min with no staff visiting your table.  About $300 for dinner for two without dessert and the only redeeming quality was the steak itself...will not be returning.

MclmqqUFv_pv9IIdMpg9tA.text: Went here for a birthday dinner, and we weren't disappointed!  This is a high end steakhouse, but the prices seemed similar to other high end dining in Vegas.   Service Booked a reservation and were seated right away. The service was great and what we expected for a restaurant of this caliber. Attentive professional waiter who mainly explained the menu and took orders and supervised the experience while the food was served by other staff members. Very unintrusive but water glasses were always kept full. Very pleasant and leisurely pace for the meal; there were comfortable pauses between courses where dishes were cleared and the table tidied.   Ambiance A very upscale and classy feel inside. Not dark and heavy and leathery like many steakhouses which was a nice surprise.  There is a fountain outside with a sort of a show with lights and effects and music (and a signing frog I think?) every 30 minutes or so which seemed odd at first but was actually pretty cute.   Food Everything was really exceptional. Wonderful cocktails, shrimp cocktail appetizer, and of course amazing steak. Even the bread basket was amazing - pretzel bread!  Need we say more?  Sides are ordered a la carte. We loved the mushrooms and mashed potatoes. The sides are huge; you will likely have plenty to take home. Exquisite dessert; they decorated one of the desserts with a birthday greeting for us which was a nice touch.   Mojo An upscale classy steakhouse with a refreshingly modern interior. Great service as expected in a high end restaurant and excellent food. Prices are high but not more than similar restaurants. Overall highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday treat
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More steak

MkdZC1_RHXDczoIATfdP0g.text: We had an extraordinary dining experience at SW steakhouse. The restaurant is absolutely beautiful, and the ambiance was truly lovely. We chose to sit outside so that we could watch the little light shows that is put on. There are heaters throughout the patio seating so if you go on a chilly night you can still enjoy dinner out there. I started with a red sangria which was very delightful.   I ordered a caprese salad. It beautifully plated and set a perfect tone for what was to come. Two complimentary baskets of warm assorted breads were brought out to our table. The French baguette was amazing and the rest of our table went Bananas over the bacon and cheese muffin. My husband ordered the Alaskan halibut fish and chips. It was a beautiful and delicious spin on fish and chips. I ordered the scallop dinner. YALL.... it was FANTASTIC. The scallops were a beautiful size and they melted in my mouth like butter. My mouth is watering writing this.  The scallops were served over a bed of English pea risotto that was seriously from the heavens. Every bite was savored and nothing was left on my plate when I was done.   The wait staff was excellent, attentive, and kind. We all loved our dishes as well as our wonderful dining experience. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a spectacularly special night.

23Fn4_RrmkDoh19_G4F-hw.text: The best place for steak in Vegas!!!! The Service increible!!! The food amazing! The view espectacular !! We have foie grass, the New York and the  Chateaubriand. I will go back again definitely!!

2Ka3wTZzGk4Rf6Gw5OWgDg.text: This place is beautiful.  Everything you want in a restaurant.   Started off with there special cheese plate, octopus appetizer, and gnocchi with crab meat.    Octopus was excellent.  The gnocchi was to die for.  It might have been the best gnocchi i have ever had literally.  Small pasta mixed in with crab so good!      For the dinner, we split the 40 oz double ribeye rubbed with jalapeno chile.  It was excellent.  It is huge!   Enough to split between 3 people.  Also split the brussel sprouts and frenchfries.    The decor is awesome and service is top notch.   Probably this and del friscos are my 2 favorite steakhouses in las vegas.

The truffle lobster gnocchi was very poorly made, watery and not tasty $26.  I also tried a ravioli, mediocre.   And some palm vegan balls. not tssty.  mashed potatoes very pedestrian.

IwtkwvPw2p2RusQDMeo0mQ.text: The host called Robert is giving attitude when asking for what time is available As walk in. Really don't understand. He can be nicely telling people that are sold out tonight but he didn't. Not acceptable service for a high end restaurant.   I didn't expect such a nice restaurant has this level of service.

D5zr-CUfeu5CxgwGb419_g.text: We reserved a table for our anniversary and requested a table with a view. The table was perfect! The wait staff was very knowledgeable about gluten allergies and made sure everything brought to the table was gluten free. The food was amazing. We will definitely be back!

MdpMrxN9RjmRm6e7ZOhwFw.text: One of the best Steakhouse in CA!!!!!  I was staying at the Wynn so naturally I wanted to see what all the fuss with SW was about. This is not your typical hotel restaurant! Among three of us, we split the huge chili rubbed ribeye steak. It was maybe one of the best I've ever tasted. The quality blew me away. And if that wasn't enough, we had a great view right by the water. Now I know where I'll be eating every time I'm in Vegas!  Tip: Order appetizer it is MUST!!!  great selection of a small plates and salad's whatever you pick you will love it.

ffmDPh1Fz4o-kYb9MdPlug.text: Sorry folks I was expecting greatness last night for our experience at the SW which turned out to be a big disappointment.    We started off with our party of 8 being seated at 9:30pm.  Immediately our waiter (Fernando) rushing us to order stating the kitchen closes in 30 minutes when he was taking our order.     Keep in mind with the amount of money you plan to spend at the SW and to get that treatment not a good start.    It was very uncomfortable and to top it off our drinks never came out on time and when we re-ordered drinks some people in our party did not receive them.   The steaks itself were not up to par.   When coming from NYC the SW would not cut the mustard.   The Wagyu beef was a joke compared to many other places we have had Wagyu.   They never even provided a certificate to prove the authenticity.     One person in our party is a well known chef and he personally complained about the quality of the Wagyu and our entire meal.     Our sides were good but not great and the only good steak I have to say was the 30 ounce Tomahawk.     Just a very poor experience and a complete disappointment.

hbjYsVT-Z3hCjip2p1-N6g.text: Given that SW Steakhouse is located next to the famed Lake of Dreams at the Wynn, it's only appropriate that the experience was...well, dreamy!  Only a few small hiccups in timing prevented this from being an utter fantasy. To be sure, these did not affect my overall impression of SW, but perhaps next time they'll be ironed out.  After checking in for our 8p reservation, we waited 20 minutes to be seated. I was hoping that this didn't result in the nightmare that is HANGRY, but we were led to our table just before that monster raised his ugly head. We'd brought our own bottle of wine and it was swiftly decanted and given some breathing room.  Our table was probably one of the best ones in the restaurant- right next to the Lake of Dreams. We were able to see 4-5 shows throughout our meal. I consider myself to be appreciative of artistic endeavors, but the Lake was just a little too odd for me. I felt like I'd need some extra "dream enhancement" to truly appreciate it. Nevertheless, it was a beautiful view.  Now, to the food! Pretty spectacular all around. We ordered the scallops entree to split as an appetizer, and it did not disappoint. The scallops were meaty, had a good char and seasoning on the outside, and were tender on the inside. The sauce was delicious, like a red wine gravy. The risotto was a bit firmer than I prefer, but did not detract from the dish.  My steak, a boneless ribeye, was very solid. I wish I'd ordered medium rare instead of medium, but it was still very nice. The char and seasoning were excellent, the meat pretty tender. I ordered the lobster add on, and was very glad that I did. Beautiful hunks of lobster meat in the shell, not over cooked, and added to my steak. The side of creamed spinach we shared was fantastic as well. Just enough cream to make it feel decadent.   My dessert, the bananas foster bread pudding was good. I wish it was a bigger portion (hey, a girl can dream), but it was tasty, not too runny, and the nuts added great texture. The ice cream on top was lovely as well.  The only bobble in our dream state was that the speed/service issues did not improve throughout the meal. I'm all for a leisurely dining experience, but some of the pacing dragged a bit too much. Perhaps it was because of the lake shows, perhaps it was just an extremely busy night.  Regardless, my meal at SW Steakhouse was a dream that I'd love to revisit.

3ZSIyCfmde1abKgMlytE_A.text: The prices are high, but that's all of Vegas now.  The food was good, but not great.  They started with a nice salad and then i had a piece of salmon.  Again, nice, not great.  I am vegetarian, so reviewing a steak place for a piece of fish might not be fair, but what i paid for that piece of fish it is fair!!!

H2IIfkdDkIrtkGIKBBeHyA.text: You get what you pay for. In this instance, a phenomenal steak. This was my third visit to SW. All three times I made a reservation months in advance. And all three times I arrived a few minutes early for my reservation. I'm never in a hurry when I go to SW, so waiting isn't that big of a deal. But all three times I've had to wait 20 minutes past my scheduled reservation to be seated. So when you go and have a reservation, just know there's a good chance you will be seated after your scheduled time. Now for the food. The steaks are thick, with a mouth watering char on the outside and cooked perfectly every time. I've tried all of the sides(we ordered all of them in a big group once). And all of them are pretty good. When I go back for my 4th time, I'm not sure I'll order a side. The bread you get before your meal might be the best side they offer, and it's free! Then maybe I'll leave room to try one of their desserts that look amazing when staring at other people eating them from afar. They do give you free chocolates after the meal. I thought they were ok. My wife talked about how bad they were for three days. So i guess my biggest suggestion is to change out those chocolates. You never want customers leaving on a bad note.

XWofhDQvJ_HlkiEdnD4oNw.text: Great spot for a meat eater and a vegan alike. This steak house has plenty options for those who are vegetarian and gluten free.   As the meat eaters at the table indulged in every single appetizer, I ordered the creamed corn with truffle and made with cashew cream which tasted like its dairy filled counterpart.  It's def a very decadent side and made for a great start. For my meal, most vegetarian options on the menu were made with gardein meat which contains gluten So my options were limited. I ordered the celery root soup which was not a pleasant texture and reminded me of grits or oatmeal. I would stay away from this soup.   The rest of the table enjoyed the well executed steaks and the best was the chateau briand which was cooked to a tender perfection.   We enjoyed the outdoor patio seating with the view of the water and a show that plays every 45 mins with interesting music and art.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus and crab cake
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. VEGAN Creamed corn with truffle - very good
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad

fiZETX9s4FU8o4mXAO5PmA.text: Two drawbacks didn't deter my experience from SW from being stellar. The first one is they ran out of the infamous Kobe steak. The second one is despite the grandeur of the restaurant I found their cocktails to be rather boring. Every other aspect was phenomenal. The crab cake, although small, was delicious. The remoulade sauce totally makes the dish. The Wagyu literally melted in my mouth & was akin to the best wagyu I've had in other establishments but a premium price being that it's located inside a five star hotel. The scallops were humongous in stature & accompanied with the black truffle risotto were hands down the best scallops I've ever tasted. The lobster gnocchi with black truffles was sheer decadence with the creamiest of textures. Lastly the cookie butter cheesecake was an absolute decadent & rich finale to an awesome meal. I do suggest you request a table closet to the water on the terrace as you'll get a front row seat of the animated spectacle show which takes place every half hour.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

brT69oK5-ar0L3xk0XlWLA.text: Great Steak & Location!  Lovely atmosphere, we even were lucky enough to be seated outside so we could watch the waterfall show. Presentation excellent, service very nice and a very good wine list, enjoyed the meal but nothing to make me go back in the sea of great steak houses in Vegas.   Filet melted in our mouths, the Cheese crusted lamb chops very nice but not the best I've ever had. All the sides we tried were very good but only the creamed corn unique and a standout.  The creamed spinach, mashed potatoes and Potatoe Lyonnaise very good but again nothing outstanding.  Dessert was the funnel cakes and strawberries, molten cake and the deep fried peach pie.  You will have a great meal just not the food experience I always expect in Vegas.

Js35W3sK-Wa9WMZ93gGQ2g.text: Ambiance 5 Service 3.5 Food 3  The boneless ribeye steak was cooked perfectly, was tender and tasted wonderful.  Seasoned perfectly. $68 Tuna tartare was fresh and had great flavor. The octopus starter was good.  The big misses were the lobster gnocchi and black truffle cream corn. Too much salt & black truffle flavor killed the dishes.   The service was very disjointed, with numerous people coming to our table and we had no idea who was our waiter. Only one was helpful out of the bunch and we never saw him except for when we placed our order. Expected much higher quality.   Wine prices were generally a three point mark up.

LvEwx8I0ZQpMQSe5l6-QGw.text: I went to the SW for a birthday dinner and Wow is all I can say. Incredible restaurant with amazing food, incredible service and a great view/location.   Everything on the menu was a hit. We ordered the yellowfin and steak tartare to start. From there, we ordered a porterhouse and a filet for steaks and had some scallops as well. In terms of sides, we ordered the mac and cheese and the au gratin potatoes. Honestly, I was too caught up with the steaks and scallops to really pay attention to them but my friends loved them.  This place is a must!

kdi4FdnueVbS9Q5R04ZIPw.text: I eat here at least once a year with the company that I work for when we travel to Las Vegas on business. We usually have at least 15 people dining with us (about 5 c-workers and the rest business associates/customers)  It is located in The Wynn on the Las Vegas Strip. It is a great place to take people for business meals.  (Food) The bread they serve is fresh and warm. We always get the Seafood Spectacular to start and it is divine! It has lobster, king crab legs, jumbo shrimp, oysters, and crab cocktail. Very filling and entirely worth it. When I order, I typically order the salmon dish with the kale and honey crisp apple salad (certainly more than enough for me to eat). I am never hungry when I leave this restaurant.  (Drink) They have a great wine selection and the servers do a great job at giving their suggestions. Upon walking into the restaurant there is also a bar to the left where you can grab a drink while waiting to be seated.  (Vibe) There is a beautiful waterfall with outdoor seating. Everyone looks forward to the little show that goes on at about 9/9:30pm and 10pm with the singing frog at the waterfall as well. It is always a nice talking point with new customers that come along with us.  This is a very fine steakhouse that my company has made great memories at!

lTLt112uCzi9uaqhyQbCog.text: This is an expensive meat palace which actually serves it instead of going to leer at it. The dress is "Business Casual" but then that depends on what your business is. What do you wear if it's just Monkey Business? The place is full of thigh high leather that is fetish free for a change.   The room is quiet for a Vegas venue until the music loop bomb goes off numbing your Vagus nerve. I was shunted into the jammed bar where I ordered a Whiskey Sour that came in a thimble. The Cocktail slinger must have heard me say Whiskey and Soap as I think the bar tender floated some Dial on it. Steve, you can do better.   The decor is Wynnsome. Muted, sand colored earth tones so you'll feel right at home when you get buried by the bill.   It was a "Lake Side" table for us "B" Listers, but then you can still avoid the Strip and the strippers. Instead you can stare at a 4 story water wall with cartoons, holograms and creepy virtual visuals while consuming your vittles. They just pop up at random cranked to concert volume just when you are about to propose or at least make a proposition.   All of a sudden a peyote fueled steampunk fantasy flashes before you, Native visionaries start warbling at vox alto channeling Tibetan Throat Singers. Wow...no more Whiskey and Purell for me.   The Vibe: Black Chips, fat chippies, drifters, grifters, and booby lifters all steppin' out...or flamin' out.   The Staff: As no nonsense as a Vegas Lounge Act. Whatever cutesy thing you can think of, they've heard it twice that night. It was like heckling Joan Rivers. Prepare to be skewered quickly. Amy was as tough as cheap meat and no heckler gets a winning hand with her. She was a pro (as in Pro Server, don't be cheeky. She knew the menu and required no help with the Heroic wine list. Kudos and a nice toke to her).   The Bar Program: Standards that are substandard as well as a Herculean wine list as large as Steve Wynn's portfolio, featuring mostly wines that only he can afford. May I see the Fanta list please?   The Food: Oh yeah, you came to dine or did you just want to see the dancing balls on the water? (Sounds like the hot tub in the motel after the Pride Parade ends).   A Seafood Tower trumps the lot, thought I. Local caught Lobster, local harvested Oysters, local trapped Crabs (definitely a possibility in Vegas), local gathered Shrimp? All local to somewhere else and when they arrived they were travel tired. Hey, life's a gamble, I guess, especially in Vegas. So, order a Tower and roll the dice or play Russian Oyster Roulette instead of eating a nice Seafood Rillette.   Now, the Bacon Cheddar Muffins were worth the hassle to get to Sin City. Cheesy muffin top and a soft spongy bottom describes them and half the ladies wandering around the Venetian. I ate four of them. (Biscuits, don't be cheeky).   Hold it, out of nowhere Garth Brooks lyrics begin to scroll across the Jumbo Tron, his Jumbo Voice blasts The Thunder Rolls over the music and all conversation is terminated like a dropped call. Hmmm, does that add anything to anything?    Steve's Chopped Salad is a pretty cylinder of chopped Romaine, Avocado, Fried Shallot Strings under a Dijon Vinaigrette. It was fresh and great with a another basket of Bacon Cheddars.   The French Fries were spot on. Nice crunch to the whole bunch. The Brussells Sprouts with Bacon were predictable as were the whupped Potatoes with Chives and the Jalapeno Creamed Corn masquerading as Polenta. Both were a bit on the gluey side. Who want's a gluey side? That's over the wall on the Strip. The Bacon was Maple-ized Belly Bacon with caramelized Shallots were stellar. The sides were no bummers, just ho hummers.   The Dry-Aged Porterhouse as fired just right. Medium, as it should be. Vegas pink on the inside. (Don't be cheeky), with some Maldon Sea Salt to finish it properly and spark the meaty taste. Alas, there was some mystery chew that tagged along for the ride. That's par for the course with steak. You Wynn some, you lose some. The Bone-In Rib Eye played much better.   Four bottles of Beaujolais and we were anxious to be away to play.   So, no dessert except a Birthday spiff. A cake the size of a walnut with a mini candle. How cute.   It may be worth a visit just to see the scene. Watch some lollypop in a pencil skirt so tight that eating a pine nut would have the thing rip at the seams. Palm the Maitre D to get a good seat for that.   Is this spot a Wynn win? Place your bets, and spin the wheel.

QEggrWxcsB4A24vI9wNoXg.text: A glittering tower of seafood to start our meal, from oysters on the half shells to succulent lobster tails to the freshest jumbo shrimps, it was almost as good to stare at as to eat.  Main course was perfectly done steak then a delectable dessert.  But best of all was the water show! The lights and music was mesmerizing! A memorable, magical experience!

l01aaIAw-3uxDchhR9gVQw.text: Dry age steak was dry. Maybe my ordering. Wait staff and bartenders were in spot. Lyonese potatoes were less than impressive. Morton's makes them better.  Just wasn't what I expected. Had better here was maybe my expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eQ7foNcKD6OXLBFzvMRptg.text: Steak was very nice; ambiance and service a big zero. Have eaten at now defunct Botero, Costa di Mare twice for amazing tasting with hubby with graceful and charming/playful atmosphere, and pretty much every other fine dining and/or eatery during multiple stays at the Wynn and Encore (see my longstanding positive reviews about Wynn separately). During a recent, very special occasion my very dear friend selected SW for her big birthday dinner (and no kidding flew halfway around the world with friends for it). The vaunted lakeside dining was too windy so we ate inside. I have to say, the indoor space was fairly charmless and the service perfunctory. Not NY cool and old-world brusque, but simply busy and "don't really care". With so many people coming and going I had no idea who our actual server was. Despite being asked multiple times if it were a 'special occasion' upon reservation and check-in (this is key to the let-down that ensued), there was absolutely nothing special about it besides the effort we made in showing up. No special greeting at the door, no "happy birthday" verbal acknowledgment, no special cake for the bday girl besides a pathetic quarter sized after-thought that I had to request (and was crazy embarrassed when I saw it being practically thrown on the table-I'm now guessing the server was embarrassed too!). Just us spending 500 dollars on a decent steak with zero vibe or buzz. I won't go into the awful treatment when I spoke with the sub-manager about our sub par and disappointing experience and was met with a wall of pure defensive hostility that I just had to back slowly away from. Vegas and the Wynn/Encore are special to me with over a decade of repeated stays. If Vegas isn't for celebrations and escape, what is it actually for? Thankfully the very gracious Wynn concierge (not associated with the restaurant per se) made an attempt to 'make it right' with a bottle of prosecco the next day sent to the room for the bday girl. Thank you. Recently in my home of DC I celebrated a friend's birthday in the magical outdoor 'igloo' at Bourbon Steak/ 4 Seasons, and was reassured that a steakhouse celebration can be light and fun, with great down to earth and kind service. Our "birthday boy" was also gifted a rather small cake on the restaurant (must be a steakhouse thing), but it was delivered with a smile one top of an already comepletely pleasurable evening. What a difference. SW--you so took us for granted. If you are on an expense account by all means go to SW. If you want a  convivial dining "experience", I would say there are a 1,000,000 places in Vegas from $ to $$$ to try first. Bon appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary happy birthday cake- don&#39;t expect singjng

k7_QLYJ3yxMiw-jo8UZJbg.text: SW Steakhouse is an overall great experience. Not only is the food amazing, the service wonderful, but the shows every 30 min and the atmosphere is just beautiful!  If you want to splurge, you should really check this beautiful restaurant out. You won't be disappointed.

uOoOThKN1G8oGHrs-r88Bw.text: My favorite 5 star resteraunt in Las Vegas by far. I came here for the first time in 2016 for mothers day and now make it a point to visit for every major family occasion.  So most recently I was here for a date night dinner. As always the device was truly 5 star 5 diamond. Fast, efficient, knowledgeable and always friendly. That consistancy is huge for me and SW is nothing if not consistently excellent.   With indoor and outdoor seating available I chose to sit outside by the lake. The view of the lake and nightly show during dinner is so beautiful and adds so much richness to the ambiance and experience.   The menu is short but focused on specialty. The fresh gnocchi is to die for. The aged rib eye was melt in your mouth delicious. On the vegan side of the menu, delicois options. I chose the meatballs and mashed potatoes. So amazingly flavorful and savory I needed a moment to savor it.  Overall this was another fabulous experience at one of the best luxury fine dining spots in town.

UYAhY7UiRATN0hdBaHkI7g.text: Where to start? I guess I'll start at the part the I didn't liked.  $330 for 6oz steak?! I understand it's Japanese Waygu and you guys are not small time place but come on! The steak was well done that's True but I don't think the cuts are quality the amount of fat was excessive it's supposed to be "marbly" but in your cuts it was to concentrated in single place.  And the service felt a bit unrespectful, perhaps it was due to us being a large group and we are a Happy bunch.  The rest was great the fogra was perfect they have a cold version and a hot version both were perfect. The yellowtail tartar and the waygu tartar were nice as well.  I really like the food but the price on the steak is a deal breaker in my eyes and if you see my other reviews you would know I don't mind spending good money on good food...

wF9WxrOdWF__N5Mj4sYoqg.text: I love this place, it's one of our preferred dining spots when I Vegas. I came here for the first time in 2014, and cannot get enough. I've tried other steak house here in Vegas but there cuts and flavor profile fall short. I was in Vegas Thanksgiving weekend and we weren't sire weather the rest of our party wanted to go here, and when they finally decided, we couldn't get a reservation. I'm going to Las Vegas this weekend and I look forward to coming here.. unfortunately we called to late for a reservation and cannot get in. Good thing Las Vegas is an hour flight away ;)  After writing this review, I decided to call them to see if they have any openings and score!!! I got an rsvp!! Maybe the hubbs didn't try hard enough

NoXhj4YESNfWqGSFLXXeoQ.text: Wow, what a wonderful place. It's truly magical here. Eat outside to watch the show. I had the filet mignon, medium rare, and it was so juicy!

TMxS0UN9Xvk5QrEeXSrWPg.text: We flew in after a horrible day at work and decided on an early dinner at SW, Restaurant on the lake at Wynn, patio is charming overlooking Vegas's version of a "lake" the restaurant decor is Vegas 4 star typical. Service was of course on point as every good restaurant in the Wynn is. Tuna tartare as well as the chopped salad was very good and fresh. My bone-in ribeye was served on a cold plate, perhaps they mistook a salad plate for a steak plate. Perhaps a blessing in disguise because I ordered it medium rare, if it were served on a hot plate to continue to cook I would have ended up with a medium well steak because it arrived medium to say the least  (over cooked from the beginning) au gratin potatoes were very good, jumbo asparagus was good but standard. Cheese crusted lamb chops were very good, goat cheese Dijon, finally funnel cakes for dessert such a nice change from cliche beignets it adds a upscale county fair aspect to dinning. Fresh strawberries with Creme, salty caramel and fudge dipping sauces a visual delight but slightly better looking than tasting it was very good don't get me wrong. Personally I felt for the price a lot of steakhouses does it for much better at half the prices......I guess it is Vegas

_qeurFEI3gPfW-4OuXdlCA.text: Everyone should visit this place, the outside view is beautiful and peaceful, we received a warm attention, and it was even a cold afternoon and they offered to lend me a shawl at the reception, the food was exquisite, we ordered a filet mignon which it  was cooked to perfection and the texture was smooth, the mac and cheese was great and the dessert was just wonderful. We had a great time, very recommendable.

t2xo32PisbzPRI0lt-AfUA.text: SW Steakhouse in Vegas is Fabulous. You will have to make a reservation ahead of time. They are booked out on the weekend. First is that you get an amazing water show outside to watch. Second is their bread basket- oh wow! It has amazing pretzel and bacon cheddar rolls! The SW salad is delicious and simple- also bigger than it looks as presented. The blue cheese wedge is also amazing! Service was on point as well as food and ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. SW Salad, it is a big chopped salad-delicious!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese wedge with massive slab of bacon!

3MuT0Lo4g5ocW4u3e9AifQ.text: This review is really the combination of two scores: Food/atmosphere - 4/5 Service - 1/2  To start with the good - the food was delicious!   Once we ordered, the food came quickly - and was hot and delicious.  Most of our table ordered the steak (8oz filet), and everyone was happy.   The sides we got were big portions (enough for 4-5 people to share).    We got potato at gratin, Mac n cheese and creamed corn.     The bread basket was awesome - they have these cheddar/bacon rolls (muffins?) that were to-die-for.     We didn't do any appetizers or dessert - and honestly, we would have ordered both had the service not been so terrible (see below).     The wine list was extensive, but I'd say the cheapest glass was 16-18 and the cheapest bottle was around 90 (up to bottles for 10k+).  The wine was good, but the prices were very high.    The service - just ouch.   Group of 5 (business dinner) - We arrived at 715 for a 730 reservation and checked in.   The host stand  was very disorganIzed, and we went up at 745 to check on our spot in line.   The hostesses were arguing with a manager, and when I told them our party's name, the manager said 'oh' , and pulled a seating slip from a pile below (not the seating slips that either of hostesses were holding to 'seat next') and brought us to a table.  I'll try to summarize the rest of the dinner experience succinctly:  - 45 minutes - time for the water to come get our drink orders once seated (we ordered one bottle of wine) - 30 minutes later - waiter came to take our order.   We skipped by appetizers at this point since it had been so long  -20 minutes later - our food came (this was the only part of dinner service that was ok/timely) -waiter never came by to check on orders -40 minutes later - waiter dropped off dessert menu.   Didn't ask if we wanted more wine (we would have) -30 minutes later - we flagged a bus boy to get our check.   We paid and left.  Maybe it was an off/short-handed night - the food was good and I'd go back but I'd be hesitant to have another business dinner here

EkqlhJ-RVlmwguE2QDzIeA.text: Not worth the hipe. Good service but the food was nothing to write home about. Had the salmon and asparagus; was just expecting more being in La Vegas and for the money.

wvaOolHjvPZTSqIgu16Lgg.text: We had a large party and ended up in a private dinning room with our servers John and James and may I say this was an amazing evening! Both our servers were super attentive and we wanted for nothing all evening long!  The table had all kinds of delicious cocktails (sidecars, martini's, manhattans etc) as well as several steaks, the (I added quinoa) kale salad.  Then the table had lobster, domestic wagyu  steak , a bone in rib eye, which our friend said exceeded the Golden Steer rib eye he had the night before.  The hubby had the 12 oz. filet which was cooked perfectly.  Now let me tell you about some of the sides...get the Truffle creamed corn!  Do not pass go, do not collect $200 and DO NOT SHARE!  This was AMAING!!!! Also had a Caesar salad that hubby ordered that was nicely dressed and not too fishy from the anchovies and the romaine lettuce was perfectly crispy!! The weak point was their after dinner coffee.  The one cup looked so weak we thought it was hot tea.  But hey, if that was all they did wrong I am IN.  Always a wonderful evening and we all enjoyed!  And don't skip the dessert. They are amazing too!!

eLhoXqc_2sGkxbn1O1MSBQ.text: Robert, the Manager, went above and beyond to help us secure a table and have the best experience.  He changed our whole trip.  Thank you, Robert!

HdQ1CYS1M4c1qP-GyO-PZQ.text: One of the nicest dining experiences I've ever had. Classy, elegant, attentive service coupled with fine foods. Win win. Even the bread basket is to die for. Steve Wynn knows how to impress his guests.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom risotto and quinoa cakes

gJ6Oihx2ehGZPcoE2kxQxA.text: This is the best steak I've had in the US.  Hands down.  I rave about this place every time I eat here.  I make it a point to eat here when I'm in Vegas.  I actually love the Wynn hotel and have stayed here many times.  I mostly stay at MGM properties b/c I like the loyalty program and they are pretty fair about comps they give. If you make reservations be sure to ask for something as close to the glass and pond as possible as they do cool shows on the pond later in the evening.  You'll enjoy it.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Time your dinner perfectly for a cool show!

JU8fPSHBRUb4MZ2wEGM6tg.text: Fantastic service, excellent ambiance, and amazing food. Terrific wine selection.  The Seafood Spectacular is very good, but not the best seafood "tower" type dish I've had. The pepper crusted Chateaubriand is without a doubt one of the best steaks I've ever had. The bone-in rib-eye was very good, but not the best I've had, not even the best I've had in Vegas. The Brussells sprouts and mac and cheese sides were really great.  Hard to beat it!
