EEC7eOr37zMCqrOa-LjPwg.text: This place is a steakhouse who knew they have vegan options yes vegan not just vegetarian And the show is a perfect combo with the food.

BhFFB9eQ1r-ajdjUCFwZ3g.text: My husband took me here for my Birthday dinner and it was absolutely delicious! We have been to lots of different steakhouses and this was by far the best one yet. From the bread basket, to the wedge salad, to the filet, to the au gratin potatoes, to the molten cake, it was all very tasty. And to top it off the atmosphere is beautiful. We choose to eat outside and although it was a little hot, we were glad we did. We will definitely be back!

ro0x37jw-zamjQ-2sc0GEQ.text: Really wanted to give SW more stars, but I'm really big on customer service. I know due to weather conditions the outside patio was closed and force more people to sit inside. We placed a reservation for an inside table next to the window, where we could watch the Lake of Dreams. When hen i placed my reservation, it appeared not to be a problem, but when we check in the hostess say's I see your request but it's up to the Maitri D to sit us there. Not only did we wasn't able to sit at a window sit, they placed us on the opposite side of the restaurant, where we could barley see the screen. The last negative point was the Maitre D was going around to the tables greeting the guests and making small talk and yes he skipped our table. The positives....The servers was awesome, the commutations and recommendations was very welcome. The food was good, the crab cake was really good. The scallops was also great. The drinks was very good. Sorry no pics

eWabYIUDo_9VJgFsan-UCg.text: The food was very average - on the bland side. Nothing special about the seafood or the steaks.  The wine list was very conservative (boring).  The service was very slow, we had to wait for the drinks forever.  The prices were very high.

QQJvEYrlunJXjJ4uNs7zEQ.text: This place was amazing.  Yes, it's super expensive.  But you are on the strip and at the Wynn, so if you're eating here and not ready to pay, then walk away!   I had a NY strip and it was fantastic.  The chocolate pistachio dessert was awesome.  Make sure to pull out your camera to video tape it as it melts with the fudge.  Excellent service topped off the evening.  Oh, and the waterfall shows with all of the robotic pieces etc was a great addition to a wonderful evening.

UCCA89UrVUt4283Psa7l1g.text: The chili rubbed bone-in ribeye here is one my top 5 steaks ever.  I've started seasoning all my steaks at home with chili. Kuddos

WZeIViEzL-bF_ZOOuR413Q.text: My whole night and Anniversary celebration is completely ruined thanks to Sw Steakhouse. I ordered a kosher Ribye for myself and the first time it came out it was horrible, it was so chewy and tuff i spit it out into a napkin and they brought out a second one and it was even worse. My husband felt guilty for enjoying his food and i had to watch him eat. The manager was very rude and didn't care at all. Not happy with the food or service at all. Spend your money elsewhere, plenty of expensive and nice places to eat at in Vegas!

N2ll8L9HK6lkzNJfZJl4XQ.text: The 40 oz. Porter house steak is superb.  We shared it with three girls and i was more than enough.  The sides were also delicious.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.  SERVICE IS  also very good.  I have also had the other steaks and no complaints.  You must have dinner with the show outside.  You have to make reservations three weeks in advanced to get outside seating and talk to a Mgr. to maker sure that they seat u outside.  Enjoy

CKMco6usJog0vgwaOVRCyA.text: I've been here twice this year and enjoyed it both times! Great ambiance overlooking the lake of dreams where it starts at 7pm and play every often the bizarre dreams of Mr. Wynn. Highly recommend reservation ahead of time and be sure to request a table by the lake. Service was very attentive and the menu is quite extensive. SW did a great job in every category of the menu. Menu may be on pricier end but it's all quality. Expect to allocate about 2 hours for dinner.   Appetizers: Complimentary house bread - must try the bacon bread with house butter, but friendly reminder not to eat so much!  Hudson Valley Foie gras appetizer with apple compote - one of the best foie gras! It was tender and the sweetness of the apple compote balance the flavor of foie gras. It was lightly seared and very flavorful. We chose the appetizer instead of the compliment with the steak because the appetizer comes with the compote.   Tuna tartare with sesame wafer - On par with fresh fish serve in a highly rated Japanese restaurant. Actually, this may be more fresh and better then most Japanese restaurant! I skipped the sesame wafer for the tuna tartare alone was fresh and delicious.  Domestic wagyu from Snake river farms NY strip 10oz $80 - Charred and the steak was done medium rare to perfection. The flavor and balance of the fat in the steak was mouth-watering. For a NY strip, it was quite fatty like a ribeye and I enjoyed every bite of it. Complimented with enoki mushroom.   Wagyu A5 from Kagoshima prefecture 4oz $140 compliment with chopped greens (chinese brocoli?) - We ordered both domestic and Japanese Wagyu to compare it side by side. The 4 oz portion was a generous amount of meat and I almost couldn't finish. It was lightly seared to medium rare. As compared to domestic, A5 wagyu has more meaty taste, less seasoning, and less flaming char flavor. It was also not as salty as the domestic one. Both wagyu was very enjoyable and was different in taste.   sauteed spinach - crispy and tasty  carrots - sweet and fresh  funnel cake with strawberry and 3 dipping sauce (anglaise, salty caramel, and chocolate) - it was good, but a bite too much carb to my liking. I only ate one funnel cake and it was very filling. You have the option to order half order with 3 funnel cakes ($10), instead of 6 ($20).

QBCFgZdaWhXTqhdlajQfKw.text: The staff treated my wife and I like we were invisible or like we were not supposed to dine in this type of establishment....we visit top restaurants all across the country monthly.   My wife was excited to take me to SW for my birthday, because the reviews were so great. She was really hurt by the way we were treated. We ended up spending almost $400, but the food nor the service were worth even $50.   We visit Las Vegas at least 3-4 times a year, and we try new restaurants every visit. Unfortunately, we will never return to this place. We were very disappointed.

uJijANSveddVO-7ekcjLUA.text: It was great experience as a steakhouse. Don't try the chicken its not their specialty. Their signature cheesecake was tasty chocolate molten cake was not woow and the Chocolate not well melted. The prices were very expensive. 216 $ for 2 person.

MbllvOaNVPJ3PQQYpG4XmA.text: Absolutely amazing Steakhouse and dining experience. This was booked out a couple weeks in advance, this is on the bottom floor of the Wynn. Prices are high but not astronomical and definitely worth it. We each got the Ancho Coffee Rubbed Filet with Penne Mac&Cheese, medium rare. The appetizer we got was on a recommendation and it was outstanding. Truffle Lobster Gnocchi was amazing and enough for 2. I can't recommend this place enough, we'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9 Oz Ancho Filet Med Rare...amazeballs!!

wookJbRc1dgeIsnvCN4gOQ.text: Date night on our last night in vegas!  We decided to try SW Steakhouse at the Wynn. As we went down the escalator at entrance of the restaurant, waterfall show was going on. It was so beautiful! (There is a lounge where you can watch the waterfall but you must put your name down to be seated there. It also has a one drink minimum.)  We went to the restaurant without any reservation around 7pm and hoping to get lucky. While waiting, I got a pom martini and him a jack and coke. We were seated in less than 10min! YAY.  ++pom martini (3.5 stars) I had two of these. First one was perfect. Perfect amount of sweet and alcohol. 2nd time, it was really syrupy and had to ask for ice to dilute the drink. The drink was inconsistent.  ++pepper crusted chateaubriand (3.5 stars) $120 We ordered this and shared as the server suggested it serves two people. Meat was filet mignon so we got it medium. Perfectly cooked. The dish was great but it wasn't the best steak I've ever had. Also felt like the spiciness of the pepper overpowered the flavor of the steak.  The ambience was beautiful. the crowd was mostly on the older side (ie 60s 70s). also were business men and such.   After the meal, we went to sit at the lounge and had few more drinks. We watched the waterfall show 3 times (show is every 20 min) before we left. Btw, the show is different every time.   Overall, I give this restaurant 4 stars. The food was 3.5 stars but with its excellent service, show, and ambience 4 solid stars.

nrdXDaqdQRGa885r4mSo-A.text: Best steakhouse on the strip. Be prepared to pay the price - but worth every ounce. Make sure you reserve in advance otherwise you will be stuck with a slot that might not fit your hunger schedule.   Recommendable.

gJgIKVkqLPcoUMZnzG7pOg.text: I think I'll stick to the Lakeside next time. During a recent trip to Las Vegas, my husband and I knew exactly where we wanted to go to have a nice dinner...one of the two restaurants overlooking the lake at our hotel, the Wynn. Since we had tried the Lakeside during a previous visit, we decided to give their next door neightbor, SW Steakhouse a try. I need to remember to stick with my first choice in the future.   Half the fun of eating at either SW or Lakeside is sitting on the patio overlooking the lake, but since it was "cold," they had the patio closed. Therefore, our reservation requesting a view of the show on the patio was None and void. Since the patio was closed, there was minimal seating along the window and although we had a reservation with a lake view request, a window seat wasn't available so rather than wait another hour, we decided to go with whatever was available. That turned out to be the table furthest away from the window, in the back of the restaurant. However, I wasn't going to let that get me down! After all, we were still at an incredibly delicious restaurant! My favorite part of the meal ended up being the cheese rolls they bring out to begin the meal. I gobbled up every bite and immediately regretted my decision as I felt myself filling up! But, I found room to continue. Our first course was the wedge salad which I really enjoyed. For my entree, I decided to order the lamb chops. This is where disappointment comes into play. Here at this incredibly expensive, high-end restaurant, my lamb chops arrived to the table cold...or should I say, cold to lukewarm. I tried one bite and thought it was just a bad bite but then I had a second and confirmed my suspicions. Now, knowing this restaurant and how they pride themselves in their service and products, I expected complete horror in the eyes of the waiter when he realized the issue. However, when he came over and I told him that my food was cold, he didn't seem very phased and didn't apologize. Instead he just took the food back and I waited ten minutes to get hot lamb chops while my husband's food had been there the whole time. After this less-than-par experience of my incredibly expensive entree coming out cold, the waiter never once apologized and when the bill came, there was no mention of this situation. I wasn't expecting the lamb chops to be comped (although in most situations, the restaurant would do that after such a thing happened), but nothing so much as a drink or side was discounted to apologize for the mistake. This showed their lack of customer service and their lack of truly caring about the customer. It was the complete opposite experience that I had at the Lakeside. Moving forward, I will only eat at the Lakeside next door.

7p5v5a1UBvT4E8ExZQhA8Q.text: Best rib eye ever... Most expensive wines by the glass and bottle I've ever seen lol and I think I saw escorts and the most pretentious crowd to date up in here lol (girls and guys on friday night trying to look important at the most swanky steakhouse in vegas) ... filet was not memorable at all ! even.with the smoked blue cheese (54 bucks)..  NO char on the outside but tasted solid enough I suppose. No truffle flavor at all in our truffled creamed corn and the texture was off putting like baby food...  I would return for that ribeye but be prepared to drop serious dough and not hear your mate while you dine because you sit so close to the next table of drunk rich people haha

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Underwhelminh filet and truffled corn

BfyNE6yE6u7mHklJAYv1yw.text: I have always seen the sign for the SW steakhouse, but never tried it until my last trip to Vegas. Now I would have to say at first that the ambiance of the steakhouse is not my favorite. I like the darker more intimate steakhouses. The SW had more of a sterile wide open feel to it. The SW does have a nice wall of windows overlooking the Wynn Waterfall.   The service is second to none. I would have to say that you will never have to get your waiters attention. They are always there to take care of any of your requests. I ended up splitting a steak with my Dad and they had no problem and didn't charge extra. Steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned well. Sides are a little less exciting than other Steakhouses I have been to, but were nice.   The price is a little higher than I would like to pay for the food and atmosphere, but the service lived up to the $. I think the Society restaurant offers just as good of food at a better price and more intimate setting.

9v8TwmOeq_39ecpdmotvHA.text: Friday (9/12/14), right before the dinner rush:  Having heard a lot of good things about SW, I was very excited to try it.  When we arrived at 6:00 pm, we were promptly seated and the place filled up quickly soon afterwards. The inside is modern with one wall opening up onto a patio for outside dining.   Drinks: We started with a Boulevardier ($16) and a Negroni ($12). Both cocktails were well-made, strong and served straight up. A little pricy but I appreciated not having the drinks slowly diluted with a large amount of melting ice.  Appetizers and bread: The bread basket consisted of two French rolls, two pretzel rolls and two bacon rolls. I have heard people rave about the bacon rolls and they were savory but also very oily and heavy; not exactly what I wanted to fill up on right before a heavy steak dinner.  We ordered 3 Kusshi and 3 Rappahannock oysters which came in the standard ice tray with sides of mignonette and cocktail sauce ($21).  The oysters tasted fresh when we ate them. The burrata and tomato appetizer consisted of two thick large round slices of tomato with a much too small dollop of burrata cheese on top of each slice ($21). The cheese was good but the proportion of burrata to tomato was way off (perhaps they were running out of cheese and were trying to stretch what they had left?). We also got a crab cake ($24). The crab cake was a deep fried hockey puck shaped disk of crab meat. The meat deep inside tasted ok but the outside fried homogeneous crust was unappealing and overcooked.  Dinner: We ordered a medium rare bone-in NY strip steak ($68) and a medium bone-in ribeye ($60). Both steaks were cooked to the right degree but were bland tasting. Each plate comes with a small ramekin of Wagu flavored garlic butter which provided an interesting taste when spread over the meat. The SW house steak sauce was far too sweet for my taste so I ended up asking for some A1 just to get some additional flavor for the bland meat. The side dish of cream corn was unusual ($14). It was more like highly ground corn meal mixed with cream and had the texture of grits. There was a definite corn flavor although no recognizable pieces of corn remained. It would probably be a popular dish at a nursing home for people who can no longer chew their food. We also ordered grilled asparagus which was crunchy and perfectly charred ($16).  Dessert: We ordered the key lime square ($14). Served as a square, the crust was mixed with rice krispies which tended to clump together and stick to your teeth when you chewed, much like a rice krispies treat. I understand the pastry chef wanting to show what they could do but this was just unpleasant. Perhaps trying to make a good tasting pie would be a good place for them to start before attempting to be 'creative'.   The service was great and the waiters were very attentive however, at the end of the day, the food was forgettable. The place charges premium prices but only delivers mediocre tasting food. As other people have already noted, there are much better high end steak houses on the strip with fantastic food and service for the same prices that you are charged at SW. Why not go elsewhere?

Mrt9FGrUaWL3BrZ_exAuWQ.text: I've been going here now for several years. Every trip to Vegas has to consist of a trip to SW steakhouse. From their bread and butter to their salads and steak to dessert. Everything there is superb. The service, the ambiance, the water show....by far one of my go to and favorite places. Never had a bad meal. Great selection of wines and side dishes. Cuts are cooked to perfection. Desserts....oh desserts, we've had almost every including specials and have never been disappointed. Good for a nice dinner date, a group gathering or special occasion. Outside seating on a beautiful Las Vegas night is the best!

eHYG43jXxOa7JVqAWy_0wQ.text: Too many waiters.  All asking the same question one after the other.  The attempt to have great customer care became a real annoyance.  At the end of the meal when asked if we wanted coffee by waiter #2 and we had already order coffee from waiter #1 I barked back and stated we just ordered it 30 seconds early.  Seems like a small deal but when asked "do you want more bread" and then "do you want more bread," followed by "do you want more water," then "do you want more water" and so on...it made the meal rushed and choppy.   We have not been to SW in years.  It was  always a great experience.  I am not sure what we were expecting but after the endless video loops playing everywhere at the Wynn about the restaurants, including SW, we expected the same great experience as we had enjoyed historically.   The food was no different than any other high end steak house.  Much of the decor appeared dated.  The waterfall show was unchanged, tired and dingy.    We will not go back.

-s7OKRbw3V50SFGUVg9Q-w.text: While I wanted this to be the meal of the weekend as my husband and I celebrated one year of marriage mixed with a babymoon, SW failed to deliver. Our waitress was very nice but service was slow.  The temperature and preparation of our steaks were mixed up.  My husband ordered medium and his steak was well done and chewy.   Mac and cheese was delicious as was dessert.  They did comp my husband steak which was the right move and appreciated.  For being 4 stars and $$$$, we expected more.

pLeYUpmgHRjTGR45tCOU0A.text: This place definitely has extreme hype due to lightshow at night and the glamorous location inside the Wynn.   Most of this establishment lives up to these expectations. The service is super professional and classy. These guys have hospitality down!   Most of the food was definitely good. I wouldn't say it was outstanding to the point that it was memorable. I've been to many more less expensive steakhouses outside of Vegas (but at the same time, it is Vegas).   Highlight of the meal was the Wedge Salad and the Wild Mushrooms. Both were delicious!   The steaks are tasty, but a little disappointing. First of all, like another Yelper mentioned, I can't believe they don't serve high quality grass fed organic beef here! For the price, I find the corn fed regular beef a big turn off.  Aside from the lightshow, I would say this place is worth 3.5 stars (especially for the high prices!!). However, sitting on the patio watching the show makes the whole experience awesome. I thoroughly enjoyed the numerous "skits".   I wouldn't say this place is a must stop, but the experience is fun and the food is pretty tasty overall.

hAc3lUUQsH9om-pedPTS5Q.text: Their steaks are awesome and their service is top notch. Get their tomahawk chop for a really flavorful steak..

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Cut Rib Eye!

yEIic0zVUPaA4nONUBg2wg.text: If you want to spend 600 for dinner for 6 without drinks then it was awesome.   The food was great.   I don't appreciate such a meal.  Restaurant has beautiful atmosphere with lights.  If you can get an outside seat.

LBaOo5Pt8H5EoXgH6cJ4Cg.text: We came here for a honeymoon dinner, and we were not disappointed. The food was so good. The services was great. Michele (if I remember her name right) was really nice. every 30 min there is a mini show on the water.

D_3NjQ5oiH-aT9R1yZBsMA.text: Absolute fine dining at its best. They have pricey food but treat yourself to it, it's well worth it. They also have a variety  shows displayed on the beautiful waterfall.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Purple rain

YKz1mTicxZHKpiDeYchQ6g.text: I'm basing this review solely on food, for the service was excellent.  Five grown men needed meat on this bachelors getaway.  We started off with the sauteed foie gras and this foie gras pate with nectarines.  Since it is now banned in california, why not?  Both were absolutely amazing, although I enjoyed the sauteed one more because I've had foie gras in the pate form many times.  I cannot forget the slight char on the sauteed foie gras.  We also had the heirloom mozerrella salad, which was also tasty and balanced.  We paired the foie gras with a riesling, which was a mistake because both dishes were already sweet.  If i were to do it over, I would go the Sauvignon blanc route or pinot grigio route.  For the meat, we decided to get the lamb chops and the chile rubbed double cut ribeye, as featured on "best thing I ever ate." First, let me say that I am really not a big fan of lamb, and I have only enjoyed lamb at a couple of places, but this lamb chop was just perfect.  See my pictures.  I cannot forget the balance of juicyness, temperture, sweetness and just enough game flavor to remind you its lamb, but not too much to remind me why I don't eat lamb a lot.  If I were to come back here, lamb chops will be ordered again.  Next, the chile rubbed ribeye.  Wow.  When it arrived, I was scared they over cooked it.  It was nice and charred inside, and it was till sizzling in that big skillet.  When I took my piece, I was shocked on how beautifully pink and medium it was, as we requested.  Charred fat outside, juicy pink meat inside = perfect ribeye to me.  It was served with onions and jalapenos also cooked on the skillet.  The rub was not really that spicy, and the seasoning was perfect.  All together, I really have to say it was a perfect ribeye, and I've only had perfectly cooked medium ribeyes and not too many places.  I would def order this again along with the lamb chops.  I've read descriptions that it is a glorified carne asada.  I can see how that descriptionis accurate.  Many of the steak purist might not enjoy the way this is cooked.  Some days, nothing can beat meat grilled to char then thrown into oven for proper color inside, then finish off with salt.  But on a day you want a flavorful, spicy kick, this is the perfect piece of meat.  All 42 oz of it was evenly cooked.  Again, see my pic. hahaha  We paired the meats with a bottle of shiraz/cab blend from paso robles.  Worked out great and didn't hurt the wallet.  I really didn't care about the truffle creamed corn.  The dish was so sweet, it overpowered any hint of shaved truffles.  I would never order this again.  Should've just gotten some potatoes.  Do not listen to anyone who says this is great.    I would not hesitate to come back here if craving a steak next time I end up in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect ribeye and perfect lamb chop!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chile rubbed double rib eye!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect lamb chops!

ppwFbOBJ2abGO9IKMZmdQw.text: What can I say that hasn't been said before? Absolutely perfect steak. The chili-rubbed rib-eye is to die for. But the thing that kicked this meal over the top? The wedge salad of all things. Big wedge of lettuce, with a blue cheese dressing that was full of crumbles that melt in your mouth. Alongside the wedge are heirloom grape tomatoes that scream Summer and a huge slab of pork belly that sent my heart all a-flutter. The combined tastes are orgasmic.  Beautiful view of the Lake of Dreams, impeccable service and killer steaks. A place worthy of the Wynn name.

JAOaLDueedSwauXdwtCwrg.text: Great service , I had the New York Steak With sauteed Veggies  my wife had Scallops and crab legs soup and everything was super delicious we ended up with strawberries and ice cream dessert !!great place can't wait to go back again

VsG4pc-OtItwMz4nGKmBVA.text: Came here with a small group for a 6 PM Saturday reservation and were immediately seated outside which offers a nice view of the Wynn Hotel lighted waterfall/show - it's a strange show. Bread was really delicious  especially the bacon asiago and pretzel bread. Husband shared the porterhouse steak with a friend. I tried several bites of their filet mignon which was incredibly tender melt in your mouth. Although it's a steakhouse, I got the snapper with salsa and black rice. That was delicious! Highly recommend and would gladly come here again.

ihbPryrRbuJ7zgiCvlNgDQ.text: The food was very good, but the service was bad.  They were very busy and everyone seemed rushed with little time for level of attentiveness (and drink refills) you expect from a restaurant of this caliber.  Twice we heard our waitress discuss with another staff member how busy things were.  Either hire more staff or seat fewer people.  I left feeling that the package didn't justify the charge.  Also, it was unusually loud.

q0x400zRJmRbL7XTfond3g.text: SW is always a must when I visit Vegas. The food is beyond delicious, great customer service, and a stunning atmosphere. If your in the area and looking for a great steak dinner look no further SW is where it's at!

8_El1FSjXWWPw1Teg0xrEQ.text: Just got back from a convention in Vegas. We had a party of 10, and this was the best dinner of the week.   The dinner was not cheap, but well worth it. For anyone going for the first time, here are my recommendations:   Seating- try your best to get near the waterfall  Apps- the raw seafood tower was excellent. It included crab legs, oysters, shrimp, lobster, and tuna tartar.  Steaks- The bone in 20 oz Rib-eye is the way to go. Several in our party split it as we had a lot of food.  Sides- typical ones, and were good.  Deserts- we had the funnel cakes and choc souffle. Def a must.   We also ate at Craft, and I thought SW steaks were better. Craft was slow service as well.   The only issue we had, was at the front bar, we found the bartender ignored us as we wanted another round. In fact, everyone at the bar was laughing at him, bc he kept blowing us off. Minus 1 star!   With so many places to go in Vegas, add this to your list to try.   We still had a great dinner bc the steaks were so good.

lYOhWySfe6kwuXF7OUrWTQ.text: Let me begin by saying this is the second time I was disappointed at SW and felt a review was appropriate. First, the service was fine, the atmosphere was nice. That is not the problem--it is the food. It is expensive so you have an expectation that the food will be top of the line.  It is not. It is just OK. The Caesar was bland; no real flavor. You would think for the prices you would get a Caesar that tastes like it was tossed tableside even if it is made in the kitchen. The real problem is the steak. Both times I got the bone-in rib-eye--their signature steak. The quality of the meat was USDA choice, at best. It definitely is not USDA prime. I can assure you that Costco's prime rib-eyes are ten times more flavorful and tender than these. The flavor of the steak, like the salad was flat--primarily because of the quality. The first time, I thought it was just a bad cut. But this time, it was exactly the same. If the restaurant is truly buying prime beef, they need to change suppliers. This steak tasted like something you would get at the hotel cafe, not a $65 steak at what is supposed to be one of the best steakhouses in town.  Very disappointing.

fsZ7AVx4Poh154fRhhk28Q.text: The lamb chops are delish and the ricotta gnocchi are not that bad either. Totally cleaned out my plate!  Seats were outside patio next to the water and the show is kind of weird.

f9MmWLhLfMUqODFIBrPeyQ.text: Amazing!  The whole eating experience is unbelievable.  I loved the fois GRAS and the veal chop was the best I've ever had.  I can never look at veal the same again. Veal will never be this good.  As for the porterhouse for two, which I tried, not so good.  It had a chipotle rub that was overpowering.  I tried the bone in rib eye which was to die for.  But, I have to say the veal chop is the best dish I tried there and what I will be ordering in the future.  The service was impeccable.

uuhjuNQJGa7LLXjyqHnggQ.text: Little bit of a fiasco here this night as rain pushed all the reservations back and we were quite late being seated. They tried to squeeze us into a corner table which would have been tight and uncomfortable but were evetually accommodated. Will have to admit though, once the food started coming all of the problems melted away. Superb job, great service, excellent preparation and presentation of the steaks. Great sides as well. Wine list is perfect and the dessert offerings looked spectacular but had enough during dinner portion of this program. Definite return.

rw_muSexV7aWz1LyHU6-eQ.text: Mediocre, pretentious and overpriced, even by Las Vegas standards. Pedestrian presentation of decent steaks. Outrageous prices on the wine list. Go somewhere else.

uAK_YW5eSTL1tlw-6p-wSQ.text: zee best steakhouse. ever.  my boyfriend and i were seated in front of the window. that made my first time at SW even more special! i had the chance to see the many shows during our meal AND enjoy the best meal ever in las vegas.  we started with oysters. deeeeeeeelish! i had the 12oz filet mingon. i love it when it's exactly made medium rare. pink is my favorite. i knew i should've ordered the smaller size because i could not finish my filet. i tried my best though!  my boyfriend had the bone in new york steak. both were juicy and made to order.  we had creamed spinach and au gratin potatoes to pair. i also had a glass of merlot. MMM MMM GOOD!  there were about three different shows. trippy and cool!  everybody, it is True. SW lives up to its hype. i'll be back every time i'm in vegas!

RyR_p-fe6xwVrvN89hW_JQ.text: Amazing seafood platter appetizer! Great steak, great sides, great wine, amazing desserts.  Sat by the waterfall and was offered a shawl as it cooled down.

3IUoaAASGV0cG0OW2r2KBg.text: SW was a very good steakhouse, but nothing extraordinary. The environment is what you'd expect, crowded, loud, and dark. We had to wait a bit to get our table, even though we had a reservation, but no big deal. The service was attentive and professional. One warning, the corkage fee is high!!! I believe it was somewhere between $75-100! Now onto the food...  Appetizer: Caesar Salad and Asparagus Vinaigrette Mix. Both were large enough to be shared and tasted good. I did not care for the asparagus dish, but my date loved it, so I assume it was just me.    Entrees: Two steaks, one fillet and one new york strip. Both were cooked perfectly, and tasted great. Exactly what you would expect from a premier steakhouse.  Sides: Creamed Spinach and Crimini Mushrooms. The mushrooms were great ad the spinach was just average, ever since I had a quail egg on top of my creamed spinach (at CUT), I can't go without it.  Price: I think it was right around $300 for the two of us... Not Cheap  Overall, its a good steakhouse. Good service, wine list, steaks, and atmosphere. I would go back, but not as a first choice.

AlB8wPhStICnMrANcT7LGw.text: I had expected this to be better, as it was the main steakhouse at the Wynn where we were staying, but I left feeling a little underwhelmed. The filet I ordered was great. But I am VERY picky about steak at steakhouses. If I'm at a steakhouse, all of which are pretty much the same, I expect the steak to be perfect. It's the wine list, service and other dishes that make or break it. And in this case, the tomato and mozzarella salad was less than mediocre - they used tiny shriveled tomatoes without much flavor. The sauteed veggies on the side were a bit soggy. When I order a side of veggies, I'm trying to balance out the heart attack aspect of the meat, not clog my arteries with more oil.  The wine we had by the glass was lovely and the service was fabulous, as was the dancing froggie in the Lake of Dreams. I would recommend SW, but again, wasn't wowed by the experience. Next time, go to DB next door for a much better and more interesting meal.

VE8LueeQElcsqD30vKwCjA.text: hands down - the BEST steak i ever had! i am a True red-meat lover and have had some really good steaks. up until my experience at SW - peter luger's was at the top of my list...but i have to say, this was a great dining experience from start to finish. (i am glad that we didn't eat much that day to save our appetites for dinner!)   we were a 4-top and started with the foie gras ( we asked for it grilled instead) and kobe beef carpaccio. both very good - and a perfect start to dinner. 2 of us had the 20 oz bone-in rib eye and the other 2 had the special "tomahawk rib eye" (40 oz!) - everything was cooked to perfection! (see pictures). we also went with an array of sides - truffle creamed corn, parmesan creamed spinach, au gratin potatoes and onion rings. they were all excellent but if i had to recommend one over the others - it would be the creamed corn an au gratin potatoes...mmmm. dessert - check out my picture of the funnel cakes! great presentation and it was awesome.   i have to also say that service was excellent. nothing could ruin a meal more than bad service - but we had wonderful and attentive service from john (i hope i remembered his name after the food coma).   dinner was about $400 - this included all the above food, drinks and over 20% tip. worth every penny. can't rave enough and i can't wait for another visit....   fyi - business casual dress code (jeans are okay) and better make reservations well in advance.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After: Your Personalized Funnel Cake
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Before: Funnel Cake Dessert
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. on special: tomahawk rib-eye topped with blue cheese

wgzo6_FbLxB9SUetl-ZLBw.text: SW steakhouse is by far one of the best steakhouses anywhere.  There are few restaurants that I would give 5 stars too, because there's almost always room to improve.  I think SW is at the top of its game.  The service was outstanding.  Our waitstaff was headed by a very friendly woman.  The rest of the team was intuitive and nice.  This helps set SW apart from many other steakhouses in Las Vegas.    The food was also outstanding.  Everything was top notch.  I was told that the bread was amazing and that was right.  It's baked fresh on premises and excellent.  I didn't want to fill up on bread, but I could have.  It set the tone for the rest of the meal.  My caesar salad was excellent and the rest of the table loved their seafood appetizers.  We went off the menu with a slice of bacon.  This was also awesome!  I ordered a strip (as always).  My strip was fantastic.  In fact, it was one of the best I've had in a while.  The steak was perfectly cooked.  There was a nice amount of char on the outside of the steak and the inside was soft and pink as I wanted.  I believe the steak was seasoned with just salt and pepper.  The salt stood out, but wasn't overbearing and the meat tasted fantastic.  I don't recall all of the sides ordered, but the photo above shows that we had parmesan creamed spinach.  I'm pretty sure that we also had the truffled creamed corn, butter roasted fingerling potatoes, and steamed asparagus.  All of the sides were excellent.  Overall, one of the best steaks and meals I've had in a really long time.  I'm looking forward to my next trip so I can sit outside and enjoy the show.

dNuaS-sKBhTL4x8M_FonOA.text: HOLY SH*T the bacon cheese rolls! amazballs!! good food and i liked the upscale atmosphere.  Nice place for a really expensive date night

94RHh2PbbNsPZ8CdirJzpg.text: I was surprised...but not in a good way.  Knowing the level of scrutiny that overshadows everything remotely associated with perfectionist Steve Wynn, I expected more than was served last night.  The first ribeye had to go back...it was quite obviously not "prime" caliber...to say it was too fatty and gristly would be an understatement.  Our server told us that the butcher had recently changed the way he'd been cutting the steaks due to a shortage of Prime quality beef.  My response: please raise prices to maintain your margin but do not deviate from the standard SW fans have come to expect.  I would stay away until the issue is addressed - you can certainly find a better place for steak on the strip.  On the brighter side, the scallops were on par with what we'd had in the past.  As always, service was top notch.  Rating 3 stars because "steak" is in the name of the restaurant - SW I hope you can help get things back on track!

bS-I4nDWZvcxCttOzWpCgA.text: Not the best steakhouse that I have been to...  I was very surprised by this as I have heard great things about this place.  The biggest objection that I had in addition to the food was the pricing on their wine.  The standard that you see is a 2x mark up this is why I was very surprised that it was 5x.  (example Joesph Phelps Cab $25 dollars retail and it was $140 on the wine list!)  I recommend if you come here to bring your own wine and pay the corkage of $35 per bottle.

xG_XC41ppS1RbRnmt2psFA.text: OMG the steaks are huge! I dont eat red meat  but everyone else that ate it said it was good and juicy. We had a fixed meal off the menu b/c it was for a wedding reception. Starters were some crab soup, which i wasn't to fond of and caesar salad. The crab cakes are good. I had the fish and it was kind of dry and over cooked also pretty bland. Dessert was a coco truffle bar that was pretty good. Service was good.

G4Lvb5EMFAA30_dzcUYJfQ.text: Great restaurant ... Excellent wine ... Seafood appetizer great starter... Steaks medium rare like butter ... Marvelous place for buisness or pleasure dining

O9M5V7IKxrn1MzGYm2gq0w.text: Had the seafood tower to start, it was outstanding. Filet for main course was excellent. Service top notch!

8Xr2nspjC00DFfFezZMYAQ.text: Went there with the hubby and some friends. The food quality was amazing. Which is not surprising from a place like this. I've always wanted to order lamb at a high quality restaurant to see if there was a difference in the gaminess of the meat. Big difference! So I had the lamb and sauteed mushrooms. The meat was cook to perfection. However, i was a little surprised by the amount of the side of mushrooms. It was only enough for 1 person. Not like Craftsteak at MGM where you can order a few sides and share them with your guests. But overall the lamb was good. I had a bite of steak from my husbands plate... The steak, in my opinion was average... but i think it had a lot to do with the way my husband eats his steak. I like mine medium rare oppose to his... medium well.

8hDd6UcTyBg1U1yZjeV6kA.text: I generally think the food in Vegas is either crap or over priced - until I ate here. I also can't get my Mom to go into a nice restaurant unless they allow you to wear jeans (she thinks it's too frou frou) - thankfully we were weighed down w/ shopping bags and she was pretty tired - so dinner at the bar it was.   The crab cake (yes there is only one) was awesome.  The kobe carpaccio (a big 'ol plate of it) was amazing. The fried capers made it perfect.  The cesar (they split in half) was good as were the yummy cheese crackers on top.  Cocktails were good and strong.  Bartenders were funny and provided great service.   I was excited to eat somewhere in Vegas that actually tasted good - it was sorta like eating at home (in SF that is) and I like that. I will definitely be back - hopefully in the summer so we can watch the show that goes on outside every half hour.   4.5 Staaaaars

C0Pq0FFKb7hNNXWipB-Elg.text: Came here while on s girls trip with 15 girls! They were able to accommodate us all with patio seating which is awesome because there's a show that plays in the courtyard every half hour! The food was great everything was cooked to standard! We ordered everything from appetizers to dessert. And a variety of seafood dishes and steaks also side dishes and everything for all 15 of us came out correct and delicious! the service was excellent! The atmosphere of the place is beautifully decorated and definitely on the dressier side. But definitely worth a place to try!

N_-jRWET9is6y8o_vvUJtA.text: Went for birthday celebration and I couldn't have picked a better spot! Service is impeccable and food was cooked to perfection. Ambiance is romantic and great for couples.

WjKOvxGN69aaxROUnY8x5Q.text: I visited this amazing restaurant the previous weekend after finally securing a reservation. Las Vegas is home to many great steakhouses, but this place is number 1!  Excellent ambiance and great food.  My party ordered the Foie Gras, bacon macaroni and cheese and lobster gnocchi for sides and ribeye, strip and porterhouse steaks. The meat was cooked perfectly to order for everyone, and the service was amazing. I will be returning my next trip to Vegas for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xwe_u1eRVfA-BDdj9Bt9oA.text: This place never disappoints!!!! I will without a doubt come here every time I come to Vegas. The service first off is impeccable. Every one so pleasant and well mannered. Sitting inside is nice but their outside is really something special (if you happen to be here when it's hot). I went last night and I had my go to items. I started with a Cesar salad, which was fantastic (just like all Cesar salads at the encore and Wynn hotels), then I got the foie gras appetizer  which melted in my mouth. Lastly, I got a petit filet, prepared medium and I got another foie gras on top. It just was so damn good. Also, every time my cup was a little less than full, someone would come over and fill up my glass. Fantastic experience.  I I'll always come back!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qgU91p-2oDEjmZIY10I2fQ.text: The 2 stars are given based on the quality of food that I got compared to the price range of this restaurant. With that said, this place left me quite disappointed. They are slightly more pricey than Mastro's, my all-time favorite steakhouse, yet did not deliver the quality that was even close to it.  My bf and I ordered the seafood spectacular, Russian osetra caviar, bone-in ribeye, and truffle creamed corn to share. The seafood spectacular had some hits and misses. The crab and oysters were good, but the lobster and shrimp lacked flavor. Caviar was good, but then again, a restaurant really shouldn't mess up caviar when it costs over $200 for a tiny jar.  Now onto the biggest disappointment of the night: the steak. My bf and I shared the 24-oz bone-in ribeye. The cut of the steak was actually not bad, but it was ruined by how HORRIBLY it was cooked. The outside was beyond charred; it was BURNT. We could literally hear the crunch as we were biting into the steak, not to mention the unpleasant, bitter taste of burnt meat. We asked for medium rare and the steak had 3 different temperatures going on all in one piece of meat: rare, medium rare, and medium. For a steakhouse at this price level, that is simply unacceptable. We wanted to send it back but we had another reservation afterwards so we decided to suck it up and eat it. The truffle creamed corn was more like grits and a bit too sweet for my liking, but my bf liked it.  Long story short, go spend your money at Mastro's or some other steakhouse in Vegas. In fact, instead of wasting $70+ on this sadly cooked piece of steak, I would rather have had a mediocre cut of steak at Fleming's that's at least COOKED right.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood spectacular &amp; Caviar. I would give a 4/5.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of the bone-in ribeye. Burnt on the outside and it had rare, medium rare, and medium sections throughout the steak!! Ugh

qI5CWHnrfWPIt-B4sLx9PA.text: This place has a special place in my heart. We went for our 4 year wedding anniversary and sat lakeside. Super romantic.   To begin with we had some of the bread they brought to the table and the pretzel bread was just to die for!!!  We also had a caesar salad which was great.  I am a Seafood FANATIC so of course I had to have the Seafood Spectacular. It was perfect. I dont like oysters so I switched those for more shrimp. And it was soooo much I couldnt finish it. It can easily be for two people.   The service was also very good and all the staff kept complimenting my husband and I on how we were dressed.   We loved it so much that the next time we were in vegas we went again.  This time I had the lobster and I must say its one of the bests ive tried in the states!! Cant wait to be back  Love all the restaurants at the Wynn! .

9CUCjTfuX5fPVksr48Y8DQ.text: 2015 update: Still top notch steak and excellent service.  Wine list could do with some refreshing to stay competitive against the likes of Prime at Bellagio, and that giant frog in the pond needs to learn some new songs to sing! :)  Had the 10oz steak this time which was sensational.  Gave me more room to try more of the delicious sides, too.

wvTqliE08R7r4bDuEcMy_A.text: Came here for the Kobe beef.  One of only 3 places in the US with certified Kobe beef.  Got the 4oz ribeye....fantastic!  Cut it with a fork and cooked perfectly.  The sides were good for sharing.  Brussels sprouts and carrots along with the mac and cheese were very good.  Service is top notch.  We never were needing anything and always attempted to.  Great location with a view of the water show.

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy inside.
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wedge salad with bacon.  Really ham on top.  Fantastic.

wDujVhp1OFBFO_f82tWHng.text: Alan and Goodwin are the best. They are always helpful.  Try the popsicle. You won't regret it.

wrNIgEXWQnAquKdmmETVow.text: Foods and services was very disappointed. Service: make reservations on the morning of for a patio sitting. When check in, I also remind the host that I had reservation for patio, she told me that she knew.  When sit, they walk us to a corner table inside by the kitchen. Again, I remind the host that I had reserved the patio sitting. Her respond " oh! Wait here." When we finally get our table at the patio, we have to clean our own cushion. Caused it was so dirty. While we sit and wait for our waiter/waitress, I noticed all the customers do the same "clean their own chair" before sitting down, while the waiter'/waitress stand around and chit chat. It take awhile for our waiter/waitress, and every time we need something, we have to raise our hand. They never come by the table to check on us. However, the bus boy did come and check on us. As for food I have the chicken and it very bland, no flavor. We will not be coming back. Don't recommend this restaurant for the price and service you pay.

p_WU_XZz2kDwOiUaUMotVg.text: Everything you would expect from a high end steakhouse at the Wynn with "his" name on it! After several visits over the years I can honestly say this is the one steakhouse in Vegas that delivers perfection every time. Food is just outstanding, wine selection excellent, service remarkable and the little extra touches make the experience special. One of my favorite places in the country.

-2w-tFQCEc8kD95ckk2_PA.text: My husband and I don't like going to the strip too often, however, we will make the drive for this steakhouse. It's by far our favorite steakhouse on the strip. The lobster is really good too! The ambiance is also amazing. Sometimes the service is really slow that's why I took one star away. However, I've never had a bad meal at this place. I usually order the filet mignon.

VI7aJ4MX5aOIteWCEtZVHQ.text: This is an update based upon a visit on Friday evening.  We were with a large party dining on the patio--celebrating a friend's 50th birthday.  The service was perfect, polite and professional.  The wine offerings robust and our selection was delicious.  The outdoor show super fun but the star was the steak on my plate--a perfectly cooked, seared/char New York that was amazing.  There is no better resort than Wynn/Encore and no better steak joint than SW.  Thank you, Mr. Wynn!

photos.caption: Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The show!
Photo of SW Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

mPdDV8QaFiy-8l0coAdINA.text: This place came very highly recommended.  The food was excellent.  However, I must say that when I pay those kind of prices (not only for food - they are VERY proud of their wine), I expect every aspect of the experience to be exceptional.  Not the case with the service we received tonight. We had to ask to order, ask to order another bottle of wine, pour our own wine, ask for plates to be removed when done, ask for dessert menus, etc etc etc.  Very disappointing.

0tR_8OLISSTyVkNOD94xBA.text: After hearing a lot of good things about SW, I was very excited to try it.  When we arrived at 6:00 pm, we were promptly seated by the most beautiful African American Hostess in the world. She was unbelievably attractive, polished and professional looking. I'm talking modelesque here people. If you go here you'll immediately know who I'm taking about. Anyway, make reservations as the restaurant fills up quickly.  We sat outside on a perfect Vegas night. It was probably in the high 60's. The patio was heated but the heaters weren't on and they weren't needed that night. The tables outside are the best seats in the restaurant. The tables are lake front and the show on the lake that takes place every 20 minutes was really cool to watch.   My friends have raved about the bread here. The bread basket consisted of French rolls, pretzel rolls and two bacon rolls. Although the bacon rolls were savory they were also dense and filling. I actually preferred the pretzel rolls. The wedge salad was the best wedge salad I've ever had. It is great to split between two people, and comes with an insanely thick slice of bacon. You can't go wrong with any of the steaks, but I went with the 12 oz filet. It was perfectly cooked and well seasoned. I would compare it to Fleming's quality not Mastro's or Cut. The kobe butter they bring out on the side it's rich and delicious. I actually preferred it over the 3 sauces; bearnaise, steak, and jalapeno passion fruit sauces that were also brought out with the steaks. However, you don't really need them as they just mask the flavor of the steak.    The service was great and the waiters were very attentive. This wasn't the best steakhouse I've ever been to, but I'm glad I experienced SW.

vtapjQFXCZ64XvR8fcxCtg.text: SW lost a star or two on my review due to choppy service. Meal was good and vibe is quintessential Vegas but our party of 6 received inattentive service through most of the evening. In addition, the wine we ordered (Stags Cab) was listed on menu at $100+\bottle but realized we were charged over $200/bottle after paying the check.   My ribeye was cooked perfectly and creamed corn was one of the highlights of my meal.   Would come back to SW but with greater caution in the future.

n75M7hUg3022ykNK47q9_A.text: We frequent this restaurant and all other Wynn owned restaurant for their world class vegan menus.  The last time we were there we took my in-laws for mommy in-laws birthday. I'll make this review about this particular night:  She had a prawn? daily special and seriously it was the largest and scariest shrimp I have ever seen in my life. That single shrimp was bigger than a small lobster. I did not take a photo of it because it grossed me out so much...anyway...she said it was wonderful.   Father in law ordered a steak of some kind and he said it was the best steak he has ever eaten before.   Hubby ordered the roasted vegan mushroom entree and wow it was amazing. It had about $50 of beautiful roasted mushrooms. He also ordered a small house salad prior.  I started off with the vegan mushroom soup which was a wonderful creamy delight. Thick, warm and yummy I crave this and try to replicate it at home.  For my entree I ordered the quinoa cakes. The portion is huge.  I always love the vegan cheesecake for dessert and for this particular birthday night they brought out a huge piece of cheesecake for her.   Perfection. Every time.

5x8dGxopQ1zwmPuTa62bIg.text: We just ate here 5 days ago and it was not good. Party of 8. There was nothing about the meal that was good let alone great. And, at the end of the meal all of the others in our party felt the same way. When one person has an opinion it is often times just an opinion. When 8 people all have the same opinion it starts to be more of a fact. The most prominent flavor in every dish was pepper. $1700 later we were not at all satisfied. With so many other great options in Vegas....go somewhere else.

i_ApI7e_eZ68EfpXbN_DRg.text: I wanted to take my friend for a steak dinner for his birthday, but needed a place that had great vegan dishes as well.  As usual, the Wynn comes through.  The steak was cooked to perfection, per my friend, and the vegan dish was absolutely perfect.  I mentioned to the waiter that it was my friends birthday and he brought him a small desert with happy birthday written in chocolate sauce.

s36QMcikMHszl-ylF0VK_g.text: Absolutely loved my dining experience here! I got a great table by the water...n as soon as i sat down i saw a water show goin on..cool! Server was friendly n helpful..explained items on menu..server brought me an amuse bouche..it was kabocha squash soup..spicy n delicious...i ordered the char grilled spanish octopus with harissa spiced chickpeas n black garlic lemon aioli as appetizer..entree i ordered the kobe beef filet mignon with maine lobster tail..side of parmesan creamed spinach..everything was delicious! Though i was full from all that i jus had to have dessert! And i ordered 2! what the heck i deserved it lol..i tried the dark molten chocolate cake with grand marnier ice cream..divine! and funnel cakes with 3 sauces.. anglaise, salty caramel, n chocolate fudge..yummmm!! and also with strawberries that were the biggest i've ever seen n sweet! It was very windy that night so they were able to get me table inside which was great..awesome service n food! I will be back!

wRlEHkxKxzK5XcaZe0fWMg.text: I had the opportunity to dine at SW this week with some co-workers and suppliers. The food was superb. The Rib Eye was excellently prepared and cooked to perfection. The scallop potatoes where delicious. We shared the creamed spinach, Mac cheese, tuna ceviche, and crab cake all of which were delightful. The desert options were wonderful. We sampled a variety of desserts all of which were delish. Service was on point from the beginning to the end. Definitely a place worth visiting for a special occasion.

TNYiYvLJFOL_loxtpWPCLw.text: Can't believe this place only got four stars. Great service and wonderful food.. Had the Waygu beef as a treat, the tenderloin which was recommended by our server and at 240 for 4 ounces I was hoping she was right.. Yep she was ... No words can describe how wonderful this meal was... Great Spanish red that was recommended a great pairing ... Yes pricey but worth it.. Go on treat yourself you won't be disappointed ...

XPUY4xmcAmUK-78xOh1mKw.text: The chili rubbed double ribeye is probably one of the more popular dishes on the menu at SW Steakhouse. It's huge, feeds 3 people (possibly more), is cooked well and has good flavor. But I can't bring myself to give SW more than 3 stars because I would rather save $106 and pay a little more for a simpler steak! I prefer my steak to be simple so I can taste the beef. The chili rubbed ribeye has a lot of spice which I think takes away from really enjoying the meat.  The beat salad here is very tasty, if you like beets. My favorite side dish is the truffle creamed corn. Delicious! The scallops and risotto are also a good choice. Definitely save room for dessert too. Last time I was here, I had the funnel cake (which everyone orders) and the warm sticky toffee pudding. The pudding is really good!!  Service at SW is great and everyone is very attentive, which they should be if you're spending that much for your dinner. It's also nice to be able to sit by the Wynn waterfall and watch the show that takes place every half hour. If I come back, I think I'll try a different steak so I can write a better review.

Q8TDyIKLlDCGZMU7eXOc4g.text: Have been here twice and it is one our favorite places to go for an awesome steak.  WOuld come here more but dont always want to get dressed up.  THe steaks here are the best I have ever had and is why we keep coming back.  My bf gets the new york strip and he eats it without his usual A1 cause it has just so much natural flavor and is super juicy so need for anything but a side to go with it like theere creamy mash potatoes are also very good.  I have tried there steeak as well and their lobster pasta dish whihc were both very good and very filling.  The lobster pasta dish was very full of flavor amd creamy and not over powering like i thought it might be .  They also have this wedge house salad that is freaking awesome and is great to split between two people it had basically a head of lettuce cut in half and then served with tomatoes and this nice thick cut clice of bacon and an swesome ranch sauce.  We get this everytime.  The portions are very good size, and pricing isnt bad compared to the rest of the steakhouse on the strip.  Plus what i really like is we maade a reservation for one time but wasnt going to be able to make it to an emergency so we called and they said they could push it back for us to whatever time we would like and that if we need to call back and push it back further cause of the emergency they could do that as well.  Which was great considering we were going there for our anniversary dinner. We had to clal and push it back twice and it was extremely busy for the summer and on the weekend and we didnt have to wait or anything.   This place is nice no matter where you sit but if you can sit outside and see the show they have out there, its worth it . Will be coming back to this place for some awesome food this summer and i can't wait  my mouth is watering already.

uBEc1KhBG17mvZwBTaR27g.text: This I actually my 2nd time visiting SW the first time I visited it was just ok, I'm glad I came back had a fabulous veal chop and tuna and crab cakes for appetizer, we were sorted inside which ii prefer patio sitting by all in all still a good night

q-gmrp_aeUHnRQjOPc2ukw.text: We went for my husband's 30th bday. When I made the reservation I noted it was a surprise bday dinner for 4. The staff were awesome about keeping their cool that they got my note about the bday and didn't even say anything to me that they could do a little something for the occasion. Everything tasted amazing. Presentation was lovely and staff were very attentive (to the point I jumped when they came out of nowhere to refill a glass that just dipped below half full). Our waitress (I forgot her name but I know she's from upstate NY and she was great!) helped our friend who wanted to try lobster into trying it and was very attentive to all his questions - he loved it btw. My husband had a filet mignon that melted in his mouth!  I've never tried a steak that nice before and we've tried a few of the upper end steakhouse out here. His lobster tail was also very nice - being from the East coast we take our seafood seriously and this was prepared just right, we were impressed. When we were all done and didn't order dessert (I had a cake at home) they brought out a French macaroon with a candle for him. It was the perfect, sneaky ending to a great bday dinner.
